Utah Code Annotated - Title 16 - Corporations
=============================================

Utah Code Annotated - Title 16 - Chapter 4 - Share Assessment Act
*****************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-101 Title.
-------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Share Assessment Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-102 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-102(1): "Corporation" means a nonprofit corporation or a profit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-102(2): 16-6a-102 "Nonprofit corporation" means a nonprofit corporation as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-102(3): 16-10a-102 "Profit corporation" means a corporation as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-102(4): 16-6a-102; 16-10a-102 "Share" means a share as defined in:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-102(4)(a): 16-6a-102 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-102(4)(b): 16-10a-102 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-102(5): "Water company" means a corporation in which a shareholder has the right, based on the shareholder's shares, to receive a proportionate share of water delivered by the corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-201 Assessments.
-------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-201(1): The shares of a nonprofit corporation are subject to assessment for any corporate purpose, except to the extent proscribed by the articles of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-201(2): The shares of a profit corporation are subject to assessment if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-201(2)(a): those shares were subject to assessment before May 1, 2007; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-201(2)(b): the assessment is not proscribed by the corporation's articles of incorporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-202 Procedure for assessment in absence of provisions in articles or bylaws.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-202(1): An assessment shall be levied in the manner this chapter provides, unless other commercially reasonable procedures are provided in the articles of incorporation or bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-202(2): 16-4-203 Each assessment shall comply with the requirements of Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-203 Equitable assessment.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-203(1): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-203(1)(a): (2) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-203(1)(b): Different classes of shares, and shares with different rights or benefits, may be subject to differing assessments.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-203(2): Shares may also be assessed on any basis required by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-203(2)(a): any existing or future contract between:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-203(2)(a)(i): the United States and a water company;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-203(2)(a)(ii): the United States and the shareholders of a water company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-203(2)(a)(iii): a water company and one or more shareholders of the water company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-203(2)(b): any contract of subscription for shares in a water company contracting with the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-203(3): (2) For purposes of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-204 Order levying assessment -- Contents.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-204(1): An assessment may be levied by order of the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-204(2): An order levying an assessment shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-204(2)(a): specify the amount of the levy on each share;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-204(2)(b): specify when, to whom, and where the assessment is payable; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-204(2)(c): identify the day on which an unpaid assessment becomes delinquent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-204(3): 16-4-206 The date on which an unpaid assessment is considered delinquent shall be at least 30 days after notice of assessment is given as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-204(4): If assessments are not levied on an equal basis for all shares, the order shall state the equitable basis for the differing assessments.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-205 Notice of assessment -- Form and contents.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
When the board of directors levies an assessment, the secretary shall prepare a notice of assessment, including:Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-205(1): the name of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-205(2): the location of the corporation's principal place of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-205(3): the date of the meeting at which the board of directors adopted the order levying the assessment;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-205(4): a description of the class or classes of shares assessed, and the amount of assessment per share;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-205(5): the time, place, and manner of payment;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-205(6): the day on which payment is considered delinquent;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-205(7): if assessments are not levied on an equal basis, a statement that the equitable basis for the assessments is set forth in the order; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-205(8): a general statement that the board of directors may elect various remedies to enforce payment, including the auctioning of shares.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-206 Service and publication of notice of assessment.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-206(1): 16-4-205 The notice of assessment required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-206(1)(a): personally served on each shareholder; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-206(1)(b): sent by first-class mail to each shareholder at the address shown on the corporation's records.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-206(2): (1) A shareholder is responsible for providing the shareholder's current mailing address to the corporation for purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-206(3): (3)(b); 45-1-101; (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-206(3)(a): (3)(b); 45-1-101 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-206(3)(a)(i): once a week for two weeks in a newspaper of general circulation in the location of the corporation's principal place of business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-206(3)(a)(ii): 45-1-101 in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-206(3)(b): (3)(a) A water company may elect not to publish notice under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-301 Enforcement of assessment.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-301(1): Payment of a delinquent assessment may be enforced by a corporation in one or more of the following ways:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-301(1)(a): imposition of a late charge, penalty, or interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-301(1)(b): suspension of one or more benefits of share ownership, including the right to vote, to transfer shares, or to delivery of water in the case of a water company;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-301(1)(c): sale at public auction of the shares on which payment is delinquent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-301(1)(d): any other enforcement method specified in the corporation's articles of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-301(2): In an enforcement action, the corporation may recover the delinquent assessment, any late charge, penalty, or interest, and all costs of collection, including attorney fees.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-301(3): 16-4-302; 16-4-312
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-301(3)(a): The board of directors shall follow enforcement procedures:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-301(3)(a)(i): as set forth in the articles of incorporation or bylaws; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-301(3)(a)(ii): as determined by the board of directors in a manner consistent with the board of directors' fiduciary duty to shareholders.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-301(3)(b): 16-4-302; 16-4-312 If the board of directors determines to sell shares at public auction, the board shall follow the procedures required by Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-302 Notice of sale -- Form.
------------------------------------------------------
Upon a determination by the board of directors to sell shares on which payment of an assessment is delinquent and the adoption of an order to sell the shares, the secretary shall prepare a notice of sale, including:Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-302(1): the name of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-302(2): the location of the corporation's principal place of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-302(3): the date on which the assessment order was adopted;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-302(4): a description of the shares on which an assessment is delinquent, including the name of any owner, certificate numbers if share certificates exist, and the number of shares represented by any certificate;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-302(5): a description of the amount due and payable with respect to each share on which an assessment is delinquent, including the assessment, any late charge, penalty, or interest, and the estimated costs and expenses of collection;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-302(6): a statement of the date, time, and place of the sale of shares to pay the amount payable if the amount is not paid before the identified date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-302(7): a statement that if shares are purchased at the auction by the corporation, or a director or officer of the corporation for the benefit of the officer or director, the shares may be redeemed by the shareholder for a period of 30 days after the day on which the shares are sold.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-303 Service and publication of notice of sale.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-303(1): 16-4-302 The notice of sale required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-303(1)(a): personally served on each shareholder whose share is subject to sale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-303(1)(b): sent by certified mail, return-receipt requested, to each shareholder whose share is subject to sale at the address shown on the corporation's records.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-303(2): (1) A shareholder is responsible for providing the shareholder's current mailing address to the corporation for purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-303(3): (1) The notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-303(4): 45-1-101 A notice of sale shall be published:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-303(4)(a): once a week for two weeks in a newspaper of general circulation in the location of the corporation's principal place of business beginning at least 15 days but no more than 45 days before the day on which the sale is to occur; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-303(4)(b): 45-1-101 in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-304 Power of sale.
---------------------------------------------
The service or mailing and publication of the notice of sale required under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-305 Number of shares to be sold.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-305(1): On the day, at the time and place appointed for a sale under this part, the secretary or other officer shall sell at public auction to the highest bidder for cash the number of shares necessary to pay all amounts due on an overdue assessment.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-305(2): Shares shall be sold in the smallest fraction as authorized in the articles of incorporation or the bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-305(3): The public auction shall be conducted by open bid, sealed bid, or by other means provided in the articles of incorporation or bylaws that reasonably protects the delinquent shareholder's interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-305(4): Proceeds of a sale in excess of the assessment and other amounts due shall be promptly paid to the shareholder whose shares were sold.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-306 Determining the highest bidder -- Transfer to highest bidder.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-306(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-306(1)(a): The person offering at a sale to pay the highest amount for the smallest number or fraction of shares, which may not be less than the delinquent assessment and all other amounts payable, is the highest bidder.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-306(1)(b): Whether the bid is for the smallest number or fraction of shares is determined by the articles of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-306(2): The shares purchased shall be transferred to the highest bidder on the share books of the corporation upon payment of the bid amount.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-307 Purchase by corporation, officer, or director -- Redemption.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-307(1): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-307(1)(a): If at the sale of shares, no bidder offers the amount of the delinquent assessment and all other amounts payable, the shares may be bid on and purchased by the corporation through the secretary, president, or any director for the amount of the delinquent assessment and all other amounts payable.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-307(1)(b): (1) If a corporation purchases shares under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-307(2): (1) If purchased under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-307(3): Any shares acquired by a corporation under this section, or purchased by an officer or director for the officer's or director's own benefit, are subject to redemption by the shareholder for a period of 30 days following the day on which the shares are sold at auction.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-307(4): (3); (4)(a); 15-1-4
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-307(4)(a): (3) Shares subject to redemption under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-307(4)(b): (4)(a); 15-1-4 The amount of interest under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-308 Status of shares purchased by corporation, officer, or director.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-308(1): 16-4-307; 16-4-307; Title 16, Chapter 10a, Utah Revised Business Corporation Act
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-308(1)(a): 16-4-307 Title to any shares purchased by a corporation under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-308(1)(b): 16-4-307; Title 16, Chapter 10a, Utah Revised Business Corporation Act Shares purchased by a corporation under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-308(1)(c): Any shares held by a corporation under this section are not assessable.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-308(1)(d): No dividends or distributions may be made on shares held by the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-308(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-308(2)(a): Title to any shares purchased by an officer or director of the corporation for the officer's or director's own benefit vest in the officer or director upon expiration of the 30-day redemption period if the right of redemption is not exercised.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-308(2)(b): Shares purchased by an officer or director for the officer's or director's own benefit are subject to all assessments levied by the corporation after the assessment that was the basis for the sale at which the officer or director purchased the shares.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-309 Extension of time specified in notices.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-309(1): The dates fixed in any notice of assessment or notice of sale may be extended for up to six months by order of the board of directors entered on the corporation's records.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-309(2): No order extending the time for the performance of any act specified in any notice under this chapter is effective unless notice of the extension is published and served in the same manner as the original notice.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-310 Error or omission in proceedings -- Effect.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-310(1): No assessment is invalidated by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-310(1)(a): a failure to serve, mail, or publish the notice of sale;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-310(1)(b): the omission of any information required to be contained in the notice; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-310(1)(c): the nonperformance of any act otherwise required to be performed in connection with the sale of shares to enforce payment of an assessment.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-310(2): No sale is valid unless proper notice is given and any material acts of nonperformance are corrected.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-311 Action to recover shares sold -- Tender -- Limitation of action.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-311(1): (1)(a); (b) No action may be brought to recover shares sold for a delinquent assessment based on irregularity or defect in the notice of sale or the sale unless the person bringing the action first pays or tenders payment to the corporation or to the person holding the shares sold:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-311(1)(a): the amount for which the shares were sold;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-311(1)(b): the amount of all subsequent assessments levied on the shares; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-311(1)(c): (1)(a); (b) interest on the amounts identified in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-311(2): No action may be brought to recover shares sold under this part more than six months after the sale of the shares at auction.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-312 Affidavit and posting of notice -- Evidence.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-312(1): An affidavit made by the secretary of a corporation of the mailing of a notice required by this chapter is prima facie evidence of the existence and mailing of the notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-312(2): 45-1-101; 45-1-101 The publication of a notice under this chapter may be proved by the affidavit of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-312(2)(a): the printer foreman or principal clerk of the newspaper in which the notice was published; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-312(2)(b): 45-1-101; 45-1-101 in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-312(3): The affidavit of the secretary of the corporation or the auctioneer responsible for selling shares is prima facie evidence of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-312(3)(a): the time and place of sale;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-312(3)(b): the quantity and particular description of the shares sold;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-312(3)(c): to whom and for what price the shares were sold; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-312(3)(d): the fact of the purchase money being paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-312(4): The affidavits referenced in this section shall be filed in the corporation's office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-4-312(5): A copy of an affidavit referenced in this section is prima facie evidence of the facts contained in the affidavit if the affidavit is certified by the secretary.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 16 - Chapter 6a - Utah Revised Nonprofit Corporation Act
************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Utah Revised Nonprofit Corporation Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(1)(a): "Address" means a location where mail can be delivered by the United States Postal Service.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(1)(b): "Address" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(1)(b)(i): a post office box number;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(1)(b)(ii): a rural free delivery route number; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(1)(b)(iii): a street name and number.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(2): "Affiliate" means a person that directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control with, the person specified.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(3): "Articles of incorporation" include:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(3)(a): amended articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(3)(b): restated articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(3)(c): articles of merger; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(3)(d): a document of a similar import to the documents described in Subsections (3)(a) through (c).
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(4): 16-10a-1506; 16-6a-1506 "Assumed corporate name" means a name assumed for use in this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(4)(a): 16-10a-1506; 16-6a-1506 by a:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(4)(a)(i): 16-10a-1506 foreign corporation as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(4)(a)(ii): 16-6a-1506 a foreign nonprofit corporation as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(4)(b): because the corporate name of the foreign corporation described in Subsection (4)(a) is not available for use in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(5): 16-6a-801
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(5)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (5)(b), "board of directors" means the body authorized to manage the affairs of a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(5)(b): 16-6a-801 Notwithstanding Subsection (5)(a), a person may not be considered a member of the board of directors because of a power delegated to that person under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(6)(a): "Bylaws" means the one or more codes of rules, other than the articles of incorporation, adopted under this chapter for the regulation or management of the affairs of a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation irrespective of the one or more names by which the codes of rules are designated.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(6)(b): "Bylaws" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(6)(b)(i): amended bylaws; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(6)(b)(ii): restated bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(7)(a): "Cash" or "money" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(7)(a)(i): legal tender;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(7)(a)(ii): a negotiable instrument; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(7)(a)(iii): other cash equivalent readily convertible into legal tender.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(7)(b): "Cash" and "money" are used interchangeably in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(8): 13-22-2 "Charitable organization" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(9)(a): "Class" means a group of memberships that has the same right with respect to voting, dissolution, redemption, transfer, or other characteristics.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(9)(b): For purposes of Subsection (9)(a), a right is considered the same if it is determined by a formula applied uniformly to a group of memberships.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(10): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(10)(a): "Conspicuous" means so written that a reasonable person against whom the writing is to operate should have noticed the writing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(10)(b): "Conspicuous" includes printing or typing in:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(10)(b)(i): italics;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(10)(b)(ii): boldface;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(10)(b)(iii): contrasting color;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(10)(b)(iv): capitals; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(10)(b)(v): underlining.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(11): "Control" or a "controlling interest" means the direct or indirect possession of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of an entity by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(11)(a): the ownership of voting shares;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(11)(b): contract; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(11)(c): a means other than those specified in Subsection (11)(a) or (b).
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(12): 16-6a-207 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(13): "Corporate name" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(13)(a): the name of a domestic corporation as stated in the domestic corporation's articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(13)(b): the name of a domestic nonprofit corporation as stated in the domestic nonprofit corporation's articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(13)(c): the name of a foreign corporation as stated in the foreign corporation's:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(13)(c)(i): articles of incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(13)(c)(ii): document of similar import to articles of incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(13)(d): the name of a foreign nonprofit corporation as stated in the foreign nonprofit corporation's:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(13)(d)(i): articles of incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(13)(d)(ii): document of similar import to articles of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(14): 16-6a-1601
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(14)(a): 16-6a-1601 "Corporate records" means the records described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(14)(b): "Corporate records" does not include correspondence, communications, notes, or other similar information, regardless of format or method of storage, that are not an official decision, published document, or record of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(15): "Corporation" or "domestic corporation" means a corporation for profit that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(15)(a): is not a foreign corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(15)(b): is incorporated under or subject to Chapter 10a, Utah Revised Business Corporation Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(16): "Delegate" means a person elected or appointed to vote in a representative assembly:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(16)(a): for the election of a director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(16)(b): on matters other than the election of a director.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(17): 16-6a-103 "Deliver" includes delivery by mail or another means of transmission authorized by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(18): "Director" means a member of the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(19): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(19)(a): "Distribution" means the payment of a dividend or any part of the income or profit of a nonprofit corporation to the nonprofit corporation's:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(19)(a)(i): members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(19)(a)(ii): directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(19)(a)(iii): officers.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(19)(b): "Distribution" does not include a fair-value payment for:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(19)(b)(i): a good sold; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(19)(b)(ii): a service received.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(20): "Division" means the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(21): 16-6a-108 "Effective date," when referring to a document filed by the division, means the time and date determined in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(22): 16-6a-103 "Effective date of notice" means the date notice is effective as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(23): "Electronic transmission" or "electronically transmitted" means a process of communication not directly involving the physical transfer of paper that is suitable for the receipt, retention, retrieval, and reproduction of information by the recipient, whether by email, texting, facsimile, or otherwise.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(24): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(24)(a): "Employee" includes an officer of a nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(24)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(24)(b)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (24)(b)(ii), "employee" does not include a director of a nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(24)(b)(ii): Notwithstanding Subsection (24)(b)(i), a director may accept one or more duties that make that director an employee of a nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(25): "Entity" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(25)(a): a domestic or foreign corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(25)(b): a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(25)(c): a limited liability company;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(25)(d): a profit or nonprofit unincorporated association;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(25)(e): a business trust;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(25)(f): an estate;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(25)(g): a partnership;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(25)(h): a trust;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(25)(i): two or more persons having a joint or common economic interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(25)(j): a state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(25)(k): the United States; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(25)(l): a foreign government.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(26): "Executive director" means the executive director of the Department of Commerce.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(27): "Foreign corporation" means a corporation for profit incorporated under a law other than the laws of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(28): "Foreign nonprofit corporation" means an entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(28)(a): incorporated under a law other than the laws of this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(28)(b): that would be a nonprofit corporation if formed under the laws of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29): 63E-1-102; 53B-3-102 "Governmental entity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(a): 63E-1-102; 53B-3-102
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(a)(i): the executive branch of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(a)(ii): the judicial branch of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(a)(iii): the legislative branch of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(a)(iv): 63E-1-102 an independent entity, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(a)(v): a political subdivision of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(a)(vi): 53B-3-102 a state institution of higher education, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(a)(vii): an entity within the state system of public education; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(a)(viii): the National Guard; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(b): any of the following that is established or controlled by a governmental entity listed in Subsection (29)(a) to carry out the public's business:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(b)(i): an office;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(b)(ii): a division;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(b)(iii): an agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(b)(iv): a board;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(b)(v): a bureau;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(b)(vi): a committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(b)(vii): a department;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(b)(viii): an advisory board;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(b)(ix): an administrative unit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(29)(b)(x): a commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(30): "Governmental subdivision" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(30)(a): a county;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(30)(b): a city;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(30)(c): a town; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(30)(d): another type of governmental subdivision authorized by the laws of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(31): "Individual" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(31)(a): a natural person;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(31)(b): the estate of an incompetent individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(31)(c): the estate of a deceased individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(32): "Internal Revenue Code" means the federal "Internal Revenue Code of 1986," as amended from time to time, or to corresponding provisions of subsequent internal revenue laws of the United States of America.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(33): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(33)(a): "Mail," "mailed," or "mailing" means deposit, deposited, or depositing in the United States mail, properly addressed, first-class postage prepaid.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(33)(b): "Mail," "mailed," or "mailing" includes registered or certified mail for which the proper fee is paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(34): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(34)(a): "Member" means one or more persons identified or otherwise appointed as a member of a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation as provided:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(34)(a)(i): in the articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(34)(a)(ii): in the bylaws;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(34)(a)(iii): by a resolution of the board of directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(34)(a)(iv): by a resolution of the members of the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(34)(b): "Member" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(34)(b)(i): "voting member"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(34)(b)(ii): a shareholder in a water company.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(35): "Membership" refers to the rights and obligations of a member or members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(36): "Mutual benefit corporation" means a nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(36)(a): that issues shares of stock to its members evidencing a right to receive distribution of water or otherwise representing property rights; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(36)(b): all of whose assets are contributed or acquired by or for the members of the nonprofit corporation or the members' predecessors in interest to serve the mutual purposes of the members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(37): "Nonprofit corporation" or "domestic nonprofit corporation" means an entity that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(37)(a): is not a foreign nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(37)(b): is incorporated under or subject to this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(38): 16-6a-103 "Notice" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39): "Party related to a director" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39)(a): the spouse of the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39)(b): a child of the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39)(c): a grandchild of the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39)(d): a sibling of the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39)(e): a parent of the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39)(f): the spouse of an individual described in Subsections (39)(b) through (e);
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39)(g): an individual having the same home as the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39)(h): a trust or estate of which the director or another individual specified in this Subsection (39) is a substantial beneficiary; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39)(i): any of the following of which the director is a fiduciary:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39)(i)(i): a trust;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39)(i)(ii): an estate;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39)(i)(iii): an incompetent;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39)(i)(iv): a conservatee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(39)(i)(v): a minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(40): "Person" means an:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(40)(a): individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(40)(b): entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(41): "Principal office" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(41)(a): the office, in or out of this state, designated by a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation as its principal office in the most recent document on file with the division providing that information, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(41)(a)(i): an annual report;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(41)(a)(ii): an application for a certificate of authority; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(41)(a)(iii): a notice of change of principal office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(41)(b): if no principal office can be determined, a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation's registered office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(42): "Proceeding" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(42)(a): a civil suit;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(42)(b): arbitration;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(42)(c): mediation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(42)(d): a criminal action;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(42)(e): an administrative action; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(42)(f): an investigatory action.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(43): "Receive," when used in reference to receipt of a writing or other document by a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation, means the writing or other document is actually received:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(43)(a): by the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation at:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(43)(a)(i): its registered office in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(43)(a)(ii): its principal office;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(43)(b): by the secretary of the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation, wherever the secretary is found; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(43)(c): by another person authorized by the bylaws or the board of directors to receive the writing or other document, wherever that person is found.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(44): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(44)(a): "Record date" means the date established under Part 6, Members, or Part 7, Member Meetings and Voting, on which a nonprofit corporation determines the identity of the nonprofit corporation's members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(44)(b): The determination described in Subsection (44)(a) shall be made as of the close of business on the record date unless another time for doing so is specified when the record date is fixed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(45): "Registered agent" means the registered agent of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(45)(a): a domestic nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(45)(b): a foreign nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(46): "Registered office" means the office within this state designated by a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation as its registered office in the most recent document on file with the division providing that information, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(46)(a): articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(46)(b): an application for a certificate of authority; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(46)(c): a notice of change of registered office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(47): 16-6a-818; 16-6a-1601 "Secretary" means the corporate officer to whom the bylaws or the board of directors delegates responsibility under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(47)(a): 16-6a-1601 the preparation and maintenance of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(47)(a)(i): minutes of the meetings of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(47)(a)(i)(A): the board of directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(47)(a)(i)(B): the members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(47)(a)(ii): 16-6a-1601 the other records and information required to be kept by the nonprofit corporation as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(47)(b): authenticating records of the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(48): "Share" means a unit of interest in a nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(49): "Shareholder" means a person in whose name a share is registered in the records of a nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(50): "State," when referring to a part of the United States, includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(50)(a): a state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(50)(b): a commonwealth;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(50)(c): the District of Columbia;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(50)(d): an agency or governmental and political subdivision of a state, commonwealth, or District of Columbia;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(50)(e): territory or insular possession of the United States; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(50)(f): an agency or governmental and political subdivision of a territory or insular possession of the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(51): "Street address" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(51)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(51)(a)(i): street name and number;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(51)(a)(ii): city or town; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(51)(a)(iii): United States post office zip code designation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(51)(b): if, by reason of rural location or otherwise, a street name, number, city, or town does not exist, an appropriate description other than that described in Subsection (51)(a) fixing as nearly as possible the actual physical location, but only if the information includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(51)(b)(i): the rural free delivery route;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(51)(b)(ii): the county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(51)(b)(iii): the United States post office zip code designation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(52): "Tribal nonprofit corporation" means a nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(52)(a): incorporated under the law of a tribe; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(52)(b): that is at least 51% owned or controlled by the tribe.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(53): "Tribe" means a tribe, band, nation, pueblo, or other organized group or community of Indians, including an Alaska Native village, that is legally recognized as eligible for and is consistent with a special program, service, or entitlement provided by the United States to Indians because of the tribe's status as Indians.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(54): "United States" includes a district, authority, office, bureau, commission, department, and another agency of the United States of America.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(55): "Vote" includes authorization by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(55)(a): written ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(55)(b): written consent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(56): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(56)(a): "Voting group" means all the members of one or more classes of members or directors that, under this chapter, the articles of incorporation, or the bylaws, are entitled to vote and be counted together collectively on a matter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(56)(b): All members or directors entitled by this chapter, the articles of incorporation, or the bylaws to vote generally on a matter are for that purpose a single voting group.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(57): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(57)(a): "Voting member" means a person entitled to vote for all matters required or permitted under this chapter to be submitted to a vote of the members, except as otherwise provided in the articles of incorporation or bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(57)(b): A person is not a voting member solely because of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(57)(b)(i): a right the person has as a delegate;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(57)(b)(ii): a right the person has to designate a director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(57)(b)(iii): a right the person has as a director.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(57)(c): Except as the bylaws may otherwise provide, "voting member" includes a "shareholder" if the nonprofit corporation has shareholders.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(58): 16-4-102 "Water company" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(58)(a): 16-4-102 the same as that term is defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-102(58)(b): a mutual benefit corporation, when the stock in the mutual benefit corporation represents a right to receive a distribution of water for beneficial use.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103 Notice.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(1): Notice given under this chapter shall be in writing unless oral notice is reasonable under the circumstances.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(2): (2)(a); 45-1-101
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(2)(a): Notice may be communicated:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(2)(a)(i): in person;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(2)(a)(ii): by telephone;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(2)(a)(iii): by electronic transmission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(2)(a)(iv): by mail or private carrier.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(2)(b): (2)(a); 45-1-101 If the forms of personal notice described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i): 45-1-101
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(A): a newspaper of general circulation in the county or similar governmental subdivision in which the corporation's principal or registered office is located; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(B): 45-1-101 as required in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(2)(b)(ii): radio, television, or other form of public broadcast communication in the county or similar governmental subdivision in which the corporation's principal or registered office is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(3): Written notice to a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state may be addressed to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(3)(a): its registered agent at its registered office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(3)(b): the corporation's secretary at its principal office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(4): (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(4)(a): Written notice by a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation to its members, is effective as to each member when mailed, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(4)(a)(i): in a comprehensible form; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(4)(a)(ii): addressed to the member's address shown in the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation's current record of members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(4)(b): (5) If three successive notices given to a member pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(5): (4) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(5)(a): when received;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(5)(b): five days after it is mailed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(5)(c): on the date shown on the return receipt if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(5)(c)(i): sent by registered or certified mail;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(5)(c)(ii): sent return receipt requested; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(5)(c)(iii): the receipt is signed by or on behalf of the addressee.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(6): Oral notice is effective when communicated if communicated in a comprehensible manner.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(7): Notice by publication is effective on the date of first publication.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(8): A written notice or report delivered as part of a newsletter, magazine, or other publication regularly sent to members shall constitute a written notice or report if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(8)(a): addressed or delivered to the member's address shown in the nonprofit corporation's current list of members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(8)(b): if two or more members are residents of the same household and have the same address in the nonprofit corporation's current list of members, addressed or delivered to one of the members at the address appearing on the current list of members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(9)(a): If this chapter prescribes notice requirements for particular circumstances, the notice requirements for the particular circumstances govern.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-103(9)(b): If articles of incorporation or bylaws prescribe notice requirements not inconsistent with this section or other provisions of this chapter, the notice requirements of the articles of incorporation or bylaws govern.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-104 Powers of the division.
-------------------------------------------------------
The division has the power reasonably necessary to perform the duties required of the division under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105 Filing requirements.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(1): To be entitled to filing by the division, a document shall satisfy the requirements of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(1)(a): this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(1)(b): any other section of this chapter that adds to or varies the requirements of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(2): This chapter shall require or permit filing the document with the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(3)(a): A document shall contain the information required by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(3)(b): In addition to the document information required by this chapter, a document may contain other information.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(4): A document shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(4)(a): typewritten; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(4)(b): machine printed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(5)(a): A document shall be in the English language.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(5)(b): A corporate name need not be in English if written in:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(5)(b)(i): English letters; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(5)(b)(ii): Arabic or Roman numerals.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(5)(c): (5)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(6): (6)(b); (6)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(6)(a): (6)(b); (6)(b) A document shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(6)(a)(i): (6)(b) executed by a person in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(6)(a)(ii): (6)(b) a true copy made by photographic, xerographic, electronic, or other process that provides similar copy accuracy of a document that has been executed by a person listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(6)(b): A document shall be executed by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(6)(b)(i): the chair of the board of directors of a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(6)(b)(ii): all of the directors of a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(6)(b)(iii): an officer of the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(6)(b)(iv): if directors have not been selected or the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation has not been formed, an incorporator;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(6)(b)(v): if the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation is in the hands of a receiver, trustee, or other court-appointed fiduciary, that receiver, trustee, or court-appointed fiduciary;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(6)(b)(vi): if the document is that of a registered agent:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(6)(b)(vi)(A): the registered agent, if the person is an individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(6)(b)(vi)(B): a person authorized by the registered agent to execute the document, if the registered agent is an entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(6)(b)(vii): an attorney in fact if a nonprofit corporation retains the power of attorney with the nonprofit corporation's records.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(7): A document shall state beneath or opposite the signature of the person executing the document:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(7)(a): the signer's name; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(7)(b): the capacity in which the document is signed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(8): A document may contain:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(8)(a): the corporate seal;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(8)(b): an attestation by the secretary or an assistant secretary; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(8)(c): an acknowledgment, verification, or proof.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(9): (8) The signature of each person signing a document, whether or not the document contains an acknowledgment, verification, or proof permitted by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(9)(a): the document is:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(9)(a)(i): the person's act and deed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(9)(a)(ii): the act and deed of the entity on behalf of which the document is executed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(9)(b): the facts stated in the document are true.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(10): 16-6a-106 If the division has prescribed a mandatory form or cover sheet for the document under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(10)(a): in or on the prescribed form; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(10)(b): have the required cover sheet.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(11): 16-6a-1510 A document shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(11)(a): delivered to the division for filing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(11)(b): 16-6a-1510 accompanied by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(11)(b)(i): 16-6a-1510 one exact or conformed copy, except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(11)(b)(ii): the correct filing fee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(11)(b)(iii): any franchise tax, license fee, or penalty required by this chapter or other law.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-105(12): 16-6a-1510 Except with respect to a filing pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-106 Forms.
--------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-106(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-106(1)(a): The division may prescribe forms or cover sheets for documents required or permitted to be filed by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-106(1)(b): (1)(a) If the division prescribes a form or cover sheet pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-106(2): (1) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-106(2)(a): the use of a form or cover sheet is not mandatory unless the division specifically requires the use of the form or cover sheet; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-106(2)(b): a requirement that a form or cover sheet be used may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-106(2)(b)(i): preclude in any way the inclusion in any document of any item that is not prohibited to be included by this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-106(2)(b)(ii): require the inclusion with the filed document of any item that is not otherwise required by this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108 Effective time and date of filed documents.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(1): (2); 16-6a-109(4); 16-6a-110(2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(1)(a): (2); 16-6a-109(4) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(1)(a)(i): at the time of filing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(1)(a)(ii): on the date it is filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(1)(b): 16-6a-110(2) The division's endorsement on the document as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(2): (2)(a); (2); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(2)(a): Unless otherwise provided in this chapter, a document, other than an application for a reserved or registered name, may specify conspicuously on its face:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(2)(a)(i): a delayed effective time;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(2)(a)(ii): a delayed effective date; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(2)(a)(iii): both a delayed effective time and date.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(2)(b): (2)(a); (2) If in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(2)(c): If both a delayed effective time and date are specified, the document becomes effective as specified.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(2)(d): If a delayed effective time but no date is specified, the document is effective on the date it is filed, as that date is specified in the division's time and date endorsement on the document, at the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(2)(d)(i): the time specified on the document as its effective time; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(2)(d)(ii): the time specified in the time and date endorsement.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(2)(e): If a delayed effective date but no time is specified, the document is effective at the close of business on the date specified as the delayed effective date.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(2)(f): (2) Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(3): (2); 16-6a-1007; 16-6a-1007 If a document specifies a delayed effective date pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(3)(a): executed:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(3)(a)(i): on behalf of the same domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation that originally submitted the document for filing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(3)(a)(ii): in the same manner as the document being withdrawn;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(3)(b): 16-6a-1007 stating that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(3)(b)(i): 16-6a-1007 the document has been revoked by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(3)(b)(i)(A): appropriate corporate action; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(3)(b)(i)(B): 16-6a-1007 court order or decree pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(3)(b)(ii): the document is void; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-108(3)(c): 16-6a-1007 if a court order or decree pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109 Correcting filed documents.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(1): A domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation may correct a document filed with the division if the document:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(1)(a): contains an incorrect statement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(1)(b): was defectively executed, attested, sealed, verified, or acknowledged.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(2): A document is corrected by delivering to the division for filing articles of correction that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(2)(a)(i): describe the document, including its filing date; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(2)(a)(ii): have attached a copy of the document;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(2)(b): specify:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(2)(b)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(2)(b)(i)(A): the incorrect statement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(2)(b)(i)(B): the reason it is incorrect; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(2)(b)(ii): the manner in which the execution, attestation, sealing, verification, or acknowledgment was defective; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(2)(c): correct:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(2)(c)(i): the incorrect statement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(2)(c)(ii): defective execution, attestation, sealing, verification, or acknowledgment.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(3): 16-6a-105(6) Articles of correction may be executed by any person:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(3)(a): 16-6a-105(6) designated in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(3)(b): who executed the document that is corrected.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(4)(a): Articles of correction are effective on the effective date of the document they correct except as to a person:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(4)(a)(i): relying on the uncorrected document; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(4)(a)(ii): adversely affected by the correction.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-109(4)(b): (4)(a) As to a person described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110 Filing duty of division.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(1): 16-6a-105 If a document delivered to the division for filing satisfies the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(2): 16-6a-1510; 16-6a-1608
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(2)(a): The division files a document by stamping or otherwise endorsing "Filed" together with the name of the division and the date and time of acceptance for filing on both the document and the accompanying copy.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(2)(b): 16-6a-1510; 16-6a-1608 After filing a document, except as provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(2)(b)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(2)(b)(i)(A): to the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation for which the filing is made; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(2)(b)(i)(B): to the representative of the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation for which the filing is made; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(2)(b)(ii): at the address:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(2)(b)(ii)(A): indicated on the filing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(2)(b)(ii)(B): that the division determines to be appropriate.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(3): If the division refuses to file a document, the division within 10 days after the day the document is delivered to the division shall return to the person requesting the filing:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(3)(a): the document; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(3)(b): a written notice providing a brief explanation of the reason for the refusal to file.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(4)(a): The division's duty to file a document under this section is ministerial.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(4)(b): Except as otherwise specifically provided in this chapter, the division's filing or refusal to file a document does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(4)(b)(i): affect the validity or invalidity of the document in whole or in part;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(4)(b)(ii): relate to the correctness or incorrectness of information contained in the document; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(4)(b)(iii): create a presumption that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(4)(b)(iii)(A): the document is valid or invalid; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-110(4)(b)(iii)(B): information contained in the document is correct or incorrect.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-111 Appeal from division's refusal to file document.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If the division refuses to file a document delivered to it for filing, in accordance withUtah Code Annotated § 16-6a-111(1): the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation for which the filing was requested; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-111(2): the representative of the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation for which filing was requested.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-112 Evidentiary effect of copy of filed document.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
One or more of the following is conclusive evidence that the original document has been filed with the division:Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-112(1): a certificate attached to a copy of a document filed by the division; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-112(2): an endorsement, seal, or stamp placed on the copy by the division.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113 Certificates issued by the division.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(1): Any person may apply to the division for:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(1)(a): a certificate of existence for a domestic nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(1)(b): a certificate of authorization for a foreign nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(1)(c): a certificate that sets forth any facts of record in the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2): 16-6a-1607 A certificate of existence or certificate of authorization sets forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2)(a)(i): the domestic nonprofit corporation's corporate name; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2)(a)(ii): the foreign nonprofit corporation's corporate name registered in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2)(b): that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2)(b)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2)(b)(i)(A): the domestic nonprofit corporation is incorporated under the law of this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2)(b)(i)(B): the date of its incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2)(b)(ii): the foreign nonprofit corporation is authorized to conduct affairs in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2)(c): that all fees, taxes, and penalties owed to this state have been paid, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2)(c)(i): payment is reflected in the records of the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2)(c)(ii): nonpayment affects the existence or authorization of the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2)(d): 16-6a-1607 that the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation's most recent annual report required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2)(e): that articles of dissolution have not been filed by the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(2)(f): other facts of record in the division that may be requested by the applicant.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-113(3): Subject to any qualification stated in the certificate, a certificate issued by the division may be relied upon as conclusive evidence of the facts set forth in the certificate.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-114 Penalty for signing false documents.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-114(1): It is unlawful for a person to sign a document:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-114(1)(a): knowing it to be false in any material respect; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-114(1)(b): with intent that the document be delivered to the division for filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-114(2): 76-3-301 An offense under this section is a class A misdemeanor punishable by a fine not to exceed the fine specified in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-115 Liability to third parties.
-----------------------------------------------------------
The directors, officers, employees, and members of a nonprofit corporation are not personally liable in their capacity as directors, officers, employees, and members for the acts, debts, liabilities, or obligations of a nonprofit corporation.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-116 Private foundations.
----------------------------------------------------
Except when otherwise determined by a court of competent jurisdiction, a nonprofit corporation that is a private foundation as defined in Section 509(a), Internal Revenue Code:Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-116(1): shall make distributions for each taxable year at the time and in the manner as not to subject the nonprofit corporation to tax under Section 4942, Internal Revenue Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-116(2): may not engage in any act of self-dealing as defined in Section 4941(d), Internal Revenue Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-116(3): may not retain any excess business holdings as defined in Section 4943(c), Internal Revenue Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-116(4): may not make any investments that would subject the nonprofit corporation to taxation under Section 4944, Internal Revenue Code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-116(5): may not make any taxable expenditures as defined in Section 4945(d), Internal Revenue Code.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117 Judicial relief.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(1): (1)(b); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(1)(a): (1)(b) A director, officer, delegate, or member may petition a court to take an action provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(1)(a)(i): call or conduct a meeting of the nonprofit corporation's members, delegates, or directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(1)(a)(ii): otherwise obtain the consent of the nonprofit corporation's members, delegates, or directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(1)(b): (1)(a) If a petition is filed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(1)(b)(i): a meeting be called; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(1)(b)(ii): a written consent or other form of obtaining the vote of members, delegates, or directors be authorized.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(2): (1); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(2)(a): A court shall, in an order issued pursuant to this section, provide for a method of notice reasonably designed to give actual notice to all persons who would be entitled to notice of a meeting held pursuant to this chapter, the articles of incorporation, or bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(2)(b): (1); (2)(a) The method of notice described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(2)(b)(i): (2)(a) results in actual notice to all persons described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(2)(b)(ii): conforms to the notice requirements that would otherwise apply.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(2)(c): In a proceeding under this section, the court may determine who are the members or directors of a nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(3): An order issued pursuant to this section may dispense with any requirement relating to the holding of or voting at meetings or obtaining votes that would otherwise be imposed by this chapter or the nonprofit corporation's articles of incorporation, or bylaws, including any requirement as to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(3)(a): quorums; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(3)(b): the number or percentage of votes needed for approval.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(4)(a): Whenever practical, any order issued pursuant to this section shall limit the subject matter of a meeting or other form of consent authorized to items the resolution of which will or may enable the nonprofit corporation to continue managing the nonprofit corporation's affairs without further resort to this section, including amendments to the articles of incorporation or bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(4)(b): (4)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(5): A meeting or other method of obtaining the vote of members, delegates, or directors conducted pursuant to and that complies with an order issued under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(5)(a): is for all purposes a valid meeting or vote, as the case may be; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(5)(b): shall have the same force and effect as if it complied with every requirement imposed by this chapter or the nonprofit corporation's articles of incorporation or bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-117(6): 16-6a-703 In addition to a meeting held under this section, a court-ordered meeting may be held pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-118 Electronic documents.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-118(1)(a): to be delivered, mailed, or filed:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-118(1)(a)(i): in an electronic medium; or
