Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-118(2)(a): in an electronic medium; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-118(2)(b): by electronic transmission.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119 Execution against a mutual benefit corporation.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(1): 73-1-10 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(1)(a): "Judicial lien" means one or more of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(1)(a)(i): a judgment lien; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(1)(a)(ii): other lien obtained by a judicial or equitable process or proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(1)(b): 73-1-10 "Water right" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(1)(b)(i): 73-1-10 a right to use water evidenced by a means identified in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(1)(b)(ii): a right to use water under an approved application:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(1)(b)(ii)(A): to appropriate;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(1)(b)(ii)(B): for a change of use; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(1)(b)(ii)(C): for the exchange of water.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(1)(c): "Water rights and related assets" means a water right or title to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(1)(c)(i): a water conveyance facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(1)(c)(ii): other asset of a mutual benefit corporation necessary to divert or distribute water to its members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(2): (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(2)(a): execute the judicial lien;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(2)(b): impose a levy as a result of the judicial lien; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(2)(c): force the sale, transfer, or change in ownership of the water rights and related assets pursuant to the judicial lien.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-119(3): 73-3-3.5 This section does not apply to a judicial lien related to a cause of action brought against a mutual benefit corporation by a shareholder under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-201 Incorporators.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-201(1): 16-6a-202 One or more persons may act as incorporators of a nonprofit corporation by delivering to the division for filing articles of incorporation meeting the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-201(2): An incorporator who is a natural person shall be 18 years of age or older.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202 Articles of incorporation.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(1): 16-6a-401; 16-17-203(1) The articles of incorporation shall set forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(1)(a): one or more purposes for which the nonprofit corporation is organized;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(1)(b): 16-6a-401 a corporate name for the nonprofit corporation that satisfies the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(1)(c): 16-17-203(1) the information required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(1)(d): the name and address of each incorporator;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(1)(e): whether or not the nonprofit corporation will have voting members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(1)(f): if the nonprofit corporation is to issue shares of stock evidencing membership in the nonprofit corporation or interests in water or other property rights:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(1)(f)(i): the aggregate number of shares that the nonprofit corporation has authority to issue; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(1)(f)(ii): if the shares are to be divided into classes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(1)(f)(ii)(A): the number of shares of each class;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(1)(f)(ii)(B): the designation of each class; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(1)(f)(ii)(C): a statement of the preferences, limitations, and relative rights of the shares of each class; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(1)(g): provisions not inconsistent with law regarding the distribution of assets on dissolution.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(2): The articles of incorporation may but need not set forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(2)(a): the names and addresses of the individuals who are to serve as the initial directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(2)(b): provisions not inconsistent with law regarding:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(2)(b)(i): managing the business and regulating the affairs of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(2)(b)(ii): defining, limiting, and regulating the powers of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(2)(b)(ii)(A): the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(2)(b)(ii)(B): the board of directors of the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(2)(b)(ii)(C): the members of the nonprofit corporation or any class of members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(2)(b)(iii): whether cumulative voting will be permitted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(2)(b)(iv): the characteristics, qualifications, rights, limitations, and obligations attaching to each or any class of members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(2)(c): any provision that under this chapter is permitted to be in the articles of incorporation or required or permitted to be set forth in the bylaws, including elective provisions that in accordance with this chapter shall be included in the articles of incorporation to be effective.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(3): (1)(a); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(3)(a): (1)(a) It is sufficient under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(3)(b): (3)(a) If the articles of incorporation include the statement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(4): The articles of incorporation need not set forth any corporate power enumerated in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(5): 16-6a-105 The articles of incorporation shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(5)(a): be signed by each incorporator; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(5)(b): 16-6a-105 meet the filing requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(6)(a): If this chapter conditions any matter upon the presence of a provision in the bylaws, the condition is satisfied if the provision is present either in:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(6)(a)(i): the articles of incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(6)(a)(ii): the bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(6)(b): If this chapter conditions any matter upon the absence of a provision in the bylaws, the condition is satisfied only if the provision is absent from both:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(6)(b)(i): the articles of incorporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-202(6)(b)(ii): the bylaws.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-203 Incorporation -- Required filings.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-203(1): 16-6a-108 A nonprofit corporation is incorporated, and its corporate existence begins:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-203(1)(a): when the articles of incorporation are filed by the division; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-203(1)(b): 16-6a-108 if a delayed effective date is specified as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-203(2): 16-6a-110 Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-203(2)(a): cancel or revoke the incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-203(2)(b): involuntarily dissolve the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-203(3): 13-22-15; 13-22-15; 13-22-15 Beginning January 1, 2025, a nonprofit corporation that is a charitable organization, unless exempted by Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-204 Liability for preincorporation transactions.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
All persons purporting to act as or on behalf of a nonprofit corporation, knowing there is no incorporation under this chapter, are jointly and severally liable for all liabilities created while so acting.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-205 Organization of the nonprofit corporation.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-205(1): After incorporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-205(1)(a): if initial directors are named in the articles of incorporation, the initial directors may hold an organizational meeting, at the call of a majority of the initial directors, to complete the organization of the nonprofit corporation by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-205(1)(a)(i): appointing officers;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-205(1)(a)(ii): adopting bylaws, if desired; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-205(1)(a)(iii): carrying on any other business brought before the meeting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-205(1)(b): if initial directors are not named in the articles of incorporation, until directors are elected, the incorporators may hold an organizational meeting at the call of a majority of the incorporators to do whatever is necessary and proper to complete the organization of the nonprofit corporation, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-205(1)(b)(i): the election of directors and officers;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-205(1)(b)(ii): the appointment of members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-205(1)(b)(iii): the adoption and amendment of bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-205(2): Action required or permitted by this chapter to be taken by incorporators at an organizational meeting may be taken without a meeting if the action taken is evidenced by one or more written consents that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-205(2)(a): describe the action taken; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-205(2)(b): are signed by each incorporator.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-205(3): An organizational meeting may be held in or out of this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-206 Bylaws.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-206(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-206(1)(a): The board of directors of a nonprofit corporation may adopt initial bylaws for the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-206(1)(b): If no directors of the nonprofit corporation have been elected, the incorporators may adopt initial bylaws for the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-206(1)(c): If neither the incorporators nor the board of directors have adopted initial bylaws, the members, if any, may adopt initial bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-206(2): The bylaws of a nonprofit corporation may contain any provision for managing the business and regulating the affairs of the nonprofit corporation that is not inconsistent with law or the articles of incorporation, including management and regulation of the nonprofit corporation in the event of an emergency.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207 Incorporation of cooperative association.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(1): (1)(b); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(1)(a): (1)(b) If a cooperative association meets the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(1)(a)(i): be incorporated under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(1)(a)(ii): use the word "cooperative" as part of its corporate or business name.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(1)(b): (1)(a) A cooperative association described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(1)(b)(i): may not be an association subject to the insurance or credit union laws of this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(1)(b)(ii): shall state in its articles of incorporation that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(1)(b)(ii)(A): a member may not have more than one vote regardless of the number or amount of stock or membership capital owned by the member unless voting is based in whole or in part on the volume of patronage of the member with the cooperative association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(1)(b)(ii)(B): savings in excess of dividends and additions to reserves and surplus shall be distributed or allocated to members or patrons on the basis of patronage.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(2): (1); 3-1-11; 3-1-11; (1); (2)(b)(i); (2)(b)(i); (2)(b)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(2)(a): (1); 3-1-11; 3-1-11 Any cooperative association incorporated in accordance with Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(2)(a)(ii): 3-1-11 may pay dividends on its stock, if it has stock, subject to the limitations of Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(2)(b)(i): the establishment and alteration of voting districts;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(2)(b)(ii): (2)(b)(i); (2)(b)(i) the election of delegates to represent:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(2)(b)(ii)(A): (2)(b)(i) the districts described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(2)(b)(ii)(B): (2)(b)(i) the members of the districts described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(2)(b)(iii): the establishment and alteration of director districts; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(2)(b)(iv): (2)(b)(ii) the election of directors to represent the districts described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(2)(b)(iv)(A): the members of the districts; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(2)(b)(iv)(B): delegates elected by the members.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(3)(a)(i): it elects to become subject to this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(3)(a)(ii): makes changes in its articles of incorporation that are:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(3)(a)(ii)(A): required by this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-207(3)(a)(ii)(B): any other changes permitted by this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-301 Purposes.
-----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-301(1): 16-6a-202(3)(a) Every nonprofit corporation incorporated under this chapter that in its articles of incorporation has a statement meeting the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-301(2): (2)(a); 7-1-103
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-301(2)(a): A nonprofit corporation engaging in an activity that is subject to regulation under another statute of this state may incorporate under this chapter only if permitted by, and subject to all limitations of, the other statute.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-301(2)(b): (2)(a); 7-1-103 Without limiting Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-301(2)(b)(i): insurance laws of this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-301(2)(b)(ii): 7-1-103 laws governing depository institutions as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302 General powers.
-----------------------------------------------
Unless its articles of incorporation provide otherwise, and except as restricted by the Utah Constitution, every nonprofit corporation has:Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(1): perpetual duration and succession in its corporate name; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2): 16-6a-823(1) the same powers as an individual to do all things necessary or convenient to carry out its permitted activities and affairs, including without limitation the power to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(a): sue and be sued, complain and defend in its corporate name;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(b)(i): have a corporate seal, that may be altered at will; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(b)(ii): use the corporate seal, or a facsimile of the corporate seal, by impressing or affixing it or in any other manner reproducing it;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(c): make and amend bylaws, not inconsistent with its articles of incorporation or with the laws of this state, for managing and regulating the affairs of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(d): purchase, receive, lease, or otherwise acquire, and own, hold, improve, use, and otherwise deal with, real or personal property, or any legal or equitable interest in property, wherever located;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(e): sell, convey, mortgage, pledge, lease, exchange, and otherwise dispose of all or any part of its property and assets;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(f): purchase, receive, subscribe for, or otherwise acquire, own, hold, vote, use, sell, mortgage, lend, pledge, or otherwise dispose of, and deal in and with shares or other interests in, or obligations of, any other entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(g): make contracts and guarantees, incur liabilities, borrow money, issue its notes, bonds, and other obligations and secure any of its obligations by mortgage or pledge of any of its property, assets, franchises, or income;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(h): lend money, invest and reinvest its funds, and receive and hold real and personal property as security for repayment, except that a nonprofit corporation may not lend money to or guarantee the obligation of a director or officer of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(i): be an agent, associate, fiduciary, manager, member, partner, promoter, or trustee of, or to hold any similar position with, any entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(j): conduct its business, locate offices, and exercise the powers granted by this chapter within or without this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(k): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(k)(i): elect directors and appoint officers, employees, and agents of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(k)(ii): define the duties of the directors, officers, employees, and agents; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(k)(iii): fix the compensation of the directors, officers, employees, and agents;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(l): pay compensation in a reasonable amount to its directors, officers, or members for services rendered, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(l)(i): payment of advances for expenses reasonably expected to be incurred; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(l)(ii): expenses relating to relocation of directors, officers, or employees;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(m): pay pensions and establish pension plans, pension trusts, profit sharing plans, share bonus plans, share option plans, and benefit or incentive plans for any or all of its current or former directors, officers, employees, and agents;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(n): make contributions to or for any person for:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(n)(i): the public welfare;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(n)(ii): charitable, religious, scientific, or educational purposes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(n)(iii): for other purposes that further the corporate interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(o): pursue any lawful activity that will aid governmental policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(p): make payments or do any other act, not inconsistent with law, that furthers the business and affairs of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(q): establish rules governing the conduct of the business and affairs of the nonprofit corporation in the event of an emergency;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(r): impose dues, assessments, admission fees, and transfer fees upon its members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(s): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(s)(i): establish conditions for admission of members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(s)(ii): admit members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(s)(iii): issue or transfer membership;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(t): carry on a business;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(u): indemnify current or former directors, officers, employees, fiduciaries, or agents as provided in this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(v): 16-6a-823(1) limit the liability of its directors as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(w): cease its corporate activities and dissolve; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(x): issue certificates or stock evidencing:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(x)(i): membership in the nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-302(2)(x)(ii): interests in water or other property rights.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303 Emergency powers.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(1): (4) In anticipation of or during an emergency defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(1)(a): modify lines of succession to accommodate the incapacity of any director, officer, employee, or agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(1)(b): adopt bylaws to be effective only in an emergency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(1)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(1)(c)(i): relocate the principal office;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(1)(c)(ii): designate an alternative principal office or regional office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(1)(c)(iii): authorize officers to relocate or designate an alternative principal office or regional office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(2): (4) During an emergency as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(2)(a): notice of a meeting of the board of directors:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(2)(a)(i): need be given only to those directors whom it is practicable to reach; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(2)(a)(ii): may be given in any practicable manner, including by publication or radio; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(2)(b): the officers of the nonprofit corporation present at a meeting of the board of directors may be considered to be directors for the meeting, in order of rank and within the same rank in order of seniority, as necessary to achieve a quorum.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(3): Corporate action taken in good faith during an emergency under this section to further the ordinary business affairs of the nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(3)(a): binds the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(3)(b): may not be the basis for the imposition of liability on any director, officer, employee, or agent of the nonprofit corporation on the ground that the action was not an authorized corporate action.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-303(4): An emergency exists for purposes of this section if a quorum of the directors cannot readily be obtained because of a catastrophic event.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-304 Ultra vires.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-304(1): (2) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-304(2): 16-6a-1414 A nonprofit corporation's power to act may be challenged:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-304(2)(a): in a proceeding against the nonprofit corporation to enjoin the act brought by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-304(2)(a)(i): a director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-304(2)(a)(ii): one or more voting members in a derivative proceeding;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-304(2)(b): in a proceeding by or in the right of the nonprofit corporation, whether directly, derivatively, or through a receiver, trustee, or other legal representative, against an incumbent or former director, officer, employee, or agent of the nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-304(2)(c): 16-6a-1414 in a proceeding by the attorney general under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-304(3): (2)(a) In a proceeding under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-304(3)(a): enjoin or set aside the act, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-304(3)(a)(i): it would be equitable to do so; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-304(3)(a)(ii): all affected persons are parties to the proceeding; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-304(3)(b): award damages for loss, including anticipated profits, suffered by the nonprofit corporation or another party because of an injunction issued under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401 Corporate name.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1): 16-6a-301; (2); 16-10a-401; 16-6a-402; 16-10a-402; 42-2-5; 42-2-5 The corporate name of a nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(a): may, but need not contain:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(a)(i): the word "corporation," "incorporated," or "company"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(a)(ii): an abbreviation of "corporation," "incorporated," or "company";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(b): 16-6a-301 may not contain:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(b)(i): 16-6a-301 any word or phrase that indicates or implies that the nonprofit corporation is organized for a purpose other than that permitted by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(b)(i)(A): 16-6a-301 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(b)(i)(B): the nonprofit corporation's articles of incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(b)(ii): for a nonprofit corporation that changes the nonprofit corporation's name or is incorporated in or authorized to do business in the state on or after May 4, 2022, the number sequence "911";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(c): (2); 16-10a-401; 16-6a-402; 16-10a-402; 42-2-5; 42-2-5 except as authorized by the division under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(c)(i): the name of any domestic corporation incorporated in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(c)(ii): the name of any foreign corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(c)(iii): the name of any domestic nonprofit corporation incorporated in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(c)(iv): the name of any foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(c)(v): the name of any domestic limited liability company formed in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(c)(vi): the name of any foreign limited liability company authorized to conduct affairs in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(c)(vii): the name of any limited partnership formed or authorized to conduct affairs in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(c)(viii): 16-6a-402; 16-10a-402 any name that is reserved under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(c)(ix): 42-2-5 the name of any entity that has registered the entity's name under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(c)(x): the name of any trademark or service mark registered by the division; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(c)(xi): 42-2-5 any assumed name filed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(d): shall be, for purposes of recordation, either translated into English or transliterated into letters of the English alphabet if the nonprofit corporation's name is not in English; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(e): without the written consent of the United States Olympic Committee, may not contain the words:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(e)(i): "Olympic";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(e)(ii): "Olympiad"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(1)(e)(iii): "Citius Altius Fortius".
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(2): (1)(c) The division may authorize the use of the name applied for if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(2)(a): (1)(c) the name is distinguishable from one or more of the names and trademarks described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(2)(b): if the applicant delivers to the division a certified copy of the final judgment of a court of competent jurisdiction establishing the applicant's right to use the name applied for in this state registered or reserved with the division pursuant to the laws of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(3): A nonprofit corporation may use the name of another domestic or foreign corporation that is used in this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(3)(a): the other corporation is incorporated or authorized to conduct affairs in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(3)(b): the proposed user corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(3)(b)(i): has merged with the other corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(3)(b)(ii): has been formed by reorganization of the other corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(3)(b)(iii): has acquired all or substantially all of the assets, including the corporate name, of the other corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(4): (1); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(4)(a): (1) A nonprofit corporation may apply to the division for authorization to file the nonprofit corporation's articles of incorporation under, or to register or reserve, a name that is not distinguishable upon the division's records from one or more of the names described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(4)(b): (4)(a) The division shall approve the application filed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(4)(b)(i): the other person whose name is not distinguishable from the name under which the applicant desires to file, or which the applicant desires to register or reserve:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(4)(b)(i)(A): consents to the filing, registration, or reservation in writing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(4)(b)(i)(B): submits an undertaking in a form satisfactory to the division to change the person's name to a name that is distinguishable from the name of the applicant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(4)(b)(ii): the applicant delivers to the division a certified copy of the final judgment of a court of competent jurisdiction establishing the applicant's right to make the requested filing in this state under the name applied for.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(5): Only names of corporations may contain the:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(5)(a): words "corporation," or "incorporated"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(5)(b): abbreviation "corp." or "inc."
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-401(6): The division may not issue a certificate of incorporation to any association violating the provisions of this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402 Reserved name.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(1)(a): Any person may apply for the reservation of the exclusive use of a corporate name by delivering an application for reservation of name to the division for filing, setting forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(1)(a)(i): the name and address of the applicant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(1)(a)(ii): the name proposed to be reserved.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(1)(b): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(1)(b)(i): (1)(a) If the division finds that the name applied for would be available for corporate use, the division shall reserve the name for the applicant's exclusive use for 120 days from the day the division receives the application under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(1)(b)(ii): A reservation may be renewed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(2): The owner of a reserved corporate name may transfer the reservation to any other person by delivery to the division for filing of a notice of the transfer that has been executed by the owner and states:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(2)(a): the reserved name;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(2)(b): the name of the owner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(2)(c): the name and address of the transferee.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(3): (3)(b); 16-6a-108(2); 16-6a-108(3); (3)(a); 16-6a-108(2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(3)(a): (3)(b); 16-6a-108(2); 16-6a-108(3) The corporate name set forth in a document described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(3)(a)(i): 16-6a-108(2) becomes effective pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(3)(a)(ii): 16-6a-108(3) is withdrawn under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(3)(b): (3)(a); 16-6a-108(2) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(3)(b)(i): is one of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(3)(b)(i)(A): articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(3)(b)(i)(B): articles of amendment to articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(3)(b)(i)(C): restated articles of incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(3)(b)(i)(D): articles of merger;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(3)(b)(ii): 16-6a-108(2) specifies a delayed effective date pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(3)(b)(iii): sets forth a new corporate name; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-402(3)(b)(iv): is filed by the division.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-403 Corporate name -- Limited rights.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
The authorization granted by the division to file articles of incorporation under a corporate name or to reserve a name does not:Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-403(1): abrogate or limit the law governing unfair competition or unfair trade practices;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-403(2): derogate from the common law the principles of equity or the statutes of this state or of the United States with respect to the right to acquire and protect names and trademarks; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-403(3): create an exclusive right in geographic or generic terms contained within a name.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-601 No requirement of members.
----------------------------------------------------------
A nonprofit corporation is not required to have members.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-602 Number and classes.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-602(1): (1)(a) A nonprofit corporation may have:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-602(1)(a): one or more classes of voting or nonvoting members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-602(1)(b): (1)(a) one or more members in each class described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-602(2): The bylaws may designate:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-602(2)(a): the class or classes of members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-602(2)(b): the qualifications and rights of the members of each class of members including the matters or items for which voting members may vote.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-603 Admission.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-603(1): The bylaws may establish:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-603(1)(a): criteria or procedures for admission of members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-603(1)(b): the procedure for replacing:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-603(1)(b)(i): a member; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-603(1)(b)(ii): a membership interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-603(2): A person may not be admitted as a member without the person's consent.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-604 Consideration.
----------------------------------------------
Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, a nonprofit corporation may admit members:Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-604(1): for no consideration; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-604(2): for such consideration as is determined by the board of directors.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-605 Differences in rights and obligations of members.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless otherwise provided by this chapter or the bylaws:Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-605(1): all voting members shall have the same rights and obligations with respect to voting and all other matters that this chapter specifically reserves to voting members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-605(2): (1) with respect to matters not reserved under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-606 Transfers.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-606(1): (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-606(1)(a): a membership; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-606(1)(b): any right arising from a membership.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-606(2): (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-606(3): (3)(a); 16-6a-612; 16-6a-808; 16-6a-809; 16-6a-822; 16-6a-824; 16-6a-825
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-606(3)(a): For a water company, unless otherwise provided by the articles of incorporation or bylaws, ownership of shares is transferrable.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-606(3)(b): (3)(a) Any restriction on the transfer of ownership under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-606(3)(b)(i): shall be reasonable;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-606(3)(b)(ii): shall be adopted in good faith and for a legitimate purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-606(3)(b)(iii): shall be adopted in the best interest of the water company and its shareholders; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-606(3)(b)(iv): may not discriminate against any individual shareholder or class of shareholders, but in a company where there are classes or divisions of stock, restrictions may differ between the classes or divisions.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-607 Creditor's action against member.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
A proceeding may not be brought by a creditor to reach the liability, if any, of a member to the nonprofit corporation unless:Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-607(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-607(1)(a): final judgment has been rendered in favor of the creditor against the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-607(1)(b): execution has been returned unsatisfied in whole or in part; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-607(2): (1) a proceeding described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-608 Resignation.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-608(1): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, a member may resign at any time.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-608(2): The resignation of a member does not relieve the member from any obligation or commitment the member may have to the nonprofit corporation incurred or made prior to resignation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609 Termination, expulsion, or suspension.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(1): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, except pursuant to a procedure that is fair and reasonable:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(1)(a): a member of a nonprofit corporation may not be expelled or suspended; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(1)(b): membership in a nonprofit corporation may not be terminated or suspended.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(2): For purposes of this section, a procedure is fair and reasonable when either:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(2)(a): the bylaws or a written policy of the board of directors set forth a procedure that provides:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(2)(a)(i): not less than 15 days prior written notice of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(2)(a)(i)(A): the expulsion, suspension, or termination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(2)(a)(i)(B): the reasons for the expulsion, suspension, or termination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(2)(a)(ii): an opportunity for the member to be heard:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(2)(a)(ii)(A): orally or in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(2)(a)(ii)(B): not less than five days before the effective date of the expulsion, suspension, or termination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(2)(a)(ii)(C): by one or more persons authorized to decide that the proposed expulsion, termination, or suspension not take place; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(2)(b): it is fair and reasonable taking into consideration all of the relevant facts and circumstances.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(3): For purposes of this section, any written notice given by mail shall be given by first-class or certified mail sent to the last address of the member shown on the nonprofit corporation's records.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(4): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, any proceeding challenging an expulsion, suspension, or termination, including a proceeding in which defective notice is alleged, shall be commenced within one year after the effective date of the expulsion, suspension, or termination.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(5): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, a member who has been expelled or suspended may be liable to the nonprofit corporation for dues, assessments, or fees as a result of an obligation incurred or commitment made prior to the effective date of the expulsion or suspension.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-609(6): 70A-8-409.1 A mutual benefit corporation that complies with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610 Purchase of memberships.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610(1): Unless otherwise provided  in the articles of incorporation or  the bylaws, a nonprofit corporation may not purchase the membership of a member:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610(1)(a): who resigns; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610(1)(b): whose membership is terminated.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610(2): (2)(a); 16-6a-1301
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610(2)(a): If so authorized, a nonprofit corporation may purchase the membership of a member who resigns or whose membership is terminated for the amount and pursuant to the conditions set forth in or authorized by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610(2)(a)(i): its  articles of incorporation or its  bylaws; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610(2)(a)(ii): agreement with the affected member.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610(2)(b): (2)(a); 16-6a-1301 A payment permitted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610(2)(b)(i): 16-6a-1301 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610(2)(b)(ii): any other provision of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610(3): A mutual benefit corporation may purchase a member's membership if, after the purchase is completed:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610(3)(a): the mutual benefit corporation would be able to pay its debts as they become due in the usual course of its activities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610(3)(b): the mutual benefit corporation's total assets would at least equal the sum of its total liabilities.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-610(4): Chapter 4, Share Assessment Act A water company may purchase the shares of a shareholder who is delinquent in payment of shareholder assessments, in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-611 Property rights.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-611(1): A member has no right relating to management, control, purpose, or duration of the nonprofit corporation, except as provided by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-611(1)(a): the articles of incorporation or  the bylaws of a mutual benefit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-611(1)(b): other applicable law.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-611(2): 73-3-3.5 Unless otherwise provided by agreement, articles of incorporation, or the bylaws of a water company, and subject to the general liabilities and obligations of the water company, a shareholder in a water company has:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-611(2)(a): an equitable, beneficial interest in the use of the water supply of the water company, proportionate to the shareholder's shares in the water company, which is an interest in real property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-611(2)(b): 73-3-3.5 the right to have the shareholder's proportionate share of the water delivered through a diversion structure, ditch, canal, storage and distribution facility, or other appurtenance of the water company, in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-611(2)(b)(i): the distribution method of the water company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-611(2)(b)(ii): 73-3-3.5 an approved change application under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612 Derivative suits.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(1): Without affecting the right of a member or director to bring a proceeding against a nonprofit corporation or its directors or officers, a proceeding may be brought in the right of a nonprofit corporation to procure a judgment in its favor by a complainant who is:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(1)(a): a voting member; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(1)(b): a director in a nonprofit corporation that does not have voting members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(2): A complainant may not commence or maintain a derivative proceeding unless the complainant:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(2)(a): is a voting member, or a director in a nonprofit corporation that does not have voting members, at the time the proceeding is brought; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(2)(b): fairly and adequately represents the nonprofit corporation's interests in enforcing the nonprofit corporation's right.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3): (3)(a)(i); (4); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(a): (3)(a)(i) A complainant may not commence a derivative proceeding until:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(a)(i): a written demand is made upon the nonprofit corporation to take suitable action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(a)(ii): (3)(a)(i) 90 days have expired from the date the demand described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(a)(ii)(A): the complainant is notified before the 90-day period expires that the demand is rejected by the nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(a)(ii)(B): irreparable injury to the nonprofit corporation would result by waiting for the 90-day period's expiration.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(b): A complaint in a derivative proceeding shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(b)(i): verified; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(b)(ii): allege with particularity the demand made to obtain action by the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(c): A derivative proceeding shall comply with the procedures of Utah Rules of Civil Procedure, Rule 23.1.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(d): (4) The court shall stay any derivative proceeding until the inquiry is completed and for an additional period as the court considers appropriate if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(d)(i): the nonprofit corporation commences an inquiry into the allegations made in the demand or complaint; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(d)(ii): (4) a person or group described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(e): (4)(a) If a nonprofit corporation proposes to dismiss a derivative proceeding pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(e)(i): is limited to facts relating to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(e)(i)(A): whether the person or group conducting the inquiry is independent and disinterested;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(e)(i)(B): the good faith of the inquiry; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(e)(i)(C): the reasonableness of the procedures followed by the person or group conducting the inquiry; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(3)(e)(ii): may not extend to any facts or substantive issues with respect to the act, omission, or other matter that is the subject matter of the derivative proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4): (4)(b); (4)(f); (4)(f); (4)(a); (4)(a); (4)(a); (4)(a); (4)(f)(i); (4)(a); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(a): (4)(b); (4)(f) A derivative proceeding shall be dismissed by the court on motion by the corporation if a person or group specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(b): (4)(f); (4)(a) Unless a panel is appointed pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(b)(i): a majority vote of independent directors present at a meeting of the board of directors, if the independent directors constitute a quorum; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(b)(ii): a majority vote of a committee consisting of two or more independent directors appointed by a majority vote of independent directors present at a meeting of the board of directors, whether or not the independent directors appointing the committee constituted a quorum.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(c): None of the following by itself causes a director to be considered not independent for purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(c)(i): the nomination or election of the director by persons:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(c)(i)(A): who are defendants in the derivative proceeding; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(c)(i)(B): against whom action is demanded;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(c)(ii): the naming of the director as:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(c)(ii)(A): a defendant in the derivative proceeding; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(c)(ii)(B): a person against whom action is demanded; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(c)(iii): the approval by the director of the act being challenged in the derivative proceeding or demand if the act resulted in no personal benefit to the director.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(d): (4)(a) If a derivative proceeding is commenced after a determination is made rejecting a demand by a complainant, the complaint shall allege with particularity facts establishing either:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(d)(i): that a majority of the board of directors did not consist of independent directors at the time the determination was made; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(d)(ii): (4)(a) that the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(e): (4)(a); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(e)(i): (4)(a) If a majority of the board of directors does not consist of independent directors at the time the determination is made to reject a demand by a shareholder, the corporation has the burden of proving that the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(e)(ii): (4)(a) If a majority of the board of directors consists of independent directors at the time the determination is made to reject a demand by a complainant, the plaintiff has the burden of proving that the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(f): (4)(f)(i); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(f)(i): The court may appoint a panel of one or more independent persons upon motion by the corporation to make a determination whether the maintenance of the derivative proceeding is in the best interest of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(f)(ii): (4)(f)(i); (4)(a) If the court appoints a panel under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(4)(g): (4)(a) A person may appeal an interlocutory order of a court that grants or denies a motion to dismiss brought pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(5): On termination of a derivative proceeding the court may order:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(5)(a): the nonprofit corporation to pay the plaintiff's reasonable expenses, including attorney fees, incurred in the proceeding, if it finds that the proceeding results in a substantial benefit to the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(5)(b): the plaintiff to pay a defendant's reasonable expenses, including attorney fees, incurred in defending the proceeding, if it finds that the proceeding was commenced or maintained:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(5)(b)(i): without reasonable cause; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(5)(b)(ii): for an improper purpose; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(5)(c): a party to pay an opposing party's reasonable expenses, including attorney fees, incurred because of the filing of a pleading, motion, or other paper, if the court finds that the pleading, motion, or other paper was:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(5)(c)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(5)(c)(i)(A): not well grounded in fact, after reasonable inquiry; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(5)(c)(i)(B): not warranted by existing law or a good faith argument for the extension, modification, or reversal of existing law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(5)(c)(ii): interposed for an improper purpose, such as to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(5)(c)(ii)(A): harass;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(5)(c)(ii)(B): cause unnecessary delay; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-612(5)(c)(ii)(C): cause needless increase in the cost of litigation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-613 Delegates.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-613(1): A nonprofit corporation may provide in its bylaws for delegates having some or all of the authority of members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-613(2): The bylaws may set forth provisions relating to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-613(2)(a): the characteristics, qualifications, rights, limitations, and obligations of delegates, including their selection and removal;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-613(2)(b): calling, noticing, holding, and conducting meetings of delegates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-613(2)(c): carrying on corporate activities during and between meetings of delegates.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701 Annual and regular meetings.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701(1): Unless the bylaws eliminate the requirement for holding an annual meeting, a nonprofit corporation that has voting members shall hold a meeting of the voting members annually:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701(1)(a): at a time and date stated in or fixed in accordance with the bylaws; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701(1)(b): if a time and date is not stated in or fixed in accordance with the bylaws, at a time and date stated in or fixed in accordance with a resolution of the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701(2): A nonprofit corporation with members may hold regular membership meetings at:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701(2)(a): a time and date stated in or fixed in accordance with the bylaws; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701(2)(b): if a time and date is not stated in or fixed in accordance with the bylaws, at a time and date stated in or fixed in accordance with a resolution of the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701(3)(a): Annual and regular membership meetings may be held in or out of this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701(3)(a)(i): at the place stated in or fixed in accordance with the bylaws; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701(3)(a)(ii): if no place is stated in or fixed in accordance with the bylaws, at a place stated in or fixed in accordance with a resolution of the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701(3)(b): (3)(a) If no place is stated or fixed in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701(4): (1) The failure to hold an annual or regular meeting at the time and date determined pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701(4)(a): affect the validity of any corporate action; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-701(4)(b): work a forfeiture or dissolution of the nonprofit corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702 Special meetings.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(1): A nonprofit corporation shall hold a special meeting of its members:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(1)(a): on call of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(1)(a)(i): its board of directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(1)(a)(ii): the person or persons authorized by the bylaws or resolution of the board of directors to call a special meeting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(1)(b): unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, if the nonprofit corporation receives one or more written demands for the meeting, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(1)(b)(i): state the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is to be held; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(1)(b)(ii): are signed and dated by members holding at least 10% of all the votes entitled pursuant to the bylaws to be cast on any issue proposed to be considered at the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(2): 16-6a-703; 16-6a-706; (1)(b) If not otherwise fixed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(2)(a): the earliest of any of the demands pursuant to which the meeting is called; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(2)(b): the date that is 60 days before the date the first of the demands is received by the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(3): (1)(b); 16-6a-704; (4); 16-6a-704 If a notice for a special meeting demanded pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(3)(a): set the time and place of the meeting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(3)(b): 16-6a-704 give notice pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(4): (3)(a); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(4)(a): A special meeting of the members may be held in or out of this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(4)(a)(i): at the place stated in or fixed in accordance with the bylaws; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(4)(a)(ii): if a place is not stated in or fixed in accordance with the bylaws, at a place stated in or fixed in accordance with a resolution of the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(4)(b): (3)(a); (4)(a) If no place is stated or fixed in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-702(5): 16-6a-704(3) Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, only business within the purposes described in the notice of the meeting required by Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703 Court-ordered meeting.
------------------------------------------------------
the date of the call orUtah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(1): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; 16-6a-702(1); Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; 16-6a-702(1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(1)(a): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration A voting member entitled to participate in an annual meeting may petition a court with jurisdiction under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(1)(a)(i): the corporation's last annual meeting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(1)(a)(ii): if there has been no annual meeting, the date of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(1)(b): 16-6a-702(1); Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; 16-6a-702(1)(b) A person who participated in a call of or demand for a special meeting effective under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(1)(b)(i): 16-6a-702(1)(b) notice of the special meeting was not given within 30 days after

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(2): If a petition is filed under this section, the court may summarily order the holding of a meeting of the members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(3): (2) A court that orders a meeting under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(3)(a): fix the time and place of the meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(3)(b): determine the members entitled to participate in the meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(3)(c): specify a record date for determining members entitled to notice of and to vote at the meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(3)(d): prescribe the form and content of the notice of the meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(3)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(3)(e)(i): fix the quorum required for specific matters to be considered at the meeting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(3)(e)(ii): direct that the votes represented at the meeting constitute a quorum for action on the specific matters to be considered at the meeting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-703(3)(f): enter other orders necessary or appropriate to accomplish the holding of the meeting.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704 Notice of meeting.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(1): A nonprofit corporation shall give to each member entitled to vote at the meeting notice consistent with its bylaws of meetings of members in a fair and reasonable manner.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(2): (3) Any notice that conforms to the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3): 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(A); 45-1-101; 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(B); 16-6a-825; 16-6a-910; 16-6a-1003; 16-6a-1010; 16-6a-1102; 16-6a-1202; 16-6a-1402 Notice is fair and reasonable if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3)(a): 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(A); 45-1-101; 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(B) the nonprofit corporation notifies its members of the place, date, and time of each annual, regular, and special meeting of members:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3)(a)(i): no fewer than 10 days before the meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3)(a)(ii): if notice is mailed by other than first-class or registered mail, no fewer than 30 days, nor more than 60 days before the meeting date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3)(a)(iii): 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(A); 45-1-101; 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(B) if notice is given:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3)(a)(iii)(A): 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(A) by newspaper as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3)(a)(iii)(A)(I): the first of the publications no more than 60 days before the meeting date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3)(a)(iii)(A)(II): the last of the publications no fewer than 10 days before the meeting date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3)(a)(iii)(B): 45-1-101; 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3)(a)(iii)(B)(I): 45-1-101 by publication in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3)(a)(iii)(B)(II): 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(B) as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3)(b): 16-6a-825; 16-6a-910; 16-6a-1003; 16-6a-1010; 16-6a-1102; 16-6a-1202; 16-6a-1402 the notice of an annual or regular meeting includes a description of any matter or matters that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3)(b)(i): must be approved by the members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3)(b)(ii): 16-6a-825; 16-6a-910; 16-6a-1003; 16-6a-1010; 16-6a-1102; 16-6a-1202; 16-6a-1402 for which the members' approval is sought under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(3)(c): unless otherwise provided by this chapter or the bylaws, the notice of a special meeting includes a description of the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(4): (4)(a); 16-6a-706
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(4)(a): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, if an annual, regular, or special meeting of members is adjourned to a different date, time, or place, notice need not be given of the new date, time, or place, if the new date, time, or place is announced at the meeting before adjournment.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(4)(b): (4)(a); 16-6a-706 Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(5): When giving notice of an annual, regular, or special meeting of members, a nonprofit corporation shall give notice of a matter a member intends to raise at the meeting if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(5)(a): requested in writing to do so by a person entitled to call a special meeting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-704(5)(b): the request is received by the secretary or president of the nonprofit corporation at least 10 days before the nonprofit corporation gives notice of the meeting.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-705 Waiver of notice.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-705(1): (1); (1)(b); (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-705(1)(a): A member may waive any notice required by this chapter or by the bylaws, whether before or after the date or time stated in the notice as the date or time when any action will occur or has occurred.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-705(1)(b): (1) A waiver described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-705(1)(b)(i): in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-705(1)(b)(ii): signed by the member entitled to the notice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-705(1)(b)(iii): delivered to the nonprofit corporation for:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-705(1)(b)(iii)(A): inclusion in the minutes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-705(1)(b)(iii)(B): filing with the corporate records.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-705(1)(c): (1)(b) A waiver satisfies the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-705(1)(d): (1)(b) The delivery and filing required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-705(2): A member's attendance at a meeting:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-705(2)(a): waives objection to lack of notice or defective notice of the meeting, unless the member at the beginning of the meeting objects to holding the meeting or transacting business at the meeting because of lack of notice or defective notice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-705(2)(b): waives objection to consideration of a particular matter at the meeting that is not within the purpose or purposes described in the meeting notice, unless the member objects to considering the matter when it is presented.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706 Record date -- Determining members entitled to notice and vote.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(1): (1)(a); (1)(a); (b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(1)(a): The bylaws may fix or provide the manner of fixing a date as the record date for determining the members entitled to notice of a members' meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(1)(b): (1)(a) If the bylaws do not fix or provide for fixing a record date described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(1)(c): (1)(a); (b) If a record date is not fixed in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(1)(c)(i): at the close of business on the business day preceding the day on which notice is given; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(1)(c)(ii): if notice is waived, at the close of business on the business day preceding the day on which the meeting is held.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(2): (2)(a); (2)(a); (b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(2)(a): The bylaws may fix or provide the manner of fixing a date as the record date for determining the members entitled to vote at a members' meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(2)(b): (2)(a) If the bylaws do not fix or provide for fixing a record date described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(2)(c): (2)(a); (b) If a record date is not fixed in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(2)(c)(i): on the date of the meeting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(2)(c)(ii): who are otherwise eligible to vote.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(3): (3)(a); (3)(a); (b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(3)(a): The bylaws may fix or provide the manner for determining a date as the record date for the purpose of determining the members entitled to exercise any rights in respect of any other lawful action.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(3)(b): (3)(a) If the bylaws do not fix or provide for fixing a record date described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(3)(c): (3)(a); (b) If a record date is not fixed in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(3)(c)(i): the close of business on the day on which the board adopts the resolution relating to the exercise of the right; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(3)(c)(ii): the close of business on the 60th day before the date of the exercise of the right.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(4): A record date fixed under this section may not be more than 70 days before the meeting or action requiring a determination of members occurs.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(5)(a): A determination of members entitled to notice of or to vote at a meeting of members is effective for any adjournment of the meeting unless the board of directors fixes a new date for determining the right to notice or the right to vote.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(5)(b): The board of directors shall fix a new date for determining the right to notice or the right to vote if the meeting is adjourned to a date more than 120 days after the record date for determining members entitled to notice of the original meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(6): If a court orders a meeting adjourned to a date more than 120 days after the date fixed for the original meeting, the court may:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(6)(a): provide that the original record date for notice or voting continues in effect; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-706(6)(b): fix a new record date for notice or voting.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707 Action without meeting.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(1): (5); 16-6a-1704(3) Unless otherwise provided in the articles of incorporation and Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(2)(a): Unless the written consents of all members entitled to vote have been obtained, notice of any member approval without a meeting shall be given at least 10 days before the consummation of the transaction, action, or event authorized by the member action to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(2)(a)(i): those members entitled to vote who have not consented in writing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(2)(a)(ii): those members:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(2)(a)(ii)(A): not entitled to vote; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(2)(a)(ii)(B): to whom this chapter requires that notice of the proposed action be given.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(2)(b): (2)(a) The notice required pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(3): Any member giving a written consent, or the member's proxyholder or a personal representative of the member or their respective proxyholder, may revoke the consent by a signed writing:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(3)(a): describing the action;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(3)(b): stating that the member's prior consent is revoked; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(3)(c): that is received by the nonprofit corporation prior to the effectiveness of the action.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(4): (1); (3); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(4)(a): (1); (3) A member action taken pursuant to this section is not effective unless all written consents on which the nonprofit corporation relies for the taking of an action pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(4)(a)(i): received by the nonprofit corporation within a 60-day period; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(4)(a)(ii): (3) not revoked pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(4)(b): Action taken by the members pursuant to this section is effective:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(4)(b)(i): as of the date the last written consent necessary to effect the action is received by the nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(4)(b)(ii): if all of the written consents necessary to effect the action specify a later date as the effective date of the action, the later date specified in the consents.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(4)(c): (1) If the nonprofit corporation has received written consents in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(4)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(4)(d)(i): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, a member may deliver a written consent under this section by an electronic transmission that provides the nonprofit corporation with a complete copy of the written consent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(4)(d)(ii): An electronic transmission consenting to an action under this section is considered to be written, signed, and dated for purposes of this section if the electronic transmission is delivered with information from which the corporation can determine:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(4)(d)(ii)(A): that the electronic transmission is transmitted by the member; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(4)(d)(ii)(B): the date on which the electronic transmission is transmitted.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(4)(d)(iii): The date on which an electronic transmission is transmitted is considered the date on which a consent is signed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(5): (1) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(6): 16-6a-703; 16-6a-706; (2); (1) If not otherwise determined under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-707(7): Action taken under this section has the same effect as action taken at a meeting of members and may be so described in any document.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-708 Meetings by telecommunication.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-708(1): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, any or all of the members may participate in an annual, regular, or special meeting of the members by, or the meeting may be conducted through the use of, any means of communication by which all persons participating in the meeting may hear each other during the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-708(2): (1) A member participating in a meeting by a means permitted under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709 Action by written ballot.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(1): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, any action that may be taken at any annual, regular, or special meeting of members may be taken without a meeting if the nonprofit corporation delivers a written ballot to every member entitled to vote on the matter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(2): (1) A written ballot described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(2)(a): set forth each proposed action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(2)(b): provide an opportunity to vote for or against each proposed action.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(3): (8); 16-6a-716
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(3)(a): (8) Approval by written ballot pursuant to this section shall be valid only when:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(3)(a)(i): (8) the time, as determined under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(3)(a)(ii): the number of approvals equals or exceeds the number of votes that would be required to approve the matter at a meeting at which the total number of votes cast was the same as the number of votes cast by ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(3)(b): 16-6a-716 Unless otherwise provided in this chapter or in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(4): All solicitations for votes by written ballot shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(4)(a): indicate the number of responses needed to meet the quorum requirements;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(4)(b): state the percentage of approvals necessary to approve each matter other than election of directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(4)(c): specify the time by which a ballot must be received by the nonprofit corporation in order to be counted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(4)(d): be accompanied by written information sufficient to permit each person casting the ballot to reach an informed decision on the matter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(5): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, a written ballot may not be revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(6): Action taken under this section has the same effect as action taken at a meeting of members and may be described as such in any document.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(7): (2) Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, a written ballot delivered to every member entitled to vote on the matter or matters therein, as described in this section, may also be used in connection with any annual, regular, or special meeting of members, thereby allowing members the choice of either voting in person or by written ballot delivered by a member to the nonprofit corporation in lieu of attendance at such meeting.  Any written ballot shall comply with the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(8)(a): Members shall be provided a fair and reasonable amount of time before the day on which the nonprofit corporation must receive ballots.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(8)(b): An amount of time is considered to be fair and reasonable if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(8)(b)(i): members are given at least 15 days from the day on which the notice is mailed, if the notice is mailed by first-class or registered mail;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(8)(b)(ii): members are given at least 30 days from the day on which the notice is mailed, if the notice is mailed by other than first-class or registered mail; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-709(8)(b)(iii): considering all the circumstances, the amount of time is otherwise reasonable.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710 Members' list for meeting and action by written ballot.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(1): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(1)(a): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, after fixing a record date for a notice of a meeting or for determining the members entitled to take action by written ballot, a nonprofit corporation shall prepare a list of the names of all the nonprofit corporation's members who are:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(1)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(1)(a)(i)(A): entitled to notice of the meeting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(1)(a)(i)(B): to vote at the meeting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(1)(a)(ii): to take the action by written ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(1)(b): (1) The list required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(1)(b)(i): be arranged by voting group;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(1)(b)(ii): be alphabetical within each voting group;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(1)(b)(iii): show the address of each member entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the meeting or to take such action by written ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(1)(b)(iv): show the number of votes each member is entitled to vote at the meeting or by written ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2): (1); (1); 16-6a-1602(3); 16-6a-1603(2); (3); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(a): (1) If prepared in connection with a meeting of the members, the members' list required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(a)(i)(A): beginning the earlier of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(a)(i)(A)(I): 10 days before the meeting for which the list was prepared; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(a)(i)(A)(II): two business days after notice of the meeting is given; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(a)(i)(B): continuing through the meeting, and any adjournment of the meeting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(a)(ii)(A): at the nonprofit corporation's principal office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(a)(ii)(B): at a place identified in the notice of the meeting in the city where the meeting will be held.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(b): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(b)(i): (1) The nonprofit corporation shall make the members' list required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(b)(ii): Any member entitled to vote at the meeting or an agent or attorney of a member entitled to vote at the meeting is entitled to inspect the members' list at any time during the meeting or any adjournment.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(c): 16-6a-1602(3); 16-6a-1603(2); (3); (1) A member entitled to vote at the meeting, or an agent or attorney of a member entitled to vote at the meeting, is entitled on written demand to inspect and, subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(c)(i): during:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(c)(i)(A): regular business hours; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(c)(i)(B): the period it is available for inspection; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(2)(c)(ii): at the member's expense.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(3): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; (2); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(3)(a): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; (2) A member of a nonprofit corporation may petition a court with jurisdiction under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(3)(b): (3)(a) If a petition is filed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(3)(b)(i): summarily order the inspection or copying of the members' list at the nonprofit corporation's expense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(3)(b)(ii): until the inspection or copying is complete:
