Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(3)(b)(ii)(A): postpone or adjourn the meeting for which the members' list was prepared; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(3)(b)(ii)(B): postpone the time when the nonprofit corporation must receive written ballots in connection with which the members' list was prepared.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(4): (3) If a court orders inspection or copying of a members' list pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(4)(a): the court shall order the nonprofit corporation to pay the member's costs, including reasonable counsel fees, incurred in obtaining the order;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(4)(b): the court may order the nonprofit corporation to pay the member for any damages the member incurred; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(4)(c): the court may grant the member any other remedy afforded the member by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(5): (3) If a court orders inspection or copying of a members' list pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-710(6): Failure to prepare or make available the members' list does not affect the validity of action taken at the meeting or by means of the written ballot.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-711 Voting entitlement generally.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-711(1): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-711(1)(a): only voting members may vote with respect to any matter required or permitted under this chapter to be submitted to a vote of the members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-711(1)(b): all references in this chapter to votes of or voting by the members permit voting only by the voting members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-711(1)(c): voting members may vote with respect to all matters required or permitted under this chapter to be submitted to a vote of the members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-711(2): (2)(b) Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, each member entitled to vote may cast:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-711(2)(a): (2)(b) one vote on each matter submitted to a vote of members for nonprofit corporations other than those in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-711(2)(b): one vote for each share held by the member on each matter submitted for a vote of members if the nonprofit corporation issues shares to its members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-711(3): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, if a membership stands of record in the names of two or more persons, the membership's acts with respect to voting have the following effect:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-711(3)(a): If only one votes, the act binds all of the persons whose membership is jointly held.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-711(3)(b): If more than one votes, the vote is divided on a pro-rata basis.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712 Proxies.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(1): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, a member entitled to vote may vote or otherwise act in person or by proxy.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(2): (2)(a); (b); (2)(b)(ii); (2)(b)(i) Without limiting the manner in which a member may appoint a proxy to vote or otherwise act for the member, Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(2)(a): A member may appoint a proxy by signing an appointment form, either personally or by the member's attorney-in-fact.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(2)(b): (2)(b)(ii); (2)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(2)(b)(i): (2)(b)(ii) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(2)(b)(i)(A): the proxy;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(2)(b)(i)(B): a proxy solicitor;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(2)(b)(i)(C): a proxy support service organization;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(2)(b)(i)(D): another person duly authorized by the proxy to receive appointments as agent for the proxy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(2)(b)(i)(E): the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(2)(b)(ii): (2)(b)(i) An appointment transmitted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(3): (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(3)(a): (2)(b) An appointment of a proxy is effective against the nonprofit corporation when received by the nonprofit corporation, including receipt by the nonprofit corporation of an appointment transmitted pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(3)(b): An appointment is valid for 11 months unless a different period is expressly provided in the appointment form.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(4): Any complete copy, including an electronic transmission, of an appointment of a proxy may be substituted for or used in lieu of the original appointment for any purpose for which the original appointment could be used.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(5): An appointment of a proxy is revocable by the member.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(6): An appointment of a proxy is revoked by the person appointing the proxy:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(6)(a): attending any meeting and voting in person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(6)(b): signing and delivering to the secretary or other officer or agent authorized to tabulate proxy votes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(6)(b)(i): a writing stating that the appointment of the proxy is revoked; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(6)(b)(ii): a subsequent appointment form.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(7): The death or incapacity of the member appointing a proxy does not affect the right of the nonprofit corporation to accept the proxy's authority unless notice of the death or incapacity is received by the secretary or other officer or agent authorized to tabulate votes before the proxy exercises the proxy's authority under the appointment.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-712(8): 16-6a-713 Subject to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713 Nonprofit corporation's acceptance of votes.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(1): If the name signed on any of the following corresponds to the name of a member, the nonprofit corporation, if acting in good faith, may accept and give the following effect as the act of the member:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(1)(a): a vote;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(1)(b): a consent;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(1)(c): a written ballot;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(1)(d): a waiver;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(1)(e): a proxy appointment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(1)(f): a proxy appointment revocation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2): (1); (1); (1); (1); (1); (2) If the name signed on any writing listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(a)(i): the member is an entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(a)(ii): the name signed purports to be that of an officer or agent of the entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(b): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(b)(i): the name signed purports to be that of an administrator, executor, guardian, or conservator representing the member; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(b)(ii): (1) evidence of fiduciary status acceptable to the nonprofit corporation with respect to the writing listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(b)(ii)(A): has been requested by the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(b)(ii)(B): is presented to the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(c): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(c)(i): the name signed purports to be that of a receiver or trustee in bankruptcy of the member; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(c)(ii): (1) evidence of this status acceptable to the nonprofit corporation with respect to the writing listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(c)(ii)(A): has been requested by the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(c)(ii)(B): is presented to the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(d): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(d)(i): the name signed purports to be that of a pledgee, beneficial owner, or attorney-in-fact of the member; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(d)(ii): (1) evidence acceptable to the nonprofit corporation of the signatory's authority to sign for the member has been presented with respect to the writing listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(d)(ii)(A): has been requested by the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(d)(ii)(B): is presented to the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(e)(i): two or more persons are the member as cotenants or fiduciaries;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(e)(ii): the name signed purports to be the name of at least one of the cotenants or fiduciaries; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(e)(iii): the person signing appears to be acting on behalf of all the cotenants or fiduciaries; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(2)(f): (1); (2) the acceptance of the writing listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(3): (1) The nonprofit corporation is entitled to reject a writing listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(3)(a): the validity of the signature on it; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(3)(b): the signatory's authority to sign for the member.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(4): (1) The nonprofit corporation and its officer or agent who accepts or rejects a writing listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-713(5): (1) Corporate action based on the acceptance or rejection of a writing listed in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-714 Quorum and voting requirements for voting groups.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-714(1): 16-6a-716
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-714(1)(a): Members entitled to vote as a separate voting group may take action on a matter at a meeting only if a quorum of those members exists with respect to that matter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-714(1)(b): 16-6a-716 Unless otherwise provided in this chapter or in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-714(2): Once a member is represented for any purpose at a meeting, including the purpose of determining that a quorum exists, the member is considered present for quorum purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-714(2)(a): for the remainder of the meeting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-714(2)(b): for any adjournment of that meeting, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-714(2)(b)(i): otherwise provided in the bylaws; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-714(2)(b)(ii): a new record date is or shall be set for that adjourned meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-714(3): Action on a matter other than the election of directors by a voting group is approved if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-714(3)(a): a quorum exists;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-714(3)(b): the votes cast within the voting group favoring the action exceed the votes cast within the voting group opposing the action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-714(3)(c): a greater number of affirmative votes is not required by this chapter or the bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-714(4): 16-6a-717 The election of directors is governed by Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-715 Action by single and multiple voting groups.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-715(1): 16-6a-714 If this chapter or the bylaws provide for voting by a single voting group on a matter, action on that matter is taken when voted upon by that voting group as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-715(2): 16-6a-714
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-715(2)(a): 16-6a-714 If this chapter or the bylaws provide for voting by two or more voting groups on a matter, action on that matter is taken only when voted upon by each of those voting groups counted separately as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-715(2)(b): One voting group may vote on a matter even though no action is taken by another voting group entitled to vote on the matter.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-716 Greater quorum or voting requirements.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-716(1): The articles of incorporation or bylaws may provide for a greater:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-716(1)(a): quorum requirement for members or voting groups than is provided for by this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-716(1)(b): voting requirement for members or voting groups than is provided by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-716(2): (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-716(2)(a): then in effect; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-716(2)(b): proposed to be adopted.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-716(3): (2) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-717 Voting for directors -- Cumulative voting.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-717(1): If the bylaws provide for cumulative voting for directors by the voting members, voting members may cumulatively vote, by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-717(1)(a): multiplying the number of votes the voting members are entitled to cast by the number of directors for whom they are entitled to vote; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-717(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-717(1)(b)(i): casting the product for a single candidate; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-717(1)(b)(ii): distributing the product among two or more candidates.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-717(2): Cumulative voting is not authorized at a particular meeting unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-717(2)(a): the meeting notice or statement accompanying the notice states that cumulative voting will take place; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-717(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-717(2)(b)(i): a voting member gives notice during the meeting and before the vote is taken of the voting member's intent to cumulate votes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-717(2)(b)(ii): if one voting member gives this notice, all other voting members participating in the election are entitled to cumulate their votes without giving further notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-717(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-717(3)(a): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, in an election of multiple directors, that number of candidates equaling the number of directors to be elected, having the highest number of votes cast in favor of their election, are elected to the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-717(3)(b): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, when only one director is being voted upon, the candidate having the highest number of votes cast in his or her favor is elected to the board of directors.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-718 Voting agreements.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-718(1): Two or more members may provide for the manner in which they will vote by signing an agreement for that purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-718(2): A voting agreement created under this section is specifically enforceable.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-801 Requirement for board of directors.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-801(1): A nonprofit corporation shall have a board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-801(2): (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-801(2)(a): (2)(b) Except as may otherwise be provided in this chapter, including Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-801(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-801(2)(b)(i): The articles of incorporation may authorize one or more persons to exercise some or all of the powers that would otherwise be exercised by the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-801(2)(b)(ii): To the extent the articles of incorporation authorize a person other than the board of directors to have the authority and perform a duty of the board of directors, the directors shall be relieved to that extent from such authority and duty.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-801(3): The board of directors may be divided into classes, each with such respective rights and duties as the articles of incorporation or bylaws may provide.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-801(4): The board of directors and the directors may be known by any other name designated in the bylaws.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-802 Qualifications of directors.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-802(1): A director shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-802(1)(a): a natural person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-802(1)(b): 18 years of age or older.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-802(2): (1) The bylaws may prescribe other qualifications for directors in addition to the requirements under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-802(3): A director need not be a resident of this state or a member of the nonprofit corporation unless required by the bylaws.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-803 Number of directors.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-803(1): A board of directors shall consist of three or more directors, with the number specified in, or fixed in accordance with, the bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-803(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-803(2)(a): The bylaws may establish, or permit the voting members or the board of directors to establish, a range for the size of the board of directors by fixing a minimum and maximum number of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-803(2)(b): (2)(a) If a range for the size of the board of directors is established in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-803(2)(b)(i): the voting members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-803(2)(b)(ii): the board of directors.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804 Election, appointment, and designation of directors.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(1)(a): All directors except the initial directors shall be elected, appointed, or designated as provided in the bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(1)(b): If no method of election, appointment, or designation is set forth in the bylaws, the directors other than the initial directors shall be elected as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(1)(b)(i): if the nonprofit corporation has voting members, all directors except the initial directors shall be elected by the voting members at each annual meeting of the voting members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(1)(b)(ii): if the nonprofit corporation does not have voting members, all directors except the initial directors shall be elected by the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(2)(a): The bylaws may authorize the election of all or a specified number or portion of directors, except the initial directors, by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(2)(a)(i): the members of one or more voting groups of voting members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(2)(a)(ii): the directors of one or more authorized classes of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(2)(b): A class of voting members or directors entitled to elect one or more directors is a separate voting group for purposes of the election of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(3): The bylaws may authorize the appointment of one or more directors by one or more persons, or by the holder of the office or position, as the bylaws shall specify.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(4): The bylaws may provide for election of directors by voting members or delegates:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(4)(a): on the basis of chapter or other organizational unit;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(4)(b): by region or other geographic unit;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(4)(c): by preferential voting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(4)(d): by any other reasonable method.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(5): For purposes of this chapter, designation occurs when the bylaws:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(5)(a): name an individual as a director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-804(5)(b): designate the holder of some office or position as a director.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-805 Terms of directors generally.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-805(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-805(1)(a): The bylaws may specify the terms of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-805(1)(b): In the absence of any term specified in the bylaws, the term of each director shall be one year.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-805(1)(c): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, directors may be elected for successive terms.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-805(2): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, the terms of the initial directors of a nonprofit corporation expire at the first meeting at which directors are elected or appointed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-805(3): A decrease in the number of directors or in the term of office does not shorten an incumbent director's term.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-805(4): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, the term of a director filling a vacancy expires at the end of the unexpired term that the director is filling, except that if a director is elected to fill a vacancy created by reason of an increase in the number of directors, the term of the director shall expire on the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-805(4)(a): the next meeting at which directors are elected; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-805(4)(b): the term, if any, designated for the director at the time of the creation of the position being filled.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-805(5): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, despite the expiration of a director's term, a director continues to serve until:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-805(5)(a): the director's successor is elected, appointed, or designated and qualifies; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-805(5)(b): there is a decrease in the number of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-805(6): 16-6a-1608 A director whose term has expired may deliver to the division for filing a statement to that effect pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-806 Staggered terms for directors.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-806(1): The bylaws may provide for staggering the terms of directors by dividing the total number of directors into any number of groups.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-806(2): (1) The terms of office of the several groups permitted under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-807 Resignation of directors.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-807(1): A director may resign at any time by giving written notice of resignation to the board's chair, the nonprofit corporation's secretary, or as otherwise provided in the bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-807(2): A resignation of a director is effective when the notice is received by the nonprofit corporation unless the notice specifies a later effective date.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-807(3): 16-6a-1608 A director who resigns may deliver to the division for filing a statement that the director resigns pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-807(4): The failure to attend or meet obligations shall be effective as a resignation at the time of the board of director's vote to confirm the failure if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-807(4)(a): at the beginning of a director's term on the board, the bylaws provide that a director may be considered to have resigned for failing to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-807(4)(a)(i): attend a specified number of board meetings; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-807(4)(a)(ii): meet other specified obligations of directors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-807(4)(b): the failure to attend or meet obligations is confirmed by an affirmative vote of the board of directors.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808 Removal of directors.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(1): (1)(a); (f); (1)(a); (d); (1)(f)(ii); 16-6a-1608 Directors elected by voting members or directors may be removed as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(1)(a): The voting members may remove one or more directors elected by them with or without cause unless the bylaws provide that directors may be removed only for cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(1)(b): If a director is elected by a voting group, only that voting group may participate in the vote to remove that director.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(1)(c): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, a director may be removed:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(1)(c)(i): when the director is elected by the voting members, only if a majority of the voting members votes to remove the director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(1)(c)(ii): when the director is elected by a voting group, only if a majority of the voting group votes to remove the director.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(1)(d): A director elected by voting members may be removed by the voting members only:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(1)(d)(i): at a meeting called for the purpose of removing that director; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(1)(d)(ii): if the meeting notice states that the purpose, or one of the purposes, of the meeting is removal of the director.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(1)(e): (1)(a); (d) An entire board of directors may be removed under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(1)(f): (1)(f)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(1)(f)(i): (1)(f)(ii) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(1)(f)(ii): A director elected by the board of directors to fill the vacancy of a director elected by the voting members may be removed without cause by the voting members but not the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(1)(g): 16-6a-1608 A director who is removed pursuant to this section may deliver to the division for filing a statement to that effect pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(2): (2)(a); (2)(b) Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(2)(a): an appointed director may be removed without cause by the person appointing the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(2)(b): (2)(a) the person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(2)(b)(i): the director; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(2)(b)(ii): the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(2)(c): (2)(b) unless the written notice described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(2)(c)(i): the director to be removed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(2)(c)(ii): the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(3): 16-6a-804(5) A designated director, as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-808(4): 16-6a-805(5) Removal of a director under this section is not affected by Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809 Removal of directors by judicial proceeding.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809(1): 16-6a-822
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809(1)(a): 16-6a-822 A court may remove a director, in an action brought by the nonprofit corporation or by voting members holding at least 10% of the votes entitled to be cast in the election of the director's successor, if the court finds that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809(1)(a)(i): the director engaged in:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809(1)(a)(i)(A): fraudulent or dishonest conduct; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809(1)(a)(i)(B): gross abuse of authority or discretion with respect to the nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809(1)(a)(ii): 16-6a-822
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809(1)(a)(ii)(A): 16-6a-822 a final judgment has been entered finding that the director has violated a duty set forth in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809(1)(a)(ii)(B): removal is in the best interests of the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809(2): The court that removes a director may bar the director for a period prescribed by the court from:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809(2)(a): reelection;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809(2)(b): reappointment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809(2)(c): designation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809(3): (1) If voting members commence a proceeding under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-809(4): 16-6a-1608 A director who is removed pursuant to this section may deliver to the division for filing a statement to that effect pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810 Vacancy on board.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(1): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, if a vacancy occurs on a board of directors, including a vacancy resulting from an increase in the number of directors:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(1)(a): the voting members, if any, may fill the vacancy;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(1)(b): the board of directors may fill the vacancy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(1)(c): if the directors remaining in office constitute fewer than a quorum of the board of directors, the remaining directors may fill the vacancy by the affirmative vote of a majority of all the directors remaining in office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(2): (1) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(2)(a): if one or more of the remaining directors were elected by the same voting group of voting members:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(2)(a)(i): only the directors elected by the same voting group of voting members are entitled to vote to fill the vacancy if it is filled by directors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(2)(a)(ii): the directors elected by the same voting group of voting members may fill the vacancy by the affirmative vote of a majority of the directors remaining in office; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(2)(b): only that voting group is entitled to vote to fill the vacancy if it is filled by the voting members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(3): (1) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(3)(a): the vacant office was held by a director elected by a voting group of directors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(3)(b): any persons in that voting group remain as directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(4): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, if a vacant office was held by an appointed director, only the person who appointed the director may fill the vacancy.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(5): 16-6a-804(5)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(5)(a): 16-6a-804(5) If a vacant office was held by a designated director, as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(5)(b): In the absence of an applicable bylaw provision, the vacancy may not be filled by the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-810(6): 16-6a-807(2) A vacancy that will occur at a specific later date by reason of a resignation effective at a later date under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-811 Compensation of directors.
----------------------------------------------------------
Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, the board of directors may authorize and fix the compensation of directors.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-812 Meetings.
-----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-812(1): Unless the bylaws eliminate the requirement for holding an annual meeting, a nonprofit corporation that does not have voting members shall hold a meeting of the directors annually:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-812(1)(a): at a time and date stated in or fixed in accordance with the bylaws; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-812(1)(b): if a time and date is not stated in or fixed in accordance with the bylaws, at a time and date stated in or fixed in accordance with a resolution of the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-812(2): The board of directors may hold regular or special meetings in or out of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-812(3): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-812(3)(a): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, the board of directors may permit any director to participate in a meeting by, or conduct the meeting through the use of, any means of communication by which all directors participating may hear each other during the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-812(3)(b): (2) A director participating in a meeting by a means permitted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-812(4): (1); (2) The failure to hold an annual or regular meeting at the time and date determined pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-812(4)(a): affect the validity of any corporate action; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-812(4)(b): result in forfeiture or dissolution of the nonprofit corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813 Action without meeting.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(1): (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(1)(a): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, any action required or permitted by this chapter to be taken at a board of directors' meeting may be taken without a meeting if all members of the board consent to the action in writing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(1)(b): (1)(a) Action is taken under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(1)(c): (1)(a); (1)(a) Action under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2): (2)(a); (2); (2)(a); (2)(e); (2)(e); (2)(a); (2)(e); (2); (2)(a); (2)(a); (2); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(a): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, any action required or permitted by this chapter to be taken at a board of directors' meeting may be taken without a meeting if notice is transmitted in writing to each member of the board and each member of the board by the time stated in the notice:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(a)(i)(A): signs a writing for such action; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(a)(i)(B): signs a writing against such action, abstains in writing from voting, or fails to respond or vote; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(a)(ii): fails to demand in writing that action not be taken without a meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(b): (2)(a) The notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(b)(i): the action to be taken;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(b)(ii): the time by which a director must respond to the notice;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(b)(iii): that failure to respond by the time stated in the notice will have the same effect as:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(b)(iii)(A): abstaining in writing by the time stated in the notice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(b)(iii)(B): failing to demand in writing by the time stated in the notice that action not be taken without a meeting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(b)(iv): any other matters the nonprofit corporation determines to include.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(c): (2); (2)(a); (2)(e); (2)(e) Action is taken under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(c)(i): (2)(e) the affirmative votes in writing for the action received by the nonprofit corporation and not revoked pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(c)(ii): (2)(e) the nonprofit corporation has not received a written demand by a director that the action not be taken without a meeting other than a demand that has been revoked pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(d): (2)(a); (2)(e) A director's right to demand that action not be taken without a meeting shall be considered to have been waived unless the nonprofit corporation receives such demand from the director in writing by the time stated in the notice transmitted pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(e): (2); (2)(a) A director who in writing has voted, abstained, or demanded action not be taken without a meeting pursuant to this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(2)(f): (2)(a); (2); (2)(a) Unless the notice transmitted pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(3): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(3)(a): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, a communication under this section may be delivered by an electronic transmission.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(3)(b): (2) An electronic transmission communicating a vote, abstention, demand, or revocation under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(3)(b)(i): that the electronic transmission is transmitted by the director; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(3)(b)(ii): the date on which the electronic transmission is transmitted.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(3)(c): The date on which an electronic transmission is transmitted is considered the date on which the vote, abstention, demand, or revocation is signed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(3)(d): For purposes of this section, communications to the nonprofit corporation are not effective until received.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(4): Action taken pursuant to this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(4)(a): has the same effect as action taken at a meeting of directors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-813(4)(b): may be described as an action taken at a meeting of directors in any document.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814 Notice of meeting.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(1): (1)(c); (1)(a); 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(A); 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(1)(a): A nonprofit corporation shall give to each director entitled to vote at an annual meeting notice of the annual meeting consistent with the nonprofit corporation's bylaws in a fair and reasonable manner.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(1)(b): (1)(c) Any notice that conforms to the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(1)(c): (1)(a); 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(A); 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(B) Notice under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(1)(c)(i): no fewer than 10 days before the meeting, unless otherwise provided by the bylaws;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(1)(c)(ii): if notice is mailed by other than first-class or registered mail, no fewer than 30 days, nor more than 60 days before the meeting date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(1)(c)(iii): 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(A); 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(B) if notice is given:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(1)(c)(iii)(A): 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(A) by newspaper as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(1)(c)(iii)(A)(I): the first of the publications no more than 60 days before the meeting date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(1)(c)(iii)(A)(II): the last of the publications no fewer than 10 days before the meeting date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(1)(c)(iii)(B): 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(1)(c)(iii)(B)(I): 16-6a-103(2)(b)(i)(B) as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(1)(c)(iii)(B)(II): for 60 days before the meeting date.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(2): Unless otherwise provided in this chapter or in the bylaws, regular meetings of the board of directors may be held without notice of the date, time, place, or purpose of the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(3)(a): Unless the bylaws provide for a longer or shorter period, special meetings of the board of directors shall be preceded by at least two days notice of the date, time, and place of the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-814(3)(b): (3)(a) The notice required by Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815 Waiver of notice.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(1): (2); (1)(b); (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(1)(a): A director may waive any notice of a meeting before or after the time and date of the meeting stated in the notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(1)(b): (2) Except as provided by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(1)(b)(i): in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(1)(b)(ii): signed by the director entitled to the notice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(1)(b)(iii): delivered to the nonprofit corporation for filing with the corporate records.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(1)(c): (1)(b) A waiver satisfies the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(1)(d): (1)(b) The delivery and filing required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(2): 16-6a-814(3) A director's attendance at or participation in a meeting waives any required notice to that director of the meeting unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(2)(a)(i): at the beginning of the meeting or promptly upon the director's later arrival, the director objects to holding the meeting or transacting business at the meeting because of lack of notice or defective notice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(2)(a)(ii): after objecting, the director does not vote for or assent to action taken at the meeting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(2)(b): 16-6a-814(3) if special notice was required of a particular purpose pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(2)(b)(i): the director objects to transacting business with respect to the purpose for which the special notice was required; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-815(2)(b)(ii): after objecting, the director does not vote for or assent to action taken at the meeting with respect to the purpose.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816 Quorum and voting.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(1): Unless a greater or lesser number is required by the bylaws, a quorum of a board of directors consists of a majority of the number of directors in office immediately before the meeting begins.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(2): 16-6a-803(2); 16-6a-803(2); 16-6a-803(2) The bylaws may authorize a quorum of a board of directors to consist of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(2)(a): no fewer than:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(2)(a)(i): one-third of the number of directors fixed if the nonprofit corporation has a fixed board size; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(2)(a)(ii): no fewer than two directors in all circumstances;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(2)(b): 16-6a-803(2); 16-6a-803(2); 16-6a-803(2) if a range for the size of the board is established pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(2)(b)(i): 16-6a-803(2) fixed in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(2)(b)(ii): 16-6a-803(2) in office immediately before the meeting begins, if no number is fixed in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(3): If a quorum is present when a vote is taken, the affirmative vote of a majority of directors present is the act of the board of directors unless the vote of a greater number of directors is required by this chapter or the bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(4): (4); 16-6a-813; (4)(a); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(4)(a): If provided in the bylaws, for purposes of determining a quorum with respect to a particular proposal, and for purposes of casting a vote for or against a particular proposal, a director may be considered to be present at a meeting and to vote if the director has granted a signed written proxy:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(4)(a)(i): to another director who is present at the meeting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(4)(a)(ii): authorizing the other director to cast the vote that is directed to be cast by the written proxy with respect to the particular proposal that is described with reasonable specificity in the proxy.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(4)(b): (4); 16-6a-813 Except as provided in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(4)(c): (4)(a); (4)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(4)(c)(i): permitted by the bylaws; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(4)(c)(ii): (4)(a) the proxy meets all other requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(5): A director who is present at a meeting of the board of directors when corporate action is taken is considered to have assented to all action taken at the meeting unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(5)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(5)(a)(i): the director objects at the beginning of the meeting, or promptly upon the director's arrival, to holding the meeting or transacting business at the meeting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(5)(a)(ii): after objecting, the director does not vote for or assent to any action taken at the meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(5)(b): the director contemporaneously requests that the director's dissent or abstention as to any specific action taken be entered in the minutes of the meeting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(5)(c): the director causes written notice of the director's dissent or abstention as to any specific action to be received by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(5)(c)(i): the presiding officer of the meeting before adjournment of the meeting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(5)(c)(ii): the nonprofit corporation promptly after adjournment of the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-816(6): (5) The right of dissent or abstention pursuant to Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817 Committees of the board.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(1): (1)(a) Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, the board of directors may:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(1)(a): create one or more committees of the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(1)(b): (1)(a) appoint two or more directors to serve on the committees created under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(2): 16-6a-816 Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, the creation of a committee of the board and appointment of directors to it shall be approved by the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(2)(a): a majority of all the directors in office when the action is taken; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(2)(b): 16-6a-816 the number of directors required by the bylaws to take action under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(3): 16-6a-812; 16-6a-816 Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, a committee of the board and the members of the committee are subject to Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(3)(a): meetings;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(3)(b): action without meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(3)(c): notice;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(3)(d): waiver of notice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(3)(e): quorum and voting requirements.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(4): 16-6a-801 To the extent stated in the bylaws or by the board of directors, each committee of the board shall have the authority of the board of directors as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(4)(a): authorize distributions;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(4)(b): approve or propose to members any action required by this chapter to be approved by members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(4)(c): elect, appoint, or remove a director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(4)(d): amend articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(4)(e): adopt, amend, or repeal bylaws;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(4)(f): approve a plan of conversion or a plan of merger not requiring member approval; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(4)(g): approve a sale, lease, exchange, or other disposition of all, or substantially all, of its property, with or without goodwill, otherwise than in the usual and regular course of business.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(5): 16-6a-822 The creation of, delegation of authority to, or action by a committee does not alone constitute compliance by a director with the standards of conduct described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(6): (6)(b); (6)(a); (6)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(6)(a): (6)(b) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(6)(a)(i): having the members and rules of procedure as the bylaws or board of directors may provide;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(6)(a)(ii): established to provide the advice, service, and assistance to the nonprofit corporation as may be specified in the bylaws or by the board of directors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(6)(a)(iii): established to carry out the duties and responsibilities for the nonprofit corporation, as may be specified in the bylaws or by the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-817(6)(b): (6)(a); (6)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818 Officers.
-----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(1)(a): A nonprofit corporation shall have the officers designated:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(1)(a)(i): in its bylaws; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(1)(a)(ii): by the board of directors in a manner not inconsistent with the bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(1)(b): An officer shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(1)(b)(i): a natural person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(1)(b)(ii): 18 years of age or older.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(1)(c): An officer need not be a director or a member of the nonprofit corporation, unless the bylaws so prescribe.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(2)(a): An officer may be appointed by the board of directors or in such other manner as the board of directors or bylaws may provide.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(2)(b): An appointed officer may appoint one or more officers or assistant officers if authorized by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(2)(b)(i): the bylaws; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(2)(b)(ii): the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(3): 16-6a-1601 The bylaws or the board of directors shall delegate to the secretary or to one or more other persons responsibility for:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(3)(a): 16-6a-1601 the preparation and maintenance of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(3)(a)(i): minutes of the directors' and members' meetings; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(3)(a)(ii): 16-6a-1601 other records and information required to be kept by the nonprofit corporation under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(3)(b): authenticating records of the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-818(4): The same individual may simultaneously hold more than one office in a nonprofit corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-819 Duties of officers.
---------------------------------------------------
Each officer shall have the authority and shall perform the duties set forth with respect to the office:Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-819(1): in the bylaws; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-819(2): to the extent not inconsistent with the bylaws, prescribed with respect to the office by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-819(2)(a): the board of directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-819(2)(b): an officer authorized by the board of directors.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820 Resignation and removal of officers.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(1): An officer may resign at any time by giving written notice of resignation to the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(2): A resignation of an officer is effective when the notice is received by the nonprofit corporation unless the notice specifies a later effective date.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(3): If a resignation is made effective at a later date, the board of directors may:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(3)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(3)(a)(i): permit the officer to remain in office until the effective date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(3)(a)(ii): fill the pending vacancy before the effective date if the successor does not take office until the effective date; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(3)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(3)(b)(i): remove the officer at any time before the effective date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(3)(b)(ii): fill the vacancy created by the removal.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(4)(a): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, the board of directors may remove any officer at any time with or without cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(4)(b): The bylaws or the board of directors may make provisions for the removal of officers by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(4)(b)(i): other officers; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(4)(b)(ii): the voting members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-820(5): 16-6a-1608 An officer who resigns, is removed, or whose appointment has expired may deliver to the division for filing a statement to that effect pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-821 Contract rights with respect to officers.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-821(1): The appointment of an officer does not itself create contract rights.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-821(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-821(2)(a): An officer's removal does not affect the officer's contract rights, if any, with the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-821(2)(b): An officer's resignation does not affect the nonprofit corporation's contract rights, if any, with the officer.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822 General standards of conduct for directors and officers.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(1): (2); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(1)(a): (2) A director shall discharge the director's duties as a director, including the director's duties as a member of a committee of the board, in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(1)(b): (2) An officer with discretionary authority shall discharge the officer's duties under that authority in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(2): (1) A director or an officer described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(2)(a): in good faith;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(2)(b): with the care an ordinarily prudent person in a like position would exercise under similar circumstances; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(2)(c): in a manner the director or officer reasonably believes to be in the best interests of the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(3): In discharging duties, a director or officer is entitled to rely on information, opinions, reports, or statements, including financial statements and other financial data, if prepared or presented by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(3)(a): one or more officers or employees of the nonprofit corporation whom the director or officer reasonably believes to be reliable and competent in the matters presented;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(3)(b): legal counsel, a public accountant, or another person as to matters the director or officer reasonably believes are within the person's professional or expert competence;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(3)(c): religious authorities or ministers, priests, rabbis, or other persons:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(3)(c)(i): whose position or duties in the nonprofit corporation, or in a religious organization with which the nonprofit corporation is affiliated, the director or officer believes justify reliance and confidence; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(3)(c)(ii): who the director or officer believes to be reliable and competent in the matters presented; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(3)(d): in the case of a director, a committee of the board of directors of which the director is not a member if the director reasonably believes the committee merits confidence.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(4): (3) A director or officer is not acting in good faith if the director or officer has knowledge concerning the matter in question that makes reliance otherwise permitted by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(5): A director, regardless of title, may not be considered to be a trustee with respect to any property held or administered by the nonprofit corporation including property that may be subject to restrictions imposed by the donor or transferor of the property.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(6): A director or officer is not liable to the nonprofit corporation, its members, or any conservator or receiver, or any assignee or successor-in-interest of the nonprofit corporation or member, for any action taken, or any failure to take any action, as an officer or director, as the case may be, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(6)(a): the director or officer has breached or failed to perform the duties of the office as set forth in this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(6)(b): the breach or failure to perform constitutes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(6)(b)(i): willful misconduct; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(6)(b)(ii): intentional infliction of harm on:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(6)(b)(ii)(A): the nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(6)(b)(ii)(B): the members of the nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-822(6)(b)(iii): gross negligence.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823 Limitation of liability of directors.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(1): (1)(b); (3); (1)(a); 16-6a-824
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(1)(a): (1)(b); (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(1)(a)(i): so provided in:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(1)(a)(i)(A): the articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(1)(a)(i)(B): the bylaws; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(1)(a)(i)(C): a resolution; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(1)(a)(ii): (3) to the extent permitted in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(1)(b): (1)(a); 16-6a-824 Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(1)(b)(i): the amount of a financial benefit received by a director to which the director is not entitled;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(1)(b)(ii): an intentional infliction of harm on:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(1)(b)(ii)(A): the nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(1)(b)(ii)(B): the members of a nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(1)(b)(iii): an intentional violation of criminal law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(1)(b)(iv): 16-6a-824 a violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(2): A provision authorized under this section may not eliminate or limit the liability of a director for any act or omission occurring prior to the date when the provision becomes effective.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(3): Any provision authorized under this section to be included in the articles of incorporation may be adopted in the bylaws or by resolution, but only if the provision is approved by the same percentage of members of each voting group as would be required to approve an amendment to the articles of incorporation including the provision.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-823(4): Any foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to transact business in this state, except as otherwise provided by law, may adopt any provision authorized under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-824 Liability of directors for unlawful distributions.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-824(1): 16-6a-1301; 16-6a-1301; 16-6a-822
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-824(1)(a): 16-6a-1301; 16-6a-1301; 16-6a-822 A director who votes for or assents to a distribution made in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-824(1)(b): In any proceeding commenced under this section, a director has all of the defenses ordinarily available to a director.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-824(2): (1); (1); 16-6a-1301 A director held liable under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-824(2)(a): (1) from every other director who could be held liable under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-824(2)(b): 16-6a-1301 from each member who accepted the distribution knowing the distribution was made in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-824(3): (2)(b); 16-6a-1301 The amount of the contribution from each member under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825 Conflicting interest transaction.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(1): As used in this section, "conflicting interest transaction" means a contract, transaction, or other financial relationship between a nonprofit corporation and:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(1)(a): a director of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(1)(b): a party related to a director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(1)(c): an entity in which a director of the nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(1)(c)(i): is a director or officer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(1)(c)(ii): has a financial interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(2): Except as otherwise provided in this section, upon the finding of a conflicting interest transaction, in an action properly brought before it, a court may:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(2)(a): rule that the conflicting interest transaction is void or voidable;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(2)(b): enjoin or set aside the conflict of interest transaction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(2)(c): determine that the conflicting interest transaction gives rise to an award of damages or other sanctions.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(3)(a): A loan may not be made directly or indirectly by a nonprofit corporation to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(3)(a)(i): a director or officer of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(3)(a)(ii): a natural person related to a director or officer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(3)(a)(iii): an entity in which a director, officer, or natural person related to a director or officer has any ownership, management right, or financial interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(3)(b): (3)(a) A director or officer who assents to or participates in the making of a loan in violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4): (4)(b); (4)(a)(ii); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(a): (4)(b); (4)(a)(ii) If the conditions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(a)(i): the conflicting interest transaction involves:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(a)(i)(A): a director of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(a)(i)(B): a party related to a director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(a)(i)(C): an entity in which a director of the nonprofit corporation is a director or officer or has a financial interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(a)(ii): the director is present at or participates in the meeting of the nonprofit corporation's board of directors or of the committee of the board of directors that authorizes, approves, or ratifies the conflicting interest transaction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(a)(iii): (4)(a)(ii) the director's vote is counted for the purpose described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(b): (4)(a) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(b)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(b)(i)(A): the material facts as to the director's relationship or interest and as to the conflicting interest transaction are disclosed or are known to the board of directors or the committee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(b)(i)(B): the board of directors or committee in good faith authorizes, approves, or ratifies the conflicting interest transaction by the affirmative vote of a majority of the disinterested directors, even though the disinterested directors are less than a quorum;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(b)(ii)(A): the material facts as to the director's relationship or interest and as to the conflicting interest transaction are disclosed or are known to the members entitled to vote on the conflicting interest transaction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(b)(ii)(B): the conflicting interest transaction is specifically authorized, approved, or ratified in good faith by a vote of the members entitled to vote thereon;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(b)(iii): the conflicting interest transaction is consistent with a provision in the articles of incorporation or bylaws which:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(b)(iii)(A): commits the nonprofit corporation to support one or more other nonprofit corporations, charitable trusts, or charitable entities; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(b)(iii)(B): authorizes one or more directors to exercise discretion in making gifts or contributions to one or more other nonprofit corporations, charitable trusts, or charitable entities; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(4)(b)(iv): the conflicting interest transaction is fair as to the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(5): Common or interested directors may be counted in determining the presence of a quorum at a meeting of the board of directors or of a committee that authorizes, approves, or ratifies the conflicting interest transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-825(6): For purposes of this section, "a natural person related to a director or officer" means any natural person whose familial, financial, professional, or employment relationship with the director or officer would, under the circumstances, reasonably be expected to exert an influence on the director's or officer's judgment when voting on a transaction.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-826 Common members, directors, or officers.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-826(1): Two or more nonprofit corporations may have members, directors, or officers that are common to each nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-826(2): The fact of common members, directors, or officers in two or more nonprofit corporations may not, by itself, create an inference that the nonprofit corporations individually or collectively:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-826(2)(a): are agents or alter egos of one another; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-826(2)(b): have been formed or availed of, for an improper purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-826(3): The doctrine of "piercing the corporate veil" may not be applied to one or more nonprofit corporations solely because of the fact of common members, directors, or officers.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901 Indemnification definitions.
------------------------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(1)(a): "Director" means an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(1)(a)(i): is or was a director of a nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(1)(a)(ii): while a director of a nonprofit corporation at the nonprofit corporation's request, is or was serving as a director, officer, partner, member, manager, trustee, employee, fiduciary, or agent of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(1)(a)(ii)(A): another domestic or foreign corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(1)(a)(ii)(B): another nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(1)(a)(ii)(C): another person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(1)(a)(ii)(D): an employee benefit plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(1)(b): A director is considered to be serving an employee benefit plan at the nonprofit corporation's request if the director's duties to the nonprofit corporation also impose duties on, or otherwise involve services by, the director to the employee benefit plan or to participants in or beneficiaries of the employee benefit plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(1)(c): "Director" includes, unless the context requires otherwise, the estate or personal representative of a director.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(2): "Expenses" includes attorneys' fees.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(3): "Liability" means the obligation incurred with respect to a proceeding to pay a judgment, settlement, penalty, or fine, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(3)(a): an excise tax assessed with respect to an employee benefit plan; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(3)(b): reasonable expenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(4): "Nonprofit corporation" includes any domestic or foreign entity that is a predecessor of a nonprofit corporation by reason of a merger or other transaction in which the predecessor's existence ceased upon consummation of the transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(5)(a): "Officer," "employee," "fiduciary," and "agent" include any person who, while serving the indicated relationship to the nonprofit corporation, at the nonprofit corporation's request, is or was serving as a director, officer, partner, trustee, employee, fiduciary, or agent of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(5)(a)(i): another domestic or foreign corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(5)(a)(ii): another person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(5)(a)(iii): an employee benefit plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(5)(b): An officer, employee, fiduciary, or agent is considered to be serving an employee benefit plan at the nonprofit corporation's request if that person's duties to the nonprofit corporation also impose duties on, or otherwise involve services by, that person to the plan or participants in, or beneficiaries of the plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(5)(c): Unless the context requires otherwise, "officer," "employee," "fiduciary," and "agent" include the estates or personal representatives of the officer, employee, fiduciary, or agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(6): 16-6a-907
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(6)(a): 16-6a-907 "Official capacity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(6)(a)(i): when used with respect to a director, the office of director in a corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(6)(a)(ii): 16-6a-907 when used with respect to a person other than a director, as contemplated in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(6)(b): "Official capacity" does not include service for any:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(6)(b)(i): other foreign or domestic corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(6)(b)(ii): other person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(6)(b)(iii): employee benefit plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(7): "Party" includes an individual who was, is, or is threatened to be made a named defendant or respondent in a proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-901(8): "Proceeding" means any threatened, pending, or completed action, suit, or proceeding, whether civil, criminal, administrative, or investigative and whether formal or informal.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-902 Authority to indemnify directors.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-902(1): (4) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-902(1)(a): the individual's conduct was in good faith;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-902(1)(b): the individual reasonably believed that the individual's conduct was in, or not opposed to, the corporation's best interests; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-902(1)(c): in the case of any criminal proceeding, the individual had no reasonable cause to believe the individual's conduct was unlawful.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-902(2): (1)(b) A director's conduct with respect to any employee benefit plan for a purpose the director reasonably believed to be in or not opposed to the interests of the participants in and beneficiaries of the plan is conduct that satisfies the requirement of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-902(3): The termination of a proceeding by judgment, order, settlement, conviction, or upon a plea of nolo contendere or its equivalent is not, of itself, determinative that the director did not meet the standard of conduct described in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-902(4): A nonprofit corporation may not indemnify a director under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-902(4)(a): in connection with a proceeding by or in the right of the nonprofit corporation in which the director was adjudged liable to the nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-902(4)(b): in connection with any other proceeding charging that the director derived an improper personal benefit, whether or not involving action in the director's official capacity, in which proceeding the director was adjudged liable on the basis that the director derived an improper personal benefit.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-902(5): Indemnification permitted under this section in connection with a proceeding by or in the right of the nonprofit corporation is limited to reasonable expenses incurred in connection with the proceeding.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-903 Mandatory indemnification of directors.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-903(1): (2) Unless limited by its bylaws, a nonprofit corporation shall indemnify a director described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-903(2): (1) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-903(2)(a): any proceeding to which the director was a party because the director is or was a director of the nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-903(2)(b): any claim, issue, or matter in the proceeding, to which the director was a party because the director is or was a director of the nonprofit corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-904 Advance of expenses for directors.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-904(1): 16-6a-902 A nonprofit corporation may pay for or reimburse the reasonable expenses incurred by a director who is a party to a proceeding in advance of final disposition of the proceeding if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-904(1)(a): 16-6a-902 the director furnishes the nonprofit corporation a written affirmation of the director's good faith belief that the director has met the applicable standard of conduct described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-904(1)(b): the director furnishes the nonprofit corporation a written undertaking, executed personally or on the director's behalf, to repay the advance, if it is ultimately determined that the director did not meet the standard of conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-904(1)(c): a determination is made that the facts then known to those making the determination would not preclude indemnification under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-904(2): (1)(b) The undertaking required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-904(2)(a): shall be an unlimited general obligation of the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-904(2)(b): need not be secured; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-904(2)(c): may be accepted without reference to financial ability to make repayment.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-904(3): 16-6a-906 Determinations and authorizations of payments under this section shall be made in the manner specified in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-905 Court-ordered indemnification of directors.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-905(1): Unless a nonprofit corporation's articles of incorporation provide otherwise, a director of the nonprofit corporation who is or was a party to a proceeding may apply for indemnification to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-905(1)(a): the court conducting the proceeding; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-905(1)(b): another court of competent jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-905(2): (1); 16-6a-903; 16-6a-902; 16-6a-902(4); 16-6a-902(4) On receipt of an application described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-905(2)(a): 16-6a-903 if the court determines that the director is entitled to mandatory indemnification under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-905(2)(a)(i): order indemnification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-905(2)(a)(ii): order the nonprofit corporation to pay the director's reasonable expenses incurred to obtain court-ordered indemnification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-905(2)(b): 16-6a-902; 16-6a-902(4); 16-6a-902(4) if the court determines that the director is fairly and reasonably entitled to indemnification in view of all the relevant circumstances, whether or not the director met the applicable standard of conduct set forth in Section
