Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-907 Indemnification of officers, employees, fiduciaries, and agents.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless a nonprofit corporation's articles of incorporation provide otherwise:Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-907(1): 16-6a-903; 16-6a-905 to the same extent as a director, an officer of the nonprofit corporation is entitled to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-907(1)(a): 16-6a-903 mandatory indemnification under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-907(1)(b): 16-6a-905 apply for court-ordered indemnification under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-907(2): a nonprofit corporation may indemnify and advance expenses to an officer, employee, fiduciary, or agent of the nonprofit corporation to the same extent as to a director; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-907(3): a nonprofit corporation may indemnify and advance expenses to an officer, employee, fiduciary, or agent who is not a director to a greater extent if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-907(3)(a): not inconsistent with public policy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-907(3)(b): provided for by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-907(3)(b)(i): its articles of incorporation or bylaws;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-907(3)(b)(ii): general or specific action of its board of directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-907(3)(b)(iii): contract.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-908 Insurance.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-908(1): 16-6a-902; 16-6a-903; 16-6a-907 A nonprofit corporation may purchase and maintain liability insurance:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-908(1)(a): on behalf of a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-908(1)(a)(i): is or was a director, officer, employee, fiduciary, or agent of the nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-908(1)(a)(ii): while serving as a director, officer, employee, fiduciary, or agent of the nonprofit corporation at the request of the nonprofit corporation, is or was serving as a director, officer, partner, trustee, employee, fiduciary, or agent of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-908(1)(a)(ii)(A): another foreign or domestic nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-908(1)(a)(ii)(B): other person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-908(1)(a)(ii)(C): an employee benefit plan; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-908(1)(b): 16-6a-902; 16-6a-903; 16-6a-907 against liability asserted against or incurred by the person in that capacity or arising from the person's status as a director, officer, employee, fiduciary, or agent, whether or not the nonprofit corporation would have power to indemnify the person against the same liability under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-908(2): Insurance may be procured from any insurance company designated by the board of directors, whether the insurance company is formed under the laws of this state or any other jurisdiction of the United States or elsewhere, including any insurance company in which the nonprofit corporation has an equity or any other interest through stock ownership or otherwise.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-909 Limitations on indemnification of directors.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-909(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-909(1)(a): A provision treating a nonprofit corporation's indemnification of, or advance for expenses to, directors that is contained in the following is valid only if and to the extent the provision is not inconsistent with this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-909(1)(a)(i): the articles of incorporation or bylaws of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-909(1)(a)(ii): a resolution of the nonprofit corporation's members or board of directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-909(1)(a)(iii): a contract, except an insurance policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-909(1)(a)(iv): other writing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-909(1)(b): If the articles of incorporation limit indemnification or advance of expenses, indemnification and advance of expenses are valid only to the extent not inconsistent with the articles of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-909(2): This part does not limit a nonprofit corporation's power to pay or reimburse expenses incurred by a director in connection with the director's appearance as a witness in a proceeding at a time when the director has not been made a named defendant or respondent to the proceeding.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-910 Notice to voting members of indemnification of director.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-910(1): If a nonprofit corporation indemnifies or advances expenses to a director under this part in connection with a proceeding by or in the right of the nonprofit corporation, the nonprofit corporation shall give written notice of the indemnification or advance to the voting members with or before the notice of the next voting members' meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-910(2): If the next voting member action after the indemnification or advance is taken without a meeting at the instigation of the board of directors, the notice shall be given to the voting members at or before the time the first voting member signs a writing consenting to the action.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1001 Authority to amend articles of incorporation.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1001(1): A nonprofit corporation may amend its articles of incorporation at any time to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1001(1)(a): add or change a provision that is required or permitted in the articles of incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1001(1)(b): delete a provision not required in the articles of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1001(2): Whether a provision is required or permitted in the articles of incorporation is determined as of the effective date of the amendment.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002 Amendment of articles of incorporation by board of directors or incorporators.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(1): 16-17-203(1) Unless otherwise provided in the articles of incorporation, the board of directors may adopt, without member approval, one or more amendments to the articles of incorporation to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(1)(a): delete the names and addresses of the initial directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(1)(b): 16-17-203(1) change the information required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(1)(c): change the corporate name by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(1)(c)(i): substituting the word "corporation," "incorporated," "company," "limited," or an abbreviation of any such word for a similar word or abbreviation in the name; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(1)(c)(ii): adding, deleting, or changing a geographical attribution; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(1)(d): make any other change expressly permitted by this chapter to be made without member action.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(2): 16-6a-1412 The board of directors may adopt, without member action, one or more amendments to the articles of incorporation to change the corporate name, if necessary, in connection with the reinstatement of a nonprofit corporation pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(3): 16-6a-1013; (3)(a); (3)(b); 16-6a-814; (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(3)(a): 16-6a-1013 Subject to any approval required pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(3)(a)(i): its incorporators until directors have been chosen; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(3)(a)(ii): its directors after the directors have been chosen.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(3)(b): (3)(a) A nonprofit corporation described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(3)(c): (3)(b); 16-6a-814 The notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(3)(c)(i): 16-6a-814 be in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(3)(c)(ii): state that the purpose, or one of the purposes, of the meeting is to consider a proposed amendment to the articles of incorporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(3)(c)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(3)(c)(iii)(A): contain or be accompanied by a copy or summary of the amendment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(3)(c)(iii)(B): state the general nature of the amendment.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(3)(d): (3)(a) An amendment described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1002(3)(d)(ii): after directors are chosen by a majority of the directors in office at the time the amendment is adopted or such greater number as is set forth in the bylaws.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003 Amendment of articles of incorporation by board of directors and members.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(1): (5) The board of directors or the members representing at least 10% of all of the votes entitled to be cast on the amendment may propose an amendment to the articles of incorporation for submission to the members unless a different vote or voting class is required by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(1)(a): this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(1)(b): the articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(1)(c): the bylaws; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(1)(d): (5) the members or the board of directors acting pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(2): (1); (5) For an amendment to the articles of incorporation to be adopted pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(2)(a): the board of directors shall recommend the amendment to the members unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(2)(a)(i): the amendment is proposed by members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(2)(a)(ii): the board of directors:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(2)(a)(ii)(A): determines that because of conflict of interest or other special circumstances it should make no recommendation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(2)(a)(ii)(B): communicates the basis for its determination to the members with the amendment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(2)(b): (5) the members entitled to vote on the amendment shall approve the amendment as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(3): The proposing board of directors or the proposing members may condition the effectiveness of the amendment on any basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(4): 16-6a-704; (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(4)(a): 16-6a-704 The nonprofit corporation shall give notice, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(4)(b): (4)(a) The notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(4)(b)(i): state that the purpose, or one of the purposes, of the meeting is to consider the amendment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(4)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(4)(b)(ii)(A): contain or be accompanied by a copy or a summary of the amendment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(4)(b)(ii)(B): shall state the general nature of the amendment.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(5): 16-6a-714; 16-6a-715; (3) The amendment shall be approved by the votes required by Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(5)(a): this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(5)(b): the articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(5)(c): bylaws adopted by the members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(5)(d): (3) the proposing board of directors or the proposing members acting pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1003(6): If the board of directors or the members seek to have the amendment approved by the members by written consent or by written ballot, the material soliciting the approval shall contain or be accompanied by a copy or summary of the amendment.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1004 Voting on amendments of articles of incorporation by voting groups.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1004(1): Unless otherwise provided by this chapter or the articles of incorporation, if membership voting is otherwise required by this chapter, the members of a class who are entitled to vote are entitled to vote as a separate voting group on an amendment to the articles of incorporation if the amendment would:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1004(1)(a): affect the rights, privileges, preferences, restrictions, or conditions of that class as to voting, dissolution, redemption, or transfer of memberships in a manner different than the amendment would affect another class;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1004(1)(b): change the rights, privileges, preferences, restrictions, or conditions of that class as to voting, dissolution, redemption, or transfer by changing the rights, privileges, preferences, restrictions, or conditions of another class;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1004(1)(c): increase or decrease the number of memberships authorized for that class;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1004(1)(d): increase the number of memberships authorized for another class;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1004(1)(e): effect an exchange, reclassification, or termination of the memberships of that class; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1004(1)(f): authorize a new class of memberships.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1004(2): If a class is to be divided into two or more classes as a result of an amendment to the articles of incorporation, the amendment shall be approved by the members of each class that would be created by the amendment.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1005 Articles of amendment to articles of incorporation.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A nonprofit corporation amending its articles of incorporation shall deliver to the division for filing articles of amendment setting forth:Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1005(1): the name of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1005(2): the text of each amendment adopted;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1005(3): the date of each amendment's adoption;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1005(4): if the amendment was adopted by the board of directors or incorporators without member action, a statement to that effect and that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1005(4)(a): the nonprofit corporation does not have members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1005(4)(b): member action was not required;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1005(5): if the amendment was adopted by the members, a statement that the number of votes cast for the amendment by the members or by each voting group entitled to vote separately on the amendment was sufficient for approval by the members or voting group respectively; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1005(6): 16-6a-1013 if approval of the amendment by some person or persons other than the members, the board of directors, or the incorporators is required pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006 Restated articles of incorporation.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(1)(a): The board of directors may restate the articles of incorporation at any time with or without member action.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(1)(b): The incorporators of a nonprofit corporation may restate the articles of incorporation at any time if the nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(1)(b)(i): has no members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(1)(b)(ii): no directors have been chosen.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(2): (1); 16-6a-1003
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(2)(a): The restatement may include one or more amendments to the articles of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(2)(b): (1); 16-6a-1003 Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(3): 16-6a-704; (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(3)(a): 16-6a-704 If the board of directors submits a restatement for member action, the nonprofit corporation shall give notice, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(3)(b): (3)(a) The notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(3)(b)(i): state that the purpose, or one of the purposes, of the meeting is to consider the restatement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(3)(b)(ii): contain or be accompanied by a copy of the restatement that identifies any amendment or other change it would make in the articles of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(4): 16-6a-1005(5) A nonprofit corporation restating its articles of incorporation shall deliver to the division for filing articles of restatement setting forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(4)(a): the name of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(4)(b): the text of the restated articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(4)(c): 16-6a-1005(5) if the restatement contains an amendment to the articles of incorporation that was adopted by the members, the information required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(4)(d): if the restatement was adopted by the board of directors or incorporators without member action, a statement to that effect and that member action was not required; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(4)(e): the restatement does not need to contain the name or address of the incorporator or incorporators that were included in the articles of incorporation when originally filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1006(5): 16-6a-108 Upon filing by the division or at any later effective date determined pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1007 Amendment of articles of incorporation pursuant to reorganization.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1007(1): 16-6a-202 Articles of incorporation may be amended, without action by the board of directors or members, to carry out a plan of reorganization ordered or decreed by a court of competent jurisdiction under a statute of this state or of the United States if the articles of incorporation after amendment contain only provisions required or permitted by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1007(2): (1) For an amendment to the articles of incorporation to be made pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1007(2)(a): the name of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1007(2)(b): the text of each amendment approved by the court;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1007(2)(c): the date of the court's order or decree approving the articles of amendment;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1007(2)(d): the title of the reorganization proceeding in which the order or decree was entered; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1007(2)(e): a statement that the court had jurisdiction of the proceeding under a specified statute of this state or of the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1007(3): This section does not apply after entry of a final decree in the reorganization proceeding even though the court retains jurisdiction of the proceeding for limited purposes unrelated to consummation of the reorganization plan.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008 Conversion to a business corporation.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(1): Chapter 10a, Utah Revised Business Corporation Act; Chapter 10a, Utah Revised Business Corporation Act; 16-10a-203
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(1)(a): Chapter 10a, Utah Revised Business Corporation Act A domestic nonprofit corporation may convert to a corporation subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(1)(b): Chapter 10a, Utah Revised Business Corporation Act; 16-10a-203 The day on which a nonprofit domestic corporation files an amendment under this section, the domestic nonprofit corporation becomes a corporation subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(1)(b)(i): commenced its existence under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(1)(b)(ii): otherwise was created, formed, incorporated, or came into being.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(2): 16-10a-601 The amendment of the articles of incorporation to convert to a corporation shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(2)(a): revise the statement of purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(2)(b): delete:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(2)(b)(i): the authorization for members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(2)(b)(ii): any other provisions relating to memberships;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(2)(c): 16-10a-601 authorize shares:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(2)(c)(i): stating the number of shares; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(2)(c)(ii): 16-10a-601 including the information required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(2)(d): make such other changes as may be necessary or desired; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(2)(e): if the corporation has any members, provide for:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(2)(e)(i): the cancellation of the memberships; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(2)(e)(ii): the conversion of the memberships to shares of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(3): If the nonprofit corporation has any voting members, an amendment to convert to a  corporation shall be approved by all of the voting members regardless of limitations or restrictions on the voting rights of the members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(4): If an amendment to the articles of incorporation filed pursuant to this section is included in a merger agreement, this section applies, except that any provisions for cancellation or conversion of memberships:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(4)(a): shall be in the merger agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(4)(b): may not be in the amendment of the articles of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(5): 16-6a-1301 A conversion under this section may not result in a violation, directly or indirectly, of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(5)(a): 16-6a-1301 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(5)(b): any other provision of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(6): The conversion of a nonprofit corporation into a corporation does not affect:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(6)(a): an obligation or liability of the converting nonprofit corporation incurred before its conversion to a corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(6)(b): the personal liability of any person incurred before the conversion.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7): (7)(a)(ii); (7)(a); (7)(a); (6)(a); (b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(a): (7)(a)(ii); (7)(a); (7)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(a)(i): (7)(a)(ii); (7)(a) When a conversion is effective under this section, for purposes of the laws of this state, the things listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(a)(i)(A): vest in the corporation to which the nonprofit corporation converts;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(a)(i)(B): are the property of the corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(a)(i)(C): (7)(a) are not considered transferred by the converting nonprofit corporation to the corporation by operation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(a)(ii): (7)(a) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(a)(ii)(A): its rights, privileges, and powers;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(a)(ii)(B): its interests in property, whether real, personal, or mixed;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(a)(ii)(C): debts due to the converting nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(a)(ii)(D): the debts, liabilities, and duties of the converting nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(a)(ii)(E): the rights and obligations under contract of the converting nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(a)(ii)(F): other things and causes of action belonging to the converting nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(b): The title to any real property vested by deed or otherwise in a nonprofit corporation converting to a corporation does not revert and is not in any way impaired by reason of this chapter or of the conversion.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(c): (6)(a); (b) A right of a creditor or a lien on property of a converting nonprofit corporation that is described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(d): A debt, liability, or duty of a converting nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(d)(i): remains attached to the corporation to which the nonprofit corporation converts; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(d)(ii): may be enforced against the corporation to the same extent as if the debts, liabilities, and duties had been incurred or contracted by the corporation in its capacity as a corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(e): A converted nonprofit corporation upon conversion to a corporation pursuant to this section is considered the same entity as the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(f): In connection with a conversion of a nonprofit corporation to a corporation under this section, the interests or rights in the nonprofit corporation which is to be converted may be exchanged or converted into one or more of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(f)(i): cash, property, interests, or rights in the corporation to which it is converted; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(f)(ii): cash, property or interests in, or rights in another entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(g): Unless otherwise agreed:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(g)(i): a converting nonprofit corporation is not required solely as a result of the conversion to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(g)(i)(A): wind up its affairs;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(g)(i)(B): pay its liabilities; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(g)(i)(C): distribute its assets; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008(7)(g)(ii): a conversion is not considered to constitute a dissolution of the nonprofit corporation, but constitutes a continuation of the existence of the nonprofit corporation in the form of a corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7 Conversion to or from a domestic limited liability company.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1): Title 48, Chapter 3a, Utah Revised Uniform Limited Liability Company Act; 48-3a-1405; (1); 48-3a-1041; (1); 48-3a-1042; 48-3a-1045
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(a): Title 48, Chapter 3a, Utah Revised Uniform Limited Liability Company Act; 48-3a-1405; (1); 48-3a-1041 A domestic nonprofit corporation may convert to a domestic limited liability company subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(a)(i): (1) this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(a)(ii): 48-3a-1041 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(b): (1); 48-3a-1042; 48-3a-1045 If a domestic nonprofit corporation converts to a domestic limited liability company in accordance with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(b)(i): 48-3a-1042; 48-3a-1045 comply with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(b)(ii): if the corporation has any members, provide for:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(b)(ii)(A): the cancellation of any membership; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(b)(ii)(B): the conversion of any membership in the domestic nonprofit corporation to a membership interest in the domestic limited liability company.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(c): Before articles of conversion or statement of conversion may be filed with the division, the conversion shall be approved:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(c)(i): in the manner provided for the articles of incorporation or bylaws of the domestic nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(c)(ii): if the articles of incorporation or bylaws of the domestic nonprofit corporation do not provide the method for approval:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(c)(ii)(A): if the domestic nonprofit corporation has voting members, by all of the members of the domestic nonprofit corporation regardless of limitations or restrictions on the voting rights of the members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(c)(ii)(B): if the nonprofit domestic corporation does not have voting members, by a majority of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(c)(ii)(B)(I): the directors in office at the time the conversion is approved by the board of directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(1)(c)(ii)(B)(II): if directors have not been appointed or elected, the incorporators.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(2): 48-3a-1041; 48-3a-1405 A domestic limited liability company may convert to a domestic nonprofit corporation subject to this chapter by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(2)(a): filing articles of incorporation in accordance with this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(2)(b): 48-3a-1041; 48-3a-1405 complying with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(3): 16-6a-1301 Any conversion under this section may not result in a violation, directly or indirectly, of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(3)(a): 16-6a-1301 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1008.7(3)(b): any other provision of this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1009 Effect of amendment of articles of incorporation.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1009(1): An amendment to the articles of incorporation does not affect:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1009(1)(a): any existing right of persons other than members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1009(1)(b): any cause of action existing against or in favor of the nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1009(1)(c): any proceeding to which the nonprofit corporation is a party.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1009(2): An amendment changing a nonprofit corporation's corporate name does not abate a proceeding brought by or against a nonprofit corporation in its former corporate name.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1010 Amendment of bylaws by board of directors or members.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1010(1): The board of directors may amend the bylaws at any time to add, change, or delete a provision, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1010(1)(a): this chapter or the articles of incorporation or bylaws:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1010(1)(a)(i): reserve the power exclusively to the members in whole or part; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1010(1)(a)(ii): otherwise prohibit the board of directors from amending the bylaws to add, change, or delete a provision; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1010(1)(b): it would result in a change of the rights, privileges, preferences, restrictions, or conditions of a membership class as to voting, dissolution, redemption, or transfer by changing the rights, privileges, preferences, restrictions, or conditions of another class.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1010(2): 16-6a-1003; 16-6a-1004; 16-6a-1003; 16-6a-1004
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1010(2)(a): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, the members may amend the bylaws even though the bylaws may also be amended by the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1010(2)(b): 16-6a-1003; 16-6a-1004; 16-6a-1003; 16-6a-1004 Amendments to the bylaws by members shall be made in accordance with Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1011 Bylaw changing quorum or voting requirement for members.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1011(1): (1)(a); Part 6, Members; Part 7, Member Meetings and Voting
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1011(1)(a): If authorized by the articles of incorporation, the members may adopt, amend, or repeal bylaws that fix a greater quorum or voting requirement for members, or voting groups of members, than is required by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1011(1)(b): (1)(a); Part 6, Members; Part 7, Member Meetings and Voting An action by the members under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1011(2): 16-6a-716 Bylaws that fix a greater quorum requirement or a greater voting requirement for members pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1012 Bylaw changing quorum or voting requirement for directors.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1012(1): Bylaws that fix a greater quorum or voting requirement for the board of directors may be amended:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1012(1)(a): if adopted by the members, only by the members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1012(1)(b): if adopted by the board of directors, by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1012(1)(b)(i): the members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1012(1)(b)(ii): the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1012(2): Bylaws adopted or amended by the members that fix a greater quorum or voting requirement for the board of directors may provide that the bylaws may be amended only by a specified vote of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1012(2)(a): the members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1012(2)(b): the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1012(3): (1)(b) Action by the board of directors under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1012(3)(a): then in effect; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1012(3)(b): proposed to be adopted.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1013 Approval by third persons.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1013(1): The articles of incorporation may require an amendment to the articles of incorporation or bylaws to be approved in writing by a specified person or persons other than the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1013(2): (1) A provision permitted under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1014 Amendment terminating members or redeeming or canceling memberships.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1014(1): An amendment to the articles of incorporation or bylaws of a nonprofit corporation shall meet the requirements of this chapter and this section if the amendment would:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1014(1)(a): terminate all members or any class of members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1014(1)(b): redeem or cancel all memberships or any class of memberships.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1014(2): (1) Before adopting a resolution proposing an amendment as described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101 Merger.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(1): 16-6a-1102; 16-10a-1103 One or more domestic corporations, foreign corporations, domestic nonprofit corporations, or foreign nonprofit corporations may merge into a nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(1)(a): if the board of directors of each domestic corporation, foreign corporation, domestic nonprofit corporation, or foreign nonprofit corporation party to the merger adopts a plan of merger;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(1)(b): 16-6a-1102 if the members of each domestic nonprofit corporation entitled to vote on the plan of merger, approve the plan of merger if required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(1)(c): 16-10a-1103 if the shareholders of each domestic corporation entitled to vote on the plan of merger, approve the plan of merger, if required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(1)(d): if the merger is permitted by and consistent with the laws of the state or country under whose law each foreign corporation or foreign nonprofit corporation party to the merger is incorporated;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(1)(e): if the shareholders of each such foreign corporation approve the plan of merger and as required by applicable law of the states or countries under whose law each foreign corporation party to the merger is incorporated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(1)(f): if the members of each such foreign nonprofit corporation approve the plan of merger and as required by applicable law of the states or countries under whose law each foreign nonprofit corporation party to the merger is incorporated.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(2): (1) The plan of merger required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(2)(a): the name of each party to the merger planning to merge;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(2)(b): the name of the surviving domestic nonprofit corporation into which each party to the merger plans to merge;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(2)(c): the terms and conditions of the merger;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(2)(d): the manner and basis of converting in whole or part the shares or memberships if any, of each party to the merger into shares, memberships, obligations, or other interests of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(2)(d)(i): the surviving domestic nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(2)(d)(ii): any other entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(2)(d)(iii): into money or other property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(2)(e): any amendments to the articles of incorporation of the surviving domestic nonprofit corporation to be effected by the merger.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(3): (2) In addition to the provisions required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(4): 16-10a-1103; Chapter 6a, Part 11, Merger One or more domestic corporations may merge into a domestic nonprofit corporation if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(4)(a): the board of directors of each participating domestic corporation adopts the plan of merger;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(4)(b): 16-10a-1103 the shareholders of each participating domestic corporation adopt the plan of merger in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1101(4)(c): Chapter 6a, Part 11, Merger the merger is effected in compliance with


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102 Action on plan of merger.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(1): After adopting the plan of merger, the board of directors of each domestic nonprofit corporation that is a party to the merger shall submit the plan of merger to its members, if any are entitled to vote on the plan of merger, for approval.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(2): (7) If the domestic nonprofit corporation has members entitled to vote with respect to the approval of a plan of merger, a plan of merger is approved by the members if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(2)(a)(i): the board of directors recommends the plan of merger to the members entitled to vote on the plan of merger; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(2)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(2)(a)(ii)(A): the board of directors determines that, because of conflict of interest or other special circumstances, it should make no recommendation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(2)(a)(ii)(B): communicates the basis for its determination to the members with the plan; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(2)(b): (7) the members entitled to vote on the plan of merger approve the plan as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(3): 16-6a-1013 After adopting the plan of merger, the board of directors of each domestic nonprofit corporation party to the merger shall submit the plan of merger for written approval by any person or persons:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(3)(a): whose approval is required by the articles of incorporation of the domestic nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(3)(b): 16-6a-1013 as required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(4): (4)(a); 16-6a-814; (4)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(4)(a): If the domestic nonprofit corporation does not have members entitled to vote on a merger, the merger shall be approved and adopted by a majority of the directors elected and in office at the time the plan of merger is considered by the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(4)(b): (4)(a); 16-6a-814 The domestic nonprofit corporation shall provide notice of any meeting of the board of directors at which the approval described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(4)(c): (4)(b) The notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(5): The board of directors may condition the effectiveness of the plan of merger on any basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(6): 16-6a-704; (6)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(6)(a): 16-6a-704 The domestic nonprofit corporation shall give notice, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(6)(b): (6)(a) The notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(6)(b)(i): state that the purpose, or one of the purposes, of the meeting is to consider the plan of merger; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(6)(b)(ii): contain or be accompanied by a copy of the plan of merger or a summary of the plan of merger.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(7): 16-6a-714; 16-6a-715; (5) The plan of merger shall be approved by the votes required by Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(7)(a): this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(7)(b): the articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(7)(c): bylaws adopted by the members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(7)(d): (5) the board of directors acting pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1102(8): Separate voting by voting groups is required on a plan of merger if the plan contains a provision that, if contained in an amendment to the articles of incorporation, would require action by one or more separate voting groups on the amendment.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1103 Articles of merger.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1103(1): 16-6a-1102; 16-6a-1102(3) After a plan of merger is approved, pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1103(1)(a): the plan of merger;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1103(1)(b): if shareholder or member approval was not required of any party to the merger:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1103(1)(b)(i): a statement to the effect that approval was not required; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1103(1)(b)(ii): a statement that the plan of merger was approved by a sufficient vote of the board of directors of each party to the merger;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1103(1)(c): if approval of the shareholders or members of one or more domestic corporation, foreign corporation, domestic nonprofit corporation, or foreign nonprofit corporation party to the merger was required, a statement that the number of votes cast for the plan by each voting group entitled to vote separately on the merger was sufficient for approval by that voting group; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1103(1)(d): 16-6a-1102(3) if approval of the plan by some person or persons other than the shareholders, members, or the board of directors is required pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1103(2): A merger takes effect upon the effective date stated in the articles of merger, which may not be prior to the date the articles of merger are filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1103(3): Articles of merger shall be executed by each party to the merger.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104 Effect of merger.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(1): When a merger takes effect:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(1)(a): every domestic corporation, foreign corporation, domestic nonprofit corporation, or foreign nonprofit corporation party to the merger merges into the surviving domestic nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(1)(b): the separate existence of every domestic corporation, foreign corporation, domestic nonprofit corporation, or foreign nonprofit corporation party to the merger except the surviving domestic nonprofit corporation ceases;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(1)(c): the title to all real estate and other property owned by every domestic corporation, foreign corporation, domestic nonprofit corporation, or foreign nonprofit corporation party to the merger is transferred to and vested in the surviving domestic nonprofit corporation without reversion or impairment;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(1)(d): the surviving domestic nonprofit corporation has all liabilities of each domestic corporation, foreign corporation, domestic nonprofit corporation, or foreign nonprofit corporation party to the merger;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(1)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(1)(e)(i): a proceeding pending by or against any party to the merger may be continued as if the merger did not occur; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(1)(e)(ii): the surviving domestic nonprofit corporation may be substituted in the proceeding for the party to the merger whose existence ceased;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(1)(f): the articles of incorporation of the surviving domestic nonprofit corporation are amended to the extent provided in the plan of merger; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(1)(g): the shares or memberships of each domestic corporation, foreign corporation, domestic nonprofit corporation, or foreign nonprofit corporation party to the merger that are to be converted into shares, memberships, obligations, or other interests of the surviving domestic nonprofit corporation or into money or other property are converted, and the former holders of the shares and memberships are entitled only to the rights provided in the articles of merger.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(2): (1)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(2)(a): (1)(c) A transfer to and vesting in the surviving domestic nonprofit corporation described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(2)(b): Consent or approval of any other person may not be required in connection with any transfer or vesting unless the consent or approval is specifically required in the event of merger by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(2)(b)(i): law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1104(2)(b)(ii): express provision in any contract, agreement, decree, order, or other instrument to which any of the domestic corporations, foreign corporations, domestic nonprofit corporations, or foreign nonprofit corporations so merged is a party or by which it is bound.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105 Merger with foreign nonprofit corporation.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(1): (1)(a); 16-6a-1103; 16-6a-1103; 16-6a-1101; 16-6a-1102; 16-6a-1103 One or more domestic nonprofit corporations may merge with one or more foreign nonprofit corporations if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(1)(a): the merger is permitted by the law of the state or country under whose law each foreign nonprofit corporation is incorporated;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(1)(b): (1)(a) each foreign nonprofit corporation complies with the provisions of the law described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(1)(c): 16-6a-1103; 16-6a-1103 if the foreign nonprofit corporation is the surviving nonprofit corporation of the merger, the foreign nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(1)(c)(i): 16-6a-1103 complies with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(1)(c)(ii): 16-6a-1103 in addition to the information required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(1)(d): 16-6a-1101; 16-6a-1102; 16-6a-1103 each domestic nonprofit corporation complies with:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(1)(d)(i): 16-6a-1101; 16-6a-1102 the applicable provisions of Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(1)(d)(ii): 16-6a-1103 if it is the surviving nonprofit corporation of the merger, with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(2): 16-17-301 Upon the merger taking effect, a surviving foreign nonprofit corporation of a merger may be served with process in any proceeding brought against it as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(3): (2) Service effected pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(3)(a): the date the foreign nonprofit corporation receives the process, notice, or demand;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(3)(b): the date shown on the return receipt, if signed on behalf of the foreign nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(3)(c): five days after mailing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1105(4): (2) Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1201 Sale of property.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1201(1): Unless the bylaws otherwise provide, a nonprofit corporation may, as authorized by the board of directors:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1201(1)(a): sell, lease, exchange, or otherwise dispose of all or substantially all of its property in the usual and regular course of business; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1201(1)(b): mortgage, pledge, dedicate to the repayment of indebtedness, whether with or without recourse, or otherwise encumber all or substantially all of its property whether or not in the usual and regular course of business.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1201(2): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, approval of a transaction described in this section by the members is not required.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202 Sale of property other than in regular course of activities.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(1)(a): A nonprofit corporation may sell, lease, exchange, or otherwise dispose of all, or substantially all, of its property, with or without its good will, other than in the usual and regular course of business on the terms and conditions and for the consideration determined by the board of directors, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(1)(a)(i): the board of directors proposes the transaction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(1)(a)(ii): the members entitled to vote on the transaction approve the transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(1)(b): A sale, lease, exchange, or other disposition of all, or substantially all, of the property of a nonprofit corporation, with or without its good will, in connection with its dissolution, other than in the usual and regular course of business, and other than pursuant to a court order, shall be subject to this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(1)(c): A sale, lease, exchange, or other disposition of all, or substantially all, of the property of a nonprofit corporation, with or without its good will, pursuant to a court order is not subject to this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(2): (2)(b); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(2)(a): (2)(b) A nonprofit corporation shall comply with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(2)(a)(i): the nonprofit corporation is entitled to vote or otherwise consent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(2)(a)(ii): the property interests held by the nonprofit corporation in the other entity constitute all, or substantially all, of the property of the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(2)(b): (2)(a) A nonprofit corporation may vote or otherwise consent to a transaction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(2)(b)(i): the board of the directors of the nonprofit corporation proposes the vote or consent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(2)(b)(ii): the members, if any are entitled to vote on the vote or consent, approve giving the vote or consent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(3): (1); (2); (6) For a transaction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(3)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(3)(a)(i): the board of directors shall recommend the transaction or the consent to the members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(3)(a)(ii): the board of directors shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(3)(a)(ii)(A): determine that because of a conflict of interest or other special circumstance it should make no recommendation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(3)(a)(ii)(B): communicate the basis for its determination to the members at a membership meeting with the submission of the transaction or consent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(3)(b): (6) the members entitled to vote on the transaction or the consent shall approve the transaction or the consent as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(4): The board of directors may condition the effectiveness of the transaction or the consent on any basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(5): 16-6a-704; (1); (2); (1); (1); (2); (1); (2); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(5)(a): 16-6a-704; (1); (2) The nonprofit corporation shall give notice, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(5)(b): (1); (1); (2); (1); (2); (2) The notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(5)(b)(i): (1); (2) state that the purpose, or one of the purposes, of the meeting is to consider:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(5)(b)(i)(A): (1) in the case of action pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(5)(b)(i)(B): (2) in the case of action pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(5)(b)(i)(B)(I): are held by the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(5)(b)(i)(B)(II): constitute all, or substantially all, of the property of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(5)(b)(ii): (1); (2) contain or be accompanied by a description of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(5)(b)(ii)(A): (1) the transaction, in the case of action pursuant to Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(6)(c): bylaws adopted by the members; or

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(7): (1); (2) After a transaction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1202(8): Part 13, Distributions A transaction that constitutes a distribution is governed by


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1301 Distributions prohibited.
----------------------------------------------------------
Except as authorized by Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302 Authorized distributions.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(1): A nonprofit corporation may:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(1)(a): make distributions or distribute the nonprofit corporation's assets to a:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(1)(a)(i): member that is a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(1)(a)(ii): member of a mutual benefit corporation, not inconsistent with its bylaws;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(1)(a)(iii): shareholder of a water company in a manner consistent with its articles of incorporation, bylaws, and the provisions of this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(1)(a)(iv): governmental entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(1)(b): pay compensation in a reasonable amount to its members, directors, or officers for services rendered;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(1)(c): if a cooperative nonprofit corporation, make distributions consistent with its purposes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(1)(d): confer benefits upon its members in conformity with its purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(2): Part 14, Dissolution A nonprofit corporation may make distributions upon dissolution as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(2)(a): to a member that is a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(2)(b): to its members if it is a mutual benefit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(2)(c): to a shareholder of a water company in proportion to the shareholder's interest in the water company, consistent with the water company's articles of incorporation and bylaws;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(2)(d): to another nonprofit corporation, including a nonprofit corporation organized to receive the assets of and function in place of the dissolved nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(2)(e): Part 14, Dissolution otherwise in conformity with
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1302(3): Authorized distributions by a dissolved nonprofit corporation may be made by authorized officers or directors, including those elected, hired, or otherwise selected after dissolution if the election, hiring, or other selection after dissolution is not inconsistent with the articles of incorporation and bylaws existing at the time of dissolution.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1401 Dissolution by incorporators or directors if no members.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1401(1): If a nonprofit corporation has no members, the following may authorize the dissolution of the nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1401(1)(a): a majority of its directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1401(1)(b): if it has no directors, a majority of its incorporators.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1401(2): The directors or incorporators in approving dissolution shall adopt a plan of dissolution indicating to whom the assets owned or held by the nonprofit corporation will be distributed after all creditors have been paid.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402 Dissolution by directors and members.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(1): (2) If a nonprofit corporation has members, dissolution of a nonprofit corporation may be authorized in the manner provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(2): (5) For a proposal to dissolve the nonprofit corporation to be authorized:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(2)(a): the board of directors shall adopt the proposal to dissolve;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(2)(b): the board of directors shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(2)(b)(i): recommend the proposal to dissolve to the members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(2)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(2)(b)(ii)(A): determine that because of a conflict of interest or other special circumstance, it should make no recommendation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(2)(b)(ii)(B): communicate the basis for its determination to the members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(2)(c): (5) the members entitled to vote on the proposal to dissolve shall approve the proposal to dissolve as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(3): The board of directors may condition the effectiveness of the dissolution, and the members may condition their approval of the dissolution, on any basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(4): 16-6a-704; (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(4)(a): 16-6a-704 The nonprofit corporation shall give notice, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(4)(b): (4)(a) The notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(4)(b)(i): state that the purpose, or one of the purposes, of the meeting is to consider the proposal to dissolve the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(4)(b)(ii): contain or be accompanied by a copy of the proposal or a summary of the proposal.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(5): 16-6a-714; 16-6a-715; (3) The proposal to dissolve shall be approved by the votes required by Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(5)(a): this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(5)(b): the articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(5)(c): bylaws adopted by the members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(5)(d): (3) the board of directors acting pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1402(6): The plan of dissolution shall indicate to whom the assets owned or held by the nonprofit corporation will be distributed after all creditors have been paid.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1403 Articles of dissolution.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1403(1): 16-6a-1409; 16-6a-1401; 16-6a-1402 At any time after dissolution is authorized, the nonprofit corporation may dissolve by delivering to the division for filing articles of dissolution setting forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1403(1)(a): the name of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1403(1)(b): 16-6a-1409
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1403(1)(b)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1403(1)(b)(i)(A): the address of the nonprofit corporation's principal office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1403(1)(b)(i)(B): if a principal office is not to be maintained, a statement that the nonprofit corporation will not maintain a principal office; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1403(1)(b)(ii): 16-6a-1409 if different from the address of the principal office or if no principal office is to be maintained, the address to which service of process may be mailed pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1403(1)(c): the date dissolution was authorized;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1403(1)(d): 16-6a-1401 if dissolution was authorized by the directors or the incorporators pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1403(1)(e): 16-6a-1402 if dissolution was approved by the members pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1403(1)(f): any additional information as the division determines is necessary or appropriate.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1403(2): A nonprofit corporation is dissolved upon the effective date of its articles of dissolution.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1403(3): 16-6a-1418 Articles of dissolution need not be filed by a nonprofit corporation that is dissolved pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404 Revocation of dissolution.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(1): A nonprofit corporation may revoke its dissolution within 120 days after the effective date of the dissolution.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(2): (2)(b); 16-6a-1402
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(2)(a): (2)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(2)(b): 16-6a-1402 The board of directors may revoke the dissolution without member action if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(2)(b)(i): 16-6a-1402 the dissolution is authorized pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(2)(b)(ii): the authorization permitted revocation by action of the board of directors alone.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(3): (2); 16-6a-1401; (2); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(3)(a): After the revocation of dissolution is authorized, the nonprofit corporation may revoke the dissolution by delivering to the division for filing, within 120 days after the effective date of dissolution:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(3)(a)(i): articles of revocation of dissolution; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(3)(a)(ii): a copy of its articles of dissolution.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(3)(b): (2); 16-6a-1401; (2); (2) The articles of revocation of dissolution shall set forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(3)(b)(i): the name of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(3)(b)(ii): the effective date of the dissolution that was revoked;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(3)(b)(iii): the date that the revocation of dissolution was authorized;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(3)(b)(iv): (2); 16-6a-1401 if, pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(3)(b)(v): (2) if, pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(3)(b)(vi): (2) if the revocation of dissolution was approved pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(4): 16-6a-108(1); 16-6a-108(2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(4)(a): 16-6a-108(1) Revocation of dissolution is effective as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(4)(b): 16-6a-108(2) A delayed effective date may not be specified pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(5): When the revocation of dissolution is effective:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(5)(a): the revocation relates back to and takes effect as of the effective date of the dissolution; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1404(5)(b): the nonprofit corporation may carry on its activities and use its corporate name as if dissolution had never occurred.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405 Effect of dissolution.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(1): A dissolved nonprofit corporation continues its corporate existence but may not carry on any activities except as is appropriate to wind up and liquidate its affairs, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(1)(a): collecting its assets;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(1)(b): returning, transferring, or conveying assets held by the nonprofit corporation upon a condition requiring return, transfer, or conveyance, which condition occurs by reason of the dissolution, in accordance with the condition;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(1)(c): transferring, subject to any contractual or legal requirements, its assets as provided in or authorized by its articles of incorporation or bylaws;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(1)(d): discharging or making provision for discharging its liabilities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(1)(e): doing every other act necessary to wind up and liquidate its assets and affairs.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(2): Dissolution of a nonprofit corporation does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(2)(a): transfer title to the nonprofit corporation's property including title to water rights, water conveyance facilities, or other assets of a nonprofit corporation organized to divert or distribute water to its members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(2)(b): subject its directors or officers to standards of conduct different from those prescribed in this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(2)(c): change quorum or voting requirements for its board of directors or members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(2)(d): change provisions for selection, resignation, or removal of its directors or officers, or both;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(2)(e): change provisions for amending its bylaws or its articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(2)(f): prevent commencement of a proceeding by or against the nonprofit corporation in its corporate name; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(2)(g): abate or suspend a proceeding pending by or against the nonprofit corporation on the effective date of dissolution.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1405(3): 16-6a-1414 Nothing in this section may be applied in a manner inconsistent with a court's power of judicial dissolution exercised in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406 Disposition of known claims by notification.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(1): A dissolved nonprofit corporation may dispose of the known claims against it by following the procedures described in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(2): (2)(c) A dissolved nonprofit corporation electing to dispose of known claims pursuant to this section may give written notice of the dissolution to known claimants at any time after the effective date of the dissolution.  The written notice shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(2)(a): describe the information that shall be included in a claim;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(2)(b): provide an address to which written notice of any claim shall be given to the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(2)(c): state the deadline by which the dissolved nonprofit corporation shall receive a claim, which may not be fewer than 120 days after the effective date of the notice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(2)(d): (2)(c) state that unless sooner barred by any other state statute limiting actions, a claim will be barred if not received by the deadline stated in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(3): (2) Unless sooner barred by any other statute limiting actions, a claim against the dissolved nonprofit corporation is barred if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(3)(a): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(3)(a)(i): (2) a claimant was given notice under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(3)(a)(ii): the claim is not received by the dissolved nonprofit corporation by the deadline stated in the notice; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(3)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(3)(b)(i): the dissolved nonprofit corporation delivers to the claimant written notice of rejection of the claim within 90 days after receipt of the claim; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(3)(b)(ii): the claimant whose claim was rejected by the dissolved nonprofit corporation does not commence a proceeding to enforce the claim within 90 days after the effective date of the rejection notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(4): Claims that are not rejected by the dissolved nonprofit corporation in writing within 90 days after receipt of the claim by the dissolved nonprofit corporation shall be considered accepted.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(5): (2) The failure of the dissolved nonprofit corporation to give notice to any known claimant pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(6): For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(6)(a): "claim" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(6)(a)(i): a contingent liability; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(6)(a)(ii): a claim based on an event occurring after the effective date of dissolution; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(6)(b): an action to enforce a claim includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(6)(b)(i): any civil action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1406(6)(b)(ii): any arbitration under any agreement for binding arbitration between the dissolved nonprofit corporation and the claimant.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407 Disposition of claims by publication.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(1): A dissolved nonprofit corporation may publish notice of its dissolution and request that persons with claims against the nonprofit corporation present them in accordance with the notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(2): (1); (2)(a)(i)(A); (B); 45-1-101 The notice described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(2)(a): (2)(a)(i)(A); (B); 45-1-101 be published:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(2)(a)(i): (2)(a)(i)(A); (B) one time in a newspaper of general circulation in:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(2)(a)(i)(A): the county where:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(2)(a)(i)(A)(I): the dissolved nonprofit corporation's principal office is located; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(2)(a)(i)(A)(II): if the dissolved nonprofit corporation has no principal office in this state, its registered office is or was last located; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(2)(a)(i)(B): (2)(a)(i)(A); (B) if neither Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(2)(a)(ii): 45-1-101 as required in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(2)(b): describe the information that shall be included in a claim;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(2)(c): provide an address at which any claim shall be given to the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(2)(d): state that unless sooner barred by any other statute limiting actions, a claim will be barred if an action to enforce the claim is not commenced within three years after publication of the notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(3): (2); 16-6a-1406 If the dissolved nonprofit corporation publishes a newspaper or website notice in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(4): For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(4)(a): "claim" means any claim, including claims of this state, whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(4)(a)(i): known;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(4)(a)(ii): due or to become due;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(4)(a)(iii): absolute or contingent;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(4)(a)(iv): liquidated or unliquidated;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(4)(a)(v): founded on contract, tort, or other legal basis; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(4)(a)(vi): otherwise; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(4)(b): an action to enforce a claim includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(4)(b)(i): any civil action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1407(4)(b)(ii): any arbitration under any agreement for binding arbitration between the dissolved nonprofit corporation and the claimant.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1408 Enforcement of claims against dissolved nonprofit corporation.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1408(1): (2); 16-6a-1406; 16-6a-1407 Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1408(1)(a): against the dissolved nonprofit corporation to the extent of its undistributed assets; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1408(1)(b): if assets have been distributed in liquidation, against any person, other than a creditor of the nonprofit corporation, to whom the nonprofit corporation distributed its property.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1408(2): (1) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1408(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1408(3)(a): A distributee required to return any portion of the value of assets received by the distributee in liquidation shall be entitled to contribution from all other distributees.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1408(3)(b): (3)(a) Each contribution under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1408(3)(b)(i): shall be in accordance with the contributing distributee's rights and interests; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1408(3)(b)(ii): may not exceed the value of the assets received by the contributing distributee in liquidation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409 Service on dissolved nonprofit corporation.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409(1): A dissolved nonprofit corporation shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409(1)(a): maintain a registered agent to accept service of process on its behalf; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409(1)(b): be considered to have authorized service of process on it by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409(1)(b)(i): the address of its principal office, if any:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409(1)(b)(i)(A): as set forth in its articles of dissolution; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409(1)(b)(i)(B): as last changed by notice delivered to the division for filing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409(1)(b)(ii): the address for service of process that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409(1)(b)(ii)(A): is stated in its articles of dissolution; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409(1)(b)(ii)(B): as last changed by notice delivered to the division for filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409(2): (1)(b) Service effected pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409(2)(a): the date the dissolved nonprofit corporation receives the process, notice, or demand;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409(2)(b): the date shown on the return receipt, if signed on behalf of the dissolved nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409(2)(c): five days after mailing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1409(3): (1) Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1410 Grounds for administrative dissolution.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
The division may commence a proceeding under SectionUtah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1410(1): the nonprofit corporation does not pay when they are due any taxes, fees, or penalties imposed by this chapter or other applicable laws of this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1410(2): the nonprofit corporation does not deliver its annual report to the division when it is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1410(3): the nonprofit corporation is without a registered agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1410(4): the nonprofit corporation does not give notice to the division that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1410(4)(a): its registered agent has been changed;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1410(4)(b): its registered agent has resigned; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1410(4)(c): the nonprofit corporation's period of duration stated in its articles of incorporation expires.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411 Procedure for and effect of administrative dissolution.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(1): 16-6a-1410 If the division determines that one or more grounds exist under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(2): (1); (2)(a); (2)(d); (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(2)(a): (1) If the nonprofit corporation does not correct each ground for dissolution, or demonstrate to the reasonable satisfaction of the division that each ground determined by the division does not exist, within 60 days after mailing of the notice contemplated in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(2)(b): (2)(a); (2)(d) If a nonprofit corporation is dissolved under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(2)(c): The division shall mail written notice of the administrative dissolution to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(2)(c)(i): the last registered agent of the dissolved nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(2)(c)(ii): if there is no registered agent of record, at least one officer of the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(2)(d): (2)(b) A nonprofit corporation's date of dissolution is five days after the date the division mails written notice of dissolution under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(3): (3)(b); 16-6a-1405; 16-6a-1406; 16-6a-1407; 16-6a-1412

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(3)(b): 16-6a-1412 If the nonprofit corporation is reinstated in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(4): The administrative dissolution of a nonprofit corporation does not terminate the authority of its registered agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(5): A notice mailed under this section shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(5)(a): mailed first class, postage prepaid; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(5)(b): addressed to the most current mailing address appearing on the records of the division for:

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1411(5)(b)(ii): the officer of the nonprofit corporation that is mailed the notice if the notice is required to be mailed to an officer of the nonprofit corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412 Reinstatement following administrative dissolution -- Reinstatement after voluntary dissolution.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1): 16-6a-1411; 16-6a-401 A nonprofit corporation administratively dissolved under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a): 16-6a-401 states:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a)(i): the effective date of the nonprofit corporation's administrative dissolution and the nonprofit corporation's corporate name on the effective date of dissolution;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a)(ii): that the ground or grounds for dissolution:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a)(ii)(A): did not exist; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a)(ii)(B): have been eliminated;
