Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a)(iii): the corporate name under which the nonprofit corporation is being reinstated;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a)(iv): 16-6a-401 the corporate name that satisfies the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a)(v): that the nonprofit corporation has paid all fees or penalties imposed under this chapter or other applicable state law;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a)(vi): that the nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a)(vi)(A): has paid any taxes, fees, or penalties owed to the State Tax Commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a)(vi)(B): is current on a payment plan with the State Tax Commission for any taxes, fees, or penalties owed to the State Tax Commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a)(vii): the address of the nonprofit corporation's registered office;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a)(viii): the name of the nonprofit corporation's registered agent at the office stated in Subsection (1)(a)(vii);
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a)(ix): the federal employer identification number of the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(a)(x): any additional information the division determines is necessary or appropriate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(1)(b): includes the written consent to appointment by the designated registered agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(2): 16-6a-1411 A nonprofit corporation administratively dissolved under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(3): 16-6a-1411; 42-2-6.6 A nonprofit corporation administratively dissolved under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(4)(a): After receiving a nonprofit corporation's application for reinstatement, the division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(4)(a)(i): provide the State Tax Commission with the nonprofit corporation's federal employer identification number; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(4)(a)(ii): request that the State Tax Commission certify that the nonprofit corporation is in good standing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(4)(b): The State Tax Commission shall certify that a nonprofit corporation is in good standing if the nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(4)(b)(i): has paid all taxes, fees, and penalties the nonprofit corporation owed to the State Tax Commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(4)(b)(ii): is current on a payment plan with the State Tax Commission for all taxes, fees, and penalties the nonprofit corporation owes to the State Tax Commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(4)(c): If a nonprofit corporation is not in good standing as described in Subsection (4)(b), the State Tax Commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(4)(c)(i): notify the division, stating that the nonprofit corporation is not in good standing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(4)(c)(ii): notify the nonprofit corporation, explaining in detail why the nonprofit corporation is not in good standing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(5): 16-6a-1411
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(5)(a): The division shall revoke the administrative dissolution if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(5)(a)(i): the division determines that the application for reinstatement contains the information required under Subsection (1) or (2);
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(5)(a)(ii): the division determines that the information in the application is correct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(5)(a)(iii): the State Tax Commission certifies that the nonprofit corporation is in good standing as described in Subsection (4)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(5)(b): 16-6a-1411 The division shall mail written notice of the revocation to the nonprofit corporation in the manner provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(6): When the reinstatement is effective:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(6)(a): the reinstatement relates back to and takes effect as of the effective date of the administrative dissolution;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(6)(b): the nonprofit corporation may carry on the nonprofit corporation's activities, under the name provided in the application for reinstatement, as if the administrative dissolution had never occurred; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(6)(c): an act of the nonprofit corporation during the period of dissolution is effective and enforceable as if the administrative dissolution had never occurred.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(7)(a): The division may make rules for the reinstatement of a nonprofit corporation voluntarily dissolved.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1412(7)(b): The rules made under Subsection (7)(a) shall be substantially similar to the requirements of this section for reinstatement of a nonprofit corporation that is administratively dissolved.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1413 Appeal from denial of reinstatement.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1413(1): 16-6a-1411; 16-6a-1411(5); (2) If the division denies a nonprofit corporation's application for reinstatement following administrative dissolution under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1413(1)(a): setting forth the reasons for denying the application; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1413(1)(b): (2) stating that the nonprofit corporation has the right to appeal the division's determination to the executive director as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1413(2): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act If the division denies a nonprofit corporation's application for reinstatement following administrative dissolution, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1413(2)(a): the nonprofit corporation for which the reinstatement was requested; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1413(2)(b): the representative of the nonprofit corporation for which reinstatement was requested.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414 Grounds and procedure for judicial dissolution.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(1): The attorney general or the division director may bring an action in a court with jurisdiction under Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration, to dissolve a nonprofit corporation if it is established that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(1)(a): the nonprofit corporation obtained the nonprofit corporation's articles of incorporation through fraud; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(1)(b): the nonprofit corporation has continued to exceed or abuse the authority conferred upon the nonprofit corporation by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(2): A member or director of a nonprofit corporation may bring an action in a court with jurisdiction under Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration, to dissolve the nonprofit corporation if it is established that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(2)(a)(i): the directors are deadlocked in the management of the corporate affairs;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(2)(a)(ii): the members, if any, are unable to break the deadlock; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(2)(a)(iii): irreparable injury to the nonprofit corporation is threatened or being suffered;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(2)(b): the directors or those in control of the nonprofit corporation have acted, are acting, or will act in a manner that is illegal, oppressive, or fraudulent;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(2)(c): the members are deadlocked in voting power and have failed, for a period that includes at least two consecutive annual meeting dates, to elect successors to directors whose terms have expired or would have expired upon the election of their successors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(2)(d): the corporate assets are being misapplied or wasted.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(3): A creditor may bring an action in a court with jurisdiction under Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration, to dissolve a nonprofit corporation if it is established that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(3)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(3)(a)(i): the creditor's claim has been reduced to judgment;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(3)(a)(ii): the execution on the judgment has been returned unsatisfied; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(3)(a)(iii): the nonprofit corporation is insolvent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(3)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(3)(b)(i): the nonprofit corporation is insolvent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(3)(b)(ii): the nonprofit corporation has admitted in writing that the creditor's claim is due and owing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(4): 76-7-102; 76-9-702; 76-9-702.1; 25-6-202
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(4)(a): 76-7-102; 76-9-702; 76-9-702.1 As used in this Subsection (4):
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(4)(a)(i): 76-7-102; 76-9-702; 76-9-702.1 "Misconduct claim" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(4)(a)(i)(A): a claim for wrongful death, fraud, breach of public trust, or an intentional tort; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(4)(a)(i)(B): 76-7-102; 76-9-702; 76-9-702.1 a claim regarding criminal conduct by a director, member, or employee of the nonprofit corporation that is a felony offense or an offense described in Title 76, Chapter 5, Part 4, Sexual Offenses, Title 76, Chapter 5b, Sexual Exploitation Act, Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(4)(a)(ii): "Nonprofit corporation" does not include a bona fide church or religious organization.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(4)(b): If a person brings a misconduct claim in an action against a nonprofit corporation, the person may also bring an action to dissolve the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(4)(c): If a person brings a dissolution action under Subsection (4)(b), the court may only dissolve the nonprofit corporation if the court finds the nonprofit corporation is liable for the misconduct claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(4)(d): Upon a motion by the plaintiff in a dissolution action described in Subsection (4)(b), the court may:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(4)(d)(i): issue an injunction preventing the nonprofit corporation from selling or disposing of any assets held by the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(4)(d)(ii): require the nonprofit corporation to deposit funds, or post a bond, with the court for the amount of damages pleaded in the complaint.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(4)(e): 25-6-202 The court may void a transaction that is made by the nonprofit corporation within 12 months before the day on which the action was filed with the court if the court finds that the transaction is voidable under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(5): If an action is brought under this section, it is not necessary to make directors or members parties to the action to dissolve the nonprofit corporation unless relief is sought against the members individually.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(6): In an action under this section, the court may:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(6)(a): issue injunctions;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(6)(b): appoint a receiver or a custodian pendente lite with all powers and duties the court directs; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(6)(c): take other action required to preserve the nonprofit corporation's assets wherever located and carry on the business of the nonprofit corporation until a full hearing can be held.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(7): 16-6a-1405; 16-6a-1405 If a nonprofit corporation has been dissolved by voluntary or another action taken under this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(7)(a): 16-6a-1405 the nonprofit corporation may bring a proceeding to wind up and liquidate its business and affairs under judicial supervision in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1414(7)(b): 16-6a-1405 the attorney general, a director, a member, a creditor, or a plaintiff under Subsection (4) may bring a proceeding to wind up and liquidate the affairs of the nonprofit corporation under judicial supervision in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416 Receivership or custodianship.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(1): 16-6a-1414; 16-6a-1414 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(1)(a): 16-6a-1414 "Decree of dissolution" includes an order of a court entered in a proceeding under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(1)(b): 16-6a-1414 "Judicial proceeding to dissolve the nonprofit corporation" includes a proceeding brought under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(2)(a): A court in a judicial proceeding brought to dissolve a nonprofit corporation may appoint:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(2)(a)(i): one or more receivers to wind up and liquidate the affairs of the nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(2)(a)(ii): one or more custodians to manage the affairs of the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(2)(b): Before appointing a receiver or custodian, the court shall hold a hearing, after giving notice to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(2)(b)(i): all parties to the proceeding; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(2)(b)(ii): any interested persons designated by the court.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(2)(c): The court appointing a receiver or custodian has exclusive jurisdiction over the nonprofit corporation and all of its property, wherever located.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(2)(d): The court may appoint as a receiver or custodian:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(2)(d)(i): an individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(2)(d)(ii): a domestic or foreign corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(2)(d)(iii): a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(2)(e): The court may require the receiver or custodian to post bond, with or without sureties, in an amount specified by the court.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(3): The court shall describe the powers and duties of the receiver or custodian in its appointing order that may be amended from time to time.  Among other powers the receiver shall have the power to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(3)(a): dispose of all or any part of the property of the nonprofit corporation, wherever located:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(3)(a)(i): at a public or private sale; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(3)(a)(ii): if authorized by the court; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(3)(b): sue and defend in the receiver's own name as receiver of the nonprofit corporation in all courts.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(4): The custodian may exercise all of the powers of the nonprofit corporation, through or in place of its board of directors or officers, to the extent necessary to manage the affairs of the nonprofit corporation in the best interests of its members and creditors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(5): If doing so is in the best interests of the nonprofit corporation and its members and creditors, the court may:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(5)(a): during a receivership, redesignate the receiver as a custodian; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(5)(b): during a custodianship, redesignate the custodian as a receiver.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(6): The court from time to time during the receivership or custodianship may order compensation paid and expense disbursements or reimbursements made from the assets of the nonprofit corporation or proceeds from the sale of the assets to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(6)(a): the receiver;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(6)(b): the custodian; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1416(6)(c): the receiver's or custodian's attorney.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417 Decree of dissolution.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(1): 16-6a-1414; 16-6a-1414 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(1)(a): 16-6a-1414 "Decree of dissolution" includes an order of a court entered in a proceeding under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(1)(b): 16-6a-1414 "Judicial proceeding to dissolve the nonprofit corporation" includes a proceeding brought under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(2): 16-6a-1414 If after a hearing the court determines that one or more grounds for judicial dissolution described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(2)(a): the court may enter a decree:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(2)(a)(i): dissolving the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(2)(a)(ii): specifying the effective date of the dissolution; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(2)(b): the clerk of the court shall deliver a certified copy of the decree to the division which shall file it accordingly.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(3): 16-6a-1405; 16-6a-1406; 16-6a-1407 After entering the decree of dissolution, the court shall direct:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(3)(a): 16-6a-1405 the winding up and liquidation of the nonprofit corporation's affairs in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(3)(b): 16-6a-1406; 16-6a-1407 the giving of notice to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(3)(b)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(3)(b)(i)(A): the nonprofit corporation's registered agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(3)(b)(i)(B): the division if it has no registered agent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(3)(b)(ii): 16-6a-1406; 16-6a-1407 to claimants in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1417(4): The court's order or decision may be appealed as in other civil proceedings.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1418 Dissolution upon expiration of period of duration.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1418(1): A nonprofit corporation shall be dissolved upon and by reason of the expiration of its period of duration, if any, stated in its articles of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1418(2): (2)(a)(i); (iii); (2)(a)(iv) For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1418(2)(a): (2)(a)(i); (iii) a provision in the articles of incorporation is considered a provision for a period of duration if it is to the effect that the nonprofit corporation or its existence shall be terminated:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1418(2)(a)(i): at a specified date;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1418(2)(a)(ii): after a stated period of time;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1418(2)(a)(iii): upon a contingency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1418(2)(a)(iv): (2)(a)(i); (iii) any event similar to those described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1418(2)(b): (2)(a)(iv) the following shall be considered to be the expiration of the nonprofit corporation's period of duration:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1418(2)(b)(i): the occurrence of the specified date;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1418(2)(b)(ii): the expiration of the stated period of time;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1418(2)(b)(iii): the occurrence of the contingency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1418(2)(b)(iv): (2)(a)(iv) the satisfaction of the provision described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1419 Deposit with state treasurer.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Assets of a dissolved nonprofit corporation that are to be transferred to a creditor, claimant, or member of the nonprofit corporation shall be reduced to cash and deposited with the state treasurer in accordance withUtah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1419(1): cannot be found; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1419(2): is not legally competent to receive the assets.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501 Authority to conduct affairs required.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(1)(a): A foreign nonprofit corporation may not conduct affairs in this state until its application for authority to conduct affairs is filed by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(1)(b): This part shall be applicable to foreign nonprofit corporations that conduct affairs governed by other statutes of this state only to the extent this part is not inconsistent with such other statutes.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2): (1); (2)(d) A foreign nonprofit corporation may not be considered to be conducting affairs in this state within the meaning of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(a): maintaining, defending, or settling in its own behalf any proceeding or dispute;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(b): holding meetings of its board of directors or members or carrying on other activities concerning internal corporate affairs;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(c): maintaining bank accounts;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(d): maintaining offices or agencies for the transfer, exchange, and registration of memberships or securities;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(e): (2)(d) maintaining trustees or depositaries with respect to the memberships or securities described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(f): selling through independent contractors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(g): soliciting or obtaining orders, if the orders require acceptance outside this state before they become contracts, whether by mail or through employees or agents or otherwise;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(h): creating, as borrower or lender, or acquiring indebtedness, mortgages, or other security interests in real or personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(i): securing or collecting debts in its own behalf or enforcing mortgages or security interests in property securing the debts;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(j): owning, without more, real or personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(k): conducting an isolated transaction that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(k)(i): completed within 30 days; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(k)(ii): not one in the course of repeated transactions of a like nature;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(l): conducting affairs in interstate commerce;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(m): granting funds;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(n): distributing information to its members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(2)(o): any other activity not considered to constitute conducting affairs in this state in the discretion of the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(3): (2) The list of activities in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(4): Nothing in this section shall limit or affect the right to subject a foreign nonprofit corporation that does not, or is not required to, have authority to conduct affairs in this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(4)(a): to the jurisdiction of the courts of this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(4)(b): to serve upon any foreign nonprofit corporation any process, notice, or demand required or permitted by law to be served upon a nonprofit corporation pursuant to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(4)(b)(i): any applicable provision of law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1501(4)(b)(ii): any applicable rules of civil procedure.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502 Consequences of conducting affairs without authority.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(1): A foreign nonprofit corporation, its successor, or anyone acting on its behalf, conducting affairs in this state without authority may not be permitted to maintain a proceeding in any court in this state until an application for authority to conduct affairs is filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(2): (2)(a)(i); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(2)(a): (2)(a)(i) A foreign nonprofit corporation or successor that conducts affairs in this state without authority shall be liable to this state in an amount equal to the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(2)(a)(i): all fees imposed by this chapter or prior law that would have been paid for all years or portions of years during which it conducted affairs in this state without authority; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(2)(a)(ii): (2)(a)(i) all penalties imposed by the division for failure to pay the fees described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(2)(b): (2) An application for authority to conduct affairs may not be filed until payment of the amounts due under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(3)(a): A court may stay a proceeding commenced by a foreign nonprofit corporation, its successor, or assignee until it determines whether the foreign nonprofit corporation, its successor, or assignee is required to file an application for authority to conduct affairs.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(3)(b): If the court determines that a foreign nonprofit corporation, its successor, or assignee is required to file an application for authority to conduct affairs, the court may further stay the proceeding until the required application for authority to conduct affairs has been filed with the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(4): (4)(a); (4)(a); (4); (4); (4); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(4)(a): A foreign nonprofit corporation that conducts affairs in this state without authority is subject to a civil penalty, payable to this state, of $100 for each day in which it transacts business in this state without authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(4)(b): (4)(a); (4)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(4)(c): The following are subject to a civil penalty payable to the state not exceeding $1,000:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(4)(c)(i): each officer of a foreign nonprofit corporation who authorizes, directs, or participates in the conducting of affairs in this state without authority; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(4)(c)(ii): each agent of a foreign nonprofit corporation who transacts business in this state on behalf of a foreign nonprofit corporation that is not authorized.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(4)(d): (4); (4) The division may make rules to carry out the provisions of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(4)(e): (4); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act If the division imposes a civil penalty under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(4)(e)(i): the foreign nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(4)(e)(ii): the representative of the foreign nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(5): (4); (5)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(5)(a): (4) The civil penalties set forth in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(5)(a)(i): in an appropriate court in Salt Lake County; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(5)(a)(ii): in any other county in this state in which the foreign nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(5)(a)(ii)(A): has a registered, principal, or business office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(5)(a)(ii)(B): has conducted affairs.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(5)(b): Upon a finding by the court that a foreign nonprofit corporation or any of its officers or agents have conducted affairs in this state in violation of this part, in addition to or instead of a civil penalty, the court shall issue an injunction restraining:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(5)(b)(i): the further conducting of affairs of the foreign nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(5)(b)(ii): the further exercise of any corporate rights and privileges in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(5)(c): (5)(b) Upon issuance of the injunction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(5)(c)(i): all civil penalties have been paid, plus any interest and court costs assessed by the court; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(5)(c)(ii): the foreign nonprofit corporation has otherwise complied with the provisions of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(6): (1); (2) Notwithstanding Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(6)(a): impair the validity of its corporate acts; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1502(6)(b): prevent the foreign nonprofit corporation from defending any proceeding in this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503 Application for authority to conduct affairs.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(1): 16-17-203 A foreign nonprofit corporation may apply for authority to conduct affairs in this state by delivering to the division for filing an application for authority to conduct affairs setting forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(1)(a): its corporate name and its assumed corporate name, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(1)(b): the name of the state or country under whose law it is incorporated;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(1)(c): its date of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(1)(d): its period of duration;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(1)(e): the street address of its principal office;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(1)(f): 16-17-203 the information required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(1)(g): the names and usual business addresses of its current directors and officers;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(1)(h): the date it commenced or expects to commence conducting affairs in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(1)(i): the additional information the division determines is necessary or appropriate to determine whether the application for authority to conduct affairs should be filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(2): With the completed application required by Subsection (1) the foreign nonprofit corporation shall deliver to the division for a certificate of existence, or a document of similar import that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(2)(a): authenticated by the division or other official having custody of corporate records in the state or country under whose law it is incorporated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(2)(b): dated within 90 days before the day on which the application for authority to conduct affairs is filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(3): The foreign nonprofit corporation shall include in the application for authority to conduct affairs, or in an accompanying document, written consent to appointment by its designated registered agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(4): 13-22-15; 13-22-15; 13-22-15 Beginning January 1, 2025, a foreign nonprofit corporation that is a charitable organization, unless exempted by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(5)(a): The division may permit a tribal nonprofit corporation to apply for authority to conduct affairs in this state in the same manner as a nonprofit corporation incorporated in another state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1503(5)(b): If a tribal nonprofit corporation elects to apply for authority to conduct affairs in this state, for purposes of this chapter, the tribal nonprofit corporation shall be treated in the same manner as a foreign nonprofit corporation incorporated under the laws of another state.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1504 Amended application for authority to conduct affairs.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1504(1): 16-17-203(1) A foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state shall deliver an amended application for authority to conduct affairs to the division for filing if the foreign nonprofit corporation changes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1504(1)(a): its corporate name;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1504(1)(b): its assumed corporate name;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1504(1)(c): the period of its duration;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1504(1)(d): the state or country of its incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1504(1)(e): 16-17-203(1) any of the information required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1504(2): 16-6a-1503 The requirements of Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1505 Effect of filing an application for authority to conduct affairs.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1505(1): Filing an application for authority to conduct affairs authorizes the foreign nonprofit corporation to conduct affairs in this state, subject to the right of the state to revoke the authority as provided in this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1505(2): A foreign nonprofit corporation that has authority to conduct affairs in this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1505(2)(a): has the same rights and privileges as, but no greater rights or privileges than, a domestic nonprofit corporation of like character; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1505(2)(b): except as otherwise provided by this chapter, is subject to the same duties, restrictions, penalties, and liabilities imposed on or later to be imposed on, a domestic nonprofit corporation of like character.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1505(3): This chapter does not authorize this state to regulate the organization or internal affairs of a foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506 Corporate name and assumed corporate name of foreign nonprofit corporation.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(1): (2); 16-6a-401; 16-6a-401; 16-6a-401
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(1)(a): (2); 16-6a-401; 16-6a-401 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(1)(b): 16-6a-401 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(2): (1); 16-6a-401(2) A foreign nonprofit corporation may obtain authority to conduct affairs in this state with a name that does not meet the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(2)(a)(i): a written consent to the foreign nonprofit corporation's use of the name, given and signed by the other person entitled to the use of the name; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(2)(a)(ii): a written undertaking by the other person, in a form satisfactory to the division, to change its name to a name that is distinguishable from the name of the applicant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(2)(b): a certified copy of a final judgment of a court of competent jurisdiction establishing the prior right of the foreign nonprofit corporation to use the requested name in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(3): A foreign nonprofit corporation may use in this state the name, including the fictitious name, of another domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation that is used or registered in this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(3)(a): the other corporation is incorporated or authorized to conduct affairs in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(3)(b): the foreign nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(3)(b)(i): has merged with the other corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(3)(b)(ii): has been formed by reorganization of the other corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(4): (1); (3); 16-6a-401; 16-6a-1504 If a foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state, whether under its corporate name or an assumed corporate name, changes its corporate name to one that does not satisfy the requirements of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(4)(a): may not conduct affairs in this state under the changed name;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(4)(b): shall use an assumed corporate name that does meet the requirements of this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1506(4)(c): 16-6a-1504 shall deliver to the division for filing an amended application for authority to conduct affairs pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507 Registered name of foreign nonprofit corporation.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(1): 16-6a-401; 16-6a-401
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(1)(a): 16-6a-401 A foreign nonprofit corporation may register its corporate name as provided in this section if the name would be available for use as a corporate name for a domestic nonprofit corporation under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(1)(b): 16-6a-401 If the foreign nonprofit corporation's corporate name would not be available for use as a corporate name for a domestic nonprofit corporation, the foreign nonprofit corporation may register its corporate name modified by the addition of any of the following words or abbreviations, if the modified name would be available for use under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(1)(b)(i): "corporation";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(1)(b)(ii): "incorporated";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(1)(b)(iii): "company";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(1)(b)(iv): "corp.";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(1)(b)(v): "inc."; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(1)(b)(vi): "co."
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(2): (1); 16-6a-401 A foreign nonprofit corporation registers its corporate name, or its corporate name with any addition permitted by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(2)(a): 16-6a-401 setting forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(2)(a)(i): its corporate name;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(2)(a)(ii): 16-6a-401 the name to be registered that shall meet the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(2)(a)(iii): the state or country and date of incorporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(2)(a)(iv): a brief description of the nature of the business in which it is engaged; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(2)(b): accompanied by a certificate of existence, or a document of similar import from the state or country of incorporation as evidence that the foreign nonprofit corporation is in existence or has authority to conduct affairs under the laws of the state or country in which it is organized.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(3)(a): A name is registered for the applicant upon the effective date of the application.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(3)(b): An initial registration is effective for one year.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(4): (1); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(4)(a): (1); (2) A foreign nonprofit corporation that has in effect a registration of its corporate name as permitted by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(4)(b): When filed, the renewal application for registration renews the registration for the year following filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(5)(a): A foreign nonprofit corporation that has in effect registration of its corporate name may:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(5)(a)(i): apply for authority to conduct affairs in this state under the registered name in accordance with the procedure set forth in this part; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(5)(a)(ii): assign the registration to another foreign nonprofit corporation by delivering to the division for filing an assignment of the registration that states:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(5)(a)(ii)(A): the registered name;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(5)(a)(ii)(B): the name of the assigning foreign nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(5)(a)(ii)(C): the name of the assignee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(5)(a)(ii)(D): the assignee's application for registration of the name.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(5)(b): (5)(a) The assignee's application for registration of the name required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(6)(a): A foreign nonprofit corporation that has in effect registration of its corporate name may terminate the registration at any time by delivering to the division for filing a statement of termination:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(6)(a)(i): setting forth the corporate name; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(6)(a)(ii): stating that the registration is terminated.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(6)(b): A registration automatically terminates upon the filing of an application for authority to conduct affairs in this state under the registered name.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1507(7): (1); 16-6a-403 The registration of a corporate name under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1510 Resignation of registered agent of foreign nonprofit corporation.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1510(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1510(1)(a): The registered agent of a foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state may resign the agency appointment by delivering to the division for filing a statement of resignation, that shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1510(1)(a)(i): be signed by the resigning registered agent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1510(1)(a)(ii): be accompanied by two exact or conformed copies of the statement of resignation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1510(1)(a)(iii): include a declaration that notice of the resignation has been given to the foreign nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1510(1)(b): The statement of resignation may include a statement that the registered office is also discontinued.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1510(2): After filing the statement of resignation, the division shall deliver:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1510(2)(a): one copy of the statement of resignation to the registered office of the foreign nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1510(2)(b): one copy of the statement of resignation to its principal office, if known.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1510(3): The agency appointment terminates, and the registered office discontinues if so provided, 31 days after the filing date of the statement of resignation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1511 Service on foreign nonprofit corporation.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1511(1): The registered agent of a foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state is the foreign corporation's agent for service of process, notice, or demand required or permitted by law to be served on the foreign nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1511(2): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1511(2)(a): If a foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state has no registered agent or if the registered agent cannot with reasonable diligence be served, the foreign nonprofit corporation may be served by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, addressed to the foreign nonprofit corporation at its principal office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1511(2)(b): (2) Service is perfected under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1511(2)(b)(i): the date the foreign nonprofit corporation receives the process, notice, or demand;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1511(2)(b)(ii): the date shown on the return receipt, if signed on behalf of the foreign nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1511(2)(b)(iii): five days after mailing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1511(3): This section does not prescribe the only means, or necessarily the required means, of serving a foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1512 Merger of foreign nonprofit corporations authorized to conduct affairs in this state.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1512(1): If two or more foreign nonprofit corporations authorized to conduct affairs in this state are a party to a statutory merger permitted by the laws of the state or country under the laws of which they are incorporated within 30 days after the merger becomes effective, the surviving nonprofit corporation shall file with the division a certificate of fact of merger certified by the proper officer of the state or country under the laws of which the statutory merger was effected.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1512(2): (1) It is not necessary for a foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state that is a party to a statutory merger described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513 Withdrawal of foreign nonprofit corporation.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(1): A foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state may not withdraw from this state until the foreign nonprofit corporation's application for withdrawal has been filed by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2): 16-6a-1514 A foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state may apply for withdrawal by delivering to the division for filing an application for withdrawal that states:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2)(a): the foreign nonprofit corporation's corporate name and assumed name, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2)(b): the name of the state or country under whose law the foreign nonprofit corporation is incorporated;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2)(c): 16-6a-1514
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2)(c)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2)(c)(i)(A): the address of the foreign nonprofit corporation's principal office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2)(c)(i)(B): if a principal office is not to be maintained, a statement that the foreign nonprofit corporation will not maintain a principal office; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2)(c)(ii): 16-6a-1514 if different from the address of the principal office or if no principal office is to be maintained, the address to which service of process may be mailed pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2)(d): that the foreign nonprofit corporation is not conducting affairs in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2)(e): that the foreign nonprofit corporation surrenders the foreign nonprofit corporation's authority to conduct affairs in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2)(f): whether the foreign nonprofit corporation's registered agent will continue to be authorized to accept service on the foreign nonprofit corporation's behalf in any proceeding based on a cause of action arising during the time the foreign nonprofit corporation was authorized to conduct affairs in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2)(g): the federal employer identification number of the foreign nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2)(h): any additional information that the division determines is necessary or appropriate to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2)(h)(i): determine whether the foreign nonprofit corporation is entitled to withdraw; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(2)(h)(ii): determine and assess any unpaid taxes, fees, and penalties payable by the foreign nonprofit corporation as prescribed by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(3): (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(3)(a): After receiving a foreign nonprofit corporation's application for withdrawal, the division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(3)(a)(i): provide the State Tax Commission with the foreign nonprofit corporation's federal employer identification number; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(3)(a)(ii): request that the State Tax Commission certify that the foreign nonprofit corporation is in good standing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(3)(b): The State Tax Commission shall certify that a foreign nonprofit corporation is in good standing if the foreign nonprofit corporation has paid all taxes, fees, and penalties the foreign nonprofit corporation owed to the State Tax Commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(3)(c): (3)(b) If a foreign nonprofit corporation is not in good standing as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(3)(c)(i): notify the division, stating that the foreign nonprofit corporation is not in good standing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(3)(c)(ii): notify the foreign nonprofit corporation, explaining in detail why the foreign nonprofit corporation is not in good standing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(4): (2); (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(4)(a): (2); (3)(b) The division shall approve a foreign nonprofit corporation's application for withdrawal if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(4)(a)(i): (2) the division determines that the application for withdrawal contains the information required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(4)(a)(ii): the division determines the information in the application is correct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(4)(a)(iii): (3)(b) the State Tax Commission certifies that the foreign nonprofit corporation is in good standing as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1513(4)(b): The division shall mail written notice of the withdrawal stating the effective date of the withdrawal to the foreign nonprofit corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514 Service on withdrawn foreign nonprofit corporation.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514(1): 16-6a-1513 A foreign nonprofit corporation that has withdrawn from this state pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514(1)(a): maintain a registered agent in this state to accept service on its behalf in any proceeding based on a cause of action arising during the time it was authorized to conduct affairs in this state, in which case the continued authority of the registered agent shall be specified in the application for withdrawal; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514(1)(b): be considered to have authorized service of process on it in connection with any cause of action by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514(1)(b)(i): the address of its principal office, if any:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514(1)(b)(i)(A): set forth in its application for withdrawal; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514(1)(b)(i)(B): as last changed by notice delivered to the division for filing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514(1)(b)(ii): the address for service of process:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514(1)(b)(ii)(A): that is stated in its application for withdrawal; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514(1)(b)(ii)(B): as last changed by notice delivered to the division for filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514(2): (1)(b) Service effected pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514(2)(a): the date the withdrawn foreign nonprofit corporation receives the process, notice, or demand;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514(2)(b): the date shown on the return receipt, if signed on behalf of the withdrawn foreign nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514(2)(c): five days after mailing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1514(3): (1) Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1515 Grounds for revocation.
--------------------------------------------------------
The division may commence a proceeding under SectionUtah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1515(1): the foreign nonprofit corporation does not deliver its annual report to the division when it is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1515(2): the foreign nonprofit corporation does not pay when they are due any taxes, fees, or penalties imposed by this chapter or other applicable laws of this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1515(3): the foreign nonprofit corporation is without a registered agent in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1515(4): the foreign nonprofit corporation does not inform the division by an appropriate filing, within 30 days of the change or resignation, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1515(4)(a): its registered agent has changed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1515(4)(b): its registered agent has resigned;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1515(5): an incorporator, director, officer, or agent of the foreign nonprofit corporation signs a document knowing it is false in any material respect with intent that the document be delivered to the division for filing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1515(6): the division receives a duly authenticated certificate from the division or other official having custody of corporate records in the state or country under whose law the foreign nonprofit corporation is incorporated stating that the foreign nonprofit corporation has dissolved or disappeared as the result of a merger.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516 Procedure for and effect of revocation.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(1): 16-6a-1515 If the division determines that one or more grounds exist under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(2): (1); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(2)(a): (1) If the foreign nonprofit corporation does not correct each ground for revocation or demonstrate to the reasonable satisfaction of the division that each ground determined by the division does not exist, within 60 days after mailing of the notice under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(2)(b): (2)(a) If a foreign nonprofit corporation's authority to conduct affairs in this state is revoked under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(2)(b)(i): mail a written notice of the revocation to the foreign nonprofit corporation stating the effective date of the revocation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(2)(b)(ii): mail a copy of the notice to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(2)(b)(ii)(A): the last registered agent of the foreign nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(2)(b)(ii)(B): if there is no registered agent of record, at least one officer of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(3): The authority of a foreign nonprofit corporation to conduct affairs in this state ceases on the date shown on the division's certificate revoking the foreign nonprofit corporation's certificate of authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(4): Revocation of a foreign nonprofit corporation's authority to conduct affairs in this state does not terminate the authority of the registered agent of the foreign nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(5): A notice mailed under this section shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(5)(a): mailed first class, postage prepaid; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(5)(b): addressed to the most current mailing address appearing on the records of the division for:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(5)(b)(i): the registered agent of the nonprofit corporation, if the notice is required to be mailed to the registered agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1516(5)(b)(ii): the officer of the nonprofit corporation that is mailed the notice if the notice is required to be mailed to an officer of the nonprofit corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1517 Appeal from revocation.
--------------------------------------------------------
If the division revokes the authority of a foreign nonprofit corporation to conduct affairs in this state, in accordance withUtah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1517(1): the foreign nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1517(2): the representative of the foreign nonprofit corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518 Domestication of foreign nonprofit corporations.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(1): (2); 16-6a-1003
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(1)(a): (2) Any foreign nonprofit corporation may become a domestic nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(1)(a)(i): (2) by delivering to the division for filing articles of domestication meeting the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(1)(a)(ii): if the board of directors of the foreign nonprofit corporation adopts the articles of domestication; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(1)(a)(iii): its members, if any, approve the domestication.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(1)(b): 16-6a-1003 The adoption and approval of the domestication shall be in accordance with the consent requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(2): 16-6a-105; 16-6a-202
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(2)(a): 16-6a-105; 16-6a-202 The articles of domestication shall meet the requirements applicable to articles of incorporation set forth in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(2)(a)(i): the articles of domestication need not name, or be signed by, the incorporators of the foreign nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(2)(a)(ii): any reference to the foreign nonprofit corporation's registered office, registered agent, or directors shall be to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(2)(a)(ii)(A): the registered office and agent in Utah; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(2)(a)(ii)(B): the directors in office at the time of filing the articles of domestication.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(2)(b): The articles of domestication shall set forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(2)(b)(i): the date on which and jurisdiction where the foreign nonprofit corporation was first formed, incorporated, or otherwise came into being;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(2)(b)(ii): the name of the foreign nonprofit corporation immediately prior to the filing of the articles of domestication;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(2)(b)(iii): any jurisdiction that constituted the seat, location of incorporation, principal place of business, or central administration of the foreign nonprofit corporation immediately prior to the filing of the articles of domestication; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(2)(b)(iv): a statement that the articles of domestication were:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(2)(b)(iv)(A): adopted by the foreign nonprofit corporation's board of directors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(2)(b)(iv)(B): approved by its members, if any.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(3)(a): Upon the filing of articles of domestication with the division, the foreign nonprofit corporation shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(3)(a)(i): be domesticated in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(3)(a)(ii): be subject to all of the provisions of this chapter after the date of filing the articles of domestication; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(3)(a)(iii): continue as if it had been incorporated under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(3)(b): Notwithstanding any other provisions of this chapter, the existence of the foreign nonprofit corporation shall be considered to have commenced on the date the foreign nonprofit corporation commenced its existence in the jurisdiction in which the foreign nonprofit corporation was first formed, incorporated, or otherwise came into being.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(4): The articles of domestication, upon filing with the division, shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(4)(a): become the articles of incorporation of the foreign nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(4)(b): be subject to amendments or restatement the same as any other articles of incorporation under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(5): The domestication of any foreign nonprofit corporation in this state may not be considered to affect any obligation or liability of the foreign nonprofit corporation incurred prior to its domestication.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1518(6): The filing of the articles of domestication may not affect the choice of law applicable to the foreign nonprofit corporation, except that from the date the articles of domestication are filed, the law of Utah, including the provisions of this chapter, shall apply to the foreign nonprofit corporation to the same extent as if the foreign nonprofit corporation had been incorporated as a domestic nonprofit corporation of this state on that date.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601 Corporate records.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(1): A nonprofit corporation shall keep as permanent records:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(1)(a): minutes of all meetings of its members and board of directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(1)(b): a record of all actions taken by the members or board of directors without a meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(1)(c): a record of all actions taken by a committee of the board of directors in place of the board of directors on behalf of the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(1)(d): a record of all waivers of notices of meetings of members and of the board of directors or any committee of the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(2): A nonprofit corporation shall maintain appropriate accounting records.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(3): A nonprofit corporation or its agent shall maintain a record of its members in a form that permits preparation of a list of the name and address of all members:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(3)(a): in alphabetical order, by class; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(3)(b): showing the number of votes each member is entitled to vote.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(4): A nonprofit corporation shall maintain its records in written form or in another form capable of conversion into written form within a reasonable time.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(5): 16-6a-1607; 16-6a-1606 A nonprofit corporation shall keep a copy of each of the following records at its principal office:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(5)(a): its articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(5)(b): its bylaws;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(5)(c): resolutions adopted by its board of directors relating to the characteristics, qualifications, rights, limitations, and obligations of members or any class or category of members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(5)(d): the minutes of all members' meetings for a period of three years;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(5)(e): records of all action taken by members without a meeting, for a period of three years;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(5)(f): all written communications to members generally as members for a period of three years;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(5)(g): a list of the names and business or home addresses of its current directors and officers;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(5)(h): 16-6a-1607 a copy of its most recent annual report delivered to the division under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1601(5)(i): 16-6a-1606 all financial statements prepared for periods ending during the last three years that a member could have requested under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602 Inspection of records by directors and members.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(1): 16-6a-1601 A director or member is entitled to inspect and copy any of the records of the nonprofit corporation described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(1)(a): during regular business hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(1)(b): at the nonprofit corporation's principal office; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(1)(c): if the director or member gives the nonprofit corporation written demand, at least five business days before the date on which the member wishes to inspect and copy the records.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(2): 16-6a-1601 In addition to the rights set forth in Subsection (1), a director or member is entitled to inspect and copy any of the other records of the nonprofit corporation described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(2)(a): during regular business hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(2)(b): at a reasonable location specified by the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(2)(c): at least five business days before the date on which the member wishes to inspect and copy the records, if the director or member:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(2)(c)(i): meets the requirements of Subsection (3); and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(2)(c)(ii): gives the nonprofit corporation written demand.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(3): A director or member may inspect and copy the records described in Subsections (1) and (2) only if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(3)(a): the demand is made:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(3)(a)(i): in good faith; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(3)(a)(ii): for a proper purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(3)(b): the director or member describes with reasonable particularity the purpose and the records the director or member desires to inspect; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(3)(c): the records are directly connected with the described purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(4): 16-6a-102 Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(4)(a): "member" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(4)(a)(i): a beneficial owner whose membership interest is held in a voting trust; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(4)(a)(ii): any other beneficial owner of a membership interest who establishes beneficial ownership; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(4)(b): "proper purpose" means a purpose reasonably related to the demanding member's or director's interest as a member or director.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(5): The right of inspection granted by this section may not be abolished or limited by the articles of incorporation or bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(6): 16-6a-710 This section does not affect:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(6)(a): 16-6a-710 the right of a director or member to inspect records under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(6)(b): the right of a member to inspect records to the same extent as any other litigant if the member is in litigation with the nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(6)(c): the power of a court, independent of this chapter, to compel the production of corporate records for examination.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1602(7): A director or member may not use any information obtained through the inspection or copying of records permitted by Subsection (2) for any purposes other than those set forth in a demand made under Subsection (3).


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1603 Scope of inspection right.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1603(1): A director's or member's agent or attorney has the same inspection and copying rights as the director or member.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1603(2): 16-6a-1602 The right to copy records under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1603(3): 16-6a-1606 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1603(4): 16-6a-1601(3); 16-6a-1601(3) The nonprofit corporation may comply with a director's or member's demand to inspect the record of members under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1603(4)(a): 16-6a-1601(3) complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1603(4)(b): is compiled no earlier than the date of the director's or member's demand.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604 Court-ordered inspection of corporate records.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(1): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; 16-6a-1602(1); 16-6a-1602(1); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(1)(a): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; 16-6a-1602(1); 16-6a-1602(1) A director or member may bring a petition in a court with jurisdiction under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(1)(a)(i): 16-6a-1602(1) the nonprofit corporation refuses to allow a director or member, or the director's or member's agent or attorney, to inspect or copy any records that the director or member is entitled to inspect or copy under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(1)(a)(ii): 16-6a-1602(1) the director or member complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(1)(b): (1)(a) If a petition is filed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(2): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; 16-6a-1602(2); (3); 16-6a-1602(2); (3); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(2)(a): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; 16-6a-1602(2); (3); 16-6a-1602(2); (3) A director or member may bring a petition in a court with jurisdiction under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(2)(a)(i): 16-6a-1602(2); (3) the nonprofit corporation refuses to allow a director or member, or the director's or member's agent or attorney, to inspect or copy any records that the director or member is entitled to inspect or copy pursuant to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(2)(a)(ii): 16-6a-1602(2); (3) the director or member complies with Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(2)(b): (2)(a) If a petition is brought under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(3): (1); (2); (2) If a court orders inspection or copying of the records demanded under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(3)(a): the court shall also order the nonprofit corporation to pay the director's or member's costs, including reasonable counsel fees, incurred to obtain the order;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(3)(b): the court may order the nonprofit corporation to pay the director or member for any damages the member incurred;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(3)(c): (2) if inspection or copying is ordered pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(3)(d): the court may grant the director or member any other remedy provided by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1604(4): If a court orders inspection or copying of records demanded, the court may impose reasonable restrictions on the use or distribution of the records by the demanding director or member.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1605 Limitations on use of membership list.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1605(1): Without consent of the board of directors, a membership list or any part of a membership list may not be obtained or used by any person for any purpose unrelated to a member's interest as a member.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1605(2): (1) Without limiting the generality of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1605(2)(a): used to solicit money or property unless the money or property will be used solely to solicit the votes of the members in an election to be held by the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1605(2)(b): used for any commercial purpose; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1605(2)(c): sold to or purchased by any person.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1606 Financial statements.
------------------------------------------------------
By no later than 15 days after the day on which the nonprofit corporation receives a written request of any member, a nonprofit corporation shall mail to the member the following that show in reasonable detail the assets and liabilities and results of the operations of the nonprofit corporation:Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1606(1): the nonprofit corporation's most recent annual financial statements, if any; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1606(2): the nonprofit corporation's most recently published financial statements, if any.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607 Annual report for division.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(1): 16-17-203(1) Each domestic nonprofit corporation, and each foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state, shall deliver to the division for filing an annual report on a form provided by the division that sets forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(1)(a)(i): the corporate name of the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(1)(a)(ii): any assumed corporate name of the foreign nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(1)(b): the jurisdiction under whose law it is incorporated;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(1)(c): 16-17-203(1) the information required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(1)(d): the street address of its principal office, wherever located; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(1)(e): the names and addresses of its directors and principal officers.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(2): The division shall deliver a copy of the prescribed form of annual report to each domestic nonprofit corporation and each foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(3): Information in the annual report shall be current as of the date the annual report is executed on behalf of the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(4): (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(4)(a): The annual report of a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation shall be delivered annually to the division no later than 60 days past the date the report was mailed by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(4)(b): (4) Proof to the satisfaction of the division that the nonprofit corporation has mailed an annual report form is considered in compliance with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(5): (5)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(5)(a): If an annual report contains the information required by this section, the division shall file it.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(5)(b): If an annual report does not contain the information required by this section, the division shall promptly notify the reporting domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation in writing and return the annual report to it for correction.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(5)(c): (5)(b) If an annual report that is rejected under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(6): The fact that an individual's name is signed on an annual report form is prima facie evidence for division purposes that the individual is authorized to certify the report on behalf of the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(7): The annual report form provided by the division may be designed to provide a simplified certification by the nonprofit corporation if no changes have been made in the required information from the last preceding report filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1607(8): A domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation may, but may not be required to, deliver to the division for filing an amendment to its annual report reflecting any change in the information contained in its annual report as last amended.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1608 Statement of person named as director or officer.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any person named as a director or officer of a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation in an annual report or other document on file with the division may, if that person does not hold the named position, deliver to the division for filing a statement setting forth:Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1608(1): that person's name;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1608(2): the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation's name;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1608(3): information sufficient to identify the report or other document in which the person is named as a director or officer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1608(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1608(4)(a): the date on which the person ceased to be a director or officer of the domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1608(4)(b): a statement that the person did not hold the position for which the person was named in the corporate report or other document.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609 Interrogatories by division.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1): (1)(a)(i); (1); (1)(e)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(a): (1)(a)(i) The division may give interrogatories reasonably necessary to ascertain whether a nonprofit corporation has complied with the provisions of this chapter applicable to the nonprofit corporation to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(a)(i): any domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation subject to the provisions of this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(a)(ii): (1)(a)(i) to any officer or director of a nonprofit corporation described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(b): (1) The interrogatories described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(b)(i): 30 days after the mailing of the interrogatories; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(b)(ii): additional time as fixed by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(c): The answers to the interrogatories shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(c)(i): full and complete; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(c)(ii): made in writing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(d)(i): If the interrogatories are directed to an individual, the interrogatories shall be answered by the individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(d)(ii): If directed to a nonprofit corporation, the interrogatories shall be answered by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(d)(ii)(A): the chair of the board of directors of the nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(d)(ii)(B): all of the nonprofit corporation's directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(d)(ii)(C): one of the nonprofit corporation's officers; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(d)(ii)(D): any other person authorized to answer the interrogatories as the nonprofit corporation's agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(e): (1)(e)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(e)(i): The division need not file any document to which the interrogatories relate until the interrogatories are answered as provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(e)(ii): (1)(e)(i) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(1)(f): The division shall certify to the attorney general, for such action as the attorney general considers appropriate, all interrogatories and answers to interrogatories that disclose a violation of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(2): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(2)(a): (1) Interrogatories given by the division under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(2)(b): The division may not disclose any facts or information obtained from the interrogatories or answers to the interrogatories, except:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(2)(b)(i): as the official duties of the division may require the facts or information to be made public; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(2)(b)(ii): in the event the interrogatories or the answers to the interrogatories are required for evidence in any criminal proceedings or in any other action by this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(3): (1); (1) Each domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation that knowingly fails or refuses to answer truthfully and fully, within the time prescribed by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(4): (1); (1) Each officer and director of a domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation who knowingly fails or refuses to answer truthfully and fully, within the time prescribed by Subsection
