Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1609(5): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration The attorney general may enforce this section by bringing an action in a court with jurisdiction under


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1610 Scope of a member's right to inspect or receive copies.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Notwithstanding the other provisions of this part, unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, a right of a member to inspect or receive information from a nonprofit corporation that is created by this part applies only to a voting member of the nonprofit corporation.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1701 Application to existing domestic nonprofit corporations -- Reports of domestic and foreign nonprofit corporation.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1701(1): 16-6a-1704; Title 16, Chapter 7, Corporations Sole; (1)(a); (b); (c) Except as otherwise provided in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1701(2)(b): from April 30, 2001, shall have all the rights and privileges and shall be subject to all the remedies, restrictions, liabilities, and duties prescribed in this chapter except as otherwise specifically provided in this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1702 Application to foreign nonprofit corporations.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1702(1): A foreign nonprofit corporation authorized to conduct affairs in this state on April 30, 2001, is subject to this chapter, but is not required to obtain a new certificate of authority to conduct affairs under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1702(2): A foreign nonprofit corporation that is qualified to do business in this state under the provisions of
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1702(3): This chapter shall apply to all foreign nonprofit corporations sole qualified to do business in this state with respect to mergers and consolidations.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1703(2): Title 3, Chapter 1, General Provisions Relating to Agricultural Cooperative Associations domestic or foreign nonprofit corporations governed by

Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1704(5)(a)(iii): existing on April 30, 2001; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1704(5)(b): the articles of incorporation of the nonprofit corporation states on April 30, 2001, that the nonprofit corporation has members.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-6a-1705 Severability clause.
-----------------------------------------------------
If any provision of this act, or the application of any provision to any person or circumstance, is held invalid, the remainder of this act is given effect without the invalid provision or application.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 16 - Chapter 7 - Corporations Sole
**************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-1 Formation -- Purposes.
---------------------------------------------------
Corporations sole may be formed for acquiring, holding or disposing of church or religious society property for the benefit of religion, for works of charity and for public worship, in the manner hereinafter provided.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-2 Articles of incorporation -- Execution -- Filing.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any person who is the archbishop, bishop, president, trustee in trust, president of stake, president of congregation, overseer, presiding elder, or clergyman of any church or religious society who has been duly chosen, elected, or appointed in conformity with the constitution, canons, rites, regulations, or discipline of such church or religious society, and in whom is vested the legal title to its property, may make and subscribe articles of incorporation, acknowledge the same before some officer authorized to take acknowledgments, and file the original articles with the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code; he shall retain a copy of these articles in his possession.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-3 Contents of articles of incorporation.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
The articles of incorporation shall specify:Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-3(1): The name of the corporation by which it shall be known.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-3(2): The object of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-3(3): The estimated value of the property at the time of the making of articles of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-3(4): The title of the person making such articles.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-4 Certified copies of articles as evidence.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
The articles of incorporation or a certified copy of those filed and recorded with the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code shall be evidence of the existence of such corporation.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-5 Amendments of articles of incorporation.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-5(1): A corporation sole formed under this chapter may alter or amend its articles of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-5(2): (1); (2)(b)(i); (2)(b) An amendment described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-5(2)(a): be made by the corporation sole;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-5(2)(b): (2)(b)(i) be executed by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-5(2)(b)(i): the person who executed the original articles of incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-5(2)(b)(ii): (2)(b)(i) the successor in office to the person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-5(2)(c): (2)(b) specify the name, title, and street address of the person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-5(2)(d): be filed in the same manner as is provided for the filing of the original articles.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-5(3): 16-7-15(1) A corporation sole altering or amending its articles of incorporation after May 3, 2004, shall comply with Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-6 Powers of corporations sole.
---------------------------------------------------------
Upon making and filing articles of incorporation as herein provided the person subscribing the same and the person's successor in office, by the name or title specified in the articles, shall thereafter be deemed and is hereby created a body politic and a corporation sole, with perpetual succession, and shall have power:Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-6(1): To acquire and possess, by donation, gift, bequest, devise or purchase, and to hold and maintain, property, real, personal and mixed; and to grant, sell, convey, rent or otherwise dispose of the same as may be necessary to carry on or promote the objects of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-6(2): To borrow money and to give written obligations therefor, and to secure the payment thereof by mortgage or other lien upon real or personal property, when necessary to promote such objects.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-6(3): To contract and be contracted with.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-6(4): To sue and be sued.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-6(5): To plead and be impleaded in all courts of justice.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-6(6): To have and use a common seal by which all deeds and acts of such corporation may be authenticated.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-7 Right to act without authorization from members -- Sale of property.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any corporation sole created under this chapter, and any such archbishop, bishop, president, trustee in trust, president of stake, president of congregation, overseer, presiding elder or clergyman of the state of Utah, who holds the title to trust property for the use and benefit of any church or religious society and who is not so incorporated, unless the articles of incorporation or deed under which such corporation or individual trustee holds such property provides otherwise, shall have power without any authority or authorization from the members of such church or religious society to mortgage, exchange, sell and convey the same; and any such corporation sole, or individual trustee residing within this state may hold title to property, real or personal, which is situated in any other state or jurisdiction; which holding shall be subject to the same conditions, limitations, powers and rights and with the same trusts, duties and obligations in regard to the property that like property is held for such purposes in this state.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-8 Execution of corporate instruments -- Authority of agents -- Revocation of authority.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-8(1): All deeds and other instruments of writing shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-8(1)(a): made in the name of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-8(1)(b): signed by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-8(1)(b)(i): the person representing the corporation in the official capacity designated in the articles of incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-8(1)(b)(ii): a duly authorized agent or agents designated and named in a certificate filed by the corporation with the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-8(2): (1)(b)(ii); (2)(a) The authority of an agent or agents designated pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-8(2)(a): the person who executed the original articles of incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-8(2)(b): (2)(a) the successor in office to the person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-8(3): A corporation sole designating an agent or agents to sign deeds and instruments of writing by certificate may revoke such authority by filing a notice of revocation of authority with the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-9 Succession in event of death, resignation, or removal of incumbent.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-9(1): In the event of the death or resignation of any such archbishop, bishop, president, trustee in trust, president of stake, president of congregation, overseer, presiding elder or clergyman, being at the time a corporation sole, or of his removal from office by the person or body having authority to remove him, his successor in office, as such corporation sole, shall be vested with the title to any and all property held by his predecessor as such corporation sole, with like power and authority over the same and subject to all the legal liabilities and obligations with reference thereto.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-9(2): (1) A successor described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-10 Death of bishop, trustee, not incorporated -- Succession to property.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In case of the death, resignation or removal of any such archbishop, bishop, president, trustee in trust, president of stake, president of congregation, overseer, presiding elder or clergyman who at the time of his death, resignation or removal was holding the title to trust property for the use or benefit of any church or religious society, and was not incorporated as a corporation sole, the title to any and all such property held by him, of every nature and kind, does not revert to the grantor nor vest in the heirs of such deceased person, but shall be deemed to be in abeyance after such death, resignation or removal until his successor is duly appointed to fill such vacancy, and upon the appointment of such successor the title to all the property held by his predecessor shall at once, without any other act or deed, vest in the person appointed to fill such vacancy.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-11 Fees for filing documents and issuing certificates.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The division shall charge and collect a fee determined by it pursuant to SectionUtah Code Annotated § 16-7-11(1): filing articles of incorporation of a corporation sole and issuing a certificate of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-11(2): filing articles of amendment and issuing a certificate of amendment;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-11(3): issuing each additional certificate of incorporation or amendment;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-11(4): filing a certificate of authorized agent and issuing the agent's certificate;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-11(5): filing a revocation of authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-11(6): furnishing a certified copy of any document, instrument, or paper relating to a corporation sole and affixing its seal;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-11(7): issuing a certificate of dissolution; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-11(8): issuing a certificate of merger or consolidation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-12 Dissolution of corporation sole.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-12(1): A corporation sole may be dissolved and its affairs wound up voluntarily by filing with the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code articles of dissolution, fully executed and signed under penalty of perjury, by the chief officer of the corporation.  If any corporation sole ceases to have assets, has failed to function, or desires to terminate its existence, the articles of dissolution may be filed by any officer of the corporation authorized to administer the affairs and property of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-12(2): An original and a copy of the articles of dissolution shall be submitted to the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code.  If it conforms to law, the division shall file it and issue a certificate of dissolution.  After the issuance of this certificate, the corporation shall cease to carry on business, except for the purpose of adjusting and winding up its affairs.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-12(3): 16-7-1 The articles of dissolution shall set forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-12(3)(a): the name of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-12(3)(b): the reason for its dissolution or winding up;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-12(3)(c): that dissolution of the corporation has been duly authorized by the organization governed by the corporation sole;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-12(3)(d): the names and addresses of the persons who are to supervise the winding up of the affairs of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-12(3)(e): that all debts, obligations, and liabilities of the corporation sole have been paid and discharged or that adequate provision has been made therefor;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-12(3)(f): 16-7-1 that all the remaining property and assets of the corporation sole have been transferred, conveyed, or distributed in accordance with the purposes of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-12(3)(g): that there are no suits pending against the corporation sole in any court, or that adequate provision has been made for the satisfaction of any judgment, order, or decree which may be entered against it in any pending suit.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-12(4): 16-7-15(1); 16-6a-1411; 16-6a-1412; 16-6a-1413 The Division of Corporations and Commercial Code may administratively dissolve a corporation sole that does not comply with Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-13 Merger and consolidation.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-13(1): As long as the surviving corporation qualifies for tax exempt status under Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3), any corporation organized under this chapter may merge with one or more domestic or foreign corporations organized or authorized to do business in this state under this title, or with one or more nonprofit domestic or foreign corporations organized or authorized to do business in this state under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-13(2): 16-7-2; Title 16, Chapter 6a, Utah Revised Nonprofit Corporation Act; 16-6a-1101; 16-6a-1102
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-13(2)(a): 16-7-2 Articles of merger or consolidation shall be adopted by the appropriate incorporator or the successor to an incorporator as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-13(2)(b): Title 16, Chapter 6a, Utah Revised Nonprofit Corporation Act; 16-6a-1101; 16-6a-1102 The articles of merger or consolidation shall be adopted by any merging or consolidating corporation organized under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-13(3): 16-6a-1104 The effect of a merger or consolidation under this section is the same as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-14 Restatement of articles of incorporation.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-14(1): 16-6a-1006 A corporation sole organized under this chapter may restate its articles of incorporation in the same manner allowed nonprofit corporations under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-14(2): 16-7-2
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-14(2)(a): 16-7-2 The restated articles shall be adopted on behalf of the corporation by the appropriate incorporator or the successor to an incorporator as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-14(2)(b): If there is no such incorporator or successor, the articles shall be signed by the officer or official authorized to administer the affairs and property of the corporation according to the practices and procedures of the church, denomination, or religious society.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-14(2)(c): The restated articles described in this section shall specify the name, title, and street address of the person executing the restated articles.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-14(3): This chapter does not require the restated articles described in this section to specify a value of the property of the corporation sole.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-14(4): 16-7-15(1) A corporation sole restating its articles of incorporation after May 3, 2004, shall comply with Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15 Official representative -- Registered office -- Registered agent.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(1): (1)(a); (2); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(1)(a): A corporation sole altering, amending, or restating its articles of incorporation on or after May 3, 2004 shall continuously maintain with the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code the name, title, and Utah street address of an official representative for the corporation sole.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(1)(b): (1)(a) The official representative described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(1)(b)(i): the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(1)(b)(ii): any other state or federal authority, agency, or official.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(1)(c): (2); (1) If a corporation sole appoints a registered agent pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(2): Title 16, Chapter 17, Model Registered Agents Act; Title 16, Chapter 17, Model Registered Agents Act; Title 16, Chapter 17, Model Registered Agents Act; (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(2)(a): Title 16, Chapter 17, Model Registered Agents Act A corporation sole formed under this chapter may maintain a registered office and registered agent in Utah by complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(2)(b): Title 16, Chapter 17, Model Registered Agents Act A corporation sole maintaining registered agent may change the registered agent by complying with the requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(2)(c): Title 16, Chapter 17, Model Registered Agents Act A registered agent of a corporation sole may resign by complying with the requirements imposed on a registered agent under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(2)(d): (2) A registered agent described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(2)(d)(i): process;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(2)(d)(ii): notice;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(2)(d)(iii): demand; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-15(2)(d)(iv): any type required or permitted by law to be served on the corporation sole.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-7-16 Prohibition on formation of corporation sole after May 3, 2004.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, a corporation sole may not be formed or incorporated under this chapter after May 3, 2004.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 16 - Chapter 10a - Utah Revised Business Corporation Act
************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-101 Short title.
---------------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the Utah Revised Business Corporation Act.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(1)(a): "Address" means a location where mail can be delivered by the United States Postal Service.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(1)(b): "Address" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(1)(b)(i): a post office box number;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(1)(b)(ii): a rural free delivery route number; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(1)(b)(iii): a  street name and number.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(2): "Affiliate" means a person that directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control with, the person specified.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(3): 16-10a-1506 "Assumed corporate name" means a name assumed for use in this state by a foreign corporation pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(4): (4)(a); (b) "Articles of incorporation" include:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(4)(a): amended and restated articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(4)(b): articles of merger; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(4)(c): (4)(a); (b) a document of a similar import to those described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(5): "Authorized shares" means the shares of all classes a domestic or foreign corporation is authorized to issue.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(6): "Bylaws" includes amended bylaws and restated bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(7): "Cash" and "money" are used interchangeably in this chapter and mean:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(7)(a): legal tender;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(7)(b): a negotiable instrument; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(7)(c): a cash equivalent readily convertible into legal tender.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(8): "Conspicuous" means so written that a reasonable person against whom the writing is to operate should have noticed it, including printing or typing in:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(8)(a): italics;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(8)(b): boldface;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(8)(c): contrasting color;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(8)(d): capitals; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(8)(e): underlining.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(9): "Control" or a "controlling interest" means the direct or indirect possession of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of an entity, whether through the ownership of voting shares, by contract, or otherwise.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(10): "Corporate name" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(10)(a): the name of a domestic corporation or a domestic nonprofit corporation as stated in its articles of incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(10)(b): the name of a foreign corporation or a foreign nonprofit corporation as stated in its articles of incorporation or document of similar import.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(11): "Corporation" or "domestic corporation" means a corporation for profit that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(11)(a): is not a foreign corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(11)(b): is incorporated under or subject to this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(12): 16-10a-103 "Deliver" includes delivery by mail or another means of transmission authorized by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(13): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(13)(a): "Distribution" means the following by a corporation to or for the benefit of its shareholders in respect of any of the corporation's shares:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(13)(a)(i): a direct or indirect transfer of money or other property, other than a corporation's own shares; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(13)(a)(ii): incurrence of indebtedness by the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(13)(b): A distribution may be in the form of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(13)(b)(i): a declaration or payment of a dividend;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(13)(b)(ii): a purchase, redemption, or other acquisition of shares;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(13)(b)(iii): distribution of indebtedness; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(13)(b)(iv): another form.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(14): "Division" means the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(15): 16-10a-123 "Effective date," when referring to a document filed by the division, means the time and date determined in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(16): 16-10a-103 "Effective date of notice" means the date notice is effective as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(17): "Electronic transmission" or "electronically transmitted" means a process of communication not directly involving the physical transfer of paper that is suitable for the receipt, retention, retrieval, and reproduction of information by the recipient, whether by e-mail, facsimile, or otherwise.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(18): "Employee" includes an officer but not a director, unless the director accepts a duty that makes that director also an employee.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(19): "Entity" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(19)(a): a domestic and foreign corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(19)(b): a nonprofit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(19)(c): a limited liability company;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(19)(d): a profit or nonprofit unincorporated association;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(19)(e): a business trust;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(19)(f): an estate;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(19)(g): a partnership;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(19)(h): a trust;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(19)(i): two or more persons having a joint or common economic interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(19)(j): a state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(19)(k): the United States; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(19)(l): a foreign government.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(20): "Foreign corporation" means a corporation for profit incorporated under a law other than the law of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(21): "Governmental subdivision" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(21)(a): county;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(21)(b): municipality; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(21)(c): another type of governmental subdivision authorized by the laws of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(22): "Individual" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(22)(a): a natural person;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(22)(b): the estate of an incompetent individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(22)(c): the estate of a deceased individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(23): "Mail," "mailed," or "mailing" means deposit, deposited, or depositing in the United States mail, properly addressed, first class postage prepaid, and includes registered or certified mail for which the proper fee is paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(24): 16-10a-103 "Notice" is as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(25): "Principal office" means the office, in or out of this state, designated by a domestic or foreign corporation as its principal office in the most recent document on file with the division providing the information, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(25)(a): an annual report;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(25)(b): an application for a certificate of authority; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(25)(c): a notice of change of principal office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(26): "Proceeding" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(26)(a): a civil suit;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(26)(b): arbitration or mediation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(26)(c): a criminal, administrative, or investigatory action.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(27): 16-10a-853; (27)(b)(i); (ii) "Qualified shares" means, with respect to a director's conflicting interest transaction pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(27)(a): that, to the knowledge, before the vote, of the secretary, other officer, or agent of the corporation authorized to tabulate votes, is beneficially owned; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(27)(b): (27)(b)(i); (ii) the voting of which is controlled, by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(27)(b)(i): a director who has a conflicting interest respecting the transaction;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(27)(b)(ii): a related person of that director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(27)(b)(iii): (27)(b)(i); (ii) a person referred to in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(28): "Receive," when used in reference to receipt of a writing or other document by a domestic or foreign corporation, means the writing or other document is actually received by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(28)(a): the corporation at its:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(28)(a)(i): registered office in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(28)(a)(ii): principal office;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(28)(b): the secretary of the corporation, wherever the secretary is found; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(28)(c): another person authorized by the bylaws or the board of directors to receive the writing or other document, wherever that person is found.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(29): Part 6, Shares and Distributions; Part 7, Shareholders; (29)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(29)(a): Part 6, Shares and Distributions; Part 7, Shareholders "Record date" means the date established under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(29)(b): (29)(a) The determination under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(30): "Registered office" means the office within this state designated by a domestic or foreign corporation as its registered office in the most recent document on file with the division providing that information, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(30)(a): articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(30)(b): an application for a certificate of authority; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(30)(c): a notice of change of registered office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(31): (31) "Related person" of a director means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(31)(a): the spouse of the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(31)(b): a child, grandchild, sibling, or parent of the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(31)(c): the spouse of a child, grandchild, sibling, or parent of the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(31)(d): an individual having the same home as the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(31)(e): (31) a trust or estate of which the director or any other individual specified in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(31)(f): a trust, estate, incompetent, conservatee, or minor of which the director is a fiduciary.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(32): 16-10a-830(3); 16-10a-830 "Secretary" means the corporate officer to whom the bylaws or the board of directors delegates responsibility under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(32)(a): 16-10a-830 the preparation and maintenance of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(32)(a)(i): minutes of the meetings of the board of directors and of the shareholders; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(32)(a)(ii): 16-10a-830 the other records and information required to be kept by the corporation by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(32)(b): authenticating records of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(33): " Share" means the unit into which the proprietary interests in a corporation are divided.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(34): 16-10a-723
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(34)(a): 16-10a-723 "Shareholder" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(34)(a)(i): the person in whose name a share is registered in the records of a corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(34)(a)(ii): 16-10a-723 the beneficial owner of a share to the extent recognized pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(34)(b): For purposes of this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(34)(b)(i): the following, identified as a shareholder in a corporation's current record of shareholders, constitute one shareholder:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(34)(b)(i)(A): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(34)(b)(i)(A)(I): three or fewer coowners; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(34)(b)(i)(A)(II): in the case of more than three coowners, each coowner in excess of the first three is counted as a separate shareholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(34)(b)(i)(B): a corporation, limited liability company, partnership, trust, estate, or other entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(34)(b)(i)(C): the trustees, guardians, custodians, or other fiduciaries of a single trust, estate, or account;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(34)(b)(ii): shareholdings registered in substantially similar names constitute one shareholder if it is reasonable to believe that the names represent the same person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(34)(b)(iii): if the record of a shareholder is not maintained in accordance with accepted practice, an additional person who would be identified as an owner on that record if it had been maintained in accordance with accepted practice shall be included as a holder of record.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(35): "Subscriber" means a person who subscribes for shares in a corporation, whether before or after incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(36): "Tribe" means a tribe, band, nation, pueblo, or other organized group or community of Indians, including an Alaska Native village, that is legally recognized as eligible for and is consistent with a special program, service, or entitlement provided by the United States to Indians because of their status as Indians.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(37): "Tribal corporation" means a corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(37)(a): incorporated under the law of a tribe; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(37)(b): that is at least 51% owned or controlled by the tribe.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(38): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(38)(a): "Voting group" means all shares of one or more classes or series that under the articles of incorporation or this chapter are entitled to vote and be counted together collectively on a matter at a meeting of shareholders.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-102(38)(b): All shares entitled by the articles of incorporation or this chapter to vote generally on the matter are for that purpose a single voting group.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103 Notice.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(1)(a): Notice given under this chapter shall be in writing unless oral notice is reasonable under the circumstances.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(1)(b): Notice by electronic transmission is written notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(2): (2)(a); 45-1-101; (2)(b)(i); (ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(2)(a): Subject to compliance with any requirement that notice be in writing, notice may be communicated in person, by telephone, by any form of electronic transmission, or by mail or private carrier.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(2)(b): (2)(a); 45-1-101; (2)(b)(i); (ii) If the forms of personal notice listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(2)(b)(i): 45-1-101
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(2)(b)(i)(A): by a newspaper of general circulation in the county, or similar subdivision, in which the corporation's principal office is located; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(2)(b)(i)(B): 45-1-101 by publication in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(2)(b)(ii): by radio, television, or other form of public broadcast communication in the county or subdivision; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(2)(b)(iii): (2)(b)(i); (ii) if the corporation has no office in this state, in the manner allowed by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(3): (3)(a)(ii); (3)(b)(i); (3)(b); (3)(a); 16-10a-705(5)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(3)(a): Written notice by a domestic or foreign corporation to its shareholders or directors, if in a comprehensible form, is effective as to each shareholder or director:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(3)(a)(i): when mailed, if addressed to the shareholder's or director's address shown in the corporation's current record of the shareholder or director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(3)(a)(ii): when electronically transmitted to the shareholder or director, in a manner and to an address provided by the shareholder or director in an unrevoked consent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(3)(b): (3)(a)(ii); (3)(b)(i) Consent under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(3)(b)(i): the corporation is unable to deliver by electronic transmission two consecutive notices transmitted by the corporation based on that consent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(3)(b)(ii): (3)(b)(i) the corporation's inability to deliver notice by electronic transmission under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(3)(b)(ii)(A): corporation's secretary;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(3)(b)(ii)(B): an assistant secretary or transfer agent of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(3)(b)(ii)(C): any other person responsible for providing notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(3)(c): (3)(b); (3)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(3)(d): 16-10a-705(5) Delivery of a notice to shareholders may be excused in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(4): Written notice to a domestic or foreign corporation authorized to transact business in this state may be addressed to the corporation's:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(4)(a): registered agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(4)(b): secretary at its principal office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(5): (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(5)(a): when received;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(5)(b): five days after it is mailed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(5)(c): on the date shown on the return receipt if sent by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, and the receipt is signed by or on behalf of the addressee.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(6): Oral notice is effective when communicated if communicated in a comprehensible manner.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(7): Notice by publication is effective on the date of first publication.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(8)(a): If this chapter prescribes notice requirements for particular circumstances, those requirements govern.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-103(8)(b): If articles of incorporation or bylaws prescribe notice requirements, not inconsistent with this section or other provisions of this chapter, those requirements govern.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-104 Powers of the division.
--------------------------------------------------------
The division has the power reasonably necessary to perform the duties required of the division under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120 Filing requirements.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(1): A document shall satisfy the requirements of this section, and of any other section of this chapter that adds to or varies these requirements, to be entitled to filing by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(2): This chapter must require or permit filing the document with the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(3)(a): The document shall contain the information required by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(3)(b): (3)(a) A document may contain information in addition to that required in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(4): The document shall be typewritten or machine printed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(5)(a): The document shall be in the English language.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(5)(b): A corporate name need not be in English if written in English letters, Arabic or Roman numerals.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(5)(c): The certificate of existence required of foreign corporations need not be in English if accompanied by a reasonably authenticated English translation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(6): The document shall be executed, or shall be a true copy made by photographic, xerographic, electronic, or other process that provides similar copy accuracy of a document that has been executed:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(6)(a): by the chairman of the board of directors of a domestic or foreign corporation, by all of its directors, or by one of its officers;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(6)(b): if directors have not been selected or the corporation has not been formed, by an incorporator;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(6)(c): if the corporation is in the hands of a receiver, trustee, or other court-appointed fiduciary, by that fiduciary;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(6)(d): if the document is that of a registered agent, by the registered agent, if the person is an individual, or by a person authorized by the registered agent to execute the document, if the registered agent is an entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(6)(e): by an attorney in fact if the corporation retains the power of attorney with the corporation's records.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(7): The document shall state beneath or opposite the signature of the person executing the document the signer's name and the capacity in which the document is signed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(8): The document may, but need not, contain:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(8)(a): the corporate seal;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(8)(b): an attestation by the secretary or an assistant secretary; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(8)(c): an acknowledgment, verification, or proof.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(9): (8) The signature of each person signing the document, whether or not the document contains an acknowledgment, verification, or proof permitted by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(10): 16-10a-121 If the division has prescribed a mandatory form or cover sheet for the document under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(11): 16-10a-1510 The document shall be delivered to the division for filing and shall be accompanied by one exact or conformed copy, except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-120(12): 16-10a-1510 Except with respect to a filing pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-121 Forms.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-121(1): The division may prescribe, and if so prescribed shall furnish on request, forms or cover sheets for documents required or permitted to be filed by this chapter as the division may determine to be appropriate.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-121(2): However:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-121(2)(a): the use of any forms or cover sheets is not mandatory unless the division specifically requires their use; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-121(2)(b): no requirement that a form or cover sheet be used precludes in any way the inclusion in any document of any item which is not prohibited to be included by this chapter, nor does it require the inclusion with the filed document of any item which is not otherwise required by this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-122 Fees.
--------------------------------------
Unless otherwise provided by statute, the division shall charge and collect fees for services as provided in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-123 Effective time and date of filed documents.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-123(1): (2); 16-10a-124(4); 16-10a-125(2) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-123(2): Unless otherwise provided in this chapter, a document, other than an application for a reserved or registered name, may specify conspicuously on its face a delayed effective time or date, or both an effective time and date, and if it does so, the document becomes effective as specified.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-123(2)(a): If a delayed effective time but no date is specified, the document is effective on the date it is filed, as that date is specified in the division's time and date endorsement on the document, at the later of the time specified on the document as its effective time or the time specified in the time and date endorsement.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-123(2)(b): If a delayed effective date but no time is specified, the document is effective at the close of business on that date.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-123(2)(c): A delayed effective date for a document may not be later than the ninetieth day after the date it is filed.  If a document specifies a delayed effective date that is later than the ninetieth day after the document is filed, the document is effective on the ninetieth day after it is filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-123(3): (2); 16-10a-1008; 16-10a-1008 If a document specifies a delayed effective date pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-123(3)(a): 16-10a-1008 that the document has been revoked by appropriate corporate action or by court order or decree pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-123(3)(b): 16-10a-1008 in the case of a court order or decree pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-124 Correcting filed documents.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-124(1): A domestic or foreign corporation may correct a document filed with the division if the document:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-124(1)(a): contains an incorrect statement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-124(1)(b): was defectively executed, attested, sealed, verified, or acknowledged.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-124(2): A document is corrected by delivering to the division for filing articles of correction that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-124(2)(a): describe the document, including its filing date, or have a copy of it attached to the articles of correction;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-124(2)(b): specify the incorrect statement and the reason it is incorrect or the manner in which the execution, attestation, sealing, verification, or acknowledgement was defective; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-124(2)(c): correct the incorrect statement or defective execution, attestation, sealing, verification, or acknowledgement.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-124(3): 16-10a-120(6) Articles of correction may be executed by any person designated in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-124(4): Articles of correction are effective on the effective date of the document they correct except as to persons relying on the uncorrected document and adversely affected by the correction.  As to those persons, articles of correction are effective when filed.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-125 Filing duty of division.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-125(1): 16-10a-120 If a document delivered to the division for filing satisfies the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-125(2): 16-10a-1510; 16-10a-1608 The division files a document by stamping or otherwise endorsing "Filed" together with the name of the division and the date and time of acceptance for filing on both the document and the accompanying copy. After filing a document, except as provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-125(3): If the division refuses to file a document, it shall return the document to the person requesting the filing within 10 days after the document was delivered to the division, together with a written notice providing a brief explanation of the reason for the refusal.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-125(4): The division's duty to file documents under this section is ministerial.  Except as otherwise specifically provided in this chapter, the division's filing or refusal to file a document does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-125(4)(a): affect the validity or invalidity of the document in whole or part;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-125(4)(b): relate to the correctness or incorrectness of information contained in the document; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-125(4)(c): create a presumption that the document is valid or invalid or that information contained in the document is correct or incorrect.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-126 Petition for review of division's refusal to file document.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-126(1): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; (1)(a); 16-10a-125(3); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-126(1)(a): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration If the division refuses to file a document delivered to the division for filing, the domestic or foreign corporation for which the filing was requested, or the corporation's representative, may petition a court with jurisdiction under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-126(1)(b): (1)(a); 16-10a-125(3) A domestic or foreign corporation, or the corporation's representative, shall file a petition under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-126(1)(c): (1)(a) The petition under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-126(2): (1) If a petition is filed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-126(3): The court's final decision is appealable as in any other civil proceedings.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-127 Evidentiary effect of copy of filed document.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A certificate attached to a copy of a document filed by the division, or an endorsement, seal, or stamp placed on the copy, which certificate, endorsement, seal, or stamp bears the signature of the director of the division, or a facsimile of the director's signature, and the seal of the division, is conclusive evidence that the original document has been filed with the division.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-128 Certificates issued by the division.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-128(1): Anyone may apply to the division for a certificate of existence for a domestic corporation, a certificate of authorization for a foreign corporation, or a certificate that sets forth any facts of record in the office of the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-128(2): 16-10a-1607 A certificate of existence or authorization sets forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-128(2)(a): the domestic corporation's corporate name or the foreign corporation's corporate name registered in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-128(2)(b): that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-128(2)(b)(i): the domestic corporation is duly incorporated under the law of this state and the date of its incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-128(2)(b)(ii): the foreign corporation is authorized to transact business in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-128(2)(c): that all fees, taxes, and penalties owed to this state have been paid, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-128(2)(c)(i): payment is reflected in the records of the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-128(2)(c)(ii): nonpayment affects the existence or authorization of the domestic or foreign corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-128(2)(d): 16-10a-1607 that its most recent annual report required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-128(2)(e): that articles of dissolution have not been filed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-128(2)(f): other facts of record in the office of the division that may be requested by the applicant.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-128(3): Subject to any qualification stated in the certificate, a certificate issued by the division may be relied upon as conclusive evidence of the facts set forth in the certificate.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-129 Penalty for signing false documents.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-129(1): A person commits an offense if he signs a document knowing it to be false in any material respect, with intent that the document be delivered to the division for filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-129(2): An offense under this section is a class A misdemeanor punishable by a fine not to exceed $2,500.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-201 Incorporators.
-----------------------------------------------
One or more persons may act as incorporators of a corporation by delivering to the division for filing articles meeting the requirements of Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202 Articles of incorporation.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(1): 16-10a-401; 16-10a-601; 16-17-203(1) The articles of incorporation shall set forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(1)(a): the purpose or purposes for which the corporation is organized;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(1)(b): 16-10a-401 a corporate name for the corporation that satisfies the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(1)(c): the number of shares the corporation is authorized to issue;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(1)(d): 16-10a-601 the information required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(1)(e): 16-17-203(1) the information required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(1)(f): the name and address of each incorporator.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(2): The articles of incorporation may set forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(2)(a): the names and addresses of the individuals who are to serve as the initial directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(2)(b): provisions not inconsistent with law regarding:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(2)(b)(i): managing the business and regulating the affairs of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(2)(b)(ii): defining, limiting, and regulating the powers of the corporation, its board of directors, and its shareholders;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(2)(b)(iii): a par value for authorized shares or classes of shares; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(2)(b)(iv): the imposition of personal liability on shareholders for the debts of the corporation to a specified extent and upon specified conditions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(2)(c): any provision that under this chapter is permitted to be in the articles of incorporation or required or permitted to be set forth in the bylaws including elective provisions which, to be effective, shall be included in the articles of incorporation, as provided in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(3): (1)(a) It shall be sufficient under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(4): The articles of incorporation need not set forth any of the corporate powers enumerated in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(5): 16-10a-120 The articles of incorporation shall be signed by each incorporator and meet the filing requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(6)(a): If this chapter conditions any matter upon the presence of a provision in the bylaws, the condition is satisfied if the provision is present either in the articles of incorporation or the bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-202(6)(b): If this chapter conditions any matter upon the absence of a provision in the bylaws, the condition is satisfied only if the provision is absent from both the articles of incorporation and the bylaws.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-203 Incorporation.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-203(1): 16-10a-123(2) A corporation is incorporated, and its corporate existence begins, when the articles of incorporation are filed by the division, unless a delayed effective date is specified pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-203(2): The filing of the articles of incorporation by the division is conclusive proof that all conditions precedent to incorporation have been satisfied, except in a proceeding by the state to cancel or revoke the incorporation or involuntarily dissolve the corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-204 Liability for preincorporation transactions.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
All persons purporting to act as or on behalf of a corporation, knowing there was no incorporation under this chapter, are jointly and severally liable for all liabilities created while so acting.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-205 Organization of the corporation.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-205(1): After incorporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-205(1)(a): if initial directors are named in the articles of incorporation, the initial directors may hold an organizational meeting, at the call of a majority of the directors, to complete the organization of the corporation by appointing officers, adopting bylaws, and carrying on any other business brought before the meeting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-205(1)(b): if initial directors are not named in the articles of incorporation, then until directors are elected, the incorporator or incorporators may hold an organizational meeting at the call of a majority of the incorporators to do whatever is necessary and proper to complete the organization of the corporation, including the election of directors and officers and the adoption and amendment of bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-205(2): Action required or permitted by this chapter to be taken by incorporators at an organizational meeting may be taken without a meeting if the action taken is evidenced by one or more written consents describing the action taken and signed by each incorporator.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-205(3): An organizational meeting may be held in or out of this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-206 Bylaws.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-206(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-206(1)(a): The board of directors of a corporation may adopt initial bylaws for the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-206(1)(b): If no directors have been elected the incorporators may adopt initial bylaws for the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-206(1)(c): If neither the incorporators nor the board of directors have adopted initial bylaws, the shareholders may do so.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-206(2): The bylaws of a corporation may contain any provision for managing the business and regulating the affairs of the corporation that is not inconsistent with law or the articles of incorporation, including management and regulation of the corporation in the event of an emergency.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-301 Purposes.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-301(1): 16-10a-202(3) A corporation incorporated under this chapter and including in the corporation's articles of incorporation a statement that meets the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-301(2): A corporation engaging in a business or an activity that is subject to regulation under another statute of this state may incorporate under this chapter only if permitted by, and subject to all limitations of, the other statute.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302 General powers.
------------------------------------------------
Unless its articles of incorporation provide otherwise, and except as restricted by the Utah Constitution, every corporation has perpetual duration and succession in its corporate name and has the same powers as an individual to do all things necessary or convenient to carry out its permitted and lawful purposes, activities, and affairs, including without limitation the power:Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(1): to sue and be sued, complain and defend in the corporation's corporate name;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(2): to have a corporate seal, which may be altered at will, and to use the corporate seal, or a facsimile of the corporate seal, by impressing or affixing the corporate seal or in any other manner reproducing the corporate seal;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(3): to make and amend bylaws, not inconsistent with the corporation's articles of incorporation or with the laws of this state, for managing the business and regulating the affairs of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(4): to purchase, receive, lease, or otherwise acquire, and own, hold, improve, use, and otherwise deal with, real or personal property, or any legal or equitable interest in property, wherever located;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(5): to sell, convey, mortgage, pledge, lease, exchange, and otherwise dispose of all or any part of the corporation's property and assets;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(6): to purchase, receive, subscribe for, or otherwise acquire, own, hold, vote, use, sell, mortgage, lend, pledge, or otherwise dispose of, and deal in and with shares or other interests in, or obligations of, any other entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(7): to make contracts and guarantees, incur liabilities, borrow money, issue the corporation's notes, bonds, and other obligations that may or may not be convertible into or include the option to purchase other securities of the corporation, and secure any of the corporation's obligations by mortgage or pledge of any of the corporation's property, assets, franchises, or income;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(8): to lend money, invest and reinvest the corporation's funds, and receive and hold real and personal property as security for repayment;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(9): to be a promoter, partner, member, associate, or manager of any partnership, joint venture, trust, or other entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(10): to conduct the corporation's business and activities, locate offices, and exercise the powers granted by this chapter within or without this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(11): to elect directors and appoint officers, employees, and agents of the corporation, define their duties, fix their compensation, and lend them money and credit;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(12): to pay pensions and establish pension plans, pension trusts, profit sharing plans, share bonus plans, share option plans, and benefit or incentive plans for any or all of the corporation's current or former directors, officers, employees, and agents;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(13): to operate, and to make donations, for the public welfare or for charitable, religious, scientific, or educational purposes;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(14): to transact any lawful business that will aid governmental policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(15): to make payments or donations, or do any other act, not inconsistent with law, that furthers the business and affairs of the corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-302(16): to establish rules governing the conduct of the business and affairs of the corporation in the event of an emergency.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-303 Ultra vires.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-303(1): (2) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-303(2): 16-10a-1430 A corporation's power to act may be challenged:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-303(2)(a): in an action by a shareholder against the corporation to enjoin the act;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-303(2)(b): in an action by the corporation, directly, derivatively, or through a receiver, trustee, or other legal representative, against an incumbent or former director, officer, employee, or agent of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-303(2)(c): 16-10a-1430 in an action by the attorney general under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-303(3): (2)(a) In a shareholder's action under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401 Corporate name.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1): 7-1-103; (1)(a)(i); (ii); 16-10a-301 The name of a corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(a): 7-1-103; (1)(a)(i); (ii) except for the name of a depository institution as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(a)(i): the word:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(a)(i)(A): "corporation";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(a)(i)(B): "incorporated"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(a)(i)(C): "company";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(a)(ii): the abbreviation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(a)(ii)(A): "corp.";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(a)(ii)(B): "inc."; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(a)(ii)(C): "co."; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(a)(iii): (1)(a)(i); (ii) words or abbreviations of like import to the words or abbreviations listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(b): 16-10a-301 may not contain:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(b)(i): 16-10a-301 language stating or implying that the corporation is organized for a purpose other than that permitted by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(b)(i)(A): 16-10a-301 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(b)(i)(B): the corporation's articles of incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(b)(ii): for a corporation that changes the corporation's name or is incorporated in or authorized to do business in the state on or after May 4, 2022, the number sequence "911"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(c): without the written consent of the United States Olympic Committee, may not contain the words:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(c)(i): "Olympic";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(c)(ii): "Olympiad"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(1)(c)(iii): "Citius Altius Fortius".
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(2): (3); (4); (5) Except as authorized by Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(2)(a): the name of any domestic corporation incorporated in or foreign corporation authorized to transact business in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(2)(b): the name of any domestic or foreign nonprofit corporation incorporated or authorized to transact business in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(2)(c): the name of any domestic or foreign limited liability company formed or authorized to transact business in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(2)(d): the name of any limited partnership formed or authorized to transact business in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(2)(e): any name reserved or registered with the division for a corporation, limited liability company, or general or limited partnership, under the laws of this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(2)(f): any business name, fictitious name, assumed name, trademark, or service mark registered by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(3): (2); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(3)(a): (2) A corporation may apply to the division for authorization to file the corporation's articles of incorporation under, or to register or reserve, a name that is not distinguishable upon the division's records from one or more of the names described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(3)(b): (3)(a) The division shall approve the application filed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(3)(b)(i): the other person whose name is not distinguishable from the name under which the applicant desires to file, or which the applicant desires to register or reserve:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(3)(b)(i)(A): consents to the filing, registration, or reservation in writing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(3)(b)(i)(B): submits an undertaking in a form satisfactory to the division to change the person's name to a name that is distinguishable from the name of the applicant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(3)(b)(ii): the applicant delivers to the division a certified copy of the final judgment of a court of competent jurisdiction establishing the applicant's right to make the requested filing in this state under the name applied for.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(4): A corporation may make a filing under the name, including the fictitious name, of another domestic or foreign corporation that is used or registered in this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(4)(a): the other corporation is incorporated or authorized to transact business in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(4)(b): the filing corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(4)(b)(i): has merged with the other corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(4)(b)(ii): has been formed by reorganization of the other corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(a): A name is distinguishable from other names, trademarks, and service marks on the records of the division if the name:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(a)(i): contains one or more different letters or numerals; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(a)(ii): has a different sequence of letters or numerals from the other names on the division's records.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b): Differences which are not distinguishing are:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(i): the words or abbreviations of the words:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(i)(A): "corporation";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(i)(B): "company";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(i)(C): "incorporated";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(i)(D): "limited partnership";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(i)(E): "L.P.";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(i)(F): "limited";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(i)(G): "limited liability company";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(i)(H): "limited company";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(i)(I): "L.C."; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(i)(J): "L.L.C.";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(ii): the presence or absence of the words or symbols of the words "the," "and," or "a";
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(iii): differences in punctuation and special characters;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(iv): differences in capitalization;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(v): differences between singular and plural forms of words for a corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(v)(A): incorporated in or authorized to do business in this state on or after May 4, 1998; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(v)(B): that changes the corporation's name on or after May 4, 1998;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(vi): differences in whether the letters or numbers immediately follow each other or are separated by one or more spaces if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(vi)(A): the sequence of letters or numbers is identical; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(vi)(B): the corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(vi)(B)(I): is incorporated in or authorized to do business in this state on or after May 3, 1999; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(vi)(B)(II): changes the corporation's name on or after May 3, 1999; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(vii): differences in abbreviations, for a corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(vii)(A): incorporated in or authorized to do business in this state on or after May 1, 2000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(b)(vii)(B): that changes the corporation's name on or after May 1, 2000.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(5)(c): The director of the division has the power and authority reasonably necessary to interpret and efficiently administer this section and to perform the duties imposed on the division by this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(6): A name that implies that the corporation is an agency of this state or of any of the state's political subdivisions, if the corporation is not actually such a legally established agency or subdivision, may not be approved for filing by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(7): (1)(d); (1)(d)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(7)(a): (1)(d) The requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-401(7)(b): (1)(d) On or after January 1, 1999, any corporation incorporated in or authorized to do business in this state shall comply with the requirements of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-402 Reserved name.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-402(1): 16-10a-401; (1) Any person may apply for the reservation of a name by delivering to the division for filing an application setting forth the name and address of the applicant and the name proposed to be reserved.  If the division finds that the name applied for would be available for use as a corporate name under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-402(2): The applicant for a reserved name may transfer the reservation to another person by delivering to the division a notice of the transfer signed by the applicant for which the name was reserved and specifying the reserved name, the name of the holder of the name, and the name and address of the transferee.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-402(3): 42-2-5; Part 15, Authority of Foreign Corporation to Transact Business A name reservation does not authorize the applicant to use the name until:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-402(3)(a): 42-2-5 the name is registered as a trade name under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-402(3)(b): articles of incorporation which bear the name are filed with the division; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-402(3)(c): Part 15, Authority of Foreign Corporation to Transact Business an application for authority to transact business in this state under the name has been filed with the division pursuant to


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-403 Corporate name -- Limited rights.
------------------------------------------------------------------
The authorization granted by the division to file articles of incorporation under a corporate name or to reserve a name does not:Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-403(1): abrogate or limit the law governing unfair competition or unfair trade practices;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-403(2): derogate from the common law the principles of equity or the statutes of this state or of the United States with respect to the right to acquire and protect names and trademarks; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-403(3): create an exclusive right in geographic or generic terms contained within a name.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-601 Authorized shares.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-601(1): 16-10a-602 The articles of incorporation shall prescribe the classes of shares and the number of shares of each class that the corporation is authorized to issue.  If more than one class of shares is authorized, the articles of incorporation shall prescribe a distinguishing designation for each class, and prior to the issuance of shares of a class the preferences, limitations, and relative rights of that class shall be described in the articles of incorporation.  All shares of a class shall have preferences, limitations, and relative rights identical with those of other shares of the same class except to the extent otherwise permitted by this section and Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-601(2): The articles of incorporation shall authorize:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-601(2)(a): one or more classes of shares that together have unlimited voting rights; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-601(2)(b): one or more classes of shares, which may be the same class or classes as those with voting rights, that together are entitled to receive the net assets of the corporation upon dissolution.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-601(3): The articles of incorporation may authorize one or more classes of shares and one or more series of shares within any class that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-601(3)(a): have special, conditional, or limited voting rights, or no right to vote, except to the extent prohibited by this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-601(3)(b): are redeemable or convertible as specified in the articles of incorporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-601(3)(b)(i): at the option of the corporation, the shareholder, or another person or upon the occurrence of a designated event;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-601(3)(b)(ii): for money, indebtedness, securities, or other property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-601(3)(b)(iii): in a designated amount or in an amount determined in accordance with a designated formula or by reference to extrinsic data or events;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-601(3)(c): entitle the holders to distributions calculated in any manner, including dividends that may be cumulative, noncumulative, or partially cumulative; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-601(3)(d): have preference over any other class or series of shares with respect to distributions, including dividends and distributions upon the dissolution of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-601(4): (3) The description of the designations, preferences, limitations, and relative rights of share classes or series of shares in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-602 Terms of class or series determined by board of directors.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-602(1): 16-10a-1002(1)(e); 16-10a-601; 16-10a-601 If the articles of incorporation so provide, the board of directors, without shareholder action but subject to any limitations and restrictions stated in the articles of incorporation, may amend the corporation's articles of incorporation pursuant to the authority granted to the board of directors by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-602(1)(a): 16-10a-601 designate in whole or in part, the preferences, limitations, and relative rights, within the limits set forth in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-602(1)(b): 16-10a-601 create one or more series within a class of shares, fix the number of shares of each such series, and designate, in whole or part, the preferences, limitations, and relative rights of the series, within the limits set forth in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-602(1)(c): alter or revoke the preferences, limitations, and relative rights granted to or imposed upon any wholly unissued class of shares or any wholly unissued series of any class of shares; or
