Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-740(7)(a): (3)(c); (3)(d); (5); (6) In any derivative proceeding in the right of a foreign corporation, the matters covered by this section shall be governed by the laws of the jurisdiction of incorporation of the foreign corporation except for Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-740(7)(b): (3)(c); (4) In the case of matters relating to a foreign corporation under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-740(7)(b)(i): (4) references to a person or group described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-740(7)(b)(ii): the standard of review of a decision by the person or group to dismiss the derivative proceeding is to be governed by the laws of the jurisdiction of incorporation of the foreign corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-801 Requirement for and duties of board of directors.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-801(1): 16-10a-732 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-801(2): 16-10a-732 All corporate powers shall be exercised by or under the authority of, and the business and affairs of the corporation managed under the direction of, its board of directors, subject to any limitation set forth in the articles of incorporation or in an agreement authorized under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-802 Qualifications of directors.
-------------------------------------------------------------
The articles of incorporation or bylaws may prescribe qualifications for directors, except a director shall be a natural person.  A director need not be a resident of this state or a shareholder of the corporation unless the articles of incorporation or bylaws so prescribe.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-803 Number and election of directors.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-803(1): (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-803(1)(a): (1)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-803(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-803(1)(b)(i): Before any shares are issued, a corporation's board of directors may consist of one or more individuals.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-803(1)(b)(ii): After shares are issued and for as long as a corporation has fewer than three shareholders entitled to vote for the election of directors, its board of directors may consist of a number of individuals equal to or greater than the number of those shareholders.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-803(1)(c): The number of directors shall be specified in or fixed in accordance with the bylaws.  Unless otherwise provided in the articles of incorporation, the number of initial directors stated in the articles of incorporation as originally filed with the division, if initial directors are so named in the articles of incorporation, shall be superseded by a provision in the bylaws specifying the number of authorized directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-803(1)(d): The number of directors may be increased or decreased from time to time by amendment to the bylaws, but no decrease may have the effect of shortening the term of any incumbent director.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-803(1)(e): In the absence of a provision in the bylaws or articles of incorporation fixing the number of individuals composing a board of directors, the number shall be the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-803(1)(e)(i): the number of directors then in office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-803(1)(e)(ii): the minimum number of directors permitted by this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-803(2): The bylaws may establish a variable range for the size of the board of directors by fixing a minimum and maximum number of directors.  If a range is established, the number of directors may be fixed or changed from time to time within the range by the shareholders or the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-803(3): 16-10a-806 Directors are elected at each annual meeting of the shareholders except as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-804 Election of directors by certain classes of shareholders.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If the articles of incorporation authorize dividing the shares into classes or series, the articles of incorporation may also authorize the election of all or a specified number or portion of directors by the holders of one or more authorized classes or series of shares.  A class or series of shares entitled to elect one or more directors is a separate voting group for purposes of the election of directors.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805 Terms of directors generally.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Except as otherwise provided in the articles of incorporation, or SectionUtah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805(1): 16-10a-806 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805(2): 16-10a-806; 16-10a-1023; 16-10a-1023 The terms of all other directors expire at the next annual shareholders' meeting following their election:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805(2)(a): 16-10a-806; 16-10a-1023; 16-10a-1023 except as provided in:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805(2)(a)(i): 16-10a-806 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805(2)(a)(ii): 16-10a-1023; 16-10a-1023 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805(2)(b): unless a shorter term is specified in the articles of incorporation in the event a director nominee fails to receive a specified vote for election.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805(3): A decrease in the number of directors does not shorten an incumbent director's term.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805(4)(a): A director elected to fill a vacancy created other than by an increase in the number of directors shall be elected for the unexpired term of the director's predecessor in office, or for any lesser period as may be prescribed by the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805(4)(b): If a director is elected to fill a vacancy created by reason of an increase in the number of directors, then the term of the director so elected expires at the next shareholders' meeting at which directors are elected, unless the vacancy is filled by a vote of the shareholders, in which case the term shall expire on the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805(4)(b)(i): the next meeting of shareholders at which directors are elected; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805(4)(b)(ii): the term designated for the director at the time of the creation of the position being filled.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805(5): 16-10a-1023; 16-10a-1023
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-805(6): 16-10a-1608 A director whose term has ended may deliver to the division for filing a statement to that effect pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-806 Staggered terms for directors.
---------------------------------------------------------------
The articles of incorporation may provide for staggering the terms of directors by dividing the total number of directors into two or three groups, with each group containing 1/2 or 1/3 of the total, as near as may be.  In that event, the terms of directors in the first group expire at the first annual shareholders' meeting after their election, the terms of directors in the second group expire at the second annual shareholders' meeting after their election, and the terms of directors in the third group, if any, expire at the third annual shareholders' meeting after their election.  Upon the expiration of the initial staggered terms directors shall be elected for terms of two years or three years, as the case may be, to succeed those whose terms expire.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-807 Resignation of directors.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-807(1): A director may resign at any time by giving a written notice of resignation to the board of directors, the board's chair, or the corporation's secretary.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-807(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-807(2)(a): A resignation of a director is effective when the notice is received by the corporation unless the notice specifies a later effective date or an effective date determined by the happening of an event.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-807(2)(b): A notice of resignation that is conditioned upon failing to receive a specified vote for election as a director may provide that it is irrevocable.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-807(3): 16-10a-1608 A director who resigns may deliver to the division for filing a statement of the director's resignation pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-808 Removal of directors by shareholders.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-808(1): The shareholders may remove one or more directors with or without cause unless the articles of incorporation provide that directors may be removed only for cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-808(2): If a director is elected by a voting group of shareholders, only the shareholders of that voting group may participate in the vote to remove him.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-808(3): If cumulative voting is in effect, a director may not be removed if the number of votes sufficient to elect the director under cumulative voting is voted against removal.  If cumulative voting is not in effect, a director may be removed only if the number of votes cast to remove the director exceeds the number of votes cast against removal.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-808(4): A director may be removed by the shareholders only at a meeting called for the purpose of removing the director and the meeting notice shall state that the purpose, or one of the purposes, of the meeting is removal of the director.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-808(5): 16-10a-1608 A director who is removed pursuant to this section may deliver to the division for filing a statement to that effect pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-809 Removal of directors by judicial proceeding.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-809(1): A court with jurisdiction under Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration, may remove a director in a proceeding commenced by the corporation or by the corporation's shareholders holding at least 10% of the outstanding shares of any class if the court finds that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-809(1)(a): the director engaged in fraudulent or dishonest conduct or gross abuse of authority or discretion with respect to the corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-809(1)(b): removal is in the best interest of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-809(2): The court that removes a director may bar the director from reelection for a period prescribed by the court.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-809(3): If shareholders commence a proceeding under Subsection (1), they shall make the corporation a party defendant.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-809(4): 16-10a-1608 A director who is removed pursuant to this section may deliver to the division for filing a statement to that effect pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-810 Vacancy on board.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-810(1): Unless the articles of incorporation provide otherwise, if a vacancy occurs on a board of directors, including a vacancy resulting from an increase in the number of directors:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-810(1)(a): the shareholders may fill the vacancy;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-810(1)(b): the board of directors may fill the vacancy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-810(1)(c): if the directors remaining in office constitute fewer than a quorum of the board, they may fill the vacancy by the affirmative vote of a majority of all the directors remaining in office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-810(2): Unless otherwise provided in the articles of incorporation, if the vacant office was held or is to be held by a director elected by a voting group of shareholders:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-810(2)(a): if one or more of the other directors elected by the same voting group are serving, only they are entitled to vote to fill the vacancy if it is filled by the directors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-810(2)(b): only the holders of shares of that voting group are entitled to vote to fill the vacancy if it is filled by the shareholders.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-810(3): 16-10a-807 A vacancy that will occur at a specific later date, by reason of a resignation effective at a later date under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-811 Compensation of directors.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Unless the articles of incorporation or bylaws provide otherwise, the board of directors may fix the compensation of directors.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-820 Meetings.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-820(1): The board of directors may hold regular or special meetings in or out of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-820(2): Unless the articles of incorporation or bylaws provide otherwise, the board of directors may permit any or all directors to participate in a regular or special meeting by, or conduct the meeting through the use of, any means of communication by which all directors participating may hear each other during the meeting.  A director participating in a meeting by this means is considered to be present in person at the meeting.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-821 Action without meeting.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-821(1): Unless the articles of incorporation, bylaws, or this chapter provide otherwise, action required or permitted by this chapter to be taken at a board of directors' meeting may be taken without a meeting if all members of the board consent to the action in writing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-821(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-821(2)(a): Action is taken under this section at the time the last director signs a writing describing the action taken, unless, prior to that time, any director has revoked a consent by a writing signed by the director and received by the secretary or any other person authorized by the bylaws or the board of directors to receive the revocation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-821(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-821(2)(b)(i): Unless otherwise provided by the bylaws, a director may deliver a written consent under this section by an electronic transmission that provides the corporation with a complete copy of the written consent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-821(2)(b)(ii): An electronic transmission consenting to an action under this section is considered to be written, signed, and dated for purposes of this section if the electronic transmission is delivered with information from which the corporation can determine:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-821(2)(b)(ii)(A): that the electronic transmission is transmitted by the director; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-821(2)(b)(ii)(B): the date on which the electronic transmission is transmitted.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-821(2)(b)(iii): The date on which an electronic transmission is transmitted is considered the date on which a consent is signed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-821(3): (2) Action under this section is effective at the time it is taken under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-821(4): Action taken under this section has the same effect as action taken at a meeting of directors and may be described as such in any document.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-822 Notice of meeting.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-822(1): Unless the articles of incorporation, bylaws, or this chapter provide otherwise, regular meetings of the board of directors may be held without notice of the date, time, place, or purposes of the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-822(2): Unless the articles of incorporation or bylaws provide for a longer or shorter period, special meetings of the board of directors shall be preceded by at least two days' notice of the date, time, and place of the meeting.  The notice need not describe the purpose of the special meeting unless required by the articles of incorporation, bylaws, or this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-823 Waiver of notice.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-823(1): (2) A director may waive any notice of a meeting before or after the date and time of the meeting stated in the notice.  Except as provided by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-823(2): A director's attendance at or participation in a meeting waives any required notice to the director of the meeting unless the director at the beginning of the meeting, or promptly upon the director's arrival, objects to holding the meeting or transacting business at the meeting because of lack of notice or defective notice, and does not thereafter vote for or assent to action taken at the meeting.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-824 Quorum and voting.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-824(1): (2); 16-10a-803(2) Unless the articles of incorporation or bylaws require a greater number, or, as permitted in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-824(1)(a): a majority of the fixed number of directors if the corporation has a fixed board size; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-824(1)(b): 16-10a-803(2) a majority of the number of directors prescribed, or if no number is prescribed, of the number in office immediately before the meeting begins, if a range for the size of the board is established pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-824(2): (1) The articles of incorporation or bylaws may authorize a quorum of a board of directors to consist of no fewer than 1/3 of the fixed or prescribed number of directors determined under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-824(3): If a quorum is present when a vote is taken, the affirmative vote of a majority of directors present is the act of the board of directors unless the articles of incorporation, bylaws, or this chapter require the vote of a greater number of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-824(4): A director who is present at a meeting of the board of directors when corporate action is taken is considered to have assented to the action taken at the meeting unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-824(4)(a): the director objects at the beginning of the meeting, or promptly upon arrival, to holding the meeting or transacting business at the meeting and does not thereafter vote for or assent to any action taken at the meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-824(4)(b): the director contemporaneously requests his dissent or abstention as to any specific action to be entered into the minutes of the meeting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-824(4)(c): the director causes written notice of a dissent or abstention as to any specific action to be received by the presiding officer of the meeting before adjournment of the meeting or by the corporation promptly after adjournment of the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-824(5): (4) The right of dissent or abstention as to a specific action pursuant to Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-825 Committees.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-825(1): Unless the articles of incorporation or bylaws provide otherwise, a board of directors may create one or more committees and appoint members of the board of directors to serve on them.  Each committee shall have two or more members, who serve at the pleasure of the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-825(2): 16-10a-824 The creation of a committee and appointment of members to it shall be approved by the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-825(2)(a): a majority of all the directors in office when the action is taken; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-825(2)(b): 16-10a-824 the number of directors required by the articles of incorporation or bylaws to take action under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-825(3): 16-10a-820; 16-10a-824 Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-825(4): 16-10a-801 To the extent specified by the board of directors or in the articles of incorporation or bylaws, each committee may exercise the authority of the board of directors under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-825(5): 16-10a-840 The creation of, delegation of authority to, or action by a committee does not alone constitute compliance by a director with the standards of conduct described in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-830 Required officers.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-830(1): A corporation shall have the officers designated in its bylaws or by the board of directors in a manner not inconsistent with the bylaws.  Any officer shall be a natural person.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-830(2): Officers may be appointed by the board of directors or in any other manner as the board of directors or bylaws may provide.  A duly appointed officer may appoint one or more officers or assistant officers if authorized by the bylaws or the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-830(3): 16-10a-1601 The bylaws or the board of directors shall delegate to one of the officers responsibility for the preparation and maintenance of minutes of the directors' and shareholders' meetings and other records and information required to be kept by the corporation under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-830(4): The same individual may simultaneously hold more than one office in a corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-831 Duties of officers.
----------------------------------------------------
Each officer has the authority and shall perform the duties set forth in the bylaws or, to the extent not inconsistent with the bylaws, the duties prescribed by the board of directors or by an officer authorized by the board of directors to prescribe the duties of other officers.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-832 Resignation and removal of officers.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-832(1): An officer may resign at any time by giving written notice of the resignation to the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-832(2): A resignation of an officer is effective when the notice is received by the corporation, unless the notice specifies a later effective date.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-832(3): If a resignation is made effective at a later date, the board of directors may permit the officer to remain in office until the effective date and may fill the pending vacancy before the effective date if the board of directors provides that the successor does not take office until the effective date, or the board of directors may remove the officer at any time prior to the effective date and may fill the resulting vacancy.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-832(4): Unless otherwise provided in the bylaws, the board of directors may remove any officer at any time with or without cause.  The bylaws or the board of directors may make provision for the removal of officers by other officers or by the shareholders.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-832(5): 16-10a-1608 An officer who resigns or is removed or whose appointment has expired may deliver to the division for filing a statement to that effect pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-833 Contract rights with respect to officers.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-833(1): The appointment of an officer does not itself create contract rights.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-833(2): An officer's removal does not affect the officer's contract rights, if any, with the corporation.  An officer's resignation does not affect the corporation's contract rights, if any, with the officer.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840 General standards of conduct for directors and officers.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(1): Each director shall discharge the director's duties as a director, including duties as a member of a committee, and each officer with discretionary authority shall discharge the officer's duties under that authority:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(1)(a): in good faith;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(1)(b): with the care an ordinarily prudent person in a like position would exercise under similar circumstances; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(1)(c): in a manner the director or officer reasonably believes to be in the best interests of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(2): (3); (1)(b) In discharging the director's or officer's duties, a director or officer is entitled to rely on information, opinions, reports, or statements, including financial statements and other financial data, if prepared or presented by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(2)(a): one or more officers or employees of the corporation, or of any other corporation of which at least 50% of the outstanding shares of stock entitling the holder of the shares to vote in the election of directors is owned directly or indirectly by the corporation, whom the director or officer reasonably believes to be reliable and competent in the matters presented;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(2)(b): legal counsel, public accountants, or other persons as to matters the director or officer reasonably believes are within the person's professional or expert competence; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(2)(c): (3); (1)(b) in the case of a director, a committee of the board of directors of which the director is not a member:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(2)(c)(i): if the committee is designated in accordance with the articles of incorporation or the bylaws;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(2)(c)(ii): if the information, opinion, report, or statement is within the committee's designated authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(2)(c)(iii): if the director reasonably believes the committee merits confidence; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(2)(c)(iv): (3); (1)(b) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(3): (2) A director or officer is not acting in good faith if the director or officer has knowledge concerning the matter in question that makes reliance otherwise permitted by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(4): A director or officer is not liable to the corporation, its shareholders, or any conservator or receiver, or any assignee or successor-in-interest thereof, for any action taken, or any failure to take any action, as an officer or director, as the case may be, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(4)(a): the director or officer has breached or failed to perform the duties of the office in compliance with this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(4)(b): the breach or failure to perform constitutes gross negligence, willful misconduct, or intentional infliction of harm on the corporation or the shareholders.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(5): (5); 16-10a-102; (5); (5)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(5)(a): (5); 16-10a-102 For purposes of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(5)(b): In taking action, including action that may involve or relate to a change or potential change in the control of the corporation, the director is entitled to consider:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(5)(b)(i): both the long-term and the short-term interests of the corporation and the corporation's shareholders; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(5)(b)(ii): the effects that the corporation's actions may have in the long-term or short-term on any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(5)(b)(ii)(A): the prospects for potential growth, development, productivity, and profitability of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(5)(b)(ii)(B): the corporation's current employees;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(5)(b)(ii)(C): the corporation's retired employees and other beneficiaries receiving or entitled to receive retirement, welfare, or similar benefits from or pursuant to any plan sponsored, or agreement entered into, by the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(5)(b)(ii)(D): the corporation's customers and creditors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(5)(b)(ii)(E): the ability of the corporation to provide, as a going concern, goods, services, employment opportunities, employment benefits, and otherwise contribute to the communities in which the corporation does business.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-840(5)(c): (5); (5)(b) This Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-841 Limitation of liability of directors.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-841(1): 16-10a-840(4); (3); 16-10a-842 Without limiting the generality of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-841(1)(a): the amount of a financial benefit received by a director to which he is not entitled;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-841(1)(b): an intentional infliction of harm on the corporation or the shareholders;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-841(1)(c): 16-10a-842 a violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-841(1)(d): an intentional violation of criminal law.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-841(2): No provision authorized under this section may eliminate or limit the liability of a director for any act or omission occurring prior to the date when the provision becomes effective.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-841(3): Any provision authorized under this section to be included in the articles of incorporation may also be adopted in the bylaws or by resolution, but only if the provision is approved by the same percentage of shareholders of each voting group as would be required to approve an amendment to the articles of incorporation including the provision.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-841(4): Any foreign corporation authorized to transact business in this state, including any federally chartered depository institution authorized under federal law to transact business in this state, may adopt any provision authorized under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-841(5): With respect to a corporation that is a depository institution regulated by the Department of Financial Institutions or by an agency of the federal government, any provision authorized under this section may include the elimination or limitation of the personal liability of a director or officer to the corporation's members or depositors.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-842 Liability of directors for unlawful distributions.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-842(1): 16-10a-640; 16-10a-640; 16-10a-840 A director who votes for or assents to a distribution made in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-842(2): (1); (1); 16-10a-640; 16-10a-640 A director held liable under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-842(2)(a): (1) from every other director who could be held liable under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-842(2)(b): 16-10a-640; 16-10a-640 from each shareholder, who accepted the distribution knowing the distribution was made in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-842(3): 16-10a-640(5); (7) A proceeding under this section is barred unless it is commenced within two years after the date on which the effect of the distribution is measured under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-850 Definitions relating to conflicting interest transactions.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
As used in SectionsUtah Code Annotated § 16-10a-850(1): (1)(b)(i); (1)(b)(i); (1)(b)(ii) "Conflicting interest" with respect to a corporation means the interest a director has respecting a transaction effected or proposed to be effected by the corporation or by any entity in which the corporation has a controlling interest if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-850(1)(a): whether or not the transaction is brought before the board of directors of the corporation for action, the director knows at the time of commitment that the director or a related person of the director is a party to the transaction or has a beneficial financial interest in or is so closely linked to, the transaction and the transaction is so financially significant to the director or a related person of the director that the interest would reasonably be expected to exert an influence on the director's judgment if the director were called upon to vote on the transaction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-850(1)(b): (1)(b)(i); (1)(b)(i); (1)(b)(ii) the transaction is brought, or is of a character and significance to the corporation that it would in the normal course be brought, before the board of directors for action, and the director knows at the time of commitment that any of the following persons is either a party to the transaction or has a beneficial financial interest in, or is so closely linked to, the transaction and the transaction is so financially significant to the person that the interest would reasonably be expected to exert an influence on the director's judgment if the director were called upon to vote on the transaction:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-850(1)(b)(i): an entity, other than the corporation, of which the director is a director, general partner, agent, or employee or an entity to which the director owes a fiduciary duty, other than a fiduciary duty arising because the director is a director of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-850(1)(b)(ii): an individual who is a general partner, principal, or employer of the director or who is a beneficiary of a fiduciary duty owed by the director, other than a fiduciary duty arising because the director is a director of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-850(1)(b)(iii): (1)(b)(i); (1)(b)(i); (1)(b)(ii) a person that controls one or more of the entities specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-850(2): "Director's conflicting interest transaction" with respect to a corporation means a transaction effected or proposed to be effected by the corporation, or by any entity controlled by the corporation respecting which a director has a conflicting interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-850(3): "Qualified director" means, with respect to a director's conflicting interest transaction, any director who does not have either a conflicting interest respecting the transaction, or a familial, financial, professional, or employment relationship with a second director who does have a conflicting interest respecting the transaction, which relationship would, in the circumstances, reasonably be expected to exert an influence on the first director's judgment when voting on the transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-850(4): "Required disclosure" means disclosure by the director who has a conflicting interest of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-850(4)(a): the existence and nature of the conflicting interest; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-850(4)(b): all facts known to the director respecting the subject matter of the transaction that an ordinarily prudent person would reasonably believe to be material to a judgment about whether or not to proceed with the transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-850(5): "Time of commitment" respecting a transaction means the time when the transaction is consummated or, if made pursuant to contract, the time when the corporation or the entity controlled by the corporation becomes contractually obligated so that its unilateral withdrawal from the transaction would entail significant loss, liability, or other damage.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-851 Judicial action.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-851(1): A transaction effected or proposed to be effected by a corporation or by any entity controlled by the corporation that is not a director's conflicting interest transaction may not be enjoined, be set aside, or give rise to an award of damages or other sanctions, in a proceeding by a shareholder or by or in the right of the corporation, solely because a director, or any person with whom or which the director has a personal, economic, or other association, has an interest in the transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-851(2): 16-10a-852; 16-10a-853 A director's conflicting interest transaction may not be enjoined, be set aside, or give rise to an award of damages or other sanctions, in a proceeding by a shareholder or by or in the right of the corporation, solely because the director, or any person with whom or which the director has a personal, economic, or other association, has an interest in the transaction, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-851(2)(a): 16-10a-852 directors' action respecting the transaction was at any time taken in compliance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-851(2)(b): 16-10a-853 shareholders' action respecting the transaction was at any time taken in compliance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-851(2)(c): the transaction, judged according to the circumstances at the time of commitment, is established to have been fair to the corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-852 Directors' action.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-852(1): 16-10a-851(2)(a); (2) Directors' action respecting a transaction is taken for purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-852(1)(a): all its members are qualified directors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-852(1)(b): its members are either all of the qualified directors or are appointed by the affirmative vote of a majority of the qualified directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-852(2): 16-10a-850(4)(b); (1) If a director has a conflicting interest respecting a transaction, but neither the director nor a related person of the director is a party to the transaction, and if the director has a duty under law or professional canon, or a duty of confidentiality to another person, respecting information relating to the transaction so that the director may not make the disclosure described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-852(3): A majority of the qualified directors on the board of directors or on the committee, as the case may be, constitutes a quorum for purposes of action that complies with this section.  Directors' action that otherwise complies with this section is not affected by the presence or vote of a director who is not a qualified director.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-853 Shareholders' action.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-853(1): 16-10a-851(2)(b); (2); (3) Shareholders' action respecting a transaction is effective for purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-853(2): (3); (4) A majority of the votes entitled to be cast by the holders of all qualified shares constitutes a quorum for purposes of action that complies with this section.  Subject to the provisions of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-853(3): (1) For purposes of compliance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-853(4): (1); (3); 16-10a-851(2)(c) If a shareholders' vote does not comply with Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-901 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used inUtah Code Annotated § 16-10a-901(1): "Corporation" includes any domestic or foreign entity that is a predecessor of a corporation by reason of a merger or other transaction in which the predecessor's existence ceased upon consummation of the transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-901(2): "Director" means an individual who is or was a director of a corporation or an individual who, while a director of a corporation, is or was serving at the corporation's request as a director, officer, partner, trustee, employee, fiduciary, or agent of another domestic or foreign corporation or other person or of an employee benefit plan.  A director is considered to be serving an employee benefit plan at the corporation's request if his duties to the corporation also impose duties on, or otherwise involve services by, him to the plan or to participants in or beneficiaries of the plan.  "Director" includes, unless the context requires otherwise, the estate or personal representative of a director.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-901(3): "Expenses" include counsel fees.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-901(4): "Liability" means the obligation incurred with respect to a proceeding to pay a judgment, settlement, penalty, fine (including an excise tax assessed with respect to an employee benefit plan), or reasonable expenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-901(5): "Officer," "employee," "fiduciary," and "agent" include any person who, while serving the indicated relationship to the corporation, is or was serving at the corporation's request as a director, officer, partner, trustee, employee, fiduciary, or agent of another domestic or foreign corporation or other person or of an employee benefit plan.  An officer, employee, fiduciary, or agent is considered to be serving an employee benefit plan at the corporation's request if that person's duties to the corporation also impose duties on, or otherwise involve services by, that person to the plan or participants in, or beneficiaries of the plan.  Unless the context requires otherwise, such terms include the estates or personal representatives of such persons.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-901(6): 16-10a-907
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-901(6)(a): 16-10a-907 "Official capacity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-901(6)(a)(i): when used with respect to a director, the office of director in a corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-901(6)(a)(ii): 16-10a-907 when used with respect to a person other than a director, as contemplated in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-901(6)(b): "Official capacity" does not include service for any other foreign or domestic corporation, other person, or employee benefit plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-901(7): "Party" includes an individual who was, is, or is threatened to be made a named defendant or respondent in a proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-901(8): "Proceeding" means any threatened, pending, or completed action, suit, or proceeding, whether civil, criminal, administrative, or investigative and whether formal or informal.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-902 Authority to indemnify directors.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-902(1): (4) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-902(1)(a): his conduct was in good faith; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-902(1)(b): he reasonably believed that his conduct was in, or not opposed to, the corporation's best interests; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-902(1)(c): in the case of any criminal proceeding, he had no reasonable cause to believe his conduct was unlawful.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-902(2): (1)(b) A director's conduct with respect to any employee benefit plan for a purpose he reasonably believed to be in or not opposed to the interests of the participants in and beneficiaries of the plan is conduct that satisfies the requirement of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-902(3): The termination of a proceeding by judgment, order, settlement, conviction, or upon a plea of nolo contendere or its equivalent is not, of itself, determinative that the director did not meet the standard of conduct described in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-902(4): A corporation may not indemnify a director under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-902(4)(a): in connection with a proceeding by or in the right of the corporation in which the director was adjudged liable to the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-902(4)(b): in connection with any other proceeding charging that the director derived an improper personal benefit, whether or not involving action in his official capacity, in which proceeding he was adjudged liable on the basis that he derived an improper personal benefit.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-902(5): Indemnification permitted under this section in connection with a proceeding by or in the right of the corporation is limited to reasonable expenses incurred in connection with the proceeding.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-903 Mandatory indemnification of directors.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless limited by its articles of incorporation, a corporation shall indemnify a director who was successful, on the merits or otherwise, in the defense of any proceeding, or in the defense of any claim, issue, or matter in the proceeding, to which he was a party because he is or was a director of the corporation, against reasonable expenses incurred by him in connection with the proceeding or claim with respect to which he has been successful.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-904 Advance of expenses for directors.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-904(1): 16-10a-902 A corporation may pay for or reimburse the reasonable expenses incurred by a director who is a party to a proceeding in advance of final disposition of the proceeding if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-904(1)(a): 16-10a-902 the director furnishes the corporation a written affirmation of his good faith belief that he has met the applicable standard of conduct described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-904(1)(b): the director furnishes to the corporation a written undertaking, executed personally or on his behalf, to repay the advance if it is ultimately determined that he did not meet the standard of conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-904(1)(c): a determination is made that the facts then known to those making the determination would not preclude indemnification under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-904(2): (1)(b) The undertaking required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-904(3): 16-10a-906 Determinations and authorizations of payments under this section shall be made in the manner specified in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-905 Court-ordered indemnification of directors.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless a corporation's articles of incorporation provide otherwise, a director of the corporation who is or was a party to a proceeding may apply for indemnification to the court conducting the proceeding or to another court of competent jurisdiction.  On receipt of an application, the court, after giving any notice the court considers necessary, may order indemnification in the following manner:Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-905(1): 16-10a-903 if the court determines that the director is entitled to mandatory indemnification under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-905(2): 16-10a-902; 16-10a-902(4); 16-10a-902(4) if the court determines that the director is fairly and reasonably entitled to indemnification in view of all the relevant circumstances, whether or not the director met the applicable standard of conduct set forth in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-906 Determination and authorization of indemnification of directors.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-906(1): 16-10a-902; 16-10a-902; 16-10a-904; 16-10a-904(1)(a); (b); 16-10a-904(1)(c) A corporation may not indemnify a director under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-906(2): (1); (2)(a); (2)(a); (b); (2)(a); (2)(b) The determinations required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-906(2)(a): by the board of directors by a majority vote of those present at a meeting at which a quorum is present, and only those directors not parties to the proceeding shall be counted in satisfying the quorum; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-906(2)(b): (2)(a) if a quorum cannot be obtained as contemplated in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-906(2)(c): (2)(a); (b); (2)(a); (2)(b) by special legal counsel:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-906(2)(c)(i): (2)(a); (b) selected by the board of directors or its committee in the manner prescribed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-906(2)(c)(ii): (2)(a); (2)(b) if a quorum of the board of directors cannot be obtained under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-906(2)(d): by the shareholders, by a majority of the votes entitled to be cast by holders of qualified shares present in person or by proxy at a meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-906(3): A majority of the votes entitled to be cast by the holders of all qualified shares constitutes a quorum for purposes of action that complies with this section.  Shareholders' action that otherwise complies with this section is not affected by the presence of holders, or the voting, of shares that are not qualified shares.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-906(4): (2)(c) Unless authorization is required by the bylaws, authorization of indemnification and advance of expenses shall be made in the same manner as the determination that indemnification or advance of expenses is permissible.  However, if the determination that indemnification or advance of expenses is permissible is made by special legal counsel, authorization of indemnification and advance of expenses shall be made by a body entitled under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-907 Indemnification of officers, employees, fiduciaries, and agents.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless a corporation's articles of incorporation provide otherwise:Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-907(1): 16-10a-903; 16-10a-905 an officer of the corporation is entitled to mandatory indemnification under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-907(2): the corporation may indemnify and advance expenses to an officer, employee, fiduciary, or agent of the corporation to the same extent as to a director; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-907(3): a corporation may also indemnify and advance expenses to an officer, employee, fiduciary, or agent who is not a director to a greater extent, if not inconsistent with public policy, and if provided for by its articles of incorporation, bylaws, general or specific action of its board of directors, or contract.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-908 Insurance.
-------------------------------------------
A corporation may purchase and maintain liability insurance on behalf of a person who is or was a director, officer, employee, fiduciary, or agent of the corporation, or who, while serving as a director, officer, employee, fiduciary, or agent of the corporation, is or was serving at the request of the corporation as a director, officer, partner, trustee, employee, fiduciary, or agent of another foreign or domestic corporation or other person, or of an employee benefit plan, against liability asserted against or incurred by him in that capacity or arising from his status as a director, officer, employee, fiduciary, or agent, whether or not the corporation would have power to indemnify him against the same liability under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-909 Limitations on indemnification of directors.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-909(1): A provision treating a corporation's indemnification of, or advance for expenses to, directors that is contained in its articles of incorporation or bylaws, in a resolution of its shareholders or board of directors, or in a contract (except an insurance policy) or otherwise, is valid only if and to the extent the provision is not inconsistent with this part.  If the articles of incorporation limit indemnification or advance of expenses, indemnification and advance of expenses are valid only to the extent not inconsistent with the articles of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-909(2): This part does not limit a corporation's power to pay or reimburse expenses incurred by a director in connection with the director's appearance as a witness in a proceeding at a time when the director has not been made a named defendant or respondent to the proceeding.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1001 Authority to amend.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1001(1): A corporation may amend its articles of incorporation at any time to add or change a provision that is required or permitted in the articles of incorporation or to delete a provision not required in the articles of incorporation.  Whether a provision is required or permitted in the articles of incorporation is determined as of the effective date of the amendment.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1001(2): A shareholder does not have a vested property right resulting from any provision in the articles of incorporation, including any provision relating to management, control, capital structure, purpose, duration of the corporation, or dividend entitlement.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1002 Amendment by board of directors.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1002(1): 16-17-203(1) Unless otherwise provided in the articles of incorporation, a corporation's board of directors may adopt, without shareholder action, one or more amendments to the corporation's articles of incorporation to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1002(1)(a): delete the names and addresses of incorporators or initial directors or both from the articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1002(1)(b): 16-17-203(1) change the information required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1002(1)(c): change each issued and unissued authorized share of a class into a greater number of whole shares if the corporation has only shares of that class outstanding;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1002(1)(d): change the corporate name by adding the word "corporation," "incorporated," or "company," or an abbreviation of these words, or by substituting any such word or abbreviation for a similar word or abbreviation in the name; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1002(1)(e): make any other change expressly permitted by this chapter to be made without shareholder action.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1002(2): 16-10a-1422 The board of directors may adopt, without shareholder action, one or more amendments to the articles of incorporation to change the corporate name, if necessary, in connection with the reinstatement of a corporation pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003 Amendment by board of directors and shareholders.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(1): A corporation's board of directors may propose one or more amendments to the articles of incorporation for submission to the shareholders.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(2): (1); (5) For an amendment to the articles of incorporation proposed pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(2)(a): the board of directors shall recommend the amendment to the shareholders unless the board determines that, because of conflicts of interest or other special circumstances, it should make no recommendation and communicates the basis for its determination to the shareholders with the amendment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(2)(b): (5) shareholders entitled to vote on the amendment shall approve the amendment as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(3): The board of directors may condition its submission of the proposed amendment on any basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(4): 16-10a-705 The corporation shall give notice, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(5): (3); 16-10a-604; 16-10a-725; 16-10a-726 Unless this chapter, the articles of incorporation, the bylaws, if authorized by the articles of incorporation, or the board of directors acting pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(5)(a): a majority of the votes entitled to be cast on the amendment by any voting group with respect to which the amendment would create dissenters' rights;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(5)(b): 16-10a-604 a majority of the votes entitled to be cast on the amendment by any voting group with respect to which the amendment would materially and adversely affect rights in respect of the shares of the voting group because it:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(5)(b)(i): alters or abolishes a preferential right of the shares;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(5)(b)(ii): creates, alters, or abolishes a right in respect of redemption, including a provision respecting a sinking fund for the redemption or repurchase, of the shares;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(5)(b)(iii): alters or abolishes a preemptive right of the holder of the shares to acquire shares or other securities;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(5)(b)(iv): excludes or limits the right of the shares to vote on any matter, or to cumulate votes, other than a limitation by dilution through issuance of shares or other securities with similar voting rights; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(5)(b)(v): 16-10a-604 reduces the number of shares owned by the shareholder to a fraction of a share or scrip if the fractional share or scrip so created is to be acquired for cash or the scrip is to be voided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(5)(c): 16-10a-725; 16-10a-726 the votes required by Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1003(6): If any amendment to the articles of incorporation would impose personal liability on shareholders for the debts of a corporation, it must be approved by all of the outstanding shares affected, regardless of limitations or restrictions on the voting rights of the shares.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004 Voting on amendments by voting groups.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004(1): (5) Except as otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004(1)(a): increase or decrease the aggregate number of authorized shares of the class;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004(1)(b): effect an exchange or reclassification of all or part of the shares of the class into shares of another class;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004(1)(c): effect an exchange or reclassification, or create the right of exchange, of all or part of the shares of another class into shares of the class;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004(1)(d): change the designation, rights, preferences, or limitations of all or part of the shares of the class;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004(1)(e): change the shares of all or part of the class into a different number of shares of the same class;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004(1)(f): create a new class of shares having rights or preferences with respect to distributions or to dissolution that are prior, superior, or substantially equal to the shares of the class;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004(1)(g): increase the rights, preferences, or number of authorized shares of any class that, after giving effect to the amendment, have rights or preferences with respect to distributions or to dissolution that are prior, superior, or substantially equal to the shares of the class;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004(1)(h): limit or deny an existing preemptive right of all or part of the shares of the class; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004(1)(i): cancel or otherwise affect rights to distributions or dividends that have accumulated but not yet been declared on all or part of the shares of the class.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004(2): (3); (1) Except as otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004(3): If a proposed amendment that entitles two or more series of a class of shares to vote as separate voting groups under this section would affect those two or more series in the same or a substantially similar way, the shares of all the series so affected shall instead vote together as a single voting group on the proposed amendment.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004(4): (5) Except as otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1004(5): Notwithstanding the rights granted by this section to holders of the outstanding shares of a class or series to vote as a separate voting group, the rights may be otherwise restricted if so provided in the original articles of incorporation, in any amendment thereto which created the class or series or which was adopted prior to the issuance of any shares of the class or series, or in any amendment thereto which was authorized by a resolution or resolutions adopted by the affirmative vote of the holders of a majority of the class or series.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1005 Amendment before issuance of shares.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
If a corporation has not yet issued shares, its board of directors or, if no board of directors has been appointed, its incorporators, may adopt any amendments to the corporation's articles of incorporation.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1006 Articles of amendment.
--------------------------------------------------------
A corporation amending its articles of incorporation shall deliver to the division for filing articles of amendment setting forth:Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1006(1): the name of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1006(2): the text of each amendment adopted;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1006(3): if an amendment provides for an exchange, reclassification, or cancellation of issued shares, provisions for implementing the amendment if not contained in the amendment itself;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1006(4): the date of each amendment's adoption;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1006(5): if an amendment was adopted by the incorporators or board of directors without shareholder action, a statement to that effect and that shareholder action was not required; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1006(6): if an amendment was approved by the shareholders:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1006(6)(a): the designation, number of outstanding shares, number of votes entitled to be cast by each voting group entitled to vote separately on the amendment, and number of votes of each voting group indisputably represented at the meeting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1006(6)(b): either the total number of votes cast for and against the amendment by each voting group entitled to vote separately on the amendment or the total number of undisputed votes cast for the amendment by each voting group and a statement that the number of votes cast for the amendment by each voting group entitled to vote separately on the amendment was sufficient for approval by that voting group.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1007 Restated articles of incorporation.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1007(1): A corporation's board of directors may restate its articles of incorporation at any time with or without shareholder action.  A corporation's incorporators may restate its articles of incorporation at any time if the corporation has not issued shares and if no directors have been appointed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1007(2): 16-10a-1003 The restatement may include one or more amendments to the articles of incorporation.  If the restatement includes an amendment requiring shareholder approval, it must be adopted as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1007(3): 16-10a-705 If the board of directors submits a restatement for shareholder action, the corporation shall give notice, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1007(4): 16-10a-1006 A corporation restating its articles of incorporation shall deliver to the division for filing articles of restatement setting forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1007(4)(a): the name of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1007(4)(b): the text of the restated articles of incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1007(4)(c): 16-10a-1006 if the restatement contains an amendment to the articles of incorporation, the information required to be set forth in articles of amendment by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1007(4)(d): if the restatement does not contain an amendment to the articles of incorporation, a statement to that effect; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1007(4)(e): if the restatement was adopted by the board of directors or incorporators without shareholder action, a statement as to how the restatement was adopted and that shareholder action was not required.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1007(5): 16-10a-123 Upon filing by the division or at any later effective date determined pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008 Amendment pursuant to reorganization.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008(1): 16-10a-202 A corporation's articles of incorporation may be amended without action by the board of directors or shareholders to carry out a plan or reorganization ordered or decreed by a court of competent jurisdiction under a statute of the United States if the articles of incorporation after amendment contain only provisions required or permitted by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008(2): (1) For an amendment to the articles of incorporation to be made pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008(2)(a): the name of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008(2)(b): the text of each amendment approved by the court;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008(2)(c): the date of the court's order or decree approving the articles of amendment;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008(2)(d): the title of the reorganization proceeding in which the order or decree was entered; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008(2)(e): a statement that the court had jurisdiction of the proceeding under a specified statute of the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008(3): Shareholders of a corporation undergoing reorganization do not have dissenters' rights except as and to the extent provided in the reorganization plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008(4): This section does not apply after entry of a final decree in the reorganization proceeding even though the court retains jurisdiction of the proceeding for limited purposes unrelated to consummation of the reorganization plan.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5 Conversion to a nonprofit corporation.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(1): Title 16, Chapter 6a, Utah Revised Nonprofit Corporation Act; Title 16, Chapter 6a, Utah Revised Nonprofit Corporation Act; 16-6a-203
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(1)(a): Title 16, Chapter 6a, Utah Revised Nonprofit Corporation Act A corporation may convert to a nonprofit corporation subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(1)(b): Title 16, Chapter 6a, Utah Revised Nonprofit Corporation Act; 16-6a-203 The day on which a corporation files an amendment under this section, the corporation becomes a nonprofit corporation subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(1)(b)(i): commenced its existence under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(1)(b)(ii): otherwise was created, formed, incorporated, or came into being.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(2): The amendment of the articles of incorporation to convert to a nonprofit corporation shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(2)(a): revise the statement of purposes of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(2)(b): delete:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(2)(b)(i): the authorization for shares; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(2)(b)(ii): any provision relating to authorized or issued shares;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(2)(c): if any shares have been issued, provide for:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(2)(c)(i): the cancellation of issued shares; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(2)(c)(ii): the conversion of the shares to membership interests in the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(2)(d): make such other changes as may be necessary or desired.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(3): If the corporation has issued shares, an amendment to convert to a nonprofit corporation shall be approved by all of the outstanding shares of all classes of shares regardless of limitations or restrictions on the voting rights of the shares.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(4): If an amendment pursuant to this section is included in a merger agreement, this section applies, except that any provision for the cancellation or conversion of shares shall be set forth in the merger agreement and not in the amendment of the articles of incorporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(5): The conversion of a corporation into a nonprofit corporation does not affect:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(5)(a): an obligation or liability of the converting corporation incurred before its conversion to a nonprofit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(5)(b): the personal liability of any person incurred before the conversion.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6): (6)(a)(ii); (6)(a); (6)(a); (6)(a); (b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(a): (6)(a)(ii); (6)(a); (6)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(a)(i): (6)(a)(ii); (6)(a) When a conversion is effective under this section, for purposes of the laws of this state, the things listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(a)(i)(A): vest in the nonprofit corporation to which the corporation converts;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(a)(i)(B): are the property of the nonprofit corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(a)(i)(C): (6)(a) are not considered transferred by the converting corporation to the nonprofit corporation by operation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(a)(ii): (6)(a) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(a)(ii)(A): its rights, privileges, and powers;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(a)(ii)(B): its interests in property, whether real, personal, or mixed;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(a)(ii)(C): debts due to the converting corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(a)(ii)(D): debts, liabilities, and duties of the converting corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(a)(ii)(E): rights and obligations under contract of the converting corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(a)(ii)(F): other things and causes of action belonging to the converting corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(b): The title to any real property vested by deed or otherwise in a corporation converting to a nonprofit corporation does not revert and is not in any way impaired by reason of this chapter or of the conversion.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(c): (6)(a); (b) A right of a creditor or a lien on property of a converting corporation that is described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(d): A debt, liability, or duty of a converting corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(d)(i): remains attached to the nonprofit corporation to which the corporation converts; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(d)(ii): may be enforced against the nonprofit corporation to the same extent as if the debts, liabilities, and duties had been incurred or contracted by the nonprofit corporation in its capacity as a nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(e): A converted corporation upon conversion to a nonprofit corporation pursuant to this section is considered the same entity as the nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(f): In connection with a conversion of a corporation to a nonprofit corporation under this section, the interests or rights in the corporation which is to be converted may be exchanged or converted into one or more of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(f)(i): cash, property, interests, or rights in the nonprofit corporation to which it is converted; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(f)(ii): cash, property or interests in, or rights in another entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(g): Unless otherwise agreed:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(g)(i): a converting corporation is not required solely as a result of the conversion to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(g)(i)(A): wind up its affairs;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(g)(i)(B): pay its liabilities; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(g)(i)(C): distribute its assets; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.5(6)(g)(ii): a conversion is not considered to constitute a dissolution of the corporation, but constitutes a continuation of the existence of the corporation in the form of a nonprofit corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7 Conversion to or from a domestic limited liability company.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1): Title 48, Chapter 3a, Utah Revised Uniform Limited Liability Company Act; 48-3a-1405; (1); 48-3a-1041; (1); 48-3a-1045; 48-3a-1046; 48-3a-1045
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(a): Title 48, Chapter 3a, Utah Revised Uniform Limited Liability Company Act; 48-3a-1405; (1); 48-3a-1041 A corporation may convert to a domestic limited liability company subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(a)(i): (1) this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(a)(ii): 48-3a-1041 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(b): (1); 48-3a-1045; 48-3a-1046 If a corporation converts to a domestic limited liability company in accordance with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(b)(i): 48-3a-1045; 48-3a-1046 comply with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(b)(ii): if the corporation has issued shares, provide for:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(b)(ii)(A): the cancellation of any issued share; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(b)(ii)(B): the conversion of any issued share to a membership interest in the domestic limited liability company.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(c): 48-3a-1045 Before a statement of conversion, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(c)(i): in the manner provided for the articles of incorporation or bylaws of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(c)(ii): if the articles of incorporation or bylaws of the corporation do not provide the method for approval:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(c)(ii)(A): if the corporation has issued shares, by all of the outstanding shares of all classes of shares of the corporation regardless of limitations or restrictions on the voting rights of the shares; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(c)(ii)(B): if the corporation has not issued shares, by a majority of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(c)(ii)(B)(I): the directors in office at the time that the conversion is approved by the board of directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(1)(c)(ii)(B)(II): if directors have not been appointed or elected, the incorporators.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(2): 48-3a-1041; 48-3a-1405 A domestic limited liability company may convert to a corporation subject to this chapter by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(2)(a): filing articles of incorporation in accordance with this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1008.7(2)(b): 48-3a-1041; 48-3a-1405 complying with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1009 Effect of amendment.
------------------------------------------------------
An amendment to articles of incorporation does not affect a cause of action existing against or in favor of the corporation, a proceeding to which the corporation is a party, or the existing rights of persons other than shareholders of the corporation.  An amendment changing a corporation's name does not abate a proceeding brought by or against the corporation in its former name.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1020 Amendment of bylaws by board of directors or shareholders.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1020(1): A corporation's board of directors may amend the corporation's bylaws at any time, except to the extent that the articles of incorporation, the bylaws, or this chapter reserve this power exclusively to the shareholders, in whole or part.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1020(2): A corporation's shareholders may amend the corporation's bylaws at any time, even though the bylaws may also be amended at any time by the board of directors.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1021 Bylaw changing quorum or voting requirement for shareholders.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1021(1): Part 7, Shareholders If authorized by the articles of incorporation or this chapter, the shareholders may adopt, amend, or repeal a bylaw that fixes a greater quorum or voting requirement for shareholders, or voting groups of shareholders, than is required by this chapter.  Such action is subject to the provisions of
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1021(2): (1) A bylaw that fixes a greater quorum or voting requirement for shareholders under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1022 Bylaw changing quorum or voting requirement for directors.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1022(1): (2) A bylaw that fixes a greater quorum or voting requirement for the board of directors than is required by this chapter may be amended or repealed:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1022(1)(a): (2) if originally adopted by the shareholders, only by the shareholders, unless otherwise permitted as contemplated by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1022(1)(b): if originally adopted by the board of directors, by the shareholders or unless otherwise provided in the articles of incorporation or bylaws, by the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1022(2): A bylaw adopted or amended by the shareholders that fixes a greater quorum or voting requirement for the board of directors may provide that it may be amended or repealed only by a specified vote of either the shareholders or the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1022(3): (1)(b) Action by the board of directors under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1023 Bylaw provisions relating to election of directors.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1023(1): (2); 16-10a-728(2) A corporation that has shares listed on a national securities exchange or regularly traded in a market maintained by one or more members of a national or affiliated securities association may elect in its bylaws to be governed in the election of directors by Subsection
