Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1507(3): The name is registered for the applicant upon the effective date of the application, and the initial registration is effective until the end of the calendar year in which it became effective.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1507(4): (1); (2) A foreign corporation that has in effect a registration of its corporate name as permitted by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1507(5): A foreign corporation that has in effect registration of its corporate name may apply for authority to transact business in this state under the registered name in accordance with the procedure set forth in this part or it may assign the registration to another foreign corporation by delivering to the division for filing an assignment of the registration that states the registered name, the name of the assigning foreign corporation, and the name of the assignee, concurrently with the delivery to the division for filing of the assignee's application for registration of the name.  The assignee's application shall meet the requirements of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1507(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1507(6)(a): A foreign corporation that has in effect registration of its corporate name may terminate the registration at any time by delivering to the division for filing a statement of termination setting forth the corporate name and stating that the registration is terminated.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1507(6)(b): A registration automatically terminates upon the filing of an application for authority to transact business in this state under the registered name.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1507(7): (1); 16-10a-403 The registration of a corporate name under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1510 Resignation of registered agent of foreign corporation.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1510(1): The registered agent of a foreign corporation authorized to transact business in this state may resign the agency appointment by delivering to the division for filing a statement of resignation, which shall be signed by the resigning registered agent and accompanied by two exact or conformed copies of the statement of resignation.  The statement of resignation may include a statement that the registered office is also discontinued.  The statement of resignation filed by the registered agent shall include a declaration that notice of the resignation has been given to the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1510(2): After filing the statement of resignation, the division shall deliver one copy of the resignation to the registered office of the foreign corporation and the other copy to its principal office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1510(3): The agency appointment terminates, and the registered office discontinues if so provided, on the 31st day after the filing date of the statement of resignation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1511 Service on foreign corporation.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1511(1): (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1511(2): The registered agent of a foreign corporation authorized to transact business in this state is the foreign corporation's agent for service of process, notice, or demand required or permitted by law to be served on the foreign corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1511(3): (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1511(3)(a): If a foreign corporation authorized to transact business in this state has no registered agent or if the registered agent cannot with reasonable diligence be served, the foreign corporation may be served by mail that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1511(3)(a)(i): registered or certified;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1511(3)(a)(ii): return receipt requested; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1511(3)(a)(iii): addressed to the foreign corporation at its principal office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1511(3)(b): (3) Service is perfected under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1511(3)(b)(i): the date the foreign corporation receives the process, notice, or demand;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1511(3)(b)(ii): the date shown on the return receipt, if signed on behalf of the foreign corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1511(3)(b)(iii): five days after mailing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1511(4): This section does not prescribe the only means, or necessarily the required means, of serving a foreign corporation authorized to transact business in this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520 Withdrawal of foreign corporation.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(1): A foreign corporation authorized to transact business in this state may not withdraw from this state until the foreign corporation's application for withdrawal has been filed by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(2): 16-10a-1521 A foreign corporation authorized to transact business in this state may apply for withdrawal by delivering to the division for filing an application for withdrawal that states:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(2)(a): the foreign corporation's corporate name and assumed name, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(2)(b): the name of the state or country under whose law the foreign corporation is incorporated;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(2)(c): 16-10a-1521 the address of the foreign corporation's principal office, or if none is to be maintained, a statement that the corporation will not maintain a principal office, and if different from the address of the principal office or if no principal office is to be maintained, the address to which service of process may be mailed pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(2)(d): that the corporation is not transacting business in this state and that the foreign corporation surrenders the foreign corporation's authority to transact business in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(2)(e): whether the foreign corporation's registered agent will continue to be authorized to accept service on the foreign corporation's behalf in any proceeding based on a cause of action arising during the time the foreign corporation was authorized to transact business in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(2)(f): the federal employer identification number of the foreign corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(2)(g): any additional information that the division determines is necessary or appropriate to determine whether the corporation is entitled to withdraw, and to determine and assess any unpaid taxes, fees, and penalties payable by the foreign corporation as prescribed by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(3): (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(3)(a): After receiving a foreign corporation's application for withdrawal, the division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(3)(a)(i): provide the State Tax Commission with the foreign corporation's federal employer identification number; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(3)(a)(ii): request that the State Tax Commission certify that the foreign corporation is in good standing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(3)(b): The State Tax Commission shall certify that a foreign corporation is in good standing if the foreign corporation has paid all taxes, fees, and penalties the foreign corporation owed to the State Tax Commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(3)(c): (3)(b) If a foreign corporation is not in good standing as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(3)(c)(i): notify the division, stating that the foreign corporation is not in good standing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(3)(c)(ii): notify the foreign corporation, explaining in detail why the foreign corporation is not in good standing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(4): (2); (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(4)(a): (2); (3)(b) The division shall approve a foreign corporation's application for withdrawal if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(4)(a)(i): (2) the division determines that the application for withdrawal contains the information required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(4)(a)(ii): the division determines the information in the application is correct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(4)(a)(iii): (3)(b) the State Tax Commission certifies that the foreign corporation is in good standing as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1520(4)(b): The division shall mail written notice of the withdrawal stating the effective date of the withdrawal to the foreign corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1521 Service on withdrawn foreign corporation.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1521(1): 16-10a-1520 A foreign corporation that has withdrawn from this state pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1521(1)(a): maintain a registered agent in this state to accept service on its behalf in any proceeding based on a cause of action arising during the time it was authorized to transact business in this state, in which case the continued authority of the registered agent shall be specified in the application for withdrawal; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1521(1)(b): be considered to have authorized service of process on it in connection with any cause of action by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1521(1)(b)(i): the address of its principal office, if any, set forth in its application for withdrawal or as last changed by notice delivered to the division for filing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1521(1)(b)(ii): the address for service of process that is stated in its application for withdrawal or as last changed by notice delivered to the division for filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1521(2): (1)(b) Service effected pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1521(2)(a): the date the withdrawn foreign corporation receives the process, notice, or demand;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1521(2)(b): the date shown on the return receipt, if signed on behalf of the withdrawn foreign corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1521(2)(c): five days after mailing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1521(3): (1) Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1530 Grounds for revocation.
---------------------------------------------------------
The division may commence a proceeding under SectionUtah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1530(1): the foreign corporation does not deliver its annual report to the division when it is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1530(2): the foreign corporation does not pay when they are due any taxes, fees, or penalties imposed by this chapter or other applicable laws of this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1530(3): the foreign corporation is without a registered agent in this state for 30 days or more;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1530(4): the foreign corporation does not inform the division by an appropriate filing within 30 days of the change or resignation that its registered agent has changed or that its registered agent has resigned;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1530(5): an incorporator, director, officer, or agent of the foreign corporation signs a document knowing it is false in any material respect with intent that the document be delivered to the division for filing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1530(6): the division receives a duly authenticated certificate from the lieutenant governor or other official having custody of corporate records in the state or country under whose law the foreign corporation is incorporated stating that the corporation has dissolved or disappeared as the result of a merger.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531 Procedure for and effect of revocation.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(1): 16-10a-1530 If the division determines that one or more grounds exist under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(1)(a): the division's determination that one or more grounds exist for revocation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(1)(b): the grounds for revocation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(2): (1); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(2)(a): (1) If the foreign corporation does not correct each ground for revocation or demonstrate to the reasonable satisfaction of the division that each ground determined by the division does not exist, within 60 days after mailing the notice under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(2)(b): (2)(a) If a foreign corporation's authority to transact business in this state is revoked under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(2)(b)(i): revocation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(2)(b)(ii): the effective date of the revocation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(2)(c): The division shall mail a copy of the notice to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(2)(c)(i): the last registered agent of the foreign corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(2)(c)(ii): if there is no registered agent of record, at least one officer of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(3): The authority of a foreign corporation to transact business in this state ceases on the date shown on the division's certificate revoking the corporation's certificate of authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(4): Revocation of a foreign corporation's authority to transact business in this state does not terminate the authority of the registered agent of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(5): A notice mailed under this section shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(5)(a): mailed first-class, postage prepaid; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(5)(b): addressed to the most current mailing address appearing on the records of the division for:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(5)(b)(i): the registered agent of the foreign corporation, if the notice is required to be mailed to the registered agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1531(5)(b)(ii): the officer of the foreign corporation that is mailed the notice, if the notice is required to be mailed to an officer of the foreign corporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1532 Appeal from revocation.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1532(1): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration If the division revokes a foreign corporation's authority to transact business in this state, the foreign corporation may petition a court with jurisdiction under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1532(2): (1); 16-10a-1531 A foreign corporation shall file a petition under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1532(3): (1) The petition under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1532(4): (1) If a petition is filed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1532(5): The court's final decision is appealable as in other civil proceedings.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533 Domestication of foreign corporations.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(1): (2); 16-10a-1003
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(1)(a): (2) Any foreign corporation may become a domestic corporation by delivering to the division for filing articles of domestication meeting the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(1)(b): 16-10a-1003 The adoption and approval of the domestication shall be in accordance with the consent requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(2): 16-10a-120; 16-10a-202
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(2)(a): 16-10a-120; 16-10a-202 The articles of domestication shall meet the requirements applicable to articles of incorporation set forth in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(2)(a)(i): the articles of domestication need not name, or be signed by, the incorporators of the foreign corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(2)(a)(ii): any reference to the corporation's registered office, registered agent, or directors shall be to the registered office and agent in Utah, and the directors then in office at the time of filing the articles of domestication.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(2)(b): The articles of domestication shall set forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(2)(b)(i): the date on which and jurisdiction where the corporation was first formed, incorporated, or otherwise came into being;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(2)(b)(ii): the name of the corporation immediately prior to the filing of the articles of domestication;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(2)(b)(iii): any jurisdiction that constituted the seat, location of incorporation, principal place of business, or central administration of the corporation immediately prior to the filing of the articles of domestication; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(2)(b)(iv): a statement that the articles of domestication were adopted by the corporation's board of directors and approved by its shareholders.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(3)(a): Upon the filing of articles of domestication with the division, the corporation shall be domesticated in this state, shall thereafter be subject to all of the provisions of this chapter, and shall continue as if it had been incorporated under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(3)(b): Notwithstanding any other provisions of this chapter, the existence of the corporation shall be considered to have commenced on the date the corporation commenced its existence in the jurisdiction in which the corporation was first formed, incorporated, or otherwise came into being.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(4): The articles of domestication, upon filing with the division, shall become the articles of incorporation of the corporation, and shall be subject to amendments or restatement the same as any other articles of incorporation under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(5): The domestication of any corporation in this state may not be considered to affect any obligation or liability of the corporation incurred prior to its domestication.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533(6): The filing of the articles of domestication does not affect the choice of law applicable to the corporation, except that from the date the articles of domestication are filed, the law of Utah, including the provisions of this chapter, shall apply to the corporation to the same extent as if the corporation had been incorporated as a corporation of this state on that date.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5 Transfer to another state.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(1): A domestic corporation may transfer to or domesticate in a jurisdiction other than this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(1)(a): that jurisdiction permits the transfer to or domestication of the corporation in the jurisdiction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(1)(b): the transfer is approved by the shareholders as provided in the corporation's bylaws or, if the bylaws do not so provide, by all of the shareholders.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(2): (2)(b); 16-10a-1503; (2)(b)(vii)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(2)(a): (2)(b) A domestic corporation transfers to or domesticates in a jurisdiction other than this state by delivering to the division for filing articles of transfer meeting the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(2)(b): 16-10a-1503; (2)(b)(vii) Articles of transfer shall state:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(2)(b)(i): the name of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(2)(b)(ii): the date of filing of the corporation's original articles of incorporation with the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(2)(b)(iii): the jurisdiction to which the corporation is to be transferred or in which it is to be domesticated;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(2)(b)(iv): the future effective date, which shall be a date certain, of the transfer or domestication if it is not to be effective upon the filing of the articles of transfer;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(2)(b)(v): that the transfer or domestication has been approved by the shareholders;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(2)(b)(vi): that the existence of the corporation as a domestic corporation of this state shall cease when the articles of transfer become effective;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(2)(b)(vii): the agreement of the corporation that it may be served with process in this state in any proceeding for enforcement of any obligation of the corporation arising while it was a corporation under the laws of this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(2)(b)(viii): 16-10a-1503; (2)(b)(vii) if the corporation does not apply for authority to transact business in this state as a foreign corporation pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(3): When the articles of transfer are filed with the division, or upon the future, delayed effective date of the articles of transfer, and after payment to the division of the fees prescribed under this chapter, the corporation shall cease to exist as a domestic corporation of this state.  Thereafter, a certificate of the division as to the transfer is prima facie evidence of the transfer or domestication by the corporation out of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(4): Transfer or domestication of a corporation out of this state in accordance with this section and the resulting cessation of its existence as a domestic corporation of this state may not be considered to affect:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(4)(a): an obligation or liability of the corporation incurred before the transfer or domestication or the personal liability of any person incurred before the transfer or domestication, including, any taxes owing to this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1533.5(4)(b): the choice of law applicable to the corporation with respect to matters arising before the transfer or domestication.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601 Corporate records.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(1): A corporation shall keep as permanent records minutes of all meetings of its shareholders and board of directors, a record of all actions taken by the shareholders or board of directors without a meeting, and a record of all actions taken on behalf of the corporation by a committee of the board of directors in place of the board of directors, and a record of all waivers of notices of meetings of shareholders, meetings of the board of directors, or any meetings of committees of the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(2): A corporation shall maintain appropriate accounting records.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(3): A corporation or its agent shall maintain a record of the names and addresses of its shareholders, in a form that permits preparation of a list of shareholders:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(3)(a): that is arranged by voting group and within each voting group by class or series of shares;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(3)(b): that is in alphabetical order within each class or series; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(3)(c): that shows the address of and the number of shares of each class and series held by each shareholder.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(4): A corporation shall maintain its records in written form or in any form capable of conversion into written form within a reasonable time.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(5): 16-10a-1607; 16-10a-1605 A corporation shall keep a copy of the following records at its principal office:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(5)(a): its articles of incorporation currently in effect;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(5)(b): its bylaws currently in effect;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(5)(c): the minutes of all shareholders' meetings, and records of all action taken by shareholders without a meeting, for the past three years;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(5)(d): all written communications within the past three years to shareholders as a group or to the holders of any class or series of shares as a group;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(5)(e): a list of the names and business addresses of its current officers and directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(5)(f): 16-10a-1607 its most recent annual report delivered to the division under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1601(5)(g): 16-10a-1605 all financial statements prepared for periods ending during the last three years that a shareholder could request under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602 Inspection of records by shareholders and directors.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(1): 16-10a-1601(5) A shareholder or director of a corporation is entitled to inspect and copy, during regular business hours at the corporation's principal office, any of the records of the corporation described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(2): (1); (3); 16-10a-1601(3) In addition to the rights set forth in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(2)(a): excerpts from:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(2)(a)(i): minutes of any meeting, records of any action taken by the board of directors, or by a committee of the board of directors while acting on behalf of the corporation in place of the board of directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(2)(a)(ii): minutes of any meeting of the shareholders;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(2)(a)(iii): records of any action taken by the shareholders without a meeting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(2)(a)(iv): waivers of notices of any meeting of the shareholders, of any meeting of the board of directors, or of any meeting of a committee of the board of directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(2)(b): accounting records of the corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(2)(c): 16-10a-1601(3) the record of shareholders described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(3): (2) A shareholder or director is entitled to inspect and copy records as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(3)(a): the demand is made in good faith and for a proper purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(3)(b): the shareholder or director describes with reasonable particularity his purpose and the records he desires to inspect; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(3)(c): the records are directly connected with his purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(4): For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(4)(a): "proper purpose" means a purpose reasonably related to the demanding shareholder's or director's interest as a shareholder or director; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(4)(b): "shareholder" includes a beneficial owner whose shares are held in a voting trust and any other beneficial owner who establishes beneficial ownership.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(5): The right of inspection granted by this section may not be abolished by a corporation's articles of incorporation or bylaws.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(6): 16-10a-720 This section does not affect:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(6)(a): 16-10a-720 the right of a shareholder or director to inspect records under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(6)(b): the power of a court, independent of this chapter, to compel the production of corporate records for examination.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1602(7): (2); (3) A shareholder or director may not use any information obtained through the inspection or copying of records permitted by Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1603 Scope of inspection right.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1603(1): A shareholder's or director's agent or attorney has the same inspection and copying rights as the shareholder or director represented by the agent or attorney.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1603(2): 16-10a-1602 The right to copy records under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1603(3): 16-10a-1606 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1603(4): 16-10a-1602(2)(c); 16-10a-1601(3) The corporation may comply with a shareholder's or director's demand to inspect the record of shareholders under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1604 Court-ordered inspection.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1604(1): 16-10a-1602(1); Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1604(1)(a): 16-10a-1602(1); Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration If a corporation does not allow a shareholder or director, or the shareholder's or director's agent or attorney, who complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1604(1)(b): (1)(a) If a petition is filed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1604(2): 16-10a-1602(2); (3); Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1604(2)(a): 16-10a-1602(2); (3); Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration If a corporation does not within a reasonable time allow a shareholder or director, or the shareholder's or director's agent or attorney, who complies with Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1604(2)(b): (2)(a) If a petition is filed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1604(2)(c): The court shall dispose of a petition under this subsection on an expedited basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1604(3): If a court orders inspection or copying of records demanded, the court shall also order the corporation to pay the shareholder's or director's costs incurred to obtain the order, including reasonable counsel fees, unless the corporation proves that it refused inspection in good faith because it had a reasonable basis for doubt about the right of the shareholder or director, or the shareholder's or director's agent or attorney, to inspect the records demanded.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1604(4): (2) If a court orders inspection or copying of records demanded, the court may:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1604(4)(a): impose reasonable restrictions on the use or distribution of the records by the demanding shareholder or director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1604(4)(b): order the corporation to pay the shareholder or director for any damages incurred as a result of the corporation's denial if the court determines that the corporation did not act in good faith in refusing to allow the inspection or copying;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1604(4)(c): (2) if inspection or copying is ordered pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1604(4)(d): grant the shareholder or director any other available legal remedy.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1605 Financial statements.
-------------------------------------------------------
Upon the written request of any shareholder, a corporation shall mail to him its most recent annual or quarterly financial statements showing in reasonable detail its assets and liabilities and the results of its operations.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1606 Information respecting shares.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Upon the written request of any shareholder, a corporation at its own expense shall mail to him the information specified by Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1607 Annual report for division.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1607(1): 16-17-203(1) Each domestic corporation, and each foreign corporation authorized to transact business in this state, shall deliver to the division for filing an annual report on a form provided by the division that sets forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1607(1)(a): the corporate name of the domestic or foreign corporation and any assumed corporate name of the foreign corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1607(1)(b): the jurisdiction under whose law it is incorporated;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1607(1)(c): 16-17-203(1) the information required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1607(1)(d): the street address of its principal office, wherever located; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1607(1)(e): the names of its principal officers.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1607(2): The division shall deliver a copy of the prescribed form of annual report to each domestic corporation and each foreign corporation authorized to transact business in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1607(3): Information in the annual report shall be current as of the date the annual report is executed on behalf of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1607(4): The annual report of a domestic or foreign corporation shall be delivered annually to the division no later than the end of the second calendar month following the calendar month in which the report form is mailed by the division.  Proof to the satisfaction of the division that the corporation has mailed an annual report form is considered in compliance with this subsection.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1607(5): If an annual report contains the information required by this section, the division shall file it.  If a report does not contain the information required by this section, the division shall promptly notify the reporting domestic or foreign corporation in writing and return the report to it for correction.  If the report was otherwise timely filed and is corrected to contain the information required by this section and delivered to the division within 30 days after the effective date of the notice of rejection, the annual report is considered to be timely filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1607(6): The fact that an individual's name is signed on an annual report form is prima facie evidence for division purposes that the individual is authorized to certify the report on behalf of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1607(7): The annual report form provided by the division may be designed to provide a simplified certification by the corporation if no changes have been made in the required information from the last preceding report filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1607(8): A domestic or foreign corporation may, but may not be required to, deliver to the division for filing an amendment to its annual report reflecting any change in the information contained in its annual report as last amended.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1608 Statement of person named as director or officer.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1608(1): Any person named as a director or officer of a domestic or foreign corporation in an annual report or other document on file with the division may, if he does not hold the named position, deliver to the division for filing a statement setting forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1608(1)(a): his name;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1608(1)(b): the domestic or foreign corporation's name;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1608(1)(c): information sufficient to identify the report or other document in which he is named as a director or officer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1608(1)(d): the date on which he ceased to be a director or officer of the domestic or foreign corporation, or a statement that he did not hold the position for which he was named in the corporate report or other document.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1701 Application to existing domestic corporations.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Except as otherwise provided in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1702 Application to foreign corporations.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
A foreign corporation authorized to transact business in this state on July 1, 1992, is subject to this chapter, but is not required to obtain a new certificate of authority to transact business under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1703 Publication.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1703(1): The division shall annually publish copies of this chapter, together with applicable annotations and commentary, for sale and distribution to the public.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1703(2): The division may charge a reasonable amount for copies of the chapter sold or distributed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1703(3): 13-1-2 The proceeds from all sales and distributions shall be deposited into the Commerce Service Account created by Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1704 Saving provisions.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1704(1): (2) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1704(1)(a): the operation of the statute or any action taken under it before its repeal;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1704(1)(b): any ratification, right, remedy, privilege, obligation, or liability acquired, accrued, or incurred under the statute before its repeal;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1704(1)(c): any violation of the statute, or any penalty, forfeiture, or punishment incurred because of the violation of the statute before its repeal; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1704(1)(d): any proceeding, reorganization, or dissolution commenced under the statute before its repeal, and any proceeding, reorganization, or dissolution may be completed in accordance with the repealed statute as if the statute had not been repealed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1704(2): If a penalty or punishment imposed for violation of a statute repealed by this act is reduced by this act, the penalty or punishment if not already imposed shall be imposed in accordance with this act.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1704(3): 16-10a-630(1); (3); 16-10a-630(2) The provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1704(4): 16-10a-704 The provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1704(4)(a): by a consent in writing, setting forth the proposed resolution, signed by all of the shareholders entitled to vote with respect to the subject matter of the resolution; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1704(4)(b): at a duly convened meeting of shareholders, by the vote of the same percentage of shareholders of each voting group as would be required to include the resolution in an amendment to the corporation's articles of incorporation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1705 Severability clause.
------------------------------------------------------
If any provision of this act, or the application of any provision to any person or circumstance, is held invalid, the remainder of this act is given effect without the invalid provision or application.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1801 Title.
----------------------------------------
This part is known as "Business Combinations."

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802 Definitions.
----------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(1): 16-10a-102 "Affiliate" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(2): "Announcement date," when used in reference to a business combination, means the date of the first public announcement of the final, definitive proposal for the business combination.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(3): "Associate," when used to indicate a relationship with a person, means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(3)(a): a corporation or organization of which the person is an officer or partner or is, directly or indirectly, the beneficial owner of 10% or more of any class of voting stock;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(3)(b): a trust or other estate in which the person has a substantial beneficial interest or as to which the person serves as trustee or in a similar fiduciary capacity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(3)(c): a relative or spouse of the person, or any relative of the spouse, who has the same home as the person.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(4): (4)(b)(ii); (4)(b)(ii) "Beneficial owner," when used with respect to stock, means a person:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(4)(a): that, individually or with or through any of its affiliates or associates, beneficially owns the stock, directly or indirectly;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(4)(b): (4)(b)(ii) that, individually or with or through any of its affiliates or associates, has:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(4)(b)(i): the right to acquire the stock:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(4)(b)(i)(A): whether the right is exercisable immediately or only after the passage of time, pursuant to an agreement, arrangement, or understanding, whether or not in writing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(4)(b)(i)(B): upon the exercise of conversion rights, exchange rights, warrants, or options, or otherwise, except that a person may not be considered the beneficial owner of stock tendered pursuant to a tender or exchange offer made by the person or an affiliate or associate of the person until the tendered stock is accepted for purchase or exchange; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(4)(b)(ii): (4)(b)(ii) the right to vote the stock pursuant to an agreement, arrangement, or understanding, whether or not in writing, except that a person may not be considered the beneficial owner of any stock under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(4)(c): (4)(b)(ii) that has an agreement, arrangement, or understanding, whether or not in writing, for the purpose of acquiring, holding, voting, except voting pursuant to a revocable proxy or consent as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(5): "Business combination," when used in reference to any domestic corporation and an interested shareholder of the corporation, means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(5)(a): a merger or consolidation of the corporation or any subsidiary of the corporation with:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(5)(a)(i): the interested shareholder; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(5)(a)(ii): any other corporation, whether or not that corporation is an interested shareholder of the corporation, that is, or after the merger or consolidation would be, an affiliate or associate of the interested shareholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(5)(b): any sale, lease, exchange, mortgage, pledge, transfer, or other disposition, in one transaction or a series of transactions, to or with the interested shareholder or any affiliate or associate of the interested shareholder of assets of the corporation or any subsidiary of the corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(5)(b)(i): having an aggregate market value equal to 10% or more of the aggregate market value of all the assets, determined on a consolidated basis, of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(5)(b)(ii): having an aggregate market value equal to 10% or more of the aggregate market value of all the outstanding stock of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(5)(b)(iii): representing 10% or more of the earning power or net income, determined on a consolidated basis, of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(5)(c): the issuance or transfer by the corporation or any subsidiary of the corporation, in one transaction or a series of transactions, of any stock of the corporation or any subsidiary of the corporation that has an aggregate market value equal to 5% or more of the aggregate market value of all the outstanding stock of the corporation to the interested shareholder or any affiliate or associate of the interested shareholder except pursuant to the exercise of warrants or rights to purchase stock offered, or a dividend or distribution paid or made, pro rata to all shareholders of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(5)(d): the adoption of any plan or proposal for the liquidation or dissolution of the corporation proposed by, or pursuant to any agreement, arrangement, or understanding, whether or not in writing, with, the interested shareholder or any affiliate or associate of the interested shareholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(5)(e): any reclassification of securities, including a stock split, stock dividend, or other distribution of stock in respect of stock, or any reverse stock split, or recapitalization of the corporation, or any merger or consolidation of the corporation with any subsidiary of the corporation, or any other transaction, whether or not with, into, or otherwise involving the interested shareholder:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(5)(e)(i): proposed by, or pursuant to any agreement, arrangement, or understanding, whether or not in writing, with, the interested shareholder or any affiliate or associate of the interested shareholder; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(5)(e)(ii): that has the effect, directly or indirectly, of increasing the proportionate share of the outstanding shares of any class or series of voting stock or securities convertible into voting stock of the corporation or any subsidiary of the corporation that is directly or indirectly owned by the interested shareholder or any affiliate or associate of the interested shareholder, except as a result of immaterial changes due to fractional share adjustments; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(5)(f): a receipt by the interested shareholder or an affiliate or associate of the interested shareholder of the benefit, directly or indirectly, except proportionately as a shareholder of the corporation, of a loan, advance, guarantee, pledge, or other financial assistance or any tax credit or other tax advantage provided by or through the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(6): "Common stock" means stock other than preferred stock.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(7): "Consummation date," with respect to a business combination, means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(7)(a): the date of consummation of the business combination; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(7)(b): in the case of a business combination as to which a shareholder vote is taken, the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(7)(b)(i): the business day before the vote; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(7)(b)(ii): 20 days before the date of consummation of the business combination.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(8): 16-10a-102; (8)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(8)(a): 16-10a-102 "Control," including the terms "controlling," "controlled by," and "under common control with," means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(8)(b): A person's beneficial ownership of 10% or more of a corporation's outstanding voting stock creates a presumption that the person has control of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(8)(c): (8) Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(9): "Exchange Act" means the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, 15 U.S.C. Sec. 78a et seq. as amended.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(10): (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(10)(a): "Interested shareholder," when used in reference to a domestic corporation, means a person, other than the corporation or a subsidiary of the corporation, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(10)(a)(i): is the beneficial owner, directly or indirectly, of 20% or more of the outstanding voting stock of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(10)(a)(ii): is an affiliate or associate of the corporation and at any time within the five-year period immediately before the date in question was the beneficial owner, directly or indirectly, of 20% or more of the then outstanding voting stock of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(10)(b): (4) For the purpose of determining whether a person is an interested shareholder, the number of shares of voting stock of the corporation considered to be outstanding shall include shares considered to be beneficially owned by the person through application of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(11): (11)(a)(i); (11)(a)(i); (ii) "Market value," when used in reference to stock or property of a domestic corporation, means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(11)(a): (11)(a)(i); (11)(a)(i); (ii) in the case of stock:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(11)(a)(i): the highest closing sale price during the 30-day period immediately preceding the date in question of a share of the stock on the composite tape for New York stock exchange-listed stocks;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(11)(a)(ii): (11)(a)(i) if the stock is not quoted on the composite tape or listed on the exchange described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(11)(a)(iii): (11)(a)(i); (ii) if no quotation is available under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(11)(b): in the case of property other than cash or stock, the fair market value of the property on the date in question as determined by the board of directors of the corporation in good faith.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(12): "Preferred stock" means a class or series of stock of a domestic corporation that under the bylaws or articles of incorporation of the corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(12)(a): is entitled to receive payment of dividends before any payment of dividends on some other class or series of stock; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(12)(b): is entitled in the event of a voluntary liquidation, dissolution, or winding up of the corporation to receive payment or distribution of a preferential amount before a payment or distribution is received by some other class or series of stock.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(13): "Stock" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(13)(a): a stock or similar security, a certificate of interest, any participation in a profit sharing agreement, a voting trust certificate, or a certificate of deposit for stock;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(13)(b): a security convertible, with or without consideration, into stock;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(13)(c): a warrant, call, or other option or privilege of buying stock without being bound to do so; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(13)(d): any other security carrying a right to acquire, subscribe to, or purchase stock.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(14): "Stock acquisition date," with respect to a person and a domestic corporation, means the date that the person first becomes an interested shareholder of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(15): "Subsidiary" of a person means any other corporation of which a majority of the voting stock is owned, directly or indirectly, by the person.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1802(16): "Voting stock" means shares of capital stock of a corporation entitled to vote generally in the election of directors.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803 Business combinations.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(1): 16-10a-1804 Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this chapter, except Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(2)(a): If a good faith proposal is made in writing to the board of directors of the corporation regarding a business combination, the board of directors shall respond in writing, within 30 days or such shorter period, if any, as may be required by the Exchange Act, setting forth the board of directors' reasons for the board of directors' decision regarding the proposal.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(2)(b): If a good faith proposal to purchase stock is made in writing to the board of directors of the corporation, unless the board of directors responds affirmatively in writing within 30 days or such shorter period, if any, as may be required by the Exchange Act, the board of directors is considered to have disapproved the proposal.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(3): (2); 16-10a-1804; (4); (5); (6) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this chapter, except Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(4): A domestic corporation may engage in a business combination with an interested shareholder of the corporation if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(4)(a): the business combination is approved by the board of directors of the corporation before the interested shareholder's stock acquisition date; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(4)(b): the purchase of stock made by the interested shareholder on the interested shareholder's stock acquisition date is approved by the board of directors of the corporation before the interested shareholder's stock acquisition date.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(5): A domestic corporation may engage in a business combination with an interested shareholder of the corporation if the business combination is approved by the affirmative vote of the holders of a majority of the outstanding voting stock not beneficially owned by the interested shareholder or an affiliate or associate of the interested shareholder at a meeting called for that purpose no earlier than five years after the interested shareholder's stock acquisition date.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6): (6)(a); (b); (c); 16-10a-1802(5)(e); (5); (4); (5); (6) A domestic corporation may engage in a business combination with an interested shareholder of the corporation if the business combination meets all of the following conditions:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(a): the aggregate amount of the cash and the market value as of the consummation date of consideration, other than cash to be received per share by holders of outstanding shares of common stock of the corporation in the business combination, is at least equal to the higher of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(a)(i): the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(a)(i)(A): the highest per share price paid by the interested shareholder at a time when the interested shareholder was the beneficial owner, directly or indirectly, of 5% or more of the outstanding voting stock of the corporation, for any shares of common stock of the same class or series acquired by the interested shareholder within the five-year period immediately before the announcement date with respect to the business combination, or within the five-year period immediately before, or in, the transaction in which the interested shareholder became an interested shareholder, whichever is higher; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(a)(i)(B): interest compounded annually from the earliest date on which the highest per share acquisition price was paid through the consummation date at the rate for one-year United States treasury obligations from time to time in effect, less the aggregate amount of any cash dividends paid, and the market value of any dividends paid other than in cash, per share of common stock since the earliest date, up to the amount of the interest; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(a)(ii): the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(a)(ii)(A): the higher of the market value per share of common stock on the announcement date with respect to the business combination or on the interested shareholder's stock acquisition date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(a)(ii)(B): interest compounded annually from the acquisition date through the consummation date at the rate for one-year United States treasury obligations from time to time in effect, less the aggregate amount of any cash dividends paid, and the market value of any dividends paid other than in cash, per share of common stock since the acquisition date, up to the amount of the interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(b): the aggregate amount of the cash and the market value as of the consummation date of consideration other than cash to be received per share by holders of outstanding shares of any class or series of stock, other than common stock, of the corporation is at least equal to the highest of the following, whether or not the interested shareholder has previously acquired any shares of the class or series of stock:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(b)(i): the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(b)(i)(A): the higher of the highest per share price paid by the interested shareholder at a time when the interested shareholder was the beneficial owner, directly or indirectly, of 5% or more of the outstanding voting stock of the corporation, for any shares of the class or series of stock acquired by the interested shareholder within the five-year period immediately before the announcement date with respect to the business combination, or within the five-year period immediately before, or in, the transaction in which the interested shareholder became an interested shareholder, whichever is higher; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(b)(i)(B): interest compounded annually from the earliest date on which the highest per share acquisition price was paid through the consummation date at the rate for one-year United States treasury obligations from time to time in effect, less the aggregate amount of any cash dividends paid, and the market value of any dividends paid other than in cash, per share of the class or series of stock since the earliest date, up to the amount of the interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(b)(ii): the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(b)(ii)(A): the highest preferential amount per share to which the holders of shares of the class or series of stock are entitled in the event of a voluntary liquidation, dissolution, or winding up of the corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(b)(ii)(B): the aggregate amount of any dividends declared or due as to which the holders are entitled before payment of dividends on some other class or series of stock, unless the aggregate amount of the dividends is included in the preferential amount; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(b)(iii): the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(b)(iii)(A): the market value per share of the class or series of stock on the announcement date with respect to the business combination or on the interested shareholder's stock acquisition date, whichever is higher; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(b)(iii)(B): interest compounded annually from the acquisition date through the consummation date at the rate for one-year United States treasury obligations from time to time in effect, less the aggregate amount of any cash dividends paid, and the market value of any dividends paid other than in cash, per share of the class or series of stock since the acquisition date, up to the amount of the interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(c): the consideration to be received by holders of a particular class or series of outstanding stock, including common stock of the corporation, in the business combination is in cash or in the same form as the interested shareholder has used to acquire the largest number of shares of the class or series of stock previously acquired by the interested shareholder, and the consideration shall be distributed promptly;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(d): (6)(a); (b); (c) the holders of all outstanding shares of stock of the corporation not beneficially owned by the interested shareholder immediately before the consummation of the business combination are entitled to receive in the business combination cash or other consideration for the shares in compliance with Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(e): 16-10a-1802(5)(e); (5); (4); (5); (6) after the interested shareholder's stock acquisition date and before the consummation date with respect to the business combination, the interested shareholder has not become the beneficial owner of any additional shares of voting stock of the corporation except:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(e)(i): as part of the transaction that resulted in the interested shareholder becoming an interested shareholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(e)(ii): 16-10a-1802(5)(e) by virtue of proportionate stock splits, stock dividends, or other distributions of stock in respect of stock not constituting a business combination under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(e)(iii): (5) through a business combination meeting the conditions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1803(6)(e)(iv): (4); (5); (6) through purchase by the interested shareholder at any price that, if the price is paid in an otherwise permissible business combination the announcement date and consummation date of which were the date of the purchase, would have satisfied the requirements of Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804 Scope of part.
------------------------------------------------
This part does not apply to:Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(1): a business combination of a domestic corporation that does not have a class of voting stock registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to Exchange Act, Sec. 12, 15 U.S.C. Sec. 78l, unless the articles of incorporation provide otherwise;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(2): a business combination of a domestic corporation whose articles of incorporation are amended to provide that the domestic corporation is subject to this part that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(2)(a): did not have a class of voting stock registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to Exchange Act, Sec. 12, 15 U.S.C. Sec. 78l, on the effective date of the amendment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(2)(b): is a business combination with an interested shareholder whose stock acquisition date is before the effective date of the amendment;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(3): a business combination of a domestic corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(3)(a): the original articles of incorporation of which contain a provision expressly electing not to be governed by this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(3)(b): that adopts an amendment to the corporation's bylaws before December 31, 2017, expressly electing not to be governed by this part; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(3)(c): that adopts an amendment to the corporation's bylaws, approved by the affirmative vote of a majority of votes of the outstanding voting stock of the corporation, excluding the voting stock of interested shareholders and the interested shareholders' affiliates and associates, expressly electing not to be governed by this part, provided that the amendment to the bylaws:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(3)(c)(i): may not be effective until 18 months after the vote of the corporation's shareholders; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(3)(c)(ii): may not apply to a business combination of the corporation with an interested shareholder whose stock acquisition date is on or before the effective date of the amendment;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(4): a domestic corporation in the mineral extractive industry, including exploration, development, sand and gravel, mining, smelting, or refining of mineral properties;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(5): any business combination of a domestic corporation with an interested shareholder of the corporation that became an interested shareholder inadvertently, if the interested shareholder:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(5)(a): as soon as practicable, divests itself of a sufficient amount of the voting stock of the corporation so that it no longer is the beneficial owner, directly or indirectly, of 20% or more of the outstanding voting stock of the corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(5)(b): would not at any time within the five-year period preceding the announcement date with respect to the business combination have been an interested shareholder but for the inadvertent acquisition; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1804(6): any business combination with an interested shareholder who was the beneficial owner, directly or indirectly, of 5% or more of the outstanding voting stock of the corporation on May 9, 2017, and remained so to the interested shareholder's stock acquisition date.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1901 Definition.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1901(1): "Oppressive conduct" means a continuing course of conduct, a significant action, or a series of actions that substantially interferes with the interests of a shareholder as a shareholder.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1901(2): "Oppressive conduct" may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1901(2)(a): termination of a shareholder's employment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1901(2)(b): limitations on a shareholder's employment benefits to the extent that the limitations interfere with distributions or other shareholder interests disproportionately as to the affected shareholder.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1901(3): "Oppressive conduct" does not include an action allowed by an agreement, the corporation's articles of incorporation, the corporation's bylaws, or a consistently applied written corporate policy or procedure.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1902 Shareholder cause of action -- Relief.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1902(1): A shareholder of a closely held corporation who is injured by oppressive conduct may bring a private cause of action against the closely held corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1902(2): (2)(b); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1902(2)(a): (2)(b) If a court finds that oppressive conduct toward the shareholder occurred, the court shall order one or more persons described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1902(2)(b): (2)(a) A court may order that any of the following purchase the shares of the shareholder as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1902(2)(b)(i): the closely held corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1902(2)(b)(ii): an officer of the closely held corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1902(2)(b)(iii): a director of the closely held corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10a-1902(2)(b)(iv): a shareholder of the closely held corporation that is responsible for the oppressive conduct.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 16 - Chapter 10b - Benefit Corporation Act
**********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Benefit Corporation Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-102 Application and effect of chapter.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-102(1): This chapter applies to a benefit corporation organized under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-102(2): The existence of a provision of this chapter does not of itself create an implication that a contrary or different rule of law is applicable to a business corporation that is not a benefit corporation.  This chapter does not affect a statute or rule of law that is applicable to a business corporation that is not a benefit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-102(3): Chapter 10a, Utah Revised Business Corporation Act; Chapter 11, Professional Corporation Act; Chapter 10a, Utah Revised Business Corporation Act; Chapter 11, Professional Corporation Act
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-102(3)(a): Chapter 10a, Utah Revised Business Corporation Act Except as otherwise provided in this chapter,
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-102(3)(b): Chapter 11, Professional Corporation Act A benefit corporation may be subject simultaneously to this chapter and other chapters of this title, including
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-102(3)(c): Chapter 10a, Utah Revised Business Corporation Act; Chapter 11, Professional Corporation Act This chapter controls over
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-102(4): The articles of incorporation or bylaws of a benefit corporation may not limit, be inconsistent with, or supersede a provision of this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(1): 16-10b-401 "Annual benefit report" means a report required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(2): "Benefit corporation" means a business corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(2)(a): that elects to become subject to this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(2)(b): the status of which as a benefit corporation has not been terminated.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(3): 16-10b-302 "Benefit director" means the director designated as the benefit director of a benefit corporation under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(4): "Benefit enforcement proceeding" means a proceeding in a court of competent jurisdiction for:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(4)(a): failure of a benefit corporation to pursue or create general public benefit or a specific public benefit purpose set forth in its articles of incorporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(4)(b): a violation of an obligation, duty, or standard of conduct under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(5): 16-10b-304 "Benefit officer" means the individual designated as the benefit officer of a benefit corporation under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(6): Chapter 10a, Utah Revised Business Corporation Act; Chapter 11, Professional Corporation Act "Business corporation" means a corporation formed under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(7): "Division" means the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(8): "Executive officer" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(8)(a): a benefit corporation's president;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(8)(b): a vice president of the benefit corporation in charge of a principal business unit, division, or function; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(8)(c): any other officer who performs a policy-making function for the benefit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(9): "General public benefit" means a material positive impact on society and the environment:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(9)(a): taken as a whole;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(9)(b): assessed against a third-party standard; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(9)(c): from the business of a benefit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(10): "Immediate family" means a parent, spouse, surviving spouse, child, or sibling of a person.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(11)(a): "Independent" means having no material relationship with a benefit corporation or a subsidiary of the benefit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(11)(b): Serving as a benefit director or benefit officer does not make an individual not independent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(11)(c): A material relationship between an individual and a benefit corporation or any of its subsidiaries will be conclusively presumed to exist if one or more of the following apply:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(11)(c)(i): the individual is, or has been within the last three years, an employee other than a benefit officer of the benefit corporation or a subsidiary of the benefit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(11)(c)(ii): an immediate family member of the individual is, or has been within the last three years, an executive officer other than a benefit officer of the benefit corporation or a subsidiary of the benefit corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(11)(c)(iii): there is beneficial or record ownership of 5% or more of the outstanding shares of the benefit corporation, calculated as if all outstanding rights to acquire equity interests in the benefit corporation had been exercised, by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(11)(c)(iii)(A): the individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(11)(c)(iii)(B): an entity of which the individual is a director, an officer, or a manager, or in which the individual owns beneficially or of record 5% or more of the outstanding equity interests, calculated as if all outstanding rights to acquire equity interests in the entity had been exercised.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(12): (12)(b)(i) "Minimum status vote" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(12)(a): in the case of a business corporation, in addition to any other required approval or vote, the satisfaction of the following conditions:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(12)(a)(i): the shareholders of every class or series may vote as a separate voting group on the corporate action regardless of a limitation stated in the articles of incorporation or bylaws on the voting rights of a class or series; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(12)(a)(ii): the corporate action is required to be approved by vote of the shareholders of each class or series entitled to cast at least two-thirds of the votes that all shareholders of the class or series are entitled to cast on the action; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(12)(b): (12)(b)(i) in the case of a domestic entity other than a business corporation, in addition to any other required approval, vote, or consent, the satisfaction of the following conditions:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(12)(b)(i): the holders of every class or series of equity interest in the entity that are entitled to receive a distribution of any kind from the entity may vote on or consent to the action regardless of any otherwise applicable limitation on the voting or consent rights of a class or series; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(12)(b)(ii): (12)(b)(i) the action must be approved by vote or consent of the holders described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(13): "Publicly traded corporation" means a business corporation that has shares listed on a national securities exchange or traded in a market maintained by one or more members of a national securities association.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(14): "Specific public benefit" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(14)(a): providing low-income or underserved individuals or communities with beneficial products or services;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(14)(b): promoting economic opportunity for individuals or communities beyond the creation of jobs in the normal course of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(14)(c): protecting or restoring the environment;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(14)(d): improving human health;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(14)(e): promoting the arts, sciences, or advancement of knowledge;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(14)(f): increasing the flow of capital to entities with a purpose to benefit society or the environment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(14)(g): conferring any other particular benefit on society or the environment.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(15): "Subsidiary" means, in relation to a person, an entity in which the person owns beneficially or of record 50% or more of the outstanding equity interests, calculated as if all outstanding rights to acquire equity interests in the entity had been exercised.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(16): 16-10b-301(1)(a)(ii); (iii); (iv); (v) "Third-party standard" means a recognized standard for defining, reporting, and assessing corporate social and environmental performance that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(16)(a): 16-10b-301(1)(a)(ii); (iii); (iv); (v) assesses the effect of the business and its operations upon the interests listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(16)(b): is developed by an entity that is not controlled by the benefit corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(16)(c): is developed by an entity that both:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(16)(c)(i): has access to necessary expertise to assess overall corporate social and environmental performance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(16)(c)(ii): uses a balanced multistakeholder approach to develop the standard, including a reasonable public comment period; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(16)(d): makes the following information publicly available:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(16)(d)(i): about the standard:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(16)(d)(i)(A): the criteria considered when measuring the overall social and environmental performance of a business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(16)(d)(i)(B): the relative weightings, if any, of those criteria; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(16)(d)(ii): about the development and revision of the standard:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(16)(d)(ii)(A): the identity of the directors, officers, material owners, and the governing body of the entity that developed and controls revisions to the standard;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(16)(d)(ii)(B): the process by which revisions to the standard and changes to the membership of the governing body are made; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-10b-103(16)(d)(ii)(C): an accounting of the revenue and sources of financial support for the entity, with sufficient detail to disclose a relationship that could reasonably be considered to present a potential conflict of interest.
