Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(e): all financial statements of the association for the six most recent years;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(f): the six most recent annual reports delivered by the association to the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(g): the minutes of members meetings for the six most recent years;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(h): evidence of all actions taken by members without a meeting for the six most recent years;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(i): a list containing:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(i)(i): the name, in alphabetical order, and last known street address and, if different, mailing address of each patron member and each investor member; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(i)(ii): if the association has districts or classes of members, information from which each current member in a district or class may be identified;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(j): the federal income tax returns, any state and local income tax returns, and any tax reports of the association for the six most recent years;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(k): accounting records maintained by the association in the ordinary course of its operations for the six most recent years;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(l): the minutes of directors meetings for the six most recent years;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(m): evidence of all actions taken by directors without a meeting for the six most recent years;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(n): the amount of money contributed and agreed to be contributed by each member;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(o): a description and statement of the agreed value of contributions other than money made and agreed to be made by each member;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(p): the times at which, or events on the happening of which, any additional contribution is to be made by each member;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(q): for each member, a description and statement of the member's interest or information from which the description and statement can be derived; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(1)(r): all communications concerning the association made in a record to all members, or to all members in a district or class, for the six most recent years.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(2): (1) If a limited cooperative association has existed for less than the period for which records are required to be maintained under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-114(3): The organic rules may require that more information be maintained.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-115 Business transactions of member with limited cooperative association.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Subject to Sections

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-116 Dual capacity.
----------------------------------------------
A person may have both a patron member's interest and an investor member's interest.  When such person acts as a patron member, the person is subject to this chapter and the organic rules governing patron members.  When such person acts as an investor member, the person is subject to this chapter and the organic rules governing investor members.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-117 Designated office and agent for service of process.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-117(1): 16-16-1404 A limited cooperative association, or a foreign cooperative that has a certificate of authority under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-117(1)(a): an office, as its designated office, which need not be a place of the association's or foreign cooperative's activity in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-117(1)(b): an agent for service of process at the designated office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-117(2): An agent for service of process of a limited cooperative association or foreign cooperative shall be an individual who is a resident of this state or an entity that is authorized to do business in this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-118 Change of designated office or agent for service of process.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-118(1): 16-16-207(5) Except as otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-118(1)(a): the name of the limited cooperative association;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-118(1)(b): the street address and, if different, mailing address of its designated office;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-118(1)(c): if the designated office is to be changed, the street address and, if different, mailing address of the new designated office;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-118(1)(d): the name of its agent for service of process; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-118(1)(e): if the agent for service of process is to be changed, the name of the new agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-118(2): 16-16-207(5) Except as otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-118(2)(a): the name of the foreign cooperative;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-118(2)(b): the name, street address and, if different, mailing address of its designated office;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-118(2)(c): if the current agent for service of process or an address of the designated office is to be changed, the new information;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-118(2)(d): the street address and, if different, mailing address of its principal office; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-118(2)(e): if the street address or, if different, the mailing address of its principal office is to be changed, the street address and, if different, the mailing address of the new principal office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-118(3): 16-16-204 Except as otherwise provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-119 Resignation of agent for service of process.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-119(1): To resign as an agent for service of process of a limited cooperative association or foreign cooperative, the agent shall deliver to the division for filing a statement of resignation containing the name of the agent and the name of the association or foreign cooperative.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-119(2): (1) After receiving a statement of resignation under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-119(3): (2) An agency for service of process of a limited cooperative association or foreign cooperative terminates on the earlier of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-119(3)(a): (2) the 31st day after the division files a statement of resignation under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-119(3)(b): when a record designating a new agent for service of process is delivered to the division for filing on behalf of the association or foreign cooperative and becomes effective.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-120 Service of process.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-120(1): An agent for service of process appointed by a limited cooperative association or foreign cooperative is an agent of the association or foreign cooperative for service of process, notice, or a demand required or permitted by law to be served upon the association or foreign cooperative.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-120(2): If a limited cooperative association or foreign cooperative does not appoint or maintain an agent for service of process in this state or the agent for service of process cannot with reasonable diligence be found at the address of the designated office on file with the division, the division is an agent of the association or foreign cooperative upon which process, notice, or a demand may be served.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-120(3): Service of process, notice, or a demand on the division as agent of a limited cooperative association or foreign cooperative may be made by delivering to the division two copies of the process, notice, or demand.  The division shall forward one copy by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, to the association or foreign cooperative at its principal office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-120(4): (3) Service is effected under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-120(4)(a): the date the limited cooperative association or foreign cooperative receives the process, notice, or demand;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-120(4)(b): the date shown on the return receipt, if signed on behalf of the association or foreign cooperative; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-120(4)(c): five days after the process, notice, or demand is deposited by the division for delivery by the United States Postal Service, if mailed postage prepaid to the address of the principal office on file with the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-120(5): The division shall keep a record of each process, notice, and demand served pursuant to this section and record the time of, and the action taken regarding, the service.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-120(6): This section does not affect the right to serve process, notice, or a demand in any other manner provided by law.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-201 Signing of records delivered for filing to division.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-201(1): 16-16-302(4); (1)(d); 16-16-1206; 16-16-1206 A record delivered to the division for filing pursuant to this chapter shall be signed as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-201(1)(a): The initial articles of organization shall be signed by at least one organizer.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-201(1)(b): 16-16-302(4) A statement of cancellation under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-201(1)(c): (1)(d) Except as otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-201(1)(d): 16-16-1206; 16-16-1206 A record filed on behalf of a dissolved association shall be signed by a person winding up activities under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-201(1)(e): Any other record shall be signed by the person on whose behalf the record is delivered to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-201(2): Any record to be signed under this chapter may be signed by an authorized agent.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-202 Signing and filing of records pursuant to judicial order.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-202(1): If a person required by this chapter to sign or deliver a record to the division for filing does not sign or deliver the record to the division for filing, the court may order, upon the petition of an aggrieved person:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-202(1)(a): the person to sign the record and deliver the record to the division for filing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-202(1)(b): delivery of the unsigned record to the division for filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-202(2): (1) An aggrieved person under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-202(3): An unsigned record filed pursuant to this section is effective.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-203 Delivery to and filing of records by division -- Effective time and date.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-203(1): A record authorized or required by this chapter to be delivered to the division for filing shall be captioned to describe the record's purpose, be in a medium and format permitted by the division, and be delivered to the division.  If the filing fees have been paid, and unless the division determines that the record does not comply with the filing requirements of this chapter, the division shall file the record.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-203(2): The division, upon request and payment of the required fee, shall furnish a certified copy of any record filed by the division under this chapter to the person making the request.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-203(3): 16-16-118; 16-16-204; 16-16-118; 16-16-204 Except as otherwise provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-203(3)(a): if the record does not specify an effective time and does not specify a delayed effective date, on the date and at the time the record is filed as evidenced by the division's endorsement of the date and time on the record;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-203(3)(b): if the record specifies an effective time but not a delayed effective date, on the date the record is filed at the time specified in the record;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-203(3)(c): if the record specifies a delayed effective date but not an effective time, at 12:01 a.m. on the earlier of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-203(3)(c)(i): the specified date; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-203(3)(c)(ii): the 90th day after the record is filed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-203(3)(d): if the record specifies an effective time and a delayed effective date, at the specified time on the earlier of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-203(3)(d)(i): the specified date; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-203(3)(d)(ii): the 90th day after the record is filed.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-204 Correcting filed record.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-204(1): A limited cooperative association or foreign cooperative may deliver to the division for filing a statement of correction to correct a record previously delivered by the association or foreign cooperative to the division and filed by the division if, at the time of filing, the record contained inaccurate information or was defectively signed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-204(2): A statement of correction may not state a delayed effective date and shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-204(2)(a): describe the record to be corrected, including its filing date, or have attached a copy of the record as filed;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-204(2)(b): specify the inaccurate information and the reason it is inaccurate or the manner in which the signing was defective; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-204(2)(c): correct the inaccurate information or defective signature.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-204(3): When filed by the division, a statement of correction is effective:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-204(3)(a): when filed as to persons relying on the inaccurate information or defective signature before its correction and adversely affected by the correction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-204(3)(b): as to all other persons, retroactively as of the effective date and time of the record the statement corrects.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-205 Liability for inaccurate information in filed record.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If a record delivered to the division for filing under this chapter and filed by the division contains inaccurate information, a person that suffers a loss by reliance on the information may recover damages for the loss from a person that signed the record or caused another to sign it on the person's behalf and knew at the time the record was signed that the information was inaccurate.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-206 Certificate of existence or authorization.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-206(1): The division, upon request and payment of the required fee, shall furnish any person that requests it a certificate of existence for a limited cooperative association if the records filed in the office of the division show that the division has filed the association's articles of organization, that the association is registered with the division, and that the division has not filed a statement of termination.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-206(2): The division, upon request and payment of the required fee, shall furnish to any person that requests it a certificate of authority for a foreign cooperative if the records filed in the office of the division show that the division has filed the foreign cooperative's certificate of authority, has not revoked nor has reason to revoke the certificate of authority, and has not filed a notice of cancellation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-206(3): Subject to any exceptions stated in the certificate, a certificate of existence or authority issued by the division establishes conclusively that the limited cooperative association or foreign cooperative is registered with the division or is authorized to transact business in this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-207 Annual report for division.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-207(1): 16-16-1405 A limited cooperative association or foreign cooperative authorized to transact business in this state shall deliver to the division for filing an annual report that states:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-207(1)(a): the name of the association or foreign cooperative;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-207(1)(b): the street address and, if different, mailing address of the association's or foreign cooperative's designated office and the name of its agent for service of process at the designated office;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-207(1)(c): the street address and, if different, mailing address of the association's or foreign cooperative's principal office; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-207(1)(d): 16-16-1405 in the case of a foreign cooperative, the state or other jurisdiction under whose law the foreign cooperative is formed and any alternative name adopted under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-207(2): Information in an annual report shall be current as of the date the report is delivered to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-207(3): The first annual report shall be delivered to the division between January 1 and April 1 of the year following the calendar year in which the limited cooperative association is formed or the foreign cooperative is authorized to transact business in this state.  For subsequent years, an annual report shall be delivered to the division during the month in which falls the anniversary of the limited cooperative association's organization or the foreign cooperative's authorization to transact business.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-207(4): (1); (1) If an annual report does not contain the information required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-207(5): If a filed annual report contains an address of the designated office, name of the agent for service of process, or address of the principal office which differs from the information shown in the records of the division immediately before the filing, the differing information in the annual report is considered a statement of change.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-207(6): 16-16-1211 If a limited cooperative association fails to deliver an annual report under this section, the division may proceed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-207(7): If a foreign cooperative fails to deliver an annual report under this section, the division may revoke the certificate of authority of the cooperative.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-208 Filing fees.
--------------------------------------------
The filing fee for records filed under this part by the division shall be established by the division in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-301 Organizers.
-------------------------------------------
A limited cooperative association shall be organized by one or more organizers.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-302 Formation of limited cooperative association -- Articles of organization.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-302(1): To form a limited cooperative association, an organizer of the association shall deliver articles of organization to the division for filing.  The articles shall state:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-302(1)(a): the name of the association;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-302(1)(b): the purposes for which the association is formed;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-302(1)(c): the street address and, if different, mailing address of the association's initial designated office and the name of the association's initial agent for service of process at the designated office;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-302(1)(d): the street address and, if different, mailing address of the initial principal office;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-302(1)(e): the name and street address and, if different, mailing address of each organizer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-302(1)(f): the term for which the association is to exist if other than perpetual.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-302(2): 16-16-113(1); (1) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-302(3): (1); 16-16-203(3) A limited cooperative association is formed after articles of organization that substantially comply with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-302(4): If articles of organization filed by the division state a delayed effective date, a limited cooperative association is not formed if, before the articles take effect, an organizer signs and delivers to the division for filing a statement of cancellation.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-303 Organization of limited cooperative association.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-303(1): After a limited cooperative association is formed:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-303(1)(a): if initial directors are named in the articles of organization, the initial directors shall hold an organizational meeting to adopt initial bylaws and carry on any other business necessary or proper to complete the organization of the association; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-303(1)(b): if initial directors are not named in the articles of organization, the organizers shall designate the initial directors and call a meeting of the initial directors to adopt initial bylaws and carry on any other business necessary or proper to complete the organization of the association.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-303(2): Unless the articles of organization otherwise provide, the initial directors may cause the limited cooperative association to accept members, including those necessary for the association to begin business.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-303(3): Initial directors need not be members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-303(4): An initial director serves until a successor is elected and qualified at a members meeting or the director is removed, resigns, is adjudged incompetent, or dies.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304 Bylaws.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304(1): Bylaws shall be in a record and, if not stated in the articles of organization, shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304(1)(a): a statement of the capital structure of the limited cooperative association, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304(1)(a)(i): the classes or other types of members' interests and relative rights, preferences, and restrictions granted to or imposed upon each class or other type of member's interest; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304(1)(a)(ii): the rights to share in profits or distributions of the association;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304(1)(b): a statement of the method for admission of members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304(1)(c): a statement designating voting and other governance rights, including which members have voting power and any restriction on voting power;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304(1)(d): a statement that a member's interest is transferable if it is to be transferable and a statement of the conditions upon which it may be transferred;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304(1)(e): a statement concerning the manner in which profits and losses are allocated and distributions are made among patron members and, if investor members are authorized, the manner in which profits and losses are allocated and how distributions are made among investor members and between patron members and investor members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304(1)(f): a statement concerning:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304(1)(f)(i): whether persons that are not members but conduct business with the association may be permitted to share in allocations of profits and losses and receive distributions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304(1)(f)(ii): the manner in which profits and losses are allocated and distributions are made with respect to those persons; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304(1)(g): a statement of the number and terms of directors or the method by which the number and terms are determined.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304(2): 16-16-113(3) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-304(3): Part 4, Amendment of Organic Rules of Limited Cooperative Association In addition to amendments permitted under


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-401 Authority to amend organic rules.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-401(1): 16-16-304 A limited cooperative association may amend its organic rules under this part for any lawful purpose.  In addition, the initial board of directors may amend the bylaws of an association under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-401(2): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a member does not have a vested property right resulting from any provision in the organic rules, including a provision relating to the management, control, capital structure, distribution, entitlement, purpose, or duration of the limited cooperative association.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-402 Notice and action on amendment of organic rules.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-402(1): 16-16-401(1); 16-16-405(6) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-402(1)(a): a majority of the board of directors, or a greater percentage if required by the organic rules; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-402(1)(b): one or more petitions signed by at least 10% of the patron members or at least 10% of the investor members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-402(2): (1) The board of directors shall call a members meeting to consider an amendment proposed pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-402(2)(a): the proposed amendment, or a summary of the proposed amendment and a statement of the manner in which a copy of the amendment in a record may be reasonably obtained by a member;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-402(2)(b): a recommendation that the members approve the amendment, or if the board determines that because of conflict of interest or other special circumstances it should not make a favorable recommendation, the basis for that determination;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-402(2)(c): a statement of any condition of the board's submission of the amendment to the members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-402(2)(d): notice of the meeting at which the proposed amendment will be considered, which shall be given in the same manner as notice for a special meeting of members.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-403 Change to amendment of organic rules at meeting.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-403(1): A substantive change to a proposed amendment of the organic rules may not be made at the members meeting at which a vote on the amendment occurs.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-403(2): A nonsubstantive change to a proposed amendment of the organic rules may be made at the members meeting at which the vote on the amendment occurs and need not be separately voted upon by the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-403(3): A vote to adopt a nonsubstantive change to a proposed amendment to the organic rules shall be by the same percentage of votes required to pass a proposed amendment.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-404 Voting by district, class, or voting group.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-404(1): 16-16-405(5)(a); (e); 16-16-405; 16-16-514 This section applies if the organic rules provide for voting by district or class, or if there is one or more identifiable voting groups that a proposed amendment to the organic rules would affect differently from other members with respect to matters identified in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-404(2): (1) If a proposed amendment to the organic rules would affect members in two or more districts or classes entitled to vote separately under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405 Approval of amendment.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(1): 16-16-404; (3); (4); 16-16-402 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(1)(a): 16-16-402 at least two-thirds of the voting power of members present at a members meeting called under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(1)(b): if the limited cooperative association has investor members, at least a majority of the votes cast by patron members, unless the organic rules require a greater percentage vote by patron members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(2): 16-16-404; (3); (4); (5); (6); 16-16-402 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(2)(a): 16-16-402 at least a majority vote of the voting power of all members present at a members meeting called under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(2)(b): if a limited cooperative association has investor members, a majority of the votes cast by patron members, unless the organic rules require a larger affirmative vote by patron members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(3): (1)(a); (2)(a); (3)(a); (b) The organic rules may require that the percentage of votes under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(3)(a): a different percentage that is not less than a majority of members voting at the meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(3)(b): measured against the voting power of all members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(3)(c): (3)(a); (b) a combination of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(4): 16-16-407 Consent in a record by a member shall be delivered to a limited cooperative association before delivery of an amendment to the articles of organization or restated articles of organization for filing pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(4)(a): personal liability for an obligation of the association; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(4)(b): an obligation or liability for an additional contribution.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(5): (1) The vote required to amend bylaws shall satisfy the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(5)(a): the equity capital structure of the limited cooperative association, including the rights of the association's members to share in profits or distributions, or the relative rights, preferences, and restrictions granted to or imposed upon one or more districts, classes, or voting groups of similarly situated members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(5)(b): the transferability of a member's interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(5)(c): the manner or method of allocation of profits or losses among members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(5)(d): the quorum for a meeting and the rights of voting and governance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(5)(e): unless otherwise provided in the organic rules, the terms for admission of new members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(6): (5) Except for the matters described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-405(7): If the articles of organization delegate amendment of bylaws to the board of directors, the board shall provide a description of any amendment of the bylaws made by the board to the members in a record not later than 30 days after the amendment, but the description may be provided at the next annual members meeting if the meeting is held within the 30-day period.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-406 Restated articles of organization.
------------------------------------------------------------------
A limited cooperative association, by the affirmative vote of a majority of the board of directors taken at a meeting for which the purpose is stated in the notice of the meeting, may adopt restated articles of organization that contain the original articles as previously amended.  Restated articles may contain amendments if the restated articles are adopted in the same manner and with the same vote as required for amendments to the articles under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-407 Amendment or restatement of articles of organization -- Filing.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-407(1): Part 16, Conversion and Merger To amend its articles of organization, a limited cooperative association shall deliver to the division for filing an amendment of the articles, or restated articles of organization or articles of conversion or merger pursuant to
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-407(1)(a): the name of the association;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-407(1)(b): the date of filing of the association's initial articles; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-407(1)(c): the changes the amendment makes to the articles as most recently amended or restated.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-407(2): 16-16-203 Before the beginning of the initial meeting of the board of directors, an organizer who knows that information in the filed articles of organization was inaccurate when the articles were filed or has become inaccurate due to changed circumstances shall promptly:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-407(2)(a): cause the articles to be amended; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-407(2)(b): 16-16-203 if appropriate, deliver an amendment to the division for filing pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-407(3): If restated articles of organization are adopted, the restated articles may be delivered to the division for filing in the same manner as an amendment.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-407(4): 16-16-203(3) Upon filing, an amendment of the articles of organization or other record containing an amendment of the articles which has been properly adopted by the members is effective as provided in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-501 Members.
----------------------------------------
To begin business, a limited cooperative association shall have at least two patron members unless the sole member is a cooperative.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-502 Becoming a member.
--------------------------------------------------
A person becomes a member:Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-502(1): as provided in the organic rules;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-502(2): Part 16, Conversion and Merger as the result of a merger or conversion under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-502(3): with the consent of all the members.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-503 No power as member to bind association.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
A member, solely by reason of being a member, may not act for or bind the limited cooperative association.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-504 No liability as member for association's obligations.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless the articles of organization otherwise provide, a debt, obligation, or other liability of a limited cooperative association is solely that of the association and is not the debt, obligation, or liability of a member solely by reason of being a member.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505 Right of member and former member to information.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(1): 16-16-114(1)(a); (h); 16-16-114(1)(b); (h) Not later than 10 business days after receipt of a demand made in a record, a limited cooperative association shall permit a member to obtain, inspect, and copy in the association's principal office required information listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(2): 16-16-114(1)(i); (j); (l); (m); (p); (r) On demand made in a record received by the limited cooperative association, a member may obtain, inspect, and copy in the association's principal office required information listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(2)(a): the member seeks the information in good faith and for a proper purpose reasonably related to the member's interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(2)(b): the demand includes a description with reasonable particularity of the information sought and the purpose for seeking the information;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(2)(c): the information sought is directly connected to the member's purpose; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(2)(d): the demand is reasonable.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(3): (2) Not later than 10 business days after receipt of a demand pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(3)(a): if the association agrees to provide the demanded information:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(3)(a)(i): what information the association will provide in response to the demand; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(3)(a)(ii): a reasonable time and place at which the association will provide the information; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(3)(b): if the association declines to provide some or all of the demanded information, the association's reasons for declining.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(4): (1); (2); (2) A person dissociated as a member may obtain, inspect, and copy information available to a member under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(4)(a): the information pertains to the period during which the person was a member in the association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(4)(b): the person seeks the information in good faith.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(5): (4); (3) A limited cooperative association shall respond to a demand made pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(6): 16-16-114(1)(q) Not later than 10 business days after receipt by a limited cooperative association of a demand made by a member in a record, but not more often than once in a six-month period, the association shall deliver to the member a record stating the information with respect to the member required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(7): (7) A limited cooperative association may impose reasonable restrictions, including nondisclosure restrictions, on the use of information obtained under this section.  In a dispute concerning the reasonableness of a restriction under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(8): A limited cooperative association may charge a person that makes a demand under this section reasonable costs of copying, limited to the costs of labor and material.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(9): (7) A person that may obtain information under this section may obtain the information through an attorney or other agent.  A restriction imposed on the person under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(10): The rights stated in this section do not extend to a person as transferee.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-505(11): The organic rules may require a limited cooperative association to provide more information than required by this section and may establish conditions and procedures for providing the information.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-506 Annual meeting of members.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-506(1): Members shall meet annually at a time provided in the organic rules or set by the board of directors not inconsistent with the organic rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-506(2): An annual members meeting may be held inside or outside this state at the place stated in the organic rules or selected by the board of directors not inconsistent with the organic rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-506(3): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, members may attend or conduct an annual members meeting through any means of communication if all members attending the meeting can communicate with each other during the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-506(4): The board of directors shall report, or cause to be reported, at the association's annual members meeting the association's business and financial condition as of the close of the most recent fiscal year.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-506(5): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, the board of directors shall designate the presiding officer of the association's annual members meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-506(6): Failure to hold an annual members meeting does not affect the validity of any action by the limited cooperative association.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-507 Special meeting of members.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-507(1): A special meeting of members may be called only:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-507(1)(a): as provided in the organic rules;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-507(1)(b): by a majority vote of the board of directors on a proposal stating the purpose of the meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-507(1)(c): by demand in a record signed by members holding at least 20% of the voting power of the persons in any district or class entitled to vote on the matter that is the purpose of the meeting stated in the demand; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-507(1)(d): by demand in a record signed by members holding at least 10% of the total voting power of all the persons entitled to vote on the matter that is the purpose of the meeting stated in the demand.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-507(2): (1)(c); (d) A demand under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-507(3): (1)(c); (d) Any voting member may withdraw its demand under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-507(4): A special meeting of members may be held inside or outside this state at the place stated in the organic rules or selected by the board of directors not inconsistent with the organic rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-507(5): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, members may attend or conduct a special meeting of members through the use of any means of communication if all members attending the meeting can communicate with each other during the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-507(6): Only business within the purpose or purposes stated in the notice of a special meeting of members may be conducted at the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-507(7): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, the presiding officer of a special meeting of members shall be designated by the board of directors.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-508 Notice of members meeting.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-508(1): A limited cooperative association shall notify each member of the time, date, and place of a members meeting at least 15 and not more than 60 days before the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-508(2): Unless the articles of organization otherwise provide, notice of an annual members meeting need not include any purpose of the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-508(3): 16-16-507(1)(c); (d); 16-16-507(1)(b) Notice of a special meeting of members shall include each purpose of the meeting as contained in the demand under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-508(4): Notice of a members meeting shall be given in a record unless oral notice is reasonable under the circumstances.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-509 Waiver of members meeting notice.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-509(1): A member may waive notice of a members meeting before, during, or after the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-509(2): A member's participation in a members meeting is a waiver of notice of that meeting unless the member objects to the meeting at the beginning of the meeting or promptly upon the member's arrival at the meeting and does not thereafter vote for or assent to action taken at the meeting.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-510 Quorum of members.
--------------------------------------------------
Unless the organic rules otherwise require a greater number of members or percentage of the voting power, the voting member or members present at a members meeting constitute a quorum.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-511 Voting by patron members.
---------------------------------------------------------
Except as provided by Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-512 Determination of voting power of patron member.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-512(1): The organic rules may allocate voting power among patron members on the basis of one or a combination of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-512(1)(a): one member, one vote;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-512(1)(b): use or patronage;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-512(1)(c): equity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-512(1)(d): if a patron member is a cooperative, the number of its patron members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-512(2): The organic rules may provide for the allocation of patron member voting power by districts or class, or any combination thereof.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-513 Voting by investor members.
-----------------------------------------------------------
If the organic rules provide for investor members, each investor member has one vote, unless the organic rules otherwise provide.  The organic rules may provide for the allocation of investor member voting power by class, classes, or any combination of classes.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-514 Voting requirements for members.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-514(1): If a limited cooperative association has both patron and investor members, the following rules apply:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-514(1)(a): the total voting power of all patron members may not be less than a majority of the entire voting power entitled to vote; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-514(1)(b): action on any matter is approved only upon the affirmative vote of at least a majority of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-514(1)(b)(i): all members voting at the meeting unless more than a majority is required by this chapter or the organic rules; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-514(1)(b)(ii): votes cast by patron members unless the organic rules require a larger affirmative vote by patron members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-514(2): The organic rules may provide for the percentage of the affirmative votes that must be cast by investor members to approve the matter.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-515 Manner of voting.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-515(1): (1) Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, voting by a proxy at a members meeting is prohibited.  This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-515(2): If voting by a proxy is permitted, a patron member may appoint only another patron member as a proxy and, if investor members are permitted, an investor member may appoint only another investor member as a proxy.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-515(3): The organic rules may provide for the manner of and provisions governing the appointment of a proxy.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-515(4): The organic rules may provide for voting on any question by ballot delivered by mail or voting by other means on questions that are subject to vote by members.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-516 Action without a meeting.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-516(1): Unless the organic rules require that action be taken only at a members meeting, any action that may be taken by the members may be taken without a meeting if each member entitled to vote on the action consents in a record to the action.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-516(2): (1) Consent under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-516(3): Consent to any action may specify the effective date or time of the action.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-517 Districts and delegates -- Classes of members.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-517(1): The organic rules may provide for the formation of geographic districts of patron members and:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-517(1)(a): for the conduct of patron member meetings by districts and the election of directors at the meetings; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-517(1)(b): that districts may elect district delegates to represent and vote for the district at members meetings.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-517(2): (1)(b) A delegate elected under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-517(3): The organic rules may provide for the establishment of classes of members, for the preferences, rights, and limitations of the classes, and:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-517(3)(a): for the conduct of members meetings by classes and the election of directors at the meetings; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-517(3)(b): that classes may elect class delegates to represent and vote for the class in members meetings.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-517(4): (3)(b) A delegate elected under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-601 Member's interest.
--------------------------------------------------
A member's interest:Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-601(1): is personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-601(2): consists of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-601(2)(a): governance rights;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-601(2)(b): financial rights; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-601(2)(c): the right or obligation, if any, to do business with the limited cooperative association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-601(3): may be in certificated or uncertificated form.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-602 Patron and investor members' interests.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-602(1): Unless the organic rules establish investor members' interests, a member's interest is a patron member's interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-602(2): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, if a limited cooperative association has investor members, while a person is a member of the association, the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-602(2)(a): if admitted as a patron member, remains a patron member;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-602(2)(b): if admitted as an investor member, remains an investor member; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-602(2)(c): if admitted as a patron member and investor member, remains a patron and investor member if not dissociated in one of the capacities.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-603 Transferability of member's interest.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-603(1): Title 70A, Uniform Commercial Code The provisions of this chapter relating to the transferability of a member's interest are subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-603(2): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a member's interest other than financial rights is not transferable.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-603(3): Unless a transfer is restricted or prohibited by the organic rules, a member may transfer the member's financial rights in the limited cooperative association.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-603(4): The terms of any restriction on transferability of financial rights shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-603(4)(a): set forth in the organic rules and the member records of the association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-603(4)(b): conspicuously noted on any certificates evidencing a member's interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-603(5): A transferee of a member's financial rights, to the extent the rights are transferred, has the right to share in the allocation of profits or losses and to receive the distributions to the member transferring the interest to the same extent as the transferring member.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-603(6): A transferee of a member's financial rights does not become a member upon transfer of the rights unless the transferee is admitted as a member by the limited cooperative association.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-603(7): A limited cooperative association need not give effect to a transfer under this section until the association has notice of the transfer.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-603(8): A transfer of a member's financial rights in violation of a restriction on transfer contained in the organic rules is ineffective as to a person having notice of the restriction at the time of transfer.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-604 Security interest and set-off.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-604(1): A member or transferee may create an enforceable security interest in its financial rights in a limited cooperative association.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-604(2): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a member may not create an enforceable security interest in the member's governance rights in a limited cooperative association.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-604(3): Title 70A, Chapter 9a, Uniform Commercial Code - Secured Transactions The organic rules may provide that a limited cooperative association has a security interest in the financial rights of a member to secure payment of any indebtedness or other obligation of the member to the association.  A security interest provided for in the organic rules is enforceable under, and governed by,
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-604(4): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a member may not compel the limited cooperative association to offset financial rights against any indebtedness or obligation owed to the association.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-605 Charging orders for judgment creditor of member or transferee.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-605(1): (1) On application by a judgment creditor of a member or transferee, a court may enter a charging order against the financial rights of the judgment debtor for the unsatisfied amount of the judgment.  A charging order issued under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-605(2): (1) To the extent necessary to effectuate the collection of distributions pursuant to a charging order under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-605(2)(a): appoint a receiver of the share of the distributions due or to become due to the judgment debtor under the judgment debtor's financial rights, with the power to make all inquiries the judgment debtor might have made; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-605(2)(b): make all other orders that the circumstances of the case may require to give effect to the charging order.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-605(3): 16-16-603 Upon a showing that distributions under a charging order will not pay the judgment debt within a reasonable time, the court may foreclose the lien and order the sale of the financial rights.  The purchaser at the foreclosure sale obtains only the financial rights that are subject to the charging order, does not thereby become a member, and is subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-605(4): (1) At any time before a sale pursuant to a foreclosure, a member or transferee whose financial rights are subject to a charging order under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-605(5): (5) At any time before sale pursuant to a foreclosure, the limited cooperative association or one or more members whose financial rights are not subject to the charging order may pay to the judgment creditor the full amount due under the judgment and succeed to the rights of the judgment creditor, including the charging order.  Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, the association may act under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-605(6): This chapter does not deprive any member or transferee of the benefit of any exemption laws applicable to the member's or transferee's financial rights.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-605(7): This section provides the exclusive remedy by which a judgment creditor of a member or transferee may satisfy the judgment from the member's or transferee's financial rights.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-701 Authority.
------------------------------------------
In this part, "marketing contract" means a contract between a limited cooperative association and another person, that need not be a patron member:Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-701(1): requiring the other person to sell, or deliver for sale or marketing on the person's behalf, a specified part of the person's products, commodities, or goods exclusively to or through the association or any facilities furnished by the association; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-701(2): authorizing the association to act for the person in any manner with respect to the products, commodities, or goods.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-702 Marketing contracts.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-702(1): If a marketing contract provides for the sale of products, commodities, or goods to a limited cooperative association, the sale transfers title to the association upon delivery or at any other specific time expressly provided by the contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-702(2): A marketing contract may:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-702(2)(a): authorize a limited cooperative association to create an enforceable security interest in the products, commodities, or goods delivered; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-702(2)(b): allow the association to sell the products, commodities, or goods delivered and pay the sales price on a pooled or other basis after deducting selling costs, processing costs, overhead, expenses, and other charges.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-702(3): Some or all of the provisions of a marketing contract between a patron member and a limited cooperative association may be contained in the organic rules.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-703 Duration of marketing contract.
---------------------------------------------------------------
The initial duration of a marketing contract may not exceed 10 years, but the contract may be self-renewing for additional periods not exceeding five years each.  Unless the contract provides for another manner or time for termination, either party may terminate the contract by giving notice in a record at least 90 days before the end of the current term.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-704 Remedies for breach of contract.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-704(1): Damages to be paid to a limited cooperative association for breach or anticipatory repudiation of a marketing contract may be liquidated, but only at an amount or under a formula that is reasonable in light of the actual or anticipated harm caused by the breach or repudiation.  A provision that so provides is not a penalty.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-704(2): Upon a breach of a marketing contract, whether by anticipatory repudiation or otherwise, a limited cooperative association may seek:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-704(2)(a): an injunction to prevent further breach; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-704(2)(b): specific performance.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-704(3): The remedies in this section are in addition to any other remedies available to an association under law other than this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-801 Board of directors.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-801(1): A limited cooperative association shall have a board of directors of at least three individuals, unless the association has fewer than three members.  If the association has fewer than three members, the number of directors may not be fewer than the number of members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-801(2): The affairs of a limited cooperative association shall be managed by, or under the direction of, the board of directors.  The board may adopt policies and procedures that do not conflict with the organic rules or this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-801(3): An individual is not an agent for a limited cooperative association solely by being a director.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-802 No liability as director for limited cooperative association's obligations.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A debt, obligation, or other liability of a limited cooperative association is solely that of the association and is not a debt, obligation, or liability of a director solely by reason of being a director.  An individual is not personally liable, directly or indirectly, for an obligation of an association solely by reason of being a director.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-803 Qualifications of directors.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-803(1): (3) Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, and subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-803(2): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a director may be an officer or employee of the limited cooperative association.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-803(3): If the organic rules provide for nonmember directors, the number of nonmember directors may not exceed:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-803(3)(a): one, if there are two through four directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-803(3)(b): two, if there are five through eight directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-803(3)(c): 1/3 of the total number of directors if there are at least nine directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-803(4): The organic rules may provide qualifications for directors in addition to those in this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-804 Election of directors and composition of board.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-804(1): Unless the organic rules require a greater number:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-804(1)(a): the number of directors that shall be patron members may not be fewer than:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-804(1)(a)(i): one, if there are two or three directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-804(1)(a)(ii): two, if there are four or five directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-804(1)(a)(iii): three, if there are six through eight directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-804(1)(a)(iv): 1/3 of the directors if there are at least nine directors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-804(1)(b): a majority of the board of directors shall be elected exclusively by patron members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-804(2): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, if a limited cooperative association has investor members, the directors who are not elected exclusively by patron members are elected by the investor members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-804(3): (1) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-804(4): (1) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-804(5): If a class of members consists of a single member, the organic rules may provide for the member to appoint a director or directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-804(6): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, cumulative voting for directors is prohibited.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-804(7): (5); 16-16-303; 16-16-516; 16-16-517; 16-16-809 Except as otherwise provided by the organic rules, Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-805 Term of director.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-805(1): (3); (4); 16-16-303(3) Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, and subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-805(2): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a director may be reelected.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-805(3): (4) Except as otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-805(4): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a director does not serve the remainder of the director's term if the director ceases to qualify to be a director.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-806 Resignation of director.
--------------------------------------------------------
A director may resign at any time by giving notice in a record to the limited cooperative association.  Unless the notice states a later effective date, a resignation is effective when the notice is received by the association.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-807 Removal of director.
----------------------------------------------------
Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, the following rules apply:Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-807(1): Members may remove a director with or without cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-807(2): A member or members holding at least 10% of the total voting power entitled to be voted in the election of a director may demand removal of the director by one or more signed petitions submitted to the officer of the limited cooperative association charged with keeping its records.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-807(3): 16-16-508 Upon receipt of a petition for removal of a director, an officer of the association or the board of directors shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-807(3)(a): call a special meeting of members to be held not later than 90 days after receipt of the petition by the association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-807(3)(b): 16-16-508 mail or otherwise transmit or deliver in a record to the members entitled to vote on the removal, and to the director to be removed, notice of the meeting which complies with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-807(4): A director is removed if the votes in favor of removal are equal to or greater than the votes required to elect the director.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-808 Suspension of director by board.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-808(1): A board of directors may suspend a director if, considering the director's course of conduct and the inadequacy of other available remedies, immediate suspension is necessary for the best interests of the association and the director is engaging, or has engaged, in:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-808(1)(a): fraudulent conduct with respect to the association or its members;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-808(1)(b): gross abuse of the position of director;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-808(1)(c): intentional or reckless infliction of harm on the association; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-808(1)(d): any other behavior, act, or omission as provided by the organic rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-808(2): (1) A suspension under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-809 Vacancy on board.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-809(1): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a vacancy on the board of directors shall be filled:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-809(1)(a): within a reasonable time by majority vote of the remaining directors until the next annual members meeting or a special meeting of members called to fill the vacancy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-809(1)(b): for the unexpired term by members at the next annual members meeting or a special meeting of members called to fill the vacancy.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-809(2): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, if a vacating director was elected or appointed by a class of members or a district:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-809(2)(a): the new director shall be of that class or district; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-809(2)(b): the selection of the director for the unexpired term shall be conducted in the same manner as would the selection for that position without a vacancy.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-809(3): If a member appointed a vacating director, the organic rules may provide for that member to appoint a director to fill the vacancy.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-810 Remuneration of directors.
----------------------------------------------------------
Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, the board of directors may set the remuneration of directors and of nondirector committee members appointed under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-811 Meetings.
-----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-811(1): A board of directors shall meet at least annually and may hold meetings inside or outside this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-811(2): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a board of directors may permit directors to attend or conduct board meetings through the use of any means of communication, if all directors attending the meeting can communicate with each other during the meeting.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-812 Action without meeting.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-812(1): Unless prohibited by the organic rules, any action that may be taken by a board of directors may be taken without a meeting if each director consents in a record to the action.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-812(2): (1) Consent under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-812(3): (1) A record of consent for any action under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-813 Meetings and notice.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-813(1): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a board of directors may establish a time, date, and place for regular board meetings, and notice of the time, date, place, or purpose of those meetings is not required.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-813(2): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, notice of the time, date, and place of a special meeting of a board of directors shall be given to all directors at least three days before the meeting, the notice shall contain a statement of the purpose of the meeting, and the meeting is limited to the matters contained in the statement.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-814 Waiver of notice of meeting.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-814(1): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a director may waive any required notice of a meeting of the board of directors in a record before, during, or after the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-814(2): 16-16-813 Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a director's participation in a meeting is a waiver of notice of that meeting unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-814(2)(a): the director objects to the meeting at the beginning of the meeting or promptly upon the director's arrival at the meeting and does not thereafter vote in favor of or otherwise assent to the action taken at the meeting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-814(2)(b): 16-16-813 the director promptly objects upon the introduction of any matter for which notice under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-815 Quorum.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-815(1): Unless the articles of organization provide for a greater number, a majority of the total number of directors specified by the organic rules constitutes a quorum for a meeting of the directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-815(2): If a quorum of the board of directors is present at the beginning of a meeting, any action taken by the directors present is valid even if withdrawal of directors originally present results in the number of directors being fewer than the number required for a quorum.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-815(3): 16-16-814(2)(a); (b) A director present at a meeting but objecting to notice under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-816 Voting.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-816(1): Each director shall have one vote for purposes of decisions made by the board of directors.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-816(2): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, the affirmative vote of a majority of directors present at a meeting is required for action by the board of directors.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-817 Committees.
-------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-817(1): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a board of directors may create one or more committees and appoint one or more individuals to serve on a committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-817(2): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, an individual appointed to serve on a committee of a limited cooperative association need not be a director or member.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-817(3): An individual who is not a director and is serving on a committee has the same rights, duties, and obligations as a director serving on the committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-817(4): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, each committee of a limited cooperative association may exercise the powers delegated to it by the board of directors, but a committee may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-817(4)(a): approve allocations or distributions except according to a formula or method prescribed by the board of directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-817(4)(b): approve or propose to members action requiring approval of members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-817(4)(c): fill vacancies on the board of directors or any of its committees.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-818 Standards of conduct and liability.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Except as otherwise provided in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 16-16-818(1): Title 3, Uniform Agricultural Cooperative Association Act the discharge of the duties of a director or member of a committee of the board of directors is governed by the law applicable to directors of entities organized under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-818(2): Title 3, Uniform Agricultural Cooperative Association Act the liability of a director or member of a committee of the board of directors is governed by the law applicable to directors of entities organized under


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-819 Conflict of interest.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-819(1): Title 3, Uniform Agricultural Cooperative Association Act The law applicable to conflicts of interest between a director of an entity organized under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-819(2): A director does not have a conflict of interest under this chapter or the organic rules solely because the director's conduct relating to the duties of the director may further the director's own interest.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-820 Other considerations of directors.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless the articles of organization otherwise provide, in considering the best interests of a limited cooperative association, a director of the association in discharging the duties of director, in conjunction with considering the long and short term interest of the association and its patron members, may consider:Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-820(1): the interest of employees, customers, and suppliers of the association;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-820(2): the interest of the community in which the association operates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-820(3): other cooperative principles and values that may be applied in the context of the decision.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-821 Right of director or committee member to information.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A director or a member of a committee appointed under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-822 Appointment and authority of officers.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-822(1): A limited cooperative association has the officers:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-822(1)(a): provided in the organic rules; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-822(1)(b): established by the board of directors in a manner not inconsistent with the organic rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-822(2): 16-16-114 The organic rules may designate or, if the rules do not designate, the board of directors shall designate, one of the association's officers for preparing all records required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-822(3): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, the board of directors shall appoint the officers of the limited cooperative association.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-822(4): Officers of a limited cooperative association shall perform the duties the organic rules prescribe or as authorized by the board of directors not in a manner inconsistent with the organic rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-822(5): The election or appointment of an officer of a limited cooperative association does not of itself create a contract between the association and the officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-822(6): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, an individual may simultaneously hold more than one office in a limited cooperative association.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-823 Resignation and removal of officers.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-823(1): The board of directors may remove an officer at any time with or without cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-823(2): An officer of a limited cooperative association may resign at any time by giving notice in a record to the association.  Unless the notice specifies a later time, the resignation is effective when the notice is given.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-901 Indemnification.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-901(1): Title 3, Uniform Agricultural Cooperative Association Act Indemnification of an individual who has incurred liability or is a party, or is threatened to be made a party, to litigation because of the performance of a duty to, or activity on behalf of, a limited cooperative association is governed by
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-901(2): Title 3, Uniform Agricultural Cooperative Association Act A limited cooperative association may purchase and maintain insurance on behalf of any individual against liability asserted against or incurred by the individual to the same extent and subject to the same conditions as provided by


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1001 Members' contributions.
--------------------------------------------------------
The organic rules shall establish the amount, manner, or method of determining any contribution requirements for members or shall authorize the board of directors to establish the amount, manner, or other method of determining any contribution requirements for members.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1002 Contribution and valuation.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1002(1): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, the contributions of a member to a limited cooperative association may consist of tangible or intangible property or other benefit to the association, including money, labor or other services performed or to be performed, promissory notes, other agreements to contribute money or property, and contracts to be performed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1002(2): The receipt and acceptance of contributions and the valuation of contributions shall be reflected in a limited cooperative association's records.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1002(3): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, the board of directors shall determine the value of a member's contributions received or to be received and the determination by the board of directors of valuation is conclusive for purposes of determining whether the member's contribution obligation has been met.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1003 Contribution agreements.
---------------------------------------------------------
