Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1003(1): Except as otherwise provided in the agreement, the following rules apply to an agreement made by a person before formation of a limited cooperative association to make a contribution to the association:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1003(1)(a): The agreement is irrevocable for six months after the agreement is signed by the person unless all parties to the agreement consent to the revocation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1003(1)(b): If a person does not make a required contribution:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1003(1)(b)(i): the person is obligated, at the option of the association, once formed, to contribute money equal to the value of that part of the contribution that has not been made, and the obligation may be enforced as a debt to the association; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1003(1)(b)(ii): the association, once formed, may rescind the agreement if the debt remains unpaid more than 20 days after the association demands payment from the person, and upon rescission the person has no further rights or obligations with respect to the association.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1003(2): Unless the organic rules or an agreement to make a contribution to a limited cooperative association otherwise provide, if a person does not make a required contribution to an association, the person or the person's estate is obligated, at the option of the association, to contribute money equal to the value of the part of the contribution which has not been made.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1004 Allocations of profits and losses.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1004(1): The organic rules may provide for allocating profits of a limited cooperative association among members, among persons that are not members but conduct business with the association, to an unallocated account, or to any combination thereof.  Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, losses of the association shall be allocated in the same proportion as profits.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1004(2): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, all profits and losses of a limited cooperative association shall be allocated to patron members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1004(3): (3) If a limited cooperative association has investor members, the organic rules may not reduce the allocation to patron members to less than 50% of profits.  For purposes of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1004(3)(a): Amounts paid or due on contracts for the delivery to the association by patron members of products, goods, or services are not considered amounts allocated to patron members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1004(3)(b): Amounts paid, due, or allocated to investor members as a stated fixed return on equity are not considered amounts allocated to investor members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1004(4): (1); (2); (3) Unless prohibited by the organic rules, in determining the profits for allocation under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1004(4)(a): an unallocated capital reserve; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1004(4)(b): reasonable unallocated reserves for specific purposes, including expansion and replacement of capital assets; education, training, cooperative development; creation and distribution of information concerning principles of cooperation; and community responsibility.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1004(5): (2); (6); (4) Subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1004(5)(a): to patron members in the ratio of each member's patronage to the total patronage of all patron members during the period for which allocations are to be made; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1004(5)(b): to investor members, if any, in the ratio of each investor member's contributions to the total contributions of all investor members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1004(6): For purposes of allocation of profits and losses or specific items of profits or losses of a limited cooperative association to members, the organic rules may establish allocation units or methods based on separate classes of members or, for patron members, on class, function, division, district, department, allocation units, pooling arrangements, members' contributions, or other equitable methods.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1005 Distributions.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1005(1): 16-16-1007 Unless the organic rules otherwise provide and subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1005(2): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, distributions to members may be made in any form, including money, capital credits, allocated patronage equities, revolving fund certificates, and the limited cooperative association's own or other securities.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1006 Redemption or repurchase.
----------------------------------------------------------
Property distributed to a member by a limited cooperative association, other than money, may be redeemed or repurchased as provided in the organic rules but a redemption or repurchase may not be made without authorization by the board of directors.  The board may withhold authorization for any reason in its sole discretion.  A redemption or repurchase is treated as a distribution for purposes of Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1007 Limitations on distributions.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1007(1): A limited cooperative association may not make a distribution if, after the distribution:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1007(1)(a): the association would not be able to pay its debts as they become due in the ordinary course of the association's activities; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1007(1)(b): the association's assets would be less than the sum of its total liabilities.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1007(2): (1) A limited cooperative association may base a determination that a distribution is not prohibited under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1007(3): (4); (2) Except as otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1007(3)(a): in the case of distribution by purchase, redemption, or other acquisition of financial rights in the limited cooperative association, as of the date money or other property is transferred or debt is incurred by the association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1007(3)(b): in all other cases, as of the date:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1007(3)(b)(i): the distribution is authorized, if the payment occurs not later than 120 days after that date; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1007(3)(b)(ii): the payment is made, if payment occurs more than 120 days after the distribution is authorized.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1007(4): If indebtedness is issued as a distribution, each payment of principal or interest on the indebtedness is treated as a distribution, the effect of which is measured on the date the payment is made.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1007(5): For purposes of this section, "distribution" does not include reasonable amounts paid to a member in the ordinary course of business as payment or compensation for commodities, goods, past or present services, or reasonable payments made in the ordinary course of business under a bona fide retirement or other benefits program.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1008 Liability for improper distributions -- Limitation of action.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1008(1): 16-16-1007; 16-16-818; 16-16-819 A director who consents to a distribution that violates Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1008(2): 16-16-1007 A member or transferee of financial rights which received a distribution knowing that the distribution was made in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1008(3): (1); (1); (2); (2) A director against whom an action is commenced under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1008(3)(a): (1) implead in the action any other director who is liable under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1008(3)(b): (2); (2) implead in the action any person that is liable under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1008(4): An action under this section is barred if it is commenced later than two years after the distribution.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1009 Alternative distribution of unclaimed property, distributions, redemptions, or payments.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A limited cooperative association may distribute unclaimed property, distributions, redemptions, or payments by complying with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101 Member's dissociation.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(1): A person has the power to dissociate as a member at any time, rightfully or wrongfully, by express will.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(2): (4)(c); (d) Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a member's dissociation from a limited cooperative association is wrongful only if the dissociation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(2)(a): breaches an express provision of the organic rules; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(2)(b): (4)(c); (d) occurs before the termination of the limited cooperative association and:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(2)(b)(i): (4)(c); (d) the person is expelled as a member under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(2)(b)(ii): in the case of a person that is not an individual, trust other than a business trust, or estate, the person is expelled or otherwise dissociated as a member because it dissolved or terminated in bad faith.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(3): Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, a person that wrongfully dissociates as a member is liable to the limited cooperative association for damages caused by the dissociation.  The liability is in addition to any other debt, obligation, or liability of the person to the association.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4): 16-16-505; (4)(d)(iv)(A); (4)(d)(iv)(B); Part 16, Conversion and Merger A member is dissociated from the limited cooperative association as a member when:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(a): the association receives notice in a record of the member's express will to dissociate as a member, or if the member specifies in the notice an effective date later than the date the association received notice, on that later date;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(b): an event stated in the organic rules as causing the member's dissociation as a member occurs;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(c): the member is expelled as a member under the organic rules;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(d): 16-16-505; (4)(d)(iv)(A); (4)(d)(iv)(B) the member is expelled as a member by the board of directors because:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(d)(i): it is unlawful to carry on the association's activities with the member as a member;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(d)(ii): 16-16-505 there has been a transfer of all the member's financial rights in the association, other than:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(d)(ii)(A): a creation or perfection of a security interest; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(d)(ii)(B): 16-16-505 a charging order in effect under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(d)(iii): the member is a limited liability company, association, or partnership, it has been dissolved, and its business is being wound up;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(d)(iv): (4)(d)(iv)(A); (4)(d)(iv)(B) the member is a corporation or cooperative and:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(d)(iv)(A): the member filed a certificate of dissolution or the equivalent, or the jurisdiction of formation revoked the association's charter or right to conduct business;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(d)(iv)(B): (4)(d)(iv)(A) the association sends a notice to the member that it will be expelled as a member for a reason described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(d)(iv)(C): (4)(d)(iv)(B) not later than 90 days after the notice was sent under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(d)(v): the member is an individual and is adjudged incompetent;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(e): in the case of a member who is an individual, the individual dies;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(f): in the case of a member that is a trust or is acting as a member by virtue of being a trustee of a trust, all the trust's financial rights in the association are distributed;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(g): in the case of a member that is an estate, the estate's entire financial interest in the association is distributed;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(h): in the case of a member that is not an individual, partnership, limited liability company, cooperative, corporation, trust, or estate, the member is terminated; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1101(4)(i): Part 16, Conversion and Merger the association's participation in a merger if, under the plan of merger as approved under


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1102 Effect of dissociation as member.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1102(1): 16-16-1103; 16-16-1103; Part 16, Conversion and Merger Upon a member's dissociation:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1102(1)(a): 16-16-1103 subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1102(1)(b): 16-16-1103; Part 16, Conversion and Merger subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1102(2): A person's dissociation as a member does not of itself discharge the person from any debt, obligation, or liability to the limited cooperative association which the person incurred under the organic rules, by contract, or by other means while a member.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1103 Power of estate of member.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Unless the organic rules provide for greater rights, if a member is dissociated because of death, dies, or is expelled by reason of being adjudged incompetent, the member's personal representative or other legal representative may exercise the rights of a transferee of the member's financial rights and, for purposes of settling the estate of a deceased member, may exercise the informational rights of a current member to obtain information under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1201 Dissolution and winding up.
------------------------------------------------------------
A limited cooperative association is dissolved only as provided in this part and upon dissolution winds up in accordance with this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1202 Nonjudicial dissolution.
---------------------------------------------------------
Except as otherwise provided in SectionsUtah Code Annotated § 16-16-1202(1): upon the occurrence of an event or at a time specified in the articles of organization;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1202(2): 16-16-1204; 16-16-1205 upon the action of the association's organizers, board of directors, or members under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1202(3): 90 days after the dissociation of a member, which results in the association having one patron member and no other members, unless the association:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1202(3)(a): has a sole member that is a cooperative; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1202(3)(b): not later than the end of the 90-day period, admits at least one member in accordance with the organic rules and has at least two members, at least one of which is a patron member.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1203 Judicial dissolution.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1203(1): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration The attorney general may bring an action in a court with jurisdiction under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1203(1)(a): the association obtained the association's articles of organization through fraud; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1203(1)(b): the association has continued to exceed or abuse the authority conferred upon the corporation by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1203(2): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration A member may bring an action in a court with jurisdiction under
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1203(2)(a): the directors are deadlocked in the management of the association's affairs, the members are unable to break the deadlock, and irreparable injury to the association is occurring or is threatened because of the deadlock;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1203(2)(b): the directors or those in control of the association have acted, are acting, or will act in a manner that is illegal, oppressive, or fraudulent;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1203(2)(c): the members are deadlocked in voting power and have failed to elect successors to directors whose terms have expired for two consecutive periods during which annual members meetings were held or were to be held; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1203(2)(d): the assets of the association are being misapplied or wasted.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1203(3): If an action is brought under this section, a court may dissolve a limited cooperative association or order an action that under the circumstances is appropriate or equitable.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1204 Voluntary dissolution before commencement of activity.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A majority of the organizers or initial directors of a limited cooperative association that has not yet begun business activity or the conduct of its affairs may dissolve the association.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205 Voluntary dissolution by the board and members.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205(1): 16-16-1204; 16-16-508; (1)(a) Except as otherwise provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205(1)(a): a resolution to dissolve shall be approved by a majority vote of the board of directors unless a greater percentage is required by the organic rules;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205(1)(b): the board of directors shall call a members meeting to consider the resolution, to be held not later than 90 days after adoption of the resolution; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205(1)(c): 16-16-508; (1)(a) the board of directors shall mail or otherwise transmit or deliver to each member in a record that complies with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205(1)(c)(i): (1)(a) the resolution required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205(1)(c)(ii): a recommendation that the members vote in favor of the resolution or, if the board determines that because of conflict of interest or other special circumstances it should not make a favorable recommendation, the basis of that determination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205(1)(c)(iii): notice of the members meeting, which shall be given in the same manner as notice of a special meeting of members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205(2): (3); (1)(b) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205(2)(a): (1)(b) at least two-thirds of the voting power of members present at a members meeting called under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205(2)(b): if the limited cooperative association has investor members, at least a majority of the votes cast by patron members, unless the organic rules require a greater percentage.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205(3): (2)(a); (3)(a); (b) The organic rules may require that the percentage of votes under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205(3)(a): a different percentage that is not less than a majority of members voting at the meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205(3)(b): measured against the voting power of all members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1205(3)(c): (3)(a); (b) a combination of Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1206 Winding up.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1206(1): A limited cooperative association continues after dissolution only for purposes of winding up the association's activities.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1206(2): In winding up a limited cooperative association's activities, the board of directors shall cause the association to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1206(2)(a): discharge the association's liabilities, settle and close the association's activities, and marshal and distribute the association's assets;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1206(2)(b): preserve the association or its property as a going concern for no more than a reasonable time;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1206(2)(c): prosecute and defend actions and proceedings;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1206(2)(d): transfer association property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1206(2)(e): perform other necessary acts.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1206(3): After dissolution and upon application of a limited cooperative association, a member, or a holder of financial rights, a court may order judicial supervision of the winding up of the association, including the appointment of a person to wind up the association's activities, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1206(3)(a): after a reasonable time, the association has not wound up the association's activities; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1206(3)(b): the applicant establishes other good cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1206(4): (3) If a person is appointed pursuant to Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1207 Distribution of assets in winding up limited cooperative association.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1207(1): (2) In winding up a limited cooperative association's business, the association shall apply its assets to discharge its obligations to creditors, including members that are creditors.  The association shall apply any remaining assets to pay in money the net amount distributable to members in accordance with their right to distributions under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1207(2): (2) Unless the organic rules otherwise provide, in this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208 Known claims against dissolved limited cooperative association.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208(1): (4); (2); (3) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208(2): A dissolved limited cooperative association may notify its known claimants of the dissolution in a record.  The notice shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208(2)(a): specify that a claim be in a record;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208(2)(b): specify the information required to be included in the claim;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208(2)(c): provide an address to which the claim shall be sent;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208(2)(d): state the deadline for receipt of the claim, which may not be less than 120 days after the date the notice is received by the claimant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208(2)(e): state that the claim will be barred if not received by the deadline.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208(3): (2); (2)(d) A claim against a dissolved limited cooperative association is barred if the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208(3)(a): (2)(d) the association is not notified of the claimant's claim, in a record, by the deadline specified in the notice under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208(3)(b): in the case of a claim that is timely received but rejected by the association, the claimant does not commence an action to enforce the claim against the association not later than 90 days after receipt of the notice of the rejection; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208(3)(c): if a claim is timely received but is neither accepted nor rejected by the association not later than 120 days after the deadline for receipt of claims, the claimant does not commence an action to enforce the claim against the association:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208(3)(c)(i): after the 120-day period; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208(3)(c)(ii): not later than 90 days after the 120-day period.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1208(4): This section does not apply to a claim based on an event occurring after the date of dissolution or a liability that is contingent on that date.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1209 Other claims against dissolved limited cooperative association.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1209(1): A dissolved limited cooperative association may publish notice of its dissolution and request persons having claims against the association to present them in accordance with the notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1209(2): (1); 45-1-101 A notice under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1209(2)(a): 45-1-101 be published:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1209(2)(a)(i): at least once in a newspaper of general circulation in the county in which the dissolved limited cooperative association's principal office is located or, if the association does not have a principal office in this state, in the county in which the association's designated office is or was last located; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1209(2)(a)(ii): 45-1-101 as required in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1209(2)(b): describe the information required to be contained in a claim and provide an address to which the claim is to be sent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1209(2)(c): state that a claim against the association is barred unless an action to enforce the claim is commenced not later than three years after publication of the notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1209(3): (2); 16-16-1208 If a dissolved limited cooperative association publishes a notice in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1209(3)(a): 16-16-1208 a claimant that is entitled to but did not receive notice in a record under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1209(3)(b): a claimant whose claim is contingent or based on an event occurring after the effective date of dissolution.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1209(4): (4) A claim not barred under this section may be enforced:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1209(4)(a): against a dissolved limited cooperative association, to the extent of its undistributed assets; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1209(4)(b): (4) if the association's assets have been distributed in connection with winding up the association's activities against a member or holder of financial rights to the extent of that person's proportionate share of the claim or the association's assets distributed to the person in connection with the winding up, whichever is less.  The person's total liability for all claims under this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1210 Court proceeding.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1210(1): 16-16-1209; Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration Upon a petition by a dissolved limited cooperative association that has published a notice under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1210(2): (1) Not later than 10 days after filing a petition under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1210(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1210(3)(a): The court may appoint a representative in a proceeding brought under this section to represent all claimants whose identities are unknown.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1210(3)(b): The dissolved limited cooperative association shall pay reasonable fees and expenses of the representative, including all reasonable attorney and expert witness fees.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1210(4): Provision by the dissolved limited cooperative association for security in the amount and the form ordered by the court satisfies the association's obligations with respect to claims that are contingent, have not been made known to the association, or are based on an event occurring after the effective date of dissolution, and the claims may not be enforced against a member that received a distribution.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1211 Administrative dissolution.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1211(1): The division may dissolve a limited cooperative association administratively if the association does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1211(1)(a): pay, not later than 60 days after the due date, any fee, tax, or penalty due to the division under this chapter or other law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1211(1)(b): deliver not later than 60 days after the due date its annual report to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1211(2): If the division determines that a ground exists for dissolving a limited cooperative association administratively, the division shall file a record of the determination and serve the association with a copy of the record.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1211(3): (2) If, not later than 60 days after service of a copy of the division's determination under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1211(4): A limited cooperative association that has been dissolved administratively continues its existence only for purposes of winding up its activities.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1211(5): The administrative dissolution of a limited cooperative association does not terminate the authority of its agent for service of process.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1212 Reinstatement following administrative dissolution.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1212(1): 16-16-111 A limited cooperative association that has been dissolved administratively may apply to the division for reinstatement under the limited cooperative association's same name at any time after the effective date of dissolution if the limited cooperative association's name is available and the limited cooperative association delivers to the division for filing an application for reinstatement that states:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1212(1)(a): the name of the association and the effective date of its administrative dissolution;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1212(1)(b): that the grounds for dissolution either did not exist or have been eliminated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1212(1)(c): 16-16-111 that the association's name satisfies the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1212(2): A limited cooperative association administratively dissolved on or after May 1, 2019, but before May 1, 2024, may apply for reinstatement under the limited cooperative association's same name if the limited cooperative association's name is available and the limited cooperative association delivers to the division for filing an application for reinstatement that satisfies the requirements of Subsections (1)(a) and (c).
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1212(3): 42-2-6.6 A limited cooperative association retains the limited cooperative association's name and assumed name, as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1212(4): If the division determines that an application contains the information required by Subsection (1) or (2) and that the information is correct, the division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1212(4)(a): prepare a declaration of reinstatement;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1212(4)(b): file the original of the declaration; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1212(4)(c): serve a copy of the declaration on the association.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1212(5): When reinstatement under this section becomes effective, it relates back to and takes effect as of the effective date of the administrative dissolution, and the limited cooperative association may resume or continue its activities as if the administrative dissolution had not occurred.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1213 Denial of reinstatement -- Appeal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1213(1): If the division denies a limited cooperative association's application for reinstatement following administrative dissolution, the division shall prepare and file a notice that explains the reason for denial and serve the association with a copy of the notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1213(2): Not later than 30 days after service of a notice of denial of reinstatement by the division, a limited cooperative association may appeal the denial by petitioning the district court to set aside the dissolution.  The petition shall be served on the division and contain a copy of the division's declaration of dissolution, the association's application for reinstatement, and the division's notice of denial.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1213(3): The court may summarily order the division to reinstate the dissolved cooperative association or may take other action the court considers appropriate.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1214 Statement of dissolution.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1214(1): A limited cooperative association that has dissolved or is about to dissolve may deliver to the division for filing a statement of dissolution that states:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1214(1)(a): the name of the association;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1214(1)(b): the date the association dissolved or will dissolve; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1214(1)(c): any other information the association considers relevant.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1214(2): A person has notice of a limited cooperative association's dissolution on the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1214(2)(a): 90 days after a statement of dissolution is filed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1214(2)(b): the effective date stated in the statement of dissolution.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1215 Statement of termination.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1215(1): A dissolved limited cooperative association that has completed winding up may deliver to the division for filing a statement of termination that states:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1215(1)(a): the name of the association;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1215(1)(b): the date of filing of its initial articles of organization; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1215(1)(c): that the association is terminated.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1215(2): The filing of a statement of termination does not itself terminate the limited cooperative association.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1301 Derivative action.
---------------------------------------------------
A member may maintain a derivative action to enforce a right of a limited cooperative association if:Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1301(1): the member demands that the association bring an action to enforce the right; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1301(2): any of the following occur:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1301(2)(a): the association does not, not later than 90 days after the member makes the demand, agree to bring the action;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1301(2)(b): the association notifies the member that it has rejected the demand;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1301(2)(c): irreparable harm to the association would result by waiting 90 days after the member makes the demand; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1301(2)(d): the association agrees to bring an action demanded and fails to bring the action within a reasonable time.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1302 Proper plaintiff.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1302(1): A derivative action to enforce a right of a limited cooperative association may be maintained only by a person that:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1302(1)(a): is a member or a dissociated member at the time the action is commenced and:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1302(1)(a)(i): was a member when the conduct giving rise to the action occurred; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1302(1)(a)(ii): whose status as a member devolved upon the person by operation of law or the organic rules from a person that was a member at the time of the conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1302(1)(b): adequately represents the interests of the association.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1302(2): (1) If the sole plaintiff in a derivative action dies while the action is pending, the court may permit another member who meets the requirements of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1303 Pleading.
------------------------------------------
In a derivative action to enforce a right of a limited cooperative association, the complaint shall state:Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1303(1): 16-16-1301(1) the date and content of the plaintiff's demand under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1303(2): if 90 days have not expired since the demand, how irreparable harm to the association would result by waiting for the expiration of 90 days; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1303(3): if the association agreed to bring an action demanded, that the action has not been brought within a reasonable time.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1304 Approval for discontinuance or settlement.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
A derivative action to enforce a right of a limited cooperative association may not be discontinued or settled without the court's approval.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1305 Proceeds and expenses.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1305(1): (2) Except as otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1305(1)(a): any proceeds or other benefits of a derivative action to enforce a right of a limited cooperative association, whether by judgment, compromise, or settlement, belong to the association and not to the plaintiff; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1305(1)(b): if the plaintiff in the derivative action receives any proceeds, the plaintiff shall immediately remit them to the association.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1305(2): If a derivative action to enforce a right of a limited cooperative association is successful in whole or in part, the court may award the plaintiff reasonable expenses, including reasonable attorney fees and costs, from the recovery of the association.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1401 Governing law.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1401(1): The law of the state or other jurisdiction under which a foreign cooperative is organized governs relations among the members of the foreign cooperative and between the members and the foreign cooperative.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1401(2): A foreign cooperative may not be denied a certificate of authority because of any difference between the law of the jurisdiction under which the foreign cooperative is organized and the law of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1401(3): A certificate of authority does not authorize a foreign cooperative to engage in any activity or exercise any power that a limited cooperative association may not engage in or exercise in this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1402 Application for certificate of authority.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1402(1): 16-16-111; 16-16-1405 A foreign cooperative may apply for a certificate of authority by delivering an application to the division for filing.  The application shall state:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1402(1)(a): 16-16-111; 16-16-1405 the name of the foreign cooperative and, if the name does not comply with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1402(1)(b): the name of the state or other jurisdiction under whose law the foreign cooperative is organized;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1402(1)(c): the street address and, if different, mailing address of the principal office and, if the law of the jurisdiction under which the foreign cooperative is organized requires the foreign cooperative to maintain another office in that jurisdiction, the street address and, if different, mailing address of the required office;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1402(1)(d): the street address and, if different, mailing address of the foreign cooperative's designated office in this state, and the name of the foreign cooperative's agent for service of process at the designated office; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1402(1)(e): the name, street address and, if different, mailing address of each of the foreign cooperative's current directors and officers.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1402(2): (1) A foreign cooperative shall deliver with a completed application under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1403 Activities not constituting transacting business.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1403(1): Activities of a foreign cooperative which do not constitute transacting business in this state under this part include:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1403(1)(a): maintaining, defending, and settling an action or proceeding;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1403(1)(b): holding meetings of the foreign cooperative's members or directors or carrying on any other activity concerning the foreign cooperative's internal affairs;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1403(1)(c): maintaining accounts in financial institutions;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1403(1)(d): maintaining offices or agencies for the transfer, exchange, and registration of the foreign cooperative's own securities or maintaining trustees or depositories with respect to those securities;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1403(1)(e): selling through independent contractors;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1403(1)(f): soliciting or obtaining orders, whether by mail or electronic means, through employees, agents, or otherwise, if the orders require acceptance outside this state before they become contracts;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1403(1)(g): creating or acquiring indebtedness, mortgages, or security interests in real or personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1403(1)(h): securing or collecting debts or enforcing mortgages or other security interests in property securing the debts, and holding, protecting, and maintaining property so acquired;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1403(1)(i): conducting an isolated transaction that is completed within 30 days and is not one in the course of similar transactions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1403(1)(j): transacting business in interstate commerce.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1403(2): (1) For purposes of this part, the ownership in this state of income-producing real property or tangible personal property, other than property excluded under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1403(3): This section does not apply in determining the contacts or activities that may subject a foreign cooperative to service of process, taxation, or regulation under law of this state other than this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1404 Issuance of certificate of authority.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless the division determines that an application for a certificate of authority does not comply with the filing requirements of this chapter, the division, upon payment by the foreign cooperative of all filing fees, shall file the application, issue a certificate of authority, and send a copy of the filed certificate, together with a receipt for the fees, to the foreign cooperative or its representative.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1405 Noncomplying name of foreign cooperative.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1405(1): 16-16-111; 16-16-111; (1); 42-2-5; 42-2-5 A foreign cooperative whose name does not comply with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1405(2): 16-16-111; (1) If a foreign cooperative authorized to transact business in this state changes its name to one that does not comply with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1406 Revocation of certificate of authority.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1406(1): (2) A certificate of authority may be revoked by the division in the manner provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1406(1)(a): pay, not later than 60 days after the due date, any fee, tax, or penalty due to the division under this chapter or any other law of this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1406(1)(b): deliver, not later than 60 days after the due date, its annual report;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1406(1)(c): appoint and maintain an agent for service of process; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1406(1)(d): deliver for filing a statement of change not later than 30 days after a change has occurred in the name of the agent or the address of the foreign cooperative's designated office.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1406(2): To revoke a certificate of authority, the division shall file a notice of revocation and send a copy to the foreign cooperative's registered agent for service of process in this state or, if the foreign cooperative does not appoint and maintain an agent for service of process in this state, to the foreign cooperative's principal office.  The notice shall state:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1406(2)(a): the revocation's effective date, which shall be at least 60 days after the date the division sends the copy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1406(2)(b): the foreign cooperative's noncompliance that is the reason for the revocation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1406(3): The authority of a foreign cooperative to transact business in this state ceases on the effective date of the notice of revocation unless before that date the foreign cooperative cures each failure to comply stated in the notice.  If the foreign cooperative cures the failures, the division shall so indicate on the filed notice.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1407 Cancellation of certificate of authority -- Effect of failure to have certificate.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1407(1): 16-16-203 To cancel its certificate of authority, a foreign cooperative shall deliver to the division for filing a notice of cancellation.  The certificate is canceled when the notice becomes effective under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1407(2): A foreign cooperative transacting business in this state may not maintain an action or proceeding in this state unless it has a certificate of authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1407(3): The failure of a foreign cooperative to have a certificate of authority does not impair the validity of a contract or act of the foreign cooperative or prevent the foreign cooperative from defending an action or proceeding in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1407(4): A member of a foreign cooperative is not liable for the obligations of the foreign cooperative solely by reason of the foreign cooperative's having transacted business in this state without a certificate of authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1407(5): If a foreign cooperative transacts business in this state without a certificate of authority or cancels its certificate, it appoints the division as its agent for service of process for an action arising out of the transaction of business in this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1408 Action by attorney general.
------------------------------------------------------------
The attorney general may maintain an action to restrain a foreign cooperative from transacting business in this state in violation of this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1501 Disposition of assets not requiring member approval.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless the articles of organization otherwise provide, member approval under SectionUtah Code Annotated § 16-16-1501(1): sell, lease, exchange, license, or otherwise dispose of all or any part of the assets of the association in the usual and regular course of business; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1501(2): mortgage, pledge, dedicate to the repayment of indebtedness, or encumber in any way all or any part of the assets of the association whether or not in the usual and regular course of business.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1502 Member approval of other disposition of assets.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A sale, lease, exchange, license, or other disposition of assets of a limited cooperative association, other than a disposition described in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1503 Notice and action on disposition of assets.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
For a limited cooperative association to dispose of assets under SectionUtah Code Annotated § 16-16-1503(1): a majority of the board of directors, or a greater percentage if required by the organic rules, shall approve the proposed disposition; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1503(2): the board of directors shall call a members meeting to consider the proposed disposition, hold the meeting not later than 90 days after approval of the proposed disposition by the board, and mail or otherwise transmit or deliver in a record to each member:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1503(2)(a): the terms of the proposed disposition;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1503(2)(b): a recommendation that the members approve the disposition, or if the board determines that because of conflict of interest or other special circumstances it should not make a favorable recommendation, the basis for that determination;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1503(2)(c): a statement of any condition of the board's submission of the proposed disposition to the members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1503(2)(d): notice of the meeting at which the proposed disposition will be considered, which shall be given in the same manner as notice of a special meeting of members.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1504 Disposition of assets.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1504(1): (2); 16-16-1502; 16-16-1503(2) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1504(1)(a): 16-16-1503(2) at least two-thirds of the voting power of members present at a members meeting called under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1504(1)(b): if the limited cooperative association has investor members, at least a majority of the votes cast by patron members, unless the organic rules require a greater percentage vote by patron members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1504(2): (1)(a); (2)(a); (b) The organic rules may require that the percentage of votes under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1504(2)(a): a different percentage that is not less than a majority of members voting at the meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1504(2)(b): measured against the voting power of all members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1504(2)(c): (2)(a); (b) a combination of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1504(3): Subject to any contractual obligations, after a disposition of assets is approved and at any time before the consummation of the disposition, a limited cooperative association may approve an amendment to the contract for disposition or the resolution authorizing the disposition or approve abandonment of the disposition:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1504(3)(a): as provided in the contract or the resolution; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1504(3)(b): except as prohibited by the resolution, with the same affirmative vote of the board of directors and of the members as was required to approve the disposition.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1504(4): 16-16-404 The voting requirements for districts, classes, or voting groups under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1601 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
In this part:Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1601(1): "Constituent entity" means an entity that is a party to a merger.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1601(2): "Constituent limited cooperative association" means a limited cooperative association that is a party to a merger.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1601(3): 16-16-1602; 16-16-1605 "Converted entity" means the organization into which a converting entity converts pursuant to Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1601(4): 16-16-1602; 16-16-1605 "Converting entity" means an entity that converts into another entity pursuant to Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1601(5): "Converting limited cooperative association" means a converting entity that is a limited cooperative association.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1601(6): "Organizational documents" means articles of incorporation, bylaws, articles of organization, operating agreements, partnership agreements, or other documents serving a similar function in the creation and governance of an entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1601(7): "Personal liability" means personal liability for a debt, liability, or other obligation of an entity imposed, by operation of law or otherwise, on a person that co-owns or has an interest in the entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1601(7)(a): by the entity's organic law solely because of the person co-owning or having an interest in the entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1601(7)(b): by the entity's organizational documents under a provision of the entity's organic law authorizing those documents to make one or more specified persons liable for all or specified parts of the entity's debts, liabilities, and other obligations solely because the person co-owns or has an interest in the entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1601(8): "Surviving entity" means an entity into which one or more other entities are merged, whether the entity existed before the merger or is created by the merger.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1602 Conversion.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1602(1): 16-16-1603; 16-16-1605 An entity that is not a limited cooperative association may convert to a limited cooperative association and a limited cooperative association may convert to an entity that is not a limited cooperative association pursuant to this section, Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1602(1)(a): the other entity's organic law authorizes the conversion;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1602(1)(b): the conversion is not prohibited by the law of the jurisdiction that enacted the other entity's organic law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1602(1)(c): the other entity complies with its organic law in effecting the conversion.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1602(2): A plan of conversion shall be in a record and shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1602(2)(a): the name and form of the entity before conversion;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1602(2)(b): the name and form of the entity after conversion;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1602(2)(c): the terms and conditions of the conversion, including the manner and basis for converting interests in the converting entity into any combination of money, interests in the converted entity, and other consideration; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1602(2)(d): the organizational documents of the proposed converted entity.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603 Action on plan of conversion by converting limited cooperative association.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(1): For a limited cooperative association to convert to another entity, a plan of conversion shall be approved by a majority of the board of directors, or a greater percentage if required by the organic rules, and the board of directors shall call a members meeting to consider the plan of conversion, hold the meeting not later than 90 days after approval of the plan by the board, and mail or otherwise transmit or deliver in a record to each member:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(1)(a): the plan, or a summary of the plan and a statement of the manner in which a copy of the plan in a record may be reasonably obtained by a member;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(1)(b): a recommendation that the members approve the plan of conversion, or if the board determines that because of a conflict of interest or other circumstances it should not make a favorable recommendation, the basis for that determination;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(1)(c): a statement of any condition of the board's submission of the plan of conversion to the members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(1)(d): notice of the meeting at which the plan of conversion will be considered, which shall be given in the same manner as notice of a special meeting of members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(2): (3); (4); (1) Subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(2)(a): (1) at least two-thirds of the voting power of members present at a members meeting called under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(2)(b): if the limited cooperative association has investor members, at least a majority of the votes cast by patron members, unless the organic rules require a greater percentage vote by patron members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(3): (2)(a); (3)(a); (b) The organic rules may require that the percentage of votes under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(3)(a): a different percentage that is not less than a majority of members voting at the meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(3)(b): measured against the voting power of all members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(3)(c): (3)(a); (b) a combination of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(4): The vote required to approve a plan of conversion may not be less than the vote required for the members of the limited cooperative association to amend the articles of organization.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(5): Consent in a record to a plan of conversion by a member shall be delivered to the limited cooperative association before delivery of articles of conversion for filing if as a result of the conversion the member will have:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(5)(a): personal liability for an obligation of the association; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(5)(b): an obligation or liability for an additional contribution.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(6): (5) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(6)(a): as provided in the plan; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(6)(b): except as prohibited by the plan, by the same affirmative vote of the board of directors and of the members as was required to approve the plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1603(7): 16-16-404 The voting requirements for districts, classes, or voting groups under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604 Filings required for conversion -- Effective date.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(1): 16-16-120; 16-16-302 After a plan of conversion is approved:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(1)(a): 16-16-120 a converting limited cooperative association shall deliver to the division for filing articles of conversion, which shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(1)(a)(i): a statement that the limited cooperative association has been converted into another entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(1)(a)(ii): the name and form of the converted entity and the jurisdiction of its governing statute;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(1)(a)(iii): the date the conversion is effective under the governing statute of the converted entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(1)(a)(iv): a statement that the conversion was approved as required by this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(1)(a)(v): a statement that the conversion was approved as required by the governing statute of the converted entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(1)(a)(vi): 16-16-120 if the converted entity is an entity organized in a jurisdiction other than this state and is not authorized to transact business in this state, the street address and, if different, mailing address of an office which the division may use for purposes of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(1)(b): 16-16-302 if the converting entity is not a converting limited cooperative association, the converting entity shall deliver to the division for filing articles of organization, which shall include, in addition to the information required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(1)(b)(i): a statement that the association was converted from another entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(1)(b)(ii): the name and form of the converting entity and the jurisdiction of its governing statute; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(1)(b)(iii): a statement that the conversion was approved in a manner that complied with the converting entity's governing statute.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(2): 16-16-203(3) A conversion becomes effective:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(2)(a): 16-16-203(3) if the converted entity is a limited cooperative association, when the articles of conversion take effect pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1604(2)(b): if the converted entity is not a limited cooperative association, as provided by the governing statute of the converted entity.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1605 Effect of conversion.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1605(1): An entity that has been converted pursuant to this part is for all purposes the same entity that existed before the conversion and is not a new entity but, after conversion, is organized under the organic law of the converted entity and is subject to that law and other law as it applies to the converted entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1605(2): Part 12, Dissolution When a conversion takes effect under this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1605(2)(a): all property owned by the converting entity remains vested in the converted entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1605(2)(b): all debts, liabilities, and other obligations of the converting entity continue as obligations of the converted entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1605(2)(c): an action or proceeding pending by or against the converting entity may be continued as if the conversion had not occurred;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1605(2)(d): except as prohibited by other law, all the rights, privileges, immunities, powers, and purposes of the converting entity remain vested in the converted entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1605(2)(e): except as otherwise provided in the plan of conversion, the terms and conditions of the plan of conversion take effect; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1605(2)(f): Part 12, Dissolution except as otherwise provided in the plan of conversion, the conversion does not dissolve a converting limited cooperative association for purposes of
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1605(3): (3); (3); 16-16-120(3); (4) A converted entity that is an entity organized under the laws of a jurisdiction other than this state consents to the jurisdiction of the courts of this state to enforce any obligation owed by the converting limited cooperative association if, before the conversion, the converting limited cooperative association was subject to suit in this state on the obligation.  A converted entity that is an entity organized under the laws of a jurisdiction other than this state and not authorized to transact business in this state appoints the division as its agent for service of process for purposes of enforcing an obligation under this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1606 Merger.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1606(1): One or more limited cooperative associations may merge with one or more other entities pursuant to this part and a plan of merger if:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1606(1)(a): the governing statute of each of the other entities authorizes the merger;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1606(1)(b): the merger is not prohibited by the law of a jurisdiction that enacted any of those governing statutes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1606(1)(c): each of the other entities complies with its governing statute in effecting the merger.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1606(2): A plan of merger shall be in a record and shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1606(2)(a): the name and form of each constituent entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1606(2)(b): the name and form of the surviving entity and, if the surviving entity is to be created by the merger, a statement to that effect;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1606(2)(c): the terms and conditions of the merger, including the manner and basis for converting the interests in each constituent entity into any combination of money, interests in the surviving entity, and other consideration;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1606(2)(d): if the surviving entity is to be created by the merger, the surviving entity's organizational documents;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1606(2)(e): if the surviving entity is not to be created by the merger, any amendments to be made by the merger to the surviving entity's organizational documents; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1606(2)(f): if a member of a constituent limited cooperative association will have personal liability with respect to a surviving entity, the identity of the member by descriptive class or other reasonable manner.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1607 Notice and action on plan of merger by constituent limited cooperative association.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1607(1): For a limited cooperative association to merge with another entity, a plan of merger shall be approved by a majority vote of the board of directors or a greater percentage if required by the association's organic rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1607(2): The board of directors shall call a members meeting to consider a plan of merger approved by the board, hold the meeting not later than 90 days after approval of the plan by the board, and mail or otherwise transmit or deliver in a record to each member:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1607(2)(a): the plan of merger, or a summary of the plan and a statement of the manner in which a copy of the plan in a record may be reasonably obtained by a member;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1607(2)(b): a recommendation that the members approve the plan of merger, or if the board determines that because of conflict of interest or other special circumstances it should not make a favorable recommendation, the basis for that determination;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1607(2)(c): a statement of any condition of the board's submission of the plan of merger to the members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1607(2)(d): notice of the meeting at which the plan of merger will be considered, which shall be given in the same manner as notice of a special meeting of members.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608 Approval or abandonment of merger by members.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(1): (2); (3); 16-16-1607(2) Subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(1)(a): 16-16-1607(2) at least two-thirds of the voting power of members present at a members meeting called under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(1)(b): if the limited cooperative association has investor members, at least a majority of the votes cast by patron members, unless the organic rules require a greater percentage vote by patron members.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(2): (1)(a); (2)(a); (b) The organic rules may provide that the percentage of votes under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(2)(a): a different percentage that is not less than a majority of members voting at the meeting;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(2)(b): measured against the voting power of all members; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(2)(c): (2)(a); (b) a combination of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(3): The vote required to approve a plan of merger may not be less than the vote required for the members of the limited cooperative association to amend the articles of organization.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(4): 16-16-1609 Consent in a record to a plan of merger by a member shall be delivered to the limited cooperative association before delivery of articles of merger for filing pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(4)(a): personal liability for an obligation of the association; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(4)(b): an obligation or liability for an additional contribution.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(5): (4) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(5)(a): as provided in the plan; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(5)(b): except as prohibited by the plan, with the same affirmative vote of the board of directors and of the members as was required to approve the plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1608(6): 16-16-404 The voting requirements for districts, classes, or voting groups under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609 Filings required for merger -- Effective date.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(1): After each constituent entity has approved a merger, articles of merger shall be signed on behalf of each constituent entity by an authorized representative.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(2): 16-16-120 The articles of merger shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(2)(a): the name and form of each constituent entity and the jurisdiction of its governing statute;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(2)(b): the name and form of the surviving entity, the jurisdiction of its governing statute, and, if the surviving entity is created by the merger, a statement to that effect;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(2)(c): the date the merger is effective under the governing statute of the surviving entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(2)(d): if the surviving entity is to be created by the merger and:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(2)(d)(i): will be a limited cooperative association, the limited cooperative association's articles of organization; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(2)(d)(ii): will be an entity other than a limited cooperative association, the organizational document that creates the entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(2)(e): if the surviving entity is not created by the merger, any amendments provided for in the plan of merger to the organizational document that created the entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(2)(f): a statement as to each constituent entity that the merger was approved as required by the entity's governing statute;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(2)(g): 16-16-120 if the surviving entity is a foreign organization not authorized to transact business in this state, the street address and, if different, mailing address of an office which the division may use for the purposes of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(2)(h): any additional information required by the governing statute of any constituent entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(3): Each limited cooperative association that is a party to a merger shall deliver the articles of merger to the division for filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(4): (3); 16-16-203(3) A merger becomes effective under this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(4)(a): (3); 16-16-203(3) if the surviving entity is a limited cooperative association, upon the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(4)(a)(i): (3) compliance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(4)(a)(ii): 16-16-203(3) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1609(4)(b): if the surviving entity is not a limited cooperative association, as provided by the governing statute of the surviving entity.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610 Effect of merger.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610(1): Part 12, Dissolution When a merger becomes effective:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610(1)(a): the surviving entity continues or comes into existence;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610(1)(b): each constituent entity that merges into the surviving entity ceases to exist as a separate entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610(1)(c): all property owned by each constituent entity that ceases to exist vests in the surviving entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610(1)(d): all debts, liabilities, and other obligations of each constituent entity that ceases to exist continue as obligations of the surviving entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610(1)(e): an action or proceeding pending by or against any constituent entity that ceases to exist may be continued as if the merger had not occurred;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610(1)(f): except as prohibited by law other than this chapter, all rights, privileges, immunities, powers, and purposes of each constituent entity that ceases to exist vest in the surviving entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610(1)(g): except as otherwise provided in the plan of merger, the terms and conditions of the plan take effect;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610(1)(h): Part 12, Dissolution except as otherwise provided in the plan of merger, if a merging limited cooperative association ceases to exist, the merger does not dissolve the association for purposes of
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610(1)(i): if the surviving entity is created by the merger and:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610(1)(i)(i): is a limited cooperative association, the articles of organization become effective; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610(1)(i)(ii): is an entity other than a limited cooperative association, the organizational document that creates the entity becomes effective; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610(1)(j): if the surviving entity is not created by the merger, any amendments made by the articles of merger for the organizational documents of the surviving entity become effective.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1610(2): (2); (2); 16-16-120(3); (4) A surviving entity that is an entity organized under the laws of a jurisdiction other than this state consents to the jurisdiction of the courts of this state to enforce any obligation owed by the constituent entity if, before the merger, the constituent entity was subject to suit in this state on the obligation.  A surviving entity that is an entity organized under the laws of a jurisdiction other than this state and not authorized to transact business in this state appoints the division as its agent for service of process for purposes of enforcing an obligation under this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1611 Consolidation.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1611(1): Constituent entities that are limited cooperative associations or foreign cooperatives may agree to call a merger a consolidation under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1611(2): (1) All provisions governing mergers or using the term merger in this chapter apply equally to mergers that the constituent entities choose to call consolidations under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1612 Part not exclusive.
----------------------------------------------------
This part does not prohibit a limited cooperative association from being converted or merged under law other than this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1701 Uniformity of application and construction.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
In applying and construing this uniform act, consideration shall be given to the need to promote uniformity of the law with respect to its subject matter among states that enact it.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1702 Relation to Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This chapter modifies, limits, or supersedes the federal Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act, 15 U.S.C. Sec. 7001 et seq., but does not modify, limit, or supersede Section 101(c) of that act, 15 U.S.C. Sec. 7001(c), or authorize electronic delivery of any of the notices described in Section 103(b) of that act, 15 U.S.C. Sec. 7003(b).

Utah Code Annotated § 16-16-1703 Savings clause.
------------------------------------------------
This chapter does not affect an action or proceeding commenced, or right accrued, before May 5, 2008.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 16 - Chapter 17 - Model Registered Agents Act
*************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Model Registered Agents Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(1): 16-17-204; 16-17-210 "Appointment of agent" means a statement appointing an agent for service of process filed by:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(1)(a): 16-17-204 a domestic or foreign unincorporated nonprofit association under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(1)(b): 16-17-210 a domestic entity that is not a filing entity or a nonqualified foreign entity under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(2): 16-17-204 "Commercial registered agent" means an individual or a domestic or foreign entity listed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(3): "Division" means the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(4): "Domestic entity" means an entity whose internal affairs are governed by the law of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(5): 48-1d-202(3); 48-1d-1405 "Entity" means a person that has a separate legal existence or has the power to acquire an interest in real property in its own name other than:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(5)(a): an individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(5)(b): a testamentary, inter vivos, or charitable trust, with the exception of a business trust, statutory trust, or similar trust;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(5)(c): 48-1d-202(3); 48-1d-1405 an association or relationship that is not a partnership by reason of Section 202(c) of the Uniform Partnership Act (1997), or Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(5)(d): a decedent's estate; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(5)(e): a public corporation, government or governmental subdivision, agency, or instrumentality, or quasi-governmental instrumentality.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(6): "Filing entity" means an entity that is created by the filing of a public organic document.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(7): "Foreign entity" means an entity other than a domestic entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(8): "Foreign qualification document" means an application for a certificate of authority or other foreign qualification filing with the division by a foreign entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(9): "Governance interest" means the right under the organic law or organic rules of an entity, other than as a governor, agent, assignee, or proxy, to:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(9)(a): receive or demand access to information concerning, or the books and records of, the entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(9)(b): vote for the election of the governors of the entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(9)(c): receive notice of or vote on any or all issues involving the internal affairs of the entity.
