Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(10): "Governor" means a person by or under whose authority the powers of an entity are exercised and under whose direction the business and affairs of the entity are managed pursuant to the organic law and organic rules of the entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(11): "Interest" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(11)(a): a governance interest in an unincorporated entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(11)(b): a transferable interest in an unincorporated entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(11)(c): a share or membership in a corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(12): "Interest holder" means a direct holder of an interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(13): "Jurisdiction of organization," with respect to an entity, means the jurisdiction whose law includes the organic law of the entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(14): 16-17-204; 16-17-203(1)(b)(ii) "Noncommercial registered agent" means a person that is not listed as a commercial registered agent under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(14)(a): an individual or a domestic or foreign entity that serves in this state as the agent for service of process of an entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(14)(b): 16-17-203(1)(b)(ii) the individual who holds the office or other position in an entity that is designated as the agent for service of process pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(15): "Nonqualified foreign entity" means a foreign entity that is not authorized to transact business in this state pursuant to a filing with the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(16): "Nonresident LLP statement" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(16)(a): a statement of qualification of a domestic limited liability partnership that does not have an office in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(16)(b): a statement of foreign qualification of a foreign limited liability partnership that does not have an office in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(17): "Organic law" means the statutes, if any, other than this chapter, governing the internal affairs of an entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(18): "Organic rules" means the public organic document and private organic rules of an entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(19): "Person" means an individual, corporation, estate, trust, partnership, limited liability company, business or similar trust, association, joint venture, public corporation, government or governmental subdivision, agency, or instrumentality, or any other legal or commercial entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(20): "Private organic rules" mean the rules, whether or not in a record, that govern the internal affairs of an entity, are binding on all of its interest holders, and are not part of its public organic document, if any.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(21): "Public organic document" means the public record the filing of which creates an entity, and any amendment to or restatement of that record.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(22): "Qualified foreign entity" means a foreign entity that is authorized to transact business in this state pursuant to a filing with the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(23): "Record" means information that is inscribed on a tangible medium or that is stored in an electronic or other medium and is retrievable in perceivable form.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(24): "Registered agent" means a commercial registered agent or a noncommercial registered agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(25): "Registered agent filing" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(25)(a): the public organic document of a domestic filing entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(25)(b): a nonresident LLP statement;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(25)(c): a foreign qualification document; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(25)(d): an appointment of agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(26): "Represented entity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(26)(a): a domestic filing entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(26)(b): a domestic or qualified foreign limited liability partnership that does not have an office in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(26)(c): a qualified foreign entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(26)(d): a domestic or foreign unincorporated nonprofit association for which an appointment of agent has been filed;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(26)(e): a domestic entity that is not a filing entity for which an appointment of agent has been filed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(26)(f): a nonqualified foreign entity for which an appointment of agent has been filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(27): "Sign" means, with present intent to authenticate or adopt a record:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(27)(a): to execute or adopt a tangible symbol; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(27)(b): to attach to or logically associate with the record an electronic sound, symbol, or process.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(28): "Transferable interest" means the right under an entity's organic law to receive distributions from the entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(29): "Type," with respect to an entity, means a generic form of entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(29)(a): recognized at common law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-102(29)(b): organized under an organic law, whether or not some entities organized under that organic law are subject to provisions of that law that create different categories of the form of entity.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-201 Fees.
-------------------------------------
Unless otherwise provided by statute, the division shall charge and collect fees for services as provided in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-202 Addresses in filings.
-----------------------------------------------------
Whenever a provision of this chapter other than SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 16-17-202(1): an actual street address or rural route box number in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-202(2): (1) a mailing address in this state, if different from the address under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-203 Appointment of registered agent.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-203(1): A registered agent filing shall state:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-203(1)(a): the name of the represented entity's commercial registered agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-203(1)(b): if the entity does not have a commercial registered agent:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-203(1)(b)(i): the name and address of the entity's noncommercial registered agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-203(1)(b)(ii): the title of an office or other position with the entity if service of process is to be sent to the person holding that office or position, and the address of the business office of that person.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-203(2): (1)(a); (b)(i) The appointment of a registered agent pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-203(3): The division shall make available in a record as soon as practicable a daily list of filings that contain the name of a registered agent.  The list shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-203(3)(a): be available for at least 14 calendar days;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-203(3)(b): list in alphabetical order the names of the registered agents; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-203(3)(c): state the type of filing and name of the represented entity making the filing.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-204 Listing of commercial registered agent.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-204(1): An individual or a domestic or foreign entity may become listed as a commercial registered agent by filing with the division a commercial registered agent listing statement signed by or on behalf of the person which states:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-204(1)(a): the name of the individual or the name, type, and jurisdiction of organization of the entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-204(1)(b): that the person is in the business of serving as a commercial registered agent in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-204(1)(c): the address of a place of business of the person in this state to which service of process and other notice and documents being served on or sent to entities represented by it may be delivered.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-204(2): 16-17-301(4) A commercial registered agent listing statement may include the information regarding acceptance of service of process in a record by the commercial registered agent provided for in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-204(3): If the name of a person filing a commercial registered agent listing statement is not distinguishable on the records of the division from the name of another commercial registered agent listed under this section, the person shall adopt a fictitious name that is distinguishable and use that name in its statement and when it does business in this state as a commercial registered agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-204(4): A commercial registered agent listing statement takes effect on filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-204(5): The division shall note the filing of the commercial registered agent listing statement in the index of filings maintained by the division for each entity represented by the registered agent at the time of the filing.  The statement has the effect of deleting the address of the registered agent from the registered agent filing of each of those entities.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-205 Termination of listing of commercial registered agent.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-205(1): 16-17-204 A commercial registered agent may terminate its listing as a commercial registered agent by filing with the division a commercial registered agent termination statement signed by or on behalf of the agent which states:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-205(1)(a): 16-17-204 the name of the agent as currently listed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-205(1)(b): that the agent is no longer in the business of serving as a commercial registered agent in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-205(2): A commercial registered agent termination statement takes effect on the 31st day after the day on which it is filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-205(3): The commercial registered agent shall promptly furnish each entity represented by it with notice in a record of the filing of the commercial registered agent termination statement.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-205(4): 16-17-301 When a commercial registered agent termination statement takes effect, the registered agent ceases to be an agent for service of process on each entity formerly represented by it.  Until an entity formerly represented by a terminated commercial registered agent appoints a new registered agent, service of process may be made on the entity as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-206 Change of registered agent by entity.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-206(1): 16-17-203(1) A represented entity may change the information currently on file under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-206(1)(a): the name of the entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-206(1)(b): the information that is to be in effect as a result of the filing of the statement of change.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-206(2): The interest holders or governors of a domestic entity need not approve the filing of:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-206(2)(a): a statement of change under this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-206(2)(b): a similar filing changing the registered agent or registered office of the entity in any other jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-206(3): (1) The appointment of a registered agent pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-206(4): A statement of change filed under this section takes effect on filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-206(5): 16-17-203(1) As an alternative to using the procedures in this section, a represented entity may change the information currently on file under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-207 Change of name or address by noncommercial registered agent.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-207(1): 16-17-203(1) If a noncommercial registered agent changes its name or its address as currently in effect with respect to a represented entity pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-207(1)(a): the name of the entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-207(1)(b): the name and address of the agent as currently in effect with respect to the entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-207(1)(c): if the name of the agent has changed, its new name; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-207(1)(d): if the address of the agent has changed, the new address.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-207(2): A statement of change filed under this section takes effect on filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-207(3): A noncommercial registered agent shall promptly furnish the represented entity with notice in a record of the filing of a statement of change and the changes made by the filing.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-208 Change of name, address, or type of organization by commercial registered agent.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-208(1): 16-17-204(1); 16-17-204(1) If a commercial registered agent changes its name, its address as currently listed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-208(1)(a): 16-17-204(1) the name of the agent as currently listed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-208(1)(b): if the name of the agent has changed, its new name;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-208(1)(c): if the address of the agent has changed, the new address; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-208(1)(d): if the type or jurisdiction of organization of the agent has changed, the new type or jurisdiction of organization.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-208(2): (1) The filing of a statement of change under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-208(3): A statement of change filed under this section takes effect on filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-208(4): A commercial registered agent shall promptly furnish each entity represented by it with notice in a record of the filing of a statement of change relating to the name or address of the agent and the changes made by the filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-208(5): 16-17-204; (5); 16-17-205; 16-17-301(2); (3); 16-17-301 If a commercial registered agent changes its address without filing a statement of change as required by this section, the division may cancel the listing of the agent under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-208(5)(a): 16-17-301 each entity represented by the agent, stating that the agent has ceased to be an agent for service of process on the entity and that, until the entity appoints a new registered agent, service of process may be made on the entity as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-208(5)(b): the agent, stating that the listing of the agent has been canceled under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-209 Resignation of registered agent.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-209(1): (3) A registered agent may resign at any time with respect to a represented entity by filing with the division a statement of resignation signed by or on behalf of the agent which states:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-209(1)(a): the name of the entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-209(1)(b): the name of the agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-209(1)(c): that the agent resigns from serving as agent for service of process for the entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-209(1)(d): (3) the name and address of the person to which the agent will send the notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-209(2): A statement of resignation takes effect on the earlier of the 31st day after the day on which it is filed or the appointment of a new registered agent for the represented entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-209(3): The registered agent shall promptly furnish the represented entity notice in a record of the date on which a statement of resignation was filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-209(4): When a statement of resignation takes effect, the registered agent ceases to have responsibility for any matter tendered to it as agent for the represented entity.  A resignation under this section does not affect any contractual rights the entity has against the agent or that the agent has against the entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-209(5): A registered agent may resign with respect to a represented entity whether or not the entity is registered with the division.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-210 Appointment of agent by nonfiling or nonqualified foreign entity.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-210(1): 16-17-203(1) A domestic entity that is not a filing entity or a nonqualified foreign entity may file with the division a statement appointing an agent for service of process signed on behalf of the entity which states:
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-210(1)(a): the name, type, and jurisdiction of organization of the entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-210(1)(b): 16-17-203(1) the information required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-210(2): A statement appointing an agent for service of process takes effect on filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-210(3): The appointment of a registered agent under this section does not qualify a nonqualified foreign entity to do business in this state and is not sufficient alone to create personal jurisdiction over the nonqualified foreign entity in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-210(4): A statement appointing an agent for service of process may not be rejected for filing because the name of the entity filing the statement is not distinguishable on the records of the division from the name of another entity appearing in those records.  The filing of a statement appointing an agent for service of process does not make the name of the entity filing the statement unavailable for use by another entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-210(5): An entity that has filed a statement appointing an agent for service of process may cancel the statement by filing a statement of cancellation, which shall take effect upon filing, and shall state the name of the entity and that the entity is canceling its appointment of an agent for service of process in this state.  A statement appointing an agent for service of process which has not been canceled earlier is effective for a period of five years after the date of filing.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-210(6): A statement appointing an agent for service of process for a nonqualified foreign entity terminates automatically on the date the entity becomes a qualified foreign entity.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-301 Service of process on entities.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-301(1): A registered agent is an agent of the represented entity authorized to receive service of any process, notice, or demand required or permitted by law to be served on the entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-301(2): (2) If an entity that previously filed a registered agent filing with the division no longer has a registered agent, or if its registered agent cannot with reasonable diligence be served, the entity may be served by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, addressed to the governors of the entity by name at its principal office in accordance with any applicable judicial rules and procedures.  The names of the governors and the address of the principal office may be as shown in the most recent annual report filed with the division.  Service is perfected under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-301(2)(a): the date the entity receives the mail;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-301(2)(b): the date shown on the return receipt, if signed on behalf of the entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-301(2)(c): five days after its deposit with the United States Postal Service, if correctly addressed and with sufficient postage.
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-301(3): (1); (2) If process, notice, or demand cannot be served on an entity pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-301(4): 16-17-204 Service of process, notice, or demand on a registered agent shall be in the form of a written document, except that service may be made on a commercial registered agent in such other forms of a record, and subject to such requirements as the agent has stated from time to time in its listing under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-301(5): Service of process, notice, or demand may be perfected by any other means prescribed by law other than this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-302 Duties of registered agent.
-----------------------------------------------------------
The only duties under this chapter of a registered agent that has complied with this chapter are:Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-302(1): to forward to the represented entity at the address most recently supplied to the agent by the entity any process, notice, or demand that is served on the agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-302(2): to provide the notices required by this chapter to the entity at the address most recently supplied to the agent by the entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-302(3): 16-17-203(1) if the agent is a noncommercial registered agent, to keep current the information required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-302(4): 16-17-204(1) if the agent is a commercial registered agent, to keep current the information listed for it under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-401 Jurisdiction and venue.
-------------------------------------------------------
The appointment or maintenance in this state of a registered agent does not by itself create the basis for personal jurisdiction over the represented entity in this state.  The address of the agent does not determine venue in an action or proceeding involving the entity.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-402 Consistency of application.
-----------------------------------------------------------
In applying and construing this chapter, consideration shall be given to the need to promote consistency of the law with respect to its subject matter among states that enact it.

Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-403 Relation to Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This chapter modifies, limits, and supersedes the federal Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act, 15 U.S.C. Section 7001, et seq., but does not modify, limit, or supersede Section 101(c) of that act, 15 U.S.C. Section 7001(c), or authorize delivery of any of the notices described in Section 103(b) of that act, 15 U.S.C. Section 7003(b).

Utah Code Annotated § 16-17-404 Savings clause.
-----------------------------------------------
This chapter does not affect an action or proceeding commenced or right accrued before the effective date of this chapter.
